channel.title: Helsingin kaupungin matkailu- ja kongressitoimisto - All places

item.title: 00130Gallery
item.description: Gallery's profile has been from the beginning an artist-run and a non-profit space. The main idea behind the gallery´s ideology is to support young contemporary artists and a non commercial projects in all mediums.

item.title: 2or+ by YAT
item.description: The Finnish designer label of women´s wear and leather accessories. The reclaimed style is urban and strong yet feminine and even poetic. Flagship store is also carrying a hand picked selection of other selective labels, A. F. Vandevorst, A. Friend, Humandid, French Connection and Junya Watanabe. Boutique also in Kluuvi at Yliopistonkatu 6.

item.title: A. Tillander
item.description: Jewellery shop, also exhibitions

item.title: A21 Cocktail Lounge
item.description: A21 Cocktail Lounge is an award-winning Lounge with an aim to offer a moment of everyday luxury through flavours, personal service and design that caresses senses. A21 is also a development organization that continuously thrives to develop the tomorrow of mixology and cocktail culture.
item.matko:groups: Main Lounge max. 50 persons/group, Sauna Lounge 25 max. persons/group

item.title: A21 Dining
item.description: Welcome to the Finnish nature in the heart of Helsinki. A21 Dining presents the best stories and flavours of Finland. Here you're invited to experience Finland's pure tastes and sceneries created by awarded A21 Cocktail Lounge. For each season you will find a theme menu which will lead you onto a unforgettable journey. These menus can be found in three, five or seven leg journey sceneries combined with hand-crafted cocktail package or wine package.
item.matko:groups: Suitable for groups - one menu set per group - chose between 3, 5 or 7 courses.

item.title: Aallonkoti Apartment Hotel
item.description: The unique apartment hotel Aallonkoti of 18 elegantly finished apartments has been built in a great location with gorgeous views in the center of Helsinki. The apartments as well as other facilities of Aallonkoti offer a perfect base for work and relaxation.
item.matko:location: Aallonkoti is situated in Finlandia Park at a walking distance from the central Helsinki amenities. The Main Railwaystation is 300-meter walk away and there are good connections to the airport.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Offering includes a range of high quality apartments from stylish studios to two-bedroom apartments that are designed for comfort and convenience. The two Penthouses are suitable for business meetings, parties and catered events. Apartments offer great facilities such as spacious balcony, laundry machine, WIFI, DVD and CD player, along with fully equipped kitchen.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Aallonkoti is cooperating with Schlegel's family restaurant. Family's restaurant Basti's is located at the street level of the building, offering cozy and stylish facilities for parties and other events. The food is made with love and passion taking healthiness and freshness into account.

item.title: Aalto University School of Business
item.description: Aalto University School of Economics has three buildings at the campus area in Töölö. There are many facilities for education and meetings. Requests and more information: facility.sales@aalto.fi
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Aarikka-shop
item.description: Aarikka Oy is a family business founded in 1954. The company designs and manufactures design products, jewellery and decorative items mainly in wood. Each product is a unique item handmade in Finland using Finnish materials.

item.title: Academic Bookstore
item.description: Alvar Aalto designed (1961-69) commercial building including a bookstore with an exceptional white marbled interior. Bookstore has a café on second floor.

item.title: Acolyth Store
item.description: Finnish and international designer fashion for men and women. Clothing, shoes, accessories. Products are available also in the webshop. Finnish and international brands: Achilles Ion Gabriel, Burlesque Tsunami, Chris Habana, Christopher Shannon, Common, Daniel Palillo, Dusty, Junction Case, Kidda, Kowtow, Marios, Odeur, Pony By Annea Lounatvuori, Sasu Kauppi, Stephan Schneider, Terhi Pölkki.
item.matko:groups: Groups get a 10 % discount on shopping that exceeds 300 €. For orders in our webshop you have right to a 10 % discount as well, by code aco10.
item.matko:services: Finnish and international brands: Achilles Ion Gabriel, Burlesque Tsunami, Chris Habana, Christopher Shannon, Common, Daniel Palillo, Dusty, Junction Case, Kidda, Kowtow, Marios, Odeur, Pony By Annea Lounatvuori, Sasu Kauppi, Stephan Schneider, Terhi Pölkki.

item.title: Adventurepark Korkee
item.description: KORKEE offers fun and adventure! It's a great way to get outdoors and try something a bit unique. Our high ropes adventure experience takes one lush, green forest and a healthy dollop of breathtaking scenery. Then we add a smattering of treetop high wire, tricky crossings (using ladders, walkways, bridges and tunnels made of wood, rope and super-strong wire) and unforgettable zip lines.
item.matko:open: May: Mon-Fri 14-20, Sat 10-20, Sun 10-18. June: Mon-Fri 12-20, Sat 10-20, Sun 10-18. July: Mon-Fri 10-20, Sat 10-20, Sun 10-18. August (1.-15.8.): Mon-Fri 10-20, Sat 10-20, Sun 10-18; (16.-31.8.): Mon-Fri 15-20, Sat 10-20, Sun 10-18. September: Mon-Fri 15-20, Sat 10-20, Sun 10-18. October: Mon-Fri 15-18.30, Sat 10-18, Sun 10-18. Closed from November to April.

item.title: AEL Hotel
item.description: Accomodation in a quiet environment, AEL-Hotel is situated close to the AEL Center for Technical Training in Malminkartano, approx. 10 km from the Helsinki city centre.
item.matko:location: In Malminkartano, approx.10km from Helsinki city centre, by M-train ~15 min., buses 45, 39, 39A (to/from Kamppi). Approx. 14 km to the Helsinki Airport (30 min).
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 30 single rooms, 40 double rooms, non-smoking. All rooms are equipped with shower, hairdryer, TV, telephone and refrigerator. The price includes breakfast, sauna and the possibility to use the gym. WLAN.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The AEL Restaurant serves the students of AEL, hotelguests of the AEL Hotel and convention guests. 230 seats. Breakfast served at the restaurant, otherwise for private functions.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The AEL Hotel reception is situated in the AEL main building. Free parking space.

item.title: AEL-auditorio
item.description: Auditorium with modern AV equipment for 215 persons.
item.matko:location: City centre 12 km, airport 14 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: AEL-Hotel, 30 single and 40 double non-smoking rooms with wireless connections
item.matko:restaurantinfo: AEL-Restaurant for 230 persons (Mon-Fri)

item.title: Agros Vault
item.description: The Agros Vault (Agroksenmäen holvikellari) has a history that dates back around 150 years. This old brewery building has been renovated respecting its history and the original handicraft. A banquet hall with beautiful natural granite stone walls offers unforgettable surroundings for your event. The Agros Vault has proved to be an excellent location for seminars, dinners, theme parties and exhibitions. Also perfect for private events, such as weddings and anniversaries. There is unrestricted catering in the premises. Also furniture and decoration rental services available.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 16 km

item.title: Ahjo Bar & Club
item.description: Ahjo is a combined bar, lounge and night club in the life style hotel Klaus K.

item.title: Aino
item.description: Finnish distinct design clothes for different body-types in high-quality fabrics made mainly out of natural fibres.

item.title: Airport Hotel Bonus Inn
item.description: Independent, friendly Airport Hotel Bonus Inn offers you quiet and relaxing accommodation between flights or after a long business day. Each room offers an en-suite bathroom with shower, international TV, free wireless WiFi, and digital Quadrigan Genesis system for fast internet access and movies, direct-dial phone, fridge or a mini-bar and coffee/tea making facilities. Standard rooms also have a kitchenette. Superior rooms are located on top floors. Family operated, contemporary Airport Hotel Bonus Inn is a member of WORLDHOTELS, Comfort Collection and of Private Hotels, Finland.
item.matko:location: Close to the Helsinki Airport, Helsinki City centre 19 km

item.title: Akvart Galleria
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Aleksi 13
item.description: A department store specialized in clothes, shoes and accessories.

item.title: Alenius Cake Shop
item.description: The time-honored cake shop and cafe located at the southern Helsinki city center, Sokerileipuri Alenius has been specialized in filled cakes and hand made chocolate truffles. There are also delicious snacks and special coffees. You may enjoy the famous banana-chocolate cake with great seaview, or take away the sweety with you.

item.title: Alexander Theatre
item.description: The Alexander Theatre is a beautiful building completed on the Bulevardi in 1879. Former Finnish National Opera. Visiting music and theatre performances.
item.matko:location: Tram 6
item.matko:open: Alexander Theatre Box Office Mon-Fri 9-18 Sat-Sun 12-18
item.matko:admission: Different price groups. Detailed information about the tickets available on the programme pages.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs to main stage, assistant needed, lift and Inva-WC, please notify in advance.
item.matko:services: Interval refreshments: Sodexo, tel. +358 (0)40 755 3065, Mon-Fri 12-15.

item.title: Alhovuori
item.description: Alhovuori's many kind of slopes offer challenges for beginners and more challenged skiers. For the snowboarders there are boxes and rails on the several slopes. For the small children there is lots to do with sledding and ice carousel.

item.title: Allergy House
item.description: Allergy house is an example of a healthy building. In the centre of the house there is good space for exhibitions and cocktail parties. In the house there is an auditorium for 130 persons, sauna and swimming pool.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lunch restaurant for 80 persons
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer for exhibitions

item.title: Allotria
item.description: Restaurant Allotria is a cozy neighbourhood restaurant in the Vallila distric. Music Theatre Kapsäkki next doors arranges musical events in the restaurant regularly.
item.matko:open: Mon 11-15, Tue 11-22, Wed-Thur 11-23, Fri 11-24, Sat 17-24, Sun closed.

item.title: Alppipuisto Park
item.description: Located between Linnanmäki amusementpark and the traintracks. The history of Alppipuistopark streches back to the 1800's. The park is popular among locals of Alppila. The green grass, ponds with fountains, small sightseeing terrace and the rough rocky environment create a unique atmosphere.
item.matko:ingress: The park is popular among locals of Alppila.

item.title: Amado
item.description: Classical and trendy second hand -clothes.

item.title: Amarillo
item.description: Texmex restaurant and bar in two floors with restaurant and Streetbar.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-23, Wed 11-02, Thu-Sat 11-04, Sun 12-23 (kitchen Mon-Thu 11-22, Fri-Sat 11-23.30, Sun 12-22). Amarillo Nights K-18 Wed 21-02, Thu 21-04, Fri-Sat 22-04.

item.title: aMazed Games
item.description: aMazed Games Room Escape offers the possibility to enjoy a lead role in an adrenaline packed and intense real life room escape game.You will feel as immersed in a movie. In the game the team will have to find its way out by solving puzzles, opening locks and completing tasks in one hour. The sense of time and place is lost at aMazed Games. Only locks, riddles and the joy of discovery are present. The game master follows the game through surveillance camera and guides when needed. aMazed Games room escape is incredibly exciting, but totally safe. aMazed Games has invested in the visual appearance and genuine atmosphere of the rooms through production design and sound effects. Our premises are cosy and presentable. The game lasts 60 minutes, but you can always try to escape earlier. Room escape game is suitable for everyone over 13 years old. You don't need prior experience or knowledge.
item.matko:disabled: aMazed Games is wheelchair-accessible.

item.title: American Bar
item.description: The esteemed leading professionals at American Bar serve innovative drinks for you to enjoy. The bar is a seamless combination of the long-standing tradition of Torni and today's international atmosphere. The bar, referred to as the "university of bartenders", always provides you with professional service, wonderful cocktails, champagne and wine.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue 17-24, Wed-Thu 17-01, Fri-Sat 16-02, Sun closed.

item.title: Amigo
item.description: Spanish style restaurant Amigo, founded in 1971 in Ullanlinna, still serves classical Amigo dishes. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-15. It is also possible to just pop in for e.g. tapas or a glass of wine. The bar is open every day 16-02.

item.title: Amos Anderson Art Museum
item.description: Amos Anderson Art Museum is the biggest private art museum in Finland. Its collection comprises mainly contemporary Finnish art, art and furnishings from Amos Anderson's private collections and Finnish and foreign art from the collection of architect Sigurd Frosterus. The museum arranges 8-11 changing exhibitions every year.
item.matko:open: Mon, Thu & Fri 10-18, Tue closed, Wed 10-20, Sat-Sun 11-17.
item.matko:disabled: It is possible to move about in a wheelchair, 2 lifts, accessible restroom, assistance needed.
item.matko:groups: Guides can be booked in advance, weekdays 50€, Sat 75€ and Sun 100€. Schoolgroups Mon-Fri 10-16 40€. Schoolgroups are kindly asked to inform their arrival in advance. Admission: children under 18 years free, senior groups (min. 15 persons) 4€/person, other adult groups 6€/person (min. 15 person).
item.matko:services: Café Amos, tel. 09-6844 4636, ca 30 seats , open Mon-Fri 9-18, Sat-Sun 10-17. Museum shop tel. 09-6844 4635. Parking at P-Forum.

item.title: Andorra
item.description: New cultural and recreational complex Andorra is comprised of four distinct spaces: Corona Bar & Billiards and Kafe Moskova on the ground floor, plus movie theatre Kino and Dubrovnik Lounge & Lobby in the basement. We have reconstructed the basement's movie theatre, formerly known as Andorra, for new use. Hall number one has been left as a theatre and named as Kino. Hall number two and lobby have been renovated as Dubrovnik Lounge & Lobby bar, named after a neonlight from Aki Kaurismäki's movie "Drifting Clouds".
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Anna K. Karaokebar
item.description: Popular karaoke bar and pub in the city centre.

item.title: Anna22
item.description: Anna 22 is a deli cafe with a cosy and comfortable bistro feeling to it, located close to Kamppi shopping center. Warm dishes served all day. The delicious speciality coffees will cheer up your day and freshly pressed juices and smoothies will make an excellent snack. Well-behaved dogs are welcome.

item.title: AnnaK
item.description: The AnnaK conference facilities are situated on the top floor at Annankatu 24. There is one larger conference room for up to 50 people and four smaller meeting rooms.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Annala Garden
item.description: Garden
item.matko:location: Tram 6. Buses 68, 71, 71V and 73B from the Railway Square, bus 74 from Hakaniemi.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups by appointment.
item.matko:services: Happenings

item.title: Annantalo
item.description: Annantalo is an arts centre for children and young people in the centre of Helsinki. Annantalo offers art education, exhibitions and dance performances and theatre productions. In addition, Annantalo works together closely with schools. During daytimes the centre is filled with primary school children who attend art classes. Several times a year family event days are held at Annantalo.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:ingress: Art centre for children; exhibitions, dance and theatre performances

item.title: Anne's Shop
item.description: Anne's Shop, situated next to the Temppeliaukio church ("rock-church"), is one of the oldest souvenir shops in Finland.

item.title: Annikki Karvinen
item.description: Annikki Karvinen's business idea is to manufacture high-quality garments to people who value unique design. Developing the handwoven 'poppana' fabric is Annikki's innovation, which has made her known as a brave and creative designer both home and abroad. Annikki has turned handwoven fabrics into international fashion. In 2008, it was 40 years since Annikki Karvinen started her design business. Nowadays, both production and the head office are located in Jyväskylä, central Finland. The company's flagship store is located in Helsinki on Pohjoisesplanadi. Oy Annikki Karvinen Ltd. is a family business.

item.title: Ansa
item.description: Selected second hand clothes to fit the fashion trends of today.

item.title: Apartementos Helsinki
item.description: Apertementos Helsinki rents modern, fully furnished and well equipped apartments in the heart of Helsinki. The surroundings are quiet and within walking distance from the city centre.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 17 km. Kulmakatu 6, Kirjatyöntekijänkatu 14 and Iso Roobertinkatu 3-5
item.matko:admission: The minimum reservation period is four days, price per day 100-115 €.
item.matko:services: In addition to the double bed, both apartments have a convertible sofa for additional guests. All linen is included. Both apartments have a TV, broadband internet connection washing machine, a dishwasher, a microwave, a coffee maker etc.

item.title: Apartment hotel Eskolampi
item.description: In Tölö, small homelike apartment hotel, situated in a beautiful and peaceful garden street between the Sibeliuspark and the ocean.
item.matko:location: City centre 2,5 min, airport 20 min
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Two room apartment 35m2, one room 25m2 and one room 28m2. Kitchens with oven, stove, microwave, coffee machine and kitchen equipment. Bathrooms with washing machine, hair blower, ironing board and iron. Bed linens.
item.matko:services: Restaurants, cafes, food stores, etc. nearby.

item.title: Apartment Hotel ESSEXhome
item.description: Beautiful and totally modern, just renovated apartments are located in a magnificent art nouveau milieu on the quiet Luotsikatu-street (Katajanokka), only a short walking distance from the downtown area of Helsinki. Each apartment has a dishwasher, refrigerator/freezer, microwave, coffee and kettle, toaster, tableware and cooking equipment, washing machine, ironing equipment, vacuum cleaner, TV, wireless internet connection, parquet floor, etc. Cleaning is performed and linen & towels are changed weekly.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, tram stop 200 m, airport 18 km

item.title: Apartment hotel Huoneistohotelli Gella Oy
item.description: High standard apartments in all sizes varying from smaller one and two room apartments to larger, up to four room apartments with separate bedrooms. All apartments are fully fitted up with modern conveniences and fine quality furniture.
item.matko:location: Apartments are located in the city centre. Apartments also in Lauttasaari, Espoo and, down the subway towards the east, Kaarikuja. Airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 50 apartments; from studio apartmets to apartments with three rooms

item.title: Apartment Hotel Niko
item.description: Fully furnished apartments in downtown Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:admission: 45-173 euros/day. The minimum renting period is seven days. The daily rate may vary if your stay lasts for more than 4 weeks. Tailormade offers for monthly stays.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Apartments from studios to 4 bedroom apartments in the city centre.
item.matko:additionalinfo: TV, VCR, basic appliances, a washing machine, crockery and cutlery. Many of the apartments also have a dishwasher, the possibility to use the telephone and a car parking space. Of interest to foreign guests will also be the possibility to connect up to cable TV, through which Helsinki receives satellite TV channels.

item.title: Apartment Månsas
item.description: This modem 2 rooms apartment, which accommodates 4-5 people, was fully renovated in 2012 and includes free Wi-Fi access, a home theater system and a fully equipped kitchen. Paloheinä Golf Course is 4 km away. Parking is free on site. A seating area is featured in the bright living room. Kitchen facilities include a stove, fridge, freezer, toaster, microwave oven aud coffee machine. The bathroom includes a shower, washing machine and toilets. Leisurc facilities include a sauna in the building (separate booking required) and a private children's playground outside. The nearest grocery store and restaurant are 100 metres away. Pirkkola Recreational Centre is 1.6 km away. The ski trails at Paloheinä are located 3.5 km away from the apartment.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 min, airport 15 min

item.title: ApartmentHelsinki
item.description: This very recently renovated studio apartment has a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom with shower. Accomodating up to 3 persons. Smoking is prohibited. In the apartment there is a dish washer, washing machine, TV, stereo equipment, w-lan, linen, towels and kitchenware, all included in the room rate.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 14 km
item.matko:admission: 1 to 2 persons 65 € per night. 3 persons 85 € per night (with extra bed). On weekends the minimum stay is 2 nights, i.e. from Friday to Sunday.

item.title: Apollo Live Club & Cafe
item.description: Built into an old movie theater Apollo live club is an event restaurant that has been operating inside Forum shopping center since 2007. During weekend nights Apollo live club merges with Forum's inner court yard creating a large unique venue setting as a nightclub and a live club. With top-of-the-game Scandinavian cover bands Apollo live club's live music playing 'till 3 am, the nights at Apollo are something nobody forgets. Apollo live club also has a cellar called THE PIT that serves its customers with Heavy / Hard rock atmosphere, roasted with sports screenings.
item.matko:open: Live Club: Mon-Thu and Sun closed, Fri-Sat 22-04. Café: Mon-Thu 15-21, Fri-Sat 14-04, Sun closed, kitchen closes every day at 20.00.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Week nights and early evenings during weekends you can find versatile events from Stand Up nights to theater performances and gigs by well known artists.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Apollo Live Club & Café is part of Night People Group.

item.title: Arabia Factory and Factory Outlet
item.description: Stylish products for the home can be found at the Arabia Factory Outlet, the largest single sales centre for Arabia, Iittala and Hackman products. The store includes special discounts and mark-down prices. Taxfree and export service.
item.matko:location: Tram number 6 from the city centre.
item.matko:open: Factory shop: Mon-Fri 10-20, Sat-Sun 10-16. Arabia Museum and Gallery: Tue-Fri 12-18, Sat-Sun 10-16 (Mon closed)
item.matko:admission: Entrance fee for the Arabia Museum and Gallery: adults 3€, children(under 12years), students and pensioners 1,50€.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, assistant needed, lift, no Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups to the Arabia Museum and Gallery: 1,50€/pers. (min.8persons). Guided tours of the factory (during office hours for the factory) and museum by request, inquiries mon-fri 12-15, tel.+358(0)204 39 5326, e-mail:arabia.visitors@iittala.com.
item.matko:services: Arabia Museum and Gallery, also other factory shops in the building.
item.matko:ingress: The largest single sales centre for Arabia, Iittala and Hackman products.

item.title: Arabianranta
item.description: The Arabia area is known for its passion in creativity. Artists, designers and craftsmen put their stamp on buildings, objects and a communal spirit that gives energy. In the area: Arabia Centre, Tapio Wirkkala Park, Museums, Factory Outlets, Public Art.

item.title: Aralis Gallery
item.description: The Gallery exhibits the works of artists from the school of Art and Design.

item.title: Arela Store
item.description: Simple, understated cashmere and cotton clothing by a local family business. Run by a mother and two daughters, all products are designed in-house. High-quality materials, vivid colours and functionality are important design elements for Arela.

item.title: Armas Design
item.description: Armas Design is a shop in the Punavuori district selling textiles, small furniture, ceramics, glass and other designs for interior decoration. Brands include e.g. HAY, Muuto and Tom Dixon.

item.title: Armas Keittiö & Viinitupa
item.description: The food of Armas Keittiö & Viinitupa (Armas Kitchen & Winebar) is simple and unpretentious Finnish food, made of fresh organic ingredients: Armas kebabs, hearty salads and soups, stews and risottos. Delicious meats, vegetables and breads are made in the wood-heated stone heart oven. Smoked Finnish fish cooked in the smoking oven is the specialty of the restaurant. Armas-tapas are at their best when enjoyed with one of restaurant's carefully selected wines or beer. There is an excellent wine list with moderately priced high-quality wines sold by the glass. Homely restaurant with 100 seats is situated in the heart of Helsinki just 5 minute walk from the railway station and the harbor, and right next to the Senate Square.
item.matko:location: Shopping center Kluuvi, 1. floor
item.matko:disabled: Elevator

item.title: Art Clipper
item.description: Art Clipper Welcome! The Art Clipper permanent sales exhibition consists of elder Finnish masters works, such as Oscar Kleineh, Elin Danielsson-Gambogi, Akseli Galleén-Kallela, Eero Nelimarkka, Magnus von Wright, Eero Järnefelt, Santeri Salokivi, Nikolai Lehto, Ulla Rantanen, Soile Yli-Mäyry, Rafael Wardi, Carita Berg, Sari Haapaniemi, Serguei Zlenko James Coignard, Max Papart, Antoni Tapíes, Salvador Dalí and Pablo Picasso.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 10-17, Sat-Sun 12-16, other times also negotiable.

item.title: Art Poster Gallery
item.description: Gallery.

item.title: Art Salon Piirto
item.description: The Art Salon/Art Gallery has two floors and is comprised of the permanent exhibition of Tapani Piirto´s works and monthly changing temporary exhibitions of visiting artists, both Finnish and foreign.

item.title: Artek
item.description: Artek was founded in 1935 by four young idealists, Alvar and Aino Aalto, Maire Gullichsen and Nils-Gustav Hahl. The business idea of the company was "to sell furniture and to promote a modern culture of habitation by exhibitions and other educational means." The founders of Artek advocated a new kind of environment for everyday life. They believed in a grand synthesis of the arts and wanted to make a difference in town planning as well as architecture and design. Today Artek is renowned as being one of the most innovative contributors to modern design, building on the heritage of Alvar Aalto. Functionality and timeless aesthetics are the essential elements in the creation of every product that bears the Artek name. The flagship store is a beautiful platform for Artek's products (Aalto, Tapiovaara, Kukkapuro) as well as other international and Finnish design brands. Varying exhibitions from the fields of art to industrial design are often displayed in the store.

item.title: Artisaani
item.description: The Artisaani arts and crafts shop was established in 1975. Today a group of craftsmen run the shop where 60 artists' works are presented. All products are unique Finnish handmade items and high quality studio products. In Artisaani you will find eg. clothes, accessories, interior textiles, pottery, glass, graphics, jewelry and wood products.

item.title: Aschan Café Jugend
item.description: The Aschan Café Jugend and winebar is located in the premises of what originally was a bank designed by architect Lars Sonck. Notable Art Nouveau interior.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: Café: Mon-Fri 9-19, Sat 10-18, Sun 11-18. Winebar: Mon-Sat 16-21, Sun closed.

item.title: Astialiisa
item.description: Astialiisa is a design, home decor and dish shop in Töölö. Its collections include selections of Finnish dishes from the last 100 years: Old and new pieces from Arabia as well as glass from Iittala and Nuutajärvi. Astialiisa also has a generous Moomin department: dishes, toys, magnets and more. Astialiisa arranges exhibitions and events together with collectors.
item.matko:open: Mon 12-17, Tue-Thu 10-18, Fri 10-17, Sat 10-14 (closed on Saturdays in July)

item.title: Astiataivas
item.description: Astiataivas is the shopping place for old dishware. You will find arabia, kupittaan savi, art glass and lots of other lovely products.

item.title: Astoria Ball Room
item.description: Astoria Hall is a perfect venue to hold all kind off events from corporate meetings to evening gala dinners. Astoria's 200 square-meter hall is suitable for events up to 500 guests. Built in 1919, the hall represents the neoclassical style, that can be seen at the decorative ornaments on the walls and ceiling. Hall floors are original oak parquet.
item.matko:location: Astoria Hall is located in the Helsinki Punavuori area, only 5-10 minutes walk from the city centre. By car/taxi it is a 20 minutes ride to the Helsinki-Vantaa international airport.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, easier entry from the gateway.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Astoria Catering is pleased to serve you and your guests delicious catering options from quick breakfasts to demanding seated dinner menus. It is also possible to bring your own favourite catering to Astoria (with the exception of yearly specified Christmas season.) Please note that Astoria holds the liquor licence so it is therefore strictly forbidden to bring your own alcoholic beverages to Astoria premises. A bar can also be opened during your event so that guests can purchase drinks of their own choice.

item.title: Asuna
item.description: Asuna is a modern designers clothing store. Strong Finnish designers together with international high class brands (eg. Marithe & Franqois Girbaud, Comme des Garcons, Mary Katrantzou, Y-3 Yohji Yamamoto, SLVR, Rick Owens) bring an interesting and impressive touch to Asuna's collection.

item.title: Atelier Torbjörn Tillander
item.description: Atelier Torbjörn Tillander designs and manufactures jewellery out of the very best metals, gemstones and pearls.

item.title: Ateljé Finne
item.description: The sculptor Gunnar Finne had his ateljé at Arkadiankatu 14 in the 1920's. In the 1960's the place was transformed into a Restaurant. The menu of Atelje Finne focuses on Finnish ingredients.

item.title: Ateljee Bar
item.description: The Ateljee Bar with its famous terrace is located on the 14th floor of Sokos Hotel Torni. From the terrace there is a unique view over the Helsinki skyline. The artistic bar, opened as early as 1951, also works as an art gallery with monthly exhibitions. This intimate and romantic location has room for 30 customers indoors and 12 on the terrace in summer. A great view over Helsinki can be seen from the Ladies' and Gentlemen's bathrooms. Age limit 20 years.

item.title: Ateneum Art Museum
item.description: Ateneum Art Museum houses the largest collections of art in Finland with more than 20,000 works of art from the 1750s to the 1950s. The changing exhibitions are on display on the ground floor and in the exhibition halls on the second floor. Ateneum also organises various workshops, guided tours and other programme. The Ateneum building was designed by the architect Theodor Höijer and it was completed in 1887. Ateneum Art Museum is part of the Finnish National Gallery.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue, Fri 10-18, Wed-Thu 10-20, Sat-Sun 10-17.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance with a lift on the Ateneuminkuja side of the museum. Wheelchairs, canes and wheeled walkers available for loan from the information desk. All floors can be reached by lift. Accessible toilet in the bottom floor.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking, tel. +358 (0)294 500 500 (Tue-Fri 9-12). Max. 25persons/group. Languages available: Finnish, Swedish, English, French, Italian, Spanish and Russian. Also sign language available. Advance tickets are available from Lippupalvelu's ticket offices and Lippupalvelu's online shop.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The premises can be used for banquets and private events, the museum's own activities permitting. The museum's facilities can be used for private purposes for more than 200 people outside the museum's opening hours.
item.matko:services: The museum shops sells a wide selection of Ateneum's own publications and exhibition merchandise, such as art postcards, art books, posters, jewelry and high-quality gift items.
item.matko:ingress: The Ateneum Art Museum is the basic part of the Finnish National Gallery.

item.title: Auditorium - Business Center Papula
item.description: This Auditorium seats 90 guests and is available for conferences, training courses, lectures, as well as private screenings, and more. The auditorium can be rented together with a roof top sauna facility in the same building. This is an excellent way to continue an event in a more relaxed space. Amenities: • Gallery seating • Projection equipment • DVD and X-BOX • Microphones • Podium • Access to catering
item.matko:location: Business Center Papula's Auditorium is located a short distance away from the Helsinki city center, in a peaceful neighborhood of Lauttasaari.

item.title: Aussie Bar
item.description: Aussie Bar is a place to feel at home with scenes from Australia's famous backyards, enter into a tranquil rainforest at the front and end up in the heartlands of the great Aussie outback, sit down to a refreshing cold beer with a mixed crowd of Aussie and Kiwi men and women and soak up the tunes that you've grown to love.

item.title: AVA-gallery
item.description: AVA Galleria is a small and cozy gallery located in the Helsinki city center, behind the Tennispalatsi on the Pohjoinen Rautatienkatu. The gallery organizes exhibitions and takes part in several art fairs all over the world. Besides introducing Finnish contemporary art, the gallery also brings international exhibitions to Helsinki. The exhibitions change every third week. AVA Galleria cooperates with The Arte Vida Arte Association and supports CASA (Centro de Assistência Social e Artística/Centre for Social and Artistic Support), an art school located in Cidade de Deus, a shanty town in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Baarikärpänen
item.description: Baarikärpänen is just perfect in size: never too small to feel like the place is overcrowded, but not that big to lose your friends into the club. Baarikärpänen also has a big terrace which is open during the summer season. The building where Baarikärpänen is located at is called Fennia-block, which has gone through broad renovations within last few years. Although the building has been modernized it has still kept its historic value. This is exactly what Baarikärpänen has also been aiming to do. Age limit: 18 years
item.matko:restaurantinfo: In the year 2001 opened Baarikärpänen is a classic of Helsinki's nightlife. The nightclub is easy to access, also without having to worry about being bankrupt. The relaxed atmosphere is taken care by the friendly staff.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Baarikärpänen is part of Night People Group.

item.title: Baker's Bar & Restaurant
item.description: Baker's offers diverse restaurant facilities right in the heart of Helsinki opposite the Stockmann department store. Baker's is one of Helsinki's oldest restaurants (est. 1915). Baker's is divided into a Café Bar, Steak Restaurant, Bar & Nightbar, and Sauna & Meeting facilities. The Steak Restaurant Baker's offers a lunch buffet and a la carte lunch on weekdays 11-14. Baker's also has the Helsinki Menu. Café Bar offers lunch Mon-Fri 11-15, Sat 12-16. The Tempo Bar is laidback place to enjoy cocktails. The Bar & Nightbar is a relaxed atmosphere for mingling with people and has a terrace balcony in summer.
item.matko:open: Steak Restaurant: kitchen open Mon-Thu 11-21.30, Fri 11-22.30, Sat 12-22.30, closed on Sundays. Café Bar: Mon, Fri-Sat 8-21, Tue-Thu 8-24. Bar: Tue-Thu 16.30-20, Fri-Sat 16.30-04. Nightbar: Fri-Sat 22-04. Tempo: Tue-Thu 17-24, Fri-Sat 17-04. Age limits: Bar & Nightbar 24 years.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant seats 210 persons, also a separate cabinet for 60 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna on request, Sun-Thu 15€/guest, min.price 90€ and Fri-Sat 20€/guest, min.price 120 €. Extra hours 40€. The sauna seats 8 persons. The sauna cabinet seats 20 persons (equipped with a 42" plasma tv)
item.matko:services: Sauna and meeting facilities.

item.title: Balderin Sali Hall
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:services: Café

item.title: Bank of Finland Museum
item.description: The Bank of Finland Museum's main themes are the history of money, central banking, monetary policy and banknote art and artists. Multimedia presentations. Changing exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the corner of the Senate Square, trams 1, 1A, 7A and 7B. Parking slots, also for buses, in the Senate Square.
item.matko:disabled: Door with ramp for wheelchairs. Accessible WC.
item.matko:groups: Free guided tours can be arranged upon request. Languages Finnish, Swedish and English.
item.matko:services: A small café (approx. 15 seats) and museum shop.

item.title: Bar Bäkkäri
item.description: Voted as the best bar in Helsinki in 2013, Bar Bäkkäri offers awesome rock spirit with big attitude. Bäkkäri's good reputation and excellent atmosphere is known also in other countries, which is the reason the place is full of tourists and other people from outside Helsinki. The place is also often visited by big national and international artists, if they happen to be having a gig in Helsinki. The interior and music at Bäkkäri is rock-related. By arranging different kinds of theme nights, such as pool- and crayfish parties, the bar constantly succeeds to surprise their customers. One of the specialties found in the bar is a list of drinks, which has been named by favorite drinks of rock stars like Nikki Sixx, Lemmy Kilmister and Aleksi Laiho. Age limit: weekdays 18 years, weekends 20 years.
item.matko:open: Bar Bäkkäri (1st floor): open every day 18-04. Restaurant Komppi (2nd floor): open Fri-Sat 22-04.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Bar Bäkkäri is part of Night People Group.

item.title: Bar Llamas
item.description: Neat little bar that is inspired by Latin America. Instead of chairs they have swings by the bar desk. Bar Llamas also serves wraps, popcorn- and nacho baskets.

item.title: Bar Loose
item.description: A rock music bar in the city centre. From 60's soul music to rock music of today.

item.title: BBQ House
item.description: BBQ House offers you the greatest delights of the Latin world such as steaks from first-class meat grilled on a lava stone grill and a whole range of other mouthwatering treats. At BBQ House everyone can master his or her own meal: you can build your portion as you wish.
item.matko:open: Mon- Thu 11-23, Fri 11-24, Sat 12-23, Sun 13-22 Kitchen closes one hour before closing.

item.title: beam.
item.description: Acne Studios, Alexander Wang, A.P.C., COMME des GARCONS, Kenzo, Raf Simons, Maison Martin Margiela, Our Legacy, Isabel Marant...

item.title: Beamhill
item.description: Ben Sherman, Resteröds, Whyred, Acne, April 77, Cheap Monday, Edwin. J. Lindeberg, Nudie, Surface to Air, Tiger, Velour, D&G Underwear, Carhartt, Ctrl, Evisu, Spiewak, Supra, Zoo York, Wood Wood, 2K t-shirts, Analog, Altamont, MHI, Mishka, Sixpack, Volcom, Levi's Vintage, Won Hundred, Clae. Converse, Karhu, Paul Smith, Reebok, Swear, Adidas, Alife, Gravis, Lakai, Nike SB, Pointer, Reebok Vans, Creative Recriation, Emerica, New Balance.

item.title: Belge Bar & Bistro
item.description: Belge bar&bistro is a Belgian beer restaurant in two floors that offers Belgian beer and food. The upstairs library creates an easy-going atmosphere with its big couches, dark wood interior and fire place.

item.title: Best Western Hotel Carlton
item.description: The Best Western Hotel Carlton is a hotel in a 1930's building located in the very heart of the city. Whether travelling on business or pleasure, Carlton is the choice for you if you want to spend your night securely and comfortably, yet surrounded by the lively environment of one of the main streets in Helsinki city. Single and double rooms all come equipped with shower, hairdryer, mini-bar, trouser press, LCD TV and wireless high-speed internet connection.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 17 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Robert's Coffee and Iguana Restaurant are located on the ground floor of the hotel building.

item.title: Best Western Hotel Rantapuisto
item.description: In Best Western Hotel Rantapuisto you can find high quality conference, hotel and restaurant facilities in architectonically significant buildings surrounded by beautiful nature. Rantapuisto offers for example: distinguished auditorium for 300 people, 15 meeting rooms and abundance of facilities for group work, 70 spacious and fresh hotel rooms, three restaurants, all rich in atmosphere, pleasant sauna facilities and a seashore sauna with its own lounge with a fireplace, exhibition hall of 600m2.
item.matko:location: City centre 17 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Access to target (No reservation needed). Some rooms are suitable for disabled, one with special equipment, electric outer door, lift and a spacious parking place. Toilets for disabled: 1 pcs in the lobby. A Wellness center suitable for all.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 42 single rooms and 25 double rooms. The 70 hotel rooms are spacious and light. All the twin rooms have sea view. All the rooms have shower and toilet, TV, hairdryer, internet connection and pay-tv channels.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Exhibition hall 600 m².
item.matko:additionalinfo: Seaside sauna with a fireplace room.
item.matko:services: Sauna by the sea + lounge with a fireplace. 2 saunas in exhibition hall, also conference room with a fire place. Hotel sauna for 8 people.

item.title: Best Western Plus Hotel Haaga
item.description: Best Western Plus Hotel Haaga is a cosy hotel with newly renovated comfortable rooms and friendly service. The hotel offers a wide selection of modern meeting rooms and versatile restaurant facilities. The hotel is situated within easy reach of the Helsinki Airport and downtown Helsinki. Parking possibilities are also good. All guest and meeting rooms have a free high-speed internet access. The 17 meter long swimming pool and three saunas also offer relaxing moments for both business and leisure travellers.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 122 rooms of which 34 single, 85 double/twin, 2 suites, 1 apartamento.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurants: Haaga Inn á la carte restaurant has a good selection of beverages and seasonal menus. The banquet restaurant is a good place for larger groups. It seats up to 250 persons and is a perfect place for banquets, cocktails, theme events and conference luncheons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, swimming pool, easy access parking, wireless internet connection (WLAN) in all rooms.

item.title: Best Western Premier Hotel Katajanokka
item.description: Best Western Premier Hotel Katajanokka fulfils the expectations of travellers looking for an exceptional quality. Inside the old brick walls, a fascinating world of contrasts opens up; a modern premier-class hotel built in a historic prison setting. The red brick walls house 106 magnificent and luxurious rooms. Stylish decor and unique atmosphere effectively take your mind away from the busy working day and intensive travelling. The thick walls ensure a good night's sleep and first class conveniences are available to meet even the most demanding requirements. The hotel is located in a beautiful, quiet park surrounded by the old prison walls.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Jailbird Restaurant, Oluthuone pub and Lobby bar, Summer terrace
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna and gym

item.title: Bicyclean Helsinki
item.description: Rental bikes.
item.matko:location: In Katajanokka, near Simon kahvio ja kioski.
item.matko:open: From may to september: Mon 12-19, Tue-Sun 9-19. From October to April: Mon 12-18, Tue-Fri 10-18, Sat 10-16, Sun closed.

item.title: Birgitta Hernesaari
item.description: Contemporary wooden summer cafe and its charcoal grill offers smoke filled experiences by the seaside (Talli architects 2014).

item.title: Bisarri
item.description: 20´th Finnish design; art glass, art ceramics and tableware.

item.title: Black & White
item.description: Large selection of second hand records, everything from jazz to rock.

item.title: BLINIt
item.description: Genuine Russian fastfood, blinis, pelmenis and different kind of pastries. Cheap prices.
item.matko:location: Alppila district
item.matko:ingress: Genuine Russian fastfood for cheap prices

item.title: Blue Peter Seaside Restaurant
item.description: Blue Peter, established in 1976, is situated on the island of Lauttasaari in Helsinki, in the middle of the Helsingfors Segelklubb HSK yacht club area. Blue Peter lends you a modern but still original atmosphere to enjoy delicious food and to arrange festive occasions and gatherings in a unique yacht club surrounding.
item.matko:open: Open all year round. Mon-Thu 10-23, Fri 10-01, Sat 12-01, Sun 12-22.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Private occasions for 20-250 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Á la carte, lunch and childrens menu. Parking area and own quay.

item.title: Bonnie's Canadian Club
item.description: Speakeasy is hideing in an old flour mill which were built during prohibition time. This old brickhouse lies in an old industrial area that generates strong contrasts between the exterior and the interior. One room hall (h=5,5 m, area 330 m2), capacity 120 during dinner, 150 during cocktail. An estrade (6m x 4m) and light & audio system for speeches. If you need any AV equipments for your event, we are at your service. Wares and equipments are easy to carry through double doors. You can bring your own goods or we can tailor an offer including only the services which you are externalizeing. The venue is well suitable for immediate, easy-going social and theme events, meetings and promos.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 25 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Interior can be easily changed from one arrangement to another in order to serve better the customer and to back up the goal of the event . Capacity is 120 during dinner and 150 during cocktail. You can bring your own beverages but the catering is exclusively of Crepperie Oy.
item.matko:services: All the necessary services, from catering and decoration to rentals and technical applications, are available under one roof.

item.title: Botta/Manala
item.description: Restaurant, disco and bar popular among eg. students. Finnish home cooking style food until closing time. On Fridays and Saturdays it is party time: four floors, five bars and two dance floors. St.Urho's Pub is an oasis for beerlovers.
item.matko:open: Manala:Mon-Fri 11-04, Sat 14-04. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-14. ManalaClub: Fri-Sat 23-04. K-22 St.Urho's Pub: Sun-Tue 15-01, Wed-Sat 15-03.

item.title: Boulevard Social
item.description: Share several small Mediterranean dishes with your friends, follow the hustle and bustle of the boulevard and let our easy-going staff serve you. Boulevard Social is a place where you can pop in for a drink, reserve a table and set out on a culinary journey for the entire evening or enjoy fresh air and cocktails on our terrace. The food and drinks, just like the decor and place settings, have been created with carefully selected details. The restaurant's elegant bistro-style decor has been designed by Risto Wikberg from FutuDesign.
item.matko:open: LUNCH Mon-Fri 11:30 am - 2 pm (Orders have to be placed by 2 pm, but you are free to enjoy your lunch until 4 pm.) Our lunch options include of a selection of dishes from our à la carte menu or our tasting menu. DINNER Mon-Sat 5 pm - 1 am (orders must be placed by 10.00 pm) Sun / closed

item.title: Boutique Freda
item.description: Shoes with an Attitude. Full range of beautiful shoes, bags and accessories. MadeInSpace ecological shoes also available.

item.title: Boutique Kaarina K
item.description: Labels such as Versace, Emilio Pucci, Giuseppe Zanotti, Herve Leger, Giambattista Valli, Balmain, Temperley London and Petteri Hemmilä.

item.title: BR-Toys
item.description: International toy store chain
item.matko:location: Forum and Kamppi Shopping Centre

item.title: Brasserie Kämp
item.description: Brasserie Kämp has served for more than 100 years with the same admiration towards quality service. Brasserie Kämp is part of Kämp Group, a local chain of individual hotels and restaurants. The Kämp Group restaurants, located at the very best spots in Helsinki have for years been popular among locals.

item.title: Brasserie Le Havre
item.description: The stylishly decorated hotel restaurant, Ravintola Seurahuone Restaurang, offers good service. Located at the best business site in Helsinki, the restaurant is a stunning blend of mood created by skilfully crafted and restored surfaces combined with contemporary furnishings. The food itself is of a high standard, reflecting the spirit of European urban culture. Despite this, the menu hasn't forgotten Seurahuone classics.
item.matko:ingress: Stunning combination of restored surfaces combined with contemporary furnishings

item.title: Bravuria
item.description: Bravuria is an Italian interactive restaurant where the customers place their orders directly to the chef. There is also a bar and a terrace.
item.matko:location: In Kamppi, in the center.

item.title: Break Sokos Hotel Flamingo
item.description: Break Sokos Hotel Flamingo is situated near the airport. The hotel brings a relaxing break to the business traveller's workday as well as action and entertainment to leisure time. This is guaranteed by the versatile selection brought to you by the Flamingo Entertainment Centre and water park, including its care and well-being sections, wellness services, cinemas and comprehensive world of restaurants. The hotel boasts a relaxed restaurant, Amarillo as well as Bankett Flamingo, a restaurant available on a reservation basis. Conference and festive premises offer fantastic facilities for successful meetings.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 17 km, airport 3 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 309 rooms, all non-smoking, 5 suites. Wireless broadband internet access in all rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Amarillo and a private restaurant for 300 persons.
item.matko:services: Business Center, spa and water park at the Flamingo Leisure complex (spa treatment reservations tel. +358 (0)20 7785 201 or +358 (0)20 7785 210)

item.title: Briossi Cafe & Bakery
item.description: Cafe & Bakery Briossi in the heart of Helsinki. Daily soup and salad lunch is served with fresh baked bread and coffee or tea included. Also take away.

item.title: Bronda
item.description: Bronda is the fifth restaurant by Helsinki's culinary super duo Tomi Björck and Matti Wikberg. The restaurant serves modern brasserie food in a relaxed atmosphere.
item.matko:open: For opening hours please visit the restaurant's website.

item.title: Bruuveri
item.description: A brewery restaurant in the Kamppi shopping centre that serves products from their own brewery as well as from the brewery Saimaan Panimo.

item.title: Bryggeri Helsinki
item.description: Bryggeri Helsinki serves food and beer produced on the premises from scratch using the finest raw ingredients. New flavours are developed according to season. At Bryggeri, food is given various roles: uncomplicated pub food goes well with a pint while an entire menu with a recommended beer is perfect for unhurried socializing. Corporate customers and groups are also welcome. You can reach us by telephone +358 (0)10 235 2500 and by sending an e-mail to helsinki@bryggeri.fi

item.title: Bulevardin Kahvisalonki
item.description: The small Bulevardin Kahvisalonki, that has served customers for decades, has now moved to a new location in the corner of Mannerheimintie and Bulevardi. Outdoor terraces on both streets, a piano (and occasionally also music) and cosy big sofas, also for bigger partys. A salad bar at lunchtime on weekdays.
item.matko:open: During summer season (27.6.-26.7.2015) Mon-Fri 11-18, Sat 12-18, Sun closed. Outside season Mon-Fri 8-21, Sat-Sun 10-20.

item.title: Burton Store Helsinki
item.description: Burton snowboards concept store, high quality street and snowboarding clothing.
item.matko:location: Sörnäinen, Helsinki

item.title: Business Center Papula, Keilaniemi
item.description: Business Center Papula's spacious rooftop sauna facilities are located in Keilaranta, a short drive away from the center of Helsinki. Beautiful sea views and relaxing warmth of a sauna offers a great setting for gatherings. The venues are excellent for hosting longer meetings and dinners or organizing parties and other leisure time events. If you wish, you can use a catering service or cook yourself in a separate kitchen.

item.title: Cable Factory
item.description: The Cable Factory is the largest cultural centre in Finland. It houses 3 museums, 12 galleries, dance theatres, art schools and a host of artists, bands and companies. Unique spaces are also available for rent on a short-term basis to stage concerts, exhibitions, festivals and fairs. Around 900 people work at Kaapeli on a daily basis, and each year over 200,000 people attend special events. The Cable Factory is located by the sea, yet almost in the centre of the city.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km (0.2 km from metro station), airport 20 km; public transport connections to the city centre are excellent
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, inva-WC in the Merikaapelihalli, Puristamo and Valssaamo, parking for disabled in the inner yard of the building, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, easy access for blind or partially sighted. Assistance needed.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Free catering is permitted at all rented spaces in the Cable Factory. Restaurant Hima & Sali at the Cable Factory has also catering services.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The most suitable spaces for exhibitions are Puristamo (the former pressing hall), Valssaamo (the former rolling hall) and Merikaapelihalli (the former sea cable hall).
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Cable Factory provides an excellent setting for a wide range of events. The building has five unique venues for festivities and events and their total floor space is more than 4000 m2. Also available for renting are three conference rooms. All the rentable facilities allow for unrestricted catering. The Cable Factory is located by the sea, yet almost in the centre of the city. Excellent public transport connections.
item.matko:services: Cafe-restaurant

item.title: Cafe - Restaurant Ursula
item.description: Ursula was founded on the seaside the same year 1952 as the first Olympic Games took place in Helsinki. The profit of Ursula has been used since the beginning for the benefit of poor people.

item.title: Café Artist
item.description: Café Artist is located on the street level in the Swedish Theatre. They serve pastries, coffee and tea, wines and alcohol-free drinks also during the intervals. Pre-booking is recommended. The beautiful newly renovated public café on the second floor serves also during intervals.
item.matko:location: citycenter

item.title: Café Bar No 9
item.description: Cafe Bar No 9 has been a livingroom for culturel city folk from 1996. People, including both staff and customers, are the most important thing behind our restaurants success. Some of the kitchen's classics are the Chicken Coriander Wok and Pollo Limonello pasta.

item.title: Café Bar Valimo
item.description: Valimo is a café-restaurant and quay facility in a stylishly renovated grass-roofed ammunition foundry. To get to Valimo you pass by the old wooden sailing vessels being repaired in the docks.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 22 km

item.title: Cafe Carusel
item.description: Cafe carusel is a cosy cafe and restaurant by the seashore near Kaivopuisto park. Cafe carusel serves fresh pastries, delicious lunch and a la carte. During the summer Carusel also has one of the most popular terraces in Helsinki. Winter musts: fresh-baked cinnamon roll and hot chocolate.
item.matko:disabled: Handicap toilet

item.title: Café Cavalier
item.description: Café Cavalier is an elegant Gay bar & café in the middle of Helsinki near the Kamppi Metro station. Enjoy the nice atmosphere with live performances, cold drinks and delicious pastries.

item.title: Café Engel
item.description: An idyllic café in the Senate Square, with a view of the Cathedral. Table service from Monday to Saturday, self-service on Sundays. Free WLAN for customers. In summertime a summer movie theatre "Kesäkino Engel", the only out door movie theatre in Finland, is situated in the court yard of the café. Tickets in advance from Kino Engel (tel+358 -(0)20 155 5801 or ½hour before at the door.
item.matko:location: On the Senate Square, opposite of the Cathedral.
item.matko:services: Several different breakfast menus, served Mon-Fri 8-12, Sat 9-14, Sun 10-15. Lunch daily 11-15. In summertime also movie theatre "Kesäkino Engel", the only out door movie theatre in Finland. Tickets in advance from Kino Engel (tel+358 -(0)20 155 5801 or ½hour before at the door.

item.title: Café Esplanad
item.description: Café Esplanad is well known for its central European atmosphere and style and especially for its huge cinnamon rolls (a Finnish sweet pastry called Korvapuusti) that are baked in the cafés own bakery. On the outdoor terrace one can also enjoy the sun. Restaurant Bistro in the back of the café offers inexpensive lunch. Bistro and Kellariravintola are open on request.

item.title: Café Kahvila Suomi
item.description: A small lunch café that serves Finnish homecooking style lunch. The Kahvila Suomi café became popular after being in the Japanese film Kamome Shokudo.

item.title: Café Kiasma
item.description: Café Kiasma is famous for its delicious food made from the best ingredients. And for the best and friendliest waiters in Helsinki. On weekdays, the lunch menu has a vegetarian, fish and meat option, a soup and a lavish deli buffet. On weekends, the lunch consists of the deli buffet and soup. You can also have a speciality coffee, a freshly-brewed tea or a soft drink, and choose a savoury or sweet delicacy from the self-service bar. The café/restaurant is fully licensed. Favourites on our wine list among out customers are organic Kiasma White and Kiasma Red, as well as Kiasma Cava. The tables in the café are designed by the Finnish architect Vesa Honkonen. The white chairs made from 100% biodegradable material are from the Compos Collection by interior architect Samuli Naamanka. The café also has three unique Star Trek high chairs designed for babies by Stefan Lindfors.
item.matko:groups: Sales and reservations for groups (Mon-Fri) Jutta Weigh, tel. +358 (0)40 531 0683, jutta.weigh@capitalcateriing.fi
item.matko:services: Reservations (less than 10 people) and lunch inquiries during the weekdays, tel. +358 (0)45 8787186 kiasma@capitalcatering.fi.

item.title: Café Krypta - summer café
item.description: Café Krypta is located in the city centre, in the stone base of the Cathedral. The café is run by different voluntary organizations . There are also exhibitions at the café.
item.matko:location: Situated in the Helsinki Cathedral crypt
item.matko:services: Paying in only cash

item.title: Cafe Kuppi & Muffini
item.description: A cozy café with their own small bakery.

item.title: Café Köket
item.description: Cafe Köket is located in a heart of Helsinki next to the Senate square. It's one of the oldest buildings in Helsinki and Cafe Köket brings a modern twist and colourfulness to historical building. Friendly staff welcomes you to enjoy good food and company in beautiful atmosphere!
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 7-19, Sat 8-17, Sun 10-17. Summer brunch on weekends 10-15.
item.matko:disabled: The café is situated in a ground floor, and there is an accessible WC.
item.matko:services: Cafe Köket is in the middle of the Kiseleff house. The hall fits 120 persons and the two conference rooms fits 25 to 40 persons. Cafe Kökets skilled chefs prepares tasty dishes for small and for bigger occasions. Cafe Köket also works as a catering service.

item.title: Cafe Köket´s container cafe
item.description: Relaxed DIY (Berlin) spirited summer cafe near Hakaniemi square.
item.matko:open: Opens during weekdays+saturdays at 7.30 and sundays at 9.30 with weather reservations!

item.title: Café Mascot
item.description: A popular place for live music, board games and billiards. On Wednesday the music focuses on rap and reggae artists. There are different theme nights.

item.title: Café Mieritz
item.description: Café Mieritz is located on the right side of the wooden bridge to Seurasaari island.

item.title: Cafe Neuhaus
item.description: Chocolate shop selling Belgian Neuhaus chocolates. Also a small cosy café.

item.title: Café Piper
item.description: A wooden-villa café in Finland's oldest English-style park. For eighty years visitors and the inhabitants of the fortress have been able to enjoy a cup of coffee and something to eat in the beautiful Piper's Café with its marvellous sea view.
item.matko:disabled: Not suitable for disabled persons.
item.matko:groups: Café Piper serves also groups by reservation and private partys. Also school groups. Ehrensvärd Society group-reservations: phone +358-(0)9-684 1850 (Ehrensävrd Society) or +358-(0)9-668 447 (during Café Piper's opening hours), e-mail: guidebooking(at)suomenlinnatours.com

item.title: Cafe Piritta
item.description: This cosy café by the sea offers you a sunny terrace, delicious cakes and à la carte dishes. Lunch is served from Monday untill Saturday. You can start your day with a luxorius breakfast during the week or enjoy brunch on Sundays.

item.title: Café Regatta
item.description: Outdoor café by the sea in Töölö with funky vintage interior and decoration.
item.matko:open: Open year round with weather permit from dusk till dawn. Open even during Christmas holidays and Midsummer.

item.title: Café Strindberg
item.description: An international café with an open kitchen, where the delicacies served in the café are prepared. The separate coffee sales point offers a variety of delicious drinks from espresso and cappucino to more exotic flavors of coffee and tea. On the second floor is Strindberg à la carte and Strindberg's Bakficka.
item.matko:open: Café: Mon-Tue 9-22, Wed-Sat 9-24, Sun 10-20. Restaurant: Mon-Tue 11-22, Wed-Fri 11-24, Sat 12-24, Sun closed.

item.title: Café Succès
item.description: Café Succès has been serving its loyal customers from 1957. Along with its sister café, Café Esplanad, this café serves among other goodies also the famous Finnish "Korvapuusti" cinnamon roll.

item.title: Café Talo
item.description: Cafe Talo is a fine mixture of a street bar and a theater restaurant. The youthful and trendy two-storey venue is perfect for private events and an excellent alternative to the bars downtown. Age limit in the evenings: 22 years.

item.title: Café Tamminiementien kahvila
item.description: Enjoy a cup of warm tea or a glass of wine outside on the idyllic terrace or inside beneath the chandeliers. The café is located close to Seurasaari.

item.title: Café Tin Tin Tango
item.description: An interesting café & bar with art displays that serves breakfast, lunch and in the evening turns into a cozy bar, while also equipped with a self-service laundromat. Fresh buns from their own bakery available also as takeaway.

item.title: Cafe Vanille
item.description: A small café in the Russian merchant quarter. Home made pastries.
item.matko:open: Open all year round. Open daily 9.30-18 from the beginning of June, closed during midsummer, open from after midsummer till the middle of August 9.30-19, open daily 11-17 from septermber onwards.
item.matko:disabled: Not suitable for disabled persons.
item.matko:services: Special coffees, beer and cider, cakes, filled rolls and pies.

item.title: Café Veranda
item.description: Café Veranda in the Finlandia-hall provides a perfect setting for a coffee with its modern and stylish design and the location in the centre of Helsinki.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 9-19 and always two hours before a concert.
item.matko:disabled: Easy access from street level via Karamzininkatu.

item.title: Cafetoria Roastery & Café
item.description: It all started at the beginning of the new milenium when two cultures, the Latin and Finnish, get together and discovered in the coffee its power to unite cultures and to transmit common emotions, feelings, perceptions and passions. From that day onwards, Cafetoria roastery has been involved in the speciality coffee sector to proclaim those wonderful organoleptic properties of the coffee, gifts to flavouring our life.

item.title: Cale Cafe
item.description: A Portuguese cafe-bar run by a Portuguese family, where you can relax in a true Portuguese atmosphere with a meal, snack or coffee. All meals and pastries are home made with the quality, health and freshness as the main concern.

item.title: Candyshop Sweetheart
item.description: Small and cute confectionary, where you can find sweets from all over Europe.
item.matko:services: Take away coffee and tea.

item.title: Casa Mare
item.description: Casa Mare is a traditional restaurant in Lauttasaari. The slogan of Casa Mare is cosier than the city and it is the living room of people in Lauttasaari. Casa Mare serves delicious food, theme weeks by the season and friendly service. Casa Mare has plenty of possibilities, there are cabinets that can be used for meetings, family parties or other events, cozy bar where you can watch sports or play games and a separate playing corner for the kids.

item.title: Casino Helsinki
item.description: Casino Helsinki in the center of Helsinki 's entertainment and nightlife area, offers versatile and high quality entertainment for adults. As all around the world, the Casino is besides playing an excellent place to spend time and enjoy a high quality program. The experience is also complemented with professional and versatile restaurant services.
item.matko:location: In the center of Helsinki. Next to the railway station.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible for wheel chairs.
item.matko:groups: In Fennia Salonki 160 people at the same time
item.matko:additionalinfo: Experience the top class show and enjoy a delicious dinner in the charming 1920´s glamour and atmosphere of Fennia salon. Fennia salon has room for 150 dinner guests. Combined with Fennia bar and Piazza you can invite up to 500 guests. Casino Piazza in heart of the Fennia block serves lunch from Monday to Saturday.

item.title: Central Park
item.description: Covering a thousand hectares, the Central Park runs ten kilometres from Töölönlahti Bay in the centre to Haltiala on the northern outskirts of the city. In the city centre, it consists of urban cultural parks, its extensive central section is mainly recreational forests, while in Haltiala there are primeval forests and agricultural landscapes. There are four nature reserves in the park: the deciduous forests in Pitkäkoski and Ruutinkoski, Haltiala primeval forest and Niskala arboretum.

item.title: Central Railway Station
item.description: The Central Railway Station was designed by Eliel Saarinen in 1909 and the station was opened in 1919. The station is mostly clad in Finnish granite, and its distinguishing features are its clock tower and the two pairs of statues holding the spherical lamps, lit at night-time, on either side of the main entrance. The station is used by approximately 200,000 passengers per day, making it Finland's most-visited building.

item.title: CheapSleep Helsinki
item.description: With a mix of 10 private rooms and 118 dorm beds, this affordable and contemporary hostel, located in Vallila, Helsinki, offers superb transport options, with all parts of the city easily reached. There is a fully equipped kitchen and a dining and lounge area for guests to enjoy. Free WiFi throughout. This newly renovated hostel offers a complete package of price, location and style.
item.matko:open: The reception is open 09-02, check-in can be arranged 24/7

item.title: Chef & Sommelier
item.description: Chef & Sommelier concentrates on organic ingredients but also uses ingredients from the nature and from Fairtrade. Chef & Sommelier was chosen as restaurant of the year in 2013 by The Gastronomic Association of Finland. The restaurant received its first Michelin star in 2014.

item.title: Chico´s Bulevardi
item.description: At Chico's, we bring you the best of North American cuisine, adding our own flavour to it: a relaxed vibe. Discover the best burgers in town, the juicy BBQ treats and the melt-in-the-mouth desserts. Other Chico's restaurants in Helsinki: Chico's Töölö, Mannerheimintie 68 Chico's Kallio, Porthaninkatu 4 Chicos's Vuosaari, Vuotie 45

item.title: Children's Traffic Park
item.description: The Children's Traffic Park has organized traffic education for children since 1958. In summer the park is open for all children over 5 years old. The children have a possibility to ride play cars or cycles after the lessons. On Sundays the park is open for everyone without age-restrictions during which the children can play around in the park under parental supervision. Traffic education is organized in the Children's Traffic Park all year long. From autumn to spring the park organizes lessons for kindergarden-groups and for school children (1st-3rd grade). During the summer season the park is open for everyone over 5 years old. Instruction in traffic safety starts with theory lessons followed by driving practice in the park.
item.matko:open: In Autumn open only on request for groups Mon-Thu 8-16, Fri 8-14.15

item.title: Christine's Design
item.description: Unique Finnish design glass, ceramics, collectibles and furniture from 1930's until today.

item.title: Church of the Good Shepherd
item.description: The church was built in Pakila in 1950. The Pienkirkkoyhdistys (Association of small churches) had collected funds for it for decades. The state expropriated a community hall, the Lepolantie property which currently functions as a youth centre, from the association. The funds received were used to acquire the church plot. The church was mostly built by volunteers. The extension to the old church was completed in 2002. Its name, the Church of the Good Shepherd, originated from the relief which was in the old church, and now decorates the wall of the parish meeting hall. The Good Shepherd relief is the work of sculptor, Yrjö Rosola. The renovation of the new and old church was designed by Juha Leiviskä, Academician. The central building material of the new church was light. The style of the designer can also be seen in the light fixtures and vertical row of windows. Artist, Markku Pääkkönen's altar artwork, Gabrielin siipi (Gabriel's wing) throws the delicate colour from the row of windows and the display of colours reflected by the spectra into the church. The relief, Sinapinsiemen (Mustard seed), above the former main door of the church is the work of sculptor, Taisto Martiskainen. Textile artist, Agneta Hobin, made the altar textiles for the church, as well as the silver textured artwork in the children's chapel. There are also paintings by artist, Juri Saarikoski, in the building. The French-style Andreas Silberman organ was made by organ builder Martti Porthan in 2003. The old instrument by organ builder Veikko Virtanen can be found in Shepherd's Hall. The bell tunes, created by composer, Tuomo Teirilä, for the seven bells of the church, vary depending on the ecclesiastical year.
item.matko:disabled: Handicap toilet

item.title: Circuit.fi
item.description: Circuit.fi is a racing based entertainment and conference center designed for a realistic simulated driving experience. Enjoy a fun and relaxing atmosphere, high tech style and club type of experience all in one place.
item.matko:location: Pitäjänmäki, Helsinki, easy access with A- train from Helsinki Central Station.
item.matko:disabled: Inva WC/lift not availaible.
item.matko:groups: Groups should book tickets in advance.
item.matko:services: Racing simulators and many other activities. Catering kitchen - good food and service, P-area.

item.title: Cirko - Center for New Circus
item.description: Cirko, based in Suvilahti, Helsinki, is the only organisation of its kind in Finland. Cirko is closely involved in a variety of international networks, promotes the interests of the new circus sector in Finland and makes an active contribution towards the creation of a new and vibrant urban culture at its Suvilahti base. Cirko runs a creative residency programme for circus professionals, generates new productions and is responsible for organising the largest new circus festival in the Nordic countries. The former power house of Suvilahti's gasworks offers a rustic atmosphere alongside high quality, purpose-built technical installations. Both of Cirko's roomy studios, Solmu and Maneesi, offer space for many different kinds of events, from seminars, conferences and product launches to filmings. Solmu auditorium space of 213m² includes 142 removable seats, a sprung dance floor, blackout curtains, Molton curtains and extensive technical equipment. The walls, the ceiling and the floor all have multiple rigging points. Free height: 6 m, width: 10 m, depth: 10 m. Inquiries: +358 400 7686.
item.matko:location: The nearest metro station is Kalasatama. The journey from the city centre to Kalasatama takes approx. 6 minutes.

item.title: City Apartments
item.description: Furnished temporary housing in the Helsinki city centre. City Apartments offers a combination of all that is best about hotels and a home of your own. All apartments located in the same address in downtown Helsinki are fully furnished and equipped (renovated 2011). Kitchen; table ware, microwave oven, stove, coffee maker, kettle, toaster, refrigerator, dishwasher. Washing machine, direct dial phone, spacious work area, iron/ironing board, hair dryer, wake up alarm, towel heater. Bathroom with complimentary toiletries. Broadband Internet Access (no time restrictions or limits on amount of data transferred). TV with international satellite channels. Indoor parking. Apartment rates includes: bed linen and towels, weekly maid service, movie channel and broadband internet access.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km.
item.matko:open: Open all year round. Office open on weekdays 9am-3pm (during summer 9am-12pm).
item.matko:admission: Rates 95,00 - 348,00 EUR / apartment. Ask our offer for long term stay.
item.matko:disabled: 3 elevators.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Free public-Internet. Secured underground parking (extra charge).
item.matko:services: Parking garage.

item.title: City Hall
item.description: The City Hall was designed by C.L. Engel as a hotel in 1833, the building has been the City Hall since the 1930s. The Helsinki coat-of-arms can be seen on the tympanum. With the exception of the facade, it was completely rebuilt in 1967-1970 under the architect Aarno Ruusuvuori.

item.title: Citykoti.com Downtown City Apartments
item.description: Fully equipped Citykoti Apartments are from 20-32 sqm and they are situated in the very heart of Helsinki. We can offer accomodation services for longer as well as for shorter periods. Apartments are fully equipped including f.ex. TV/DVD, CD-radio, the change of bed linens etc.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Cloth Gallery
item.description: Cloth Gallery offers clothes of highest quality, timeless yet unique. Leena Ikonen, the owner of the company, creates the tailored fitting outfits. Cloth Gallery uses natural fabrics - silks, wool and linen. New designs are produced weekly and kept in small quantities.all of Cloth Gallery's collections are made by Finnish professionals in small workshops.

item.title: Club Playground
item.description: Electronic dance music. Club in the heart of Helsinki. Famous from its afterparties every Saturday & Sunday morning 05:00 till mid day or later.

item.title: Club Prkl
item.description: Rock Club

item.title: Club Venue
item.description: On Fridays the music in Venue consists of electronical music and its different sub genres. The Saturdays are dedicated to the different styles of house and tecno music. On most occasions during the parties Club Venue unites with the Playground club downstairs.
item.matko:open: Opening hours vary, for particular opening hours please see the Club's website.

item.title: Coccola
item.description: Restaurant Coccola is a breath of the Mediterranean inside the restaurant World at Linnanmäki amusement park. Restaurant Coccola serves pizzas, pastas and delightful salads.
item.matko:disabled: Handicap toilet, restaurant is on the ground floor.
item.matko:groups: Max 50 persons

item.title: Colorado Bar & Grill
item.description: Colorado Bar & Grill is a unique restaurant in downtown Helsinki offering a wide variety of classic American dishes from its South-West menu. In Colorado you can also just stop by for a drink and enjoy the famous interior design that sends you back to the Wild West like no other restaurant in Finland!
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 16-23 (kitchen open -22), Wed-Thu 16-24 (kitchen open -23), Fri 16-01 (kitchen open -23), Sat 12-01 (kitchen open -23), Sun 13-23 (kitchen -22).

item.title: Comodo Apartments
item.description: Comodo Apartments provides fully furnished and comfortable self-catering apartments in Helsinki region. We offer apartments in different size and quality depending on your needs. The minimum stay is 4 days or as long as you desire. . Our Comodo team is looking forward to helping you make the most of Helsinki. For more details, rates and availability please visit our website (www.comodo.fi/en) or contact us.

item.title: Congress T2 Helsinki Airport
item.description: Our facilities include more than ten different venues which can be used as efficient conference or meeting facilities or party venues with a view over the runway. Thanks to its compact size, the congress centre works well as a venue for private functions. The venue is suited to small-scale fairs as well as conferences with its group and exhibition facilities.
