Our friendly and helpful staff will ensure a successful event for you and your party. All our facilities are equipped with state-of-the-art conference technology: projector and screen, WLAN, flip chart and stationery. A laptop and conference phone are available for an extra fee. Congress T2 Helsinki Airport The entire Congress T2 is available for private functions. Seasons Meeting Room The fully equipped conference cabinet for 14 people is located in Restaurant Season's premises on the airside. The cabinet is available for booking if all the conference attendees are catching a flight. O'Learys Sportsbar Lion Cabinet Follow sports in the course of your conference, and explore the Finnish Ice Hockey Association's photo exhibition. The fully equipped conference cabinet for 20 is located in O'Learys Sportsbar's premises on the airside. The cabinet is available for booking if all the conference attendees are catching a flight.

item.title: Cooking Studio Espa
item.matko:location: In the centre, 20 km to the airport
item.matko:groups: Two meeting rooms for 8-12 and 10-20 people.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Tilat soveltuvat kokouskäytön lisäksi kokkaukseen, tuote-esittelyihin, lehdistötapahtumiin sekä cocktail- ja juhlakäyttöön. Tiloissa on moderni kokoustekniikka.

item.title: Corona Bar & Billiards
item.description: Corona Bar & Billiards is a combination of a New York-styled street bar and billiard hall with nine pool tables and one snooker table. Come and experience the laidback bar founded by the legendary Kaurismäki brothers.

item.title: Crazy Hedgehog Tea House
item.description: Crazy Hedgehog Tea House is a modern and bright tea house in the centre of Helsinki, next to the Railway Station, opposite the Parliament. Over 40 teas, cold tea drinks: tea-smoothie, tea-cocktail (also without alcohol), small snacks and self-made sweets. Full alcohol license (beer, cider, long drink, wine, sparkling wine, cocktails). There is a small stage and a piano.
item.matko:disabled: Suitable for disabled guests. Also guests with baby prams.

item.title: CrossFit Central Helsinki
item.description: The only CrossFit gym in Helsinki!

item.title: Crowne Plaza Helsinki
item.description: The Crowne Plaza Helsinki is an upscale hotel with high-quality services and a four-time-winner of World Travel Award "Finlands Leading Hotel", 2008, 2009, 2010 and 2011. All guestrooms offer first-class conveniences, including amenities and services of the Sleep Advantage program and free high-speed internet. The Club Floor on the top floor features Club rooms and Suites and the Club Lounge.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km. Hotel is situated opposite the Finnish National Opera, close to the Finlandia Hall and Olympic Stadium.
item.matko:disabled: Crowne Plaza has two rooms for persons with physical disability. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:groups: Winter Garden: 120 Banquet Hall: 430 1000 (cocktail event combining different rooms)
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 349 rooms of which 270 Standard rooms, 33 Club rooms, 42 Junior Suites, 4 Suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Macu - a la carte restaurant, elegant and with contemporary decor, 180 seats. International lobby bar.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Lounge 80 m2, Winter Garden 212 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Crowne Plaza Helsinki offers extensive banquet and meeting services. Forever Health Club & Day Spa, at the ground floor, is an unique place to treat and exercise your body and soul. Use of sauna, swimming pool and gym is included in the room rates.
item.matko:services: Crowne Plaza Helsinki offers extensive banquet and meeting services. Forever Health Club & Day Spa, at the ground floor, is an unique place to treat and exercise your body and soul. Use of sauna, swimming pool and gym is included in the room rates.

item.title: Cultural Magazine Gallery
item.description: The gallery features around 170 journals published by members of the Finnish Association for Cultural, Political and Scientific Journals (Kultti ry) and the Swedish language Journal Centre (Tidskriftscentralen).

item.title: Cumulus Airport (Restel)
item.description: The Cumulus Airport is an efficient and pleasant hotel close to the Helsinki-Vantaa Airport. A comfortable night's sleep, a good kitchen, and quick and friendly service ensure that your trip will go smoothly. Complimentary airport shuttle bus, which runs according to a set schedule, will take you to and from the hotel.
item.matko:location: Helsinki 18 km, airport 4 km. The Cumulus Airport is an efficient and pleasant hotel close to Helsinki-Vantaa airport.
item.matko:disabled: Lift. Four wheelchair accessible rooms.
item.matko:services: Two customer saunas, buffet breakfast, gym, garage, laundry, ironing rooms, rooms service, restaurant Huviretki, parking places, free airport connection.

item.title: Cumulus Hakaniemi Helsinki
item.description: Cumulus Hakaniemi Helsinki is a cosy 152 room city hotel. The modern hotel is located in the Hakaniemi district with good connections and lots of services nearby. All of the modern rooms are equipped with internet connection.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 15 km. Cumulus Hakaniemi Helsinki is located by the Hakaniemi market square, and walking distance from the main Railway station.
item.matko:disabled: The hotel has an elevator. One wheelchair accessible room.
item.matko:groups: The hotel has 32 rooms with three beds, eight rooms with four beds and five rooms with five beds. In addition, 19 rooms with a communicating door.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 152 rooms. Special rooms: non-smokers, combi, superior, extra beds.
item.matko:services: Lobby bar, breakfast restaurant, mini gym and two customer saunas.

item.title: Cumulus Kallio Helsinki
item.description: Cumulus Kallio Helsinki is favoured by business travellers as well as families on holiday. All rooms, corridor areas and the restaurant HuviRetki have been restyled from floor to ceiling to meet the high standard and look of the previously renovated reception. Traffic connections are good and there are facilities for bowling, swimming and ball games in the Urheilutalo sports centre next door. Linnanmäki Amusement Park and the SeaLife aquarium are nearby.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 5 cm) along the path, essential access, one step, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, a suite serves as an inva-room when necessary.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 121 rooms: 48 single rooms, 60 double rooms, 3 family rooms, 10 superior rooms.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, laundry service, wireless internet connection, free Disney Channel for kids (during summer season).
item.matko:services: Next to the Cumulus Kallio Helsinki is the sports hall Helsingin Urheilutalo with its gym, swimming pool, bowling alleys and ball courts. Guests have at their disposal a considerably wider range of services than city hotels can normally offer and the special prices are available with the valid hotel key card.

item.title: Customs Museum
item.description: The Customs Museum is located in the building Curtain Hamilton-Polhem in Susisaari, at the Suomenlinna fortress island. The permanent exhibition tells about the history of customs and smuggling in Finland. Information material on customs matters is also available at the museum.
item.matko:location: The Customs Museum is located in the building Curtain Hamilton-Polhem, i.e. building B 20, on Susisaari Island
item.matko:open: During summer season (23.5.-31.8.) Mon closed, Tue-Sun 12.30-17.30. During winter season (1.9.-22.5.) open for pre-booked groups.
item.matko:disabled: Not suitable for disabled persons.
item.matko:groups: Group visits can be arranged at other times by appointment. Bookings during winter tel +358 (0)20 492 1830.

item.title: Dance Center Footlight
item.description: Dance Center Footlight gives the education of dance art in Helsinki to children and teenagers as well as training for those aiming to be dance professionals. Own classes for adults. The background organization is Suomen Taidetanssin Tuki Ry. High curriculum consists of a children's education of dance, basic level studies and deepening studies. Dance Center Footlight has long traditions in dance teaching. The school was founded already in 1984.

item.title: Dance Theatre Rollo
item.description: Theatre Rollo (founded 1972) is a professional touring theatre that performs all over Finland and abroad. The performances are family-oriented with humour, movement and live, custom-composed music. Rollo's expertise encompasses encountering and handling juvenile audiences in genuinely interactive performance.
item.matko:ingress: Dance Theatre Rollo is one of the oldest Finnish dance theatres.

item.title: Day Spa BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel Haaga
item.description: A new Day Spa has been opened in BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel Haaga this Autumn. The new welfare center consists of Verso Beauty Salon, sport services and delicious healthy food. The Day Spa complements the renewed hotel's versatile facilities.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 9-20, Sat 10-17. Swimming pool is open every day 6-22.

item.title: Della Marga
item.description: Clothes, shoes, accessories etc. by eg. Armani, Chanel Accessories, Sonia Rykiel, Saint Laurent Paris, Dolce&Gabbana and Moncler.

item.title: DEMMERS TEEHAUS
item.description: A place for tea lovers. Tea, tea accessories and possibility to taste.

item.title: Design loft
item.description: Lovely design loft in glorious sunlight in Ruoholahti. Sea view opens to neighboring Lauttasaari. Excellent commuting, great location to explore Helsinki and its surroundings. Fully equipped and furnished Rent includes: Sauna in apartment, wireless internet, iPhone/ iPad Zeppelin dock, 47 inch LED TV and
item.matko:location: In the Ruoholahti district; city centre 10 min, airport 40 min.

item.title: Design Museum
item.description: The Design Museum illustrates the development of industrial art, artistic handicraft and industrial design from the second half of the 19th century to the present day. Classics of the Finnish design. Interesting special exhibitions. The permanent exhibition of the museum is supported by temporary Finnish and international thematic exhibitions on historical and contemporary design. The building from 1894 offers beautiful surroundings for all events which get additional value from the exhibitions. The exhibition spaces can be hired for events outside the Design Museums opening hours, the lecturing hall (70m2, 60 persons) and conference room (16 persons) can also be hired during opening hours.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 min, airport 30-40min
item.matko:open: During winter season (1.9.-31.5.) Mon closed, Tue 11-20, Wed-Sun 11-18. During summer season (1.6.-31.8.) daily 11-18.
item.matko:disabled: Entrance for wheelchairs and prams from Ullanlinnankatu street. Design Museum has an obstacle-free lift, and a wheelchair-accessible toilet on the basement level (floor K).
item.matko:groups: Guided tours can be booked in advance, tel.+358 (0)9 622 0540 (weekdays 8-11), at other times info@designmuseum.fi Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, Russian, Estonian and Spanish.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Café. High-class catering services available in the exhibition areas.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Exhibition areas on three floors: Basement 250 m2, height 200-285 cm, max 100 persons, I floor 335m2, height 360-410 cm, max 300 persons, II floor 800 m2, height 420-610 cm, max 500 persons. The exhibition architecture may have an effect on the amount of persons. Restaurant services in the exhibition spaces.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Receptions (max. 700 persons) can be arranged in the exhibition area outside the opening hours.
item.matko:services: Cafe (CafeBar Luomus, tel.+358 (0)9 6220 5423, www.cafeluomus.com) and museum shop open during the museum opening hours.The exhibition spaces can be hired for events outside the Design Museums opening hours, the lecture hall (70m2, 60 persons) and conference room (16 persons) can also be hired during opening hours.
item.matko:ingress: Permanent and temporary exhibitions of Finnish design.

item.title: Design Museum Arabia
item.description: The permanent exhibition of the Arabia Museum displays Arabia utility and art ceramics over a period of 130 years. The gallery is devoted to special exhibitions, historical and contemporary ceramics and glass. The museum is a part of the Design Museum.
item.matko:location: Tram nr. 6 from the city centre.
item.matko:open: Wed-fri 12am-6pm, sat-sun 10am-4pm. Mon-tue, 3rd April and 1st May closed.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups 1,50€/person (min. 8 persons). Guided tours by request. A visit to the Arabia factory and Iittala Group's show room can also be included in the tour. Bookings and inquiries: Taina Grönqvist, (Mon-Thu), tel.+358(0)204-39 5326, fax +358 (0)204-39 5180, e-mail: taina.gronqvist@iittala.com.
item.matko:services: Factory's retail shop. In the building also other retail shops and eg. lunch restaurant May.

item.title: Didrichsen Art Museum
item.description: The Didrichsen Art Museum is a unique combination of art museum and private home on Kuusisaari island in Helsinki. Temporary exhibitions and permanent displays of ancient Chinese and pre-Columbian artefacts. The building and its extension (1957 and 1964) was designed by architect Viljo Revell of Toronto City Hall fame and offers modern architecture, art and a sculpture park by the sea. Museum has largest collection of Henry Moore in Nordic countries.
item.matko:location: Buses 194, 195 from Eliel Square and buses 503-506.
item.matko:open: In spring (28.2.-31.5.) Mon closed, Tue-Sun 11-18. In summer (1.6.-31.8.) Mon closed, Tue-Sun 11-17.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is fully accessible.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours on request (in Finnish, Swedish, English). Guide fee weekdays 70€, Sun 80€, school groups 30€. Guided tours outside regular opening hours upon request. Possibility to arrange small snack on request.
item.matko:services: Museum shop, coffee and water automat. Car park. Museum also available for private functions.

item.title: Diesel Store
item.description: Diesel flagship store in Helsinki includes the entire collection of the premium casual wear brand for both male and female.

item.title: Digelius
item.description: Record store specialised in jazz- and ethnic music. New and second hand lp:s and cd:s since 1971.
item.matko:location: Viiskulma

item.title: Domin Rental Apartments
item.description: Domin Rental Apartments offers an alternative to staying in a hotel. Around 50 furnished apartments in the Greater Helsinki region to choose from. Minimum charge 5 days.
item.matko:location: Furnished apartments for rent in Helsinki and Espoo.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Prices include use of a furnished apartment, cleaning and sheets. Charges are made on a daily basis. The longer stay, the lower the daily rate. Phone calls and satellite tv channels are charged separately. 20% service premium will be added to the invoice.

item.title: Don Corleone
item.description: A very simple concept of serving great food in a simple and comfortable environment, for reasonable prices, has made Don Corleone one of the most talked about restaurants in Helsinki. After only one year since its opening, Don Corleone was awarded with "the best pasta in town" title by City magazine and is enjoying a sea of smiles and praise from its regular customers. In addition to pasta, Don Corleone offers mouth watering appetizers, fresh salads and delicacies from the grill. All made and supervised by their native italian chefs.

item.title: Dubrovnik
item.description: Dubrovnik Lounge & Lobby is the first New York-style live music and picture venue in Helsinki

item.title: eBike Shack Helsinki Oy
item.description: eBike Shack Helsinki is an electric bike rental shop located in the heart of the city, Erottajanaukio. You can take a trip around Helsinki and see the best sites, eBike Shack Helsinki gives you tips what to do on your bike route. You can either join in a group tour, which will be operated on scheduled times listed on eBike Shack Helsinki's website, or you can just rent a bike and do your own thing! Take a ride, and see Helsinki in a different way!

item.title: Ecobike
item.description: Bikes for rent, new and used bikes for sale, repairs and spare parts.
item.matko:location: Next to the football stadium.
item.matko:open: Open by appointment, please call in advance.

item.title: Ecoshop Ekotin
item.description: Ekotin is specialized in ecologically and ethically produced home accessories, textiles, decorative items, gifts and organic delicatessen. NB! Ecotin functions currently only online.
item.matko:location: Ekotin is situated next the Hakaniemi Market Hall about 5 minutes away from the city centre. The shop can be reached by bus, metro or tram.

item.title: Ecoshop Ruohonjuuri
item.description: A broad selection of ecological and organic products, foodstuffs etc. Other stores: Itäkeskus, Hakaniemi, Citycenter.
item.matko:open: Shops open at: Mon-Fri 9-21, Sat 9-18, Sun 12-18 Hakaniemi: Mon-Fri 10-20, Sat 10-17, Sun 12-16

item.title: Ehrensvärd Museum
item.description: Once the residence of the fortress commandant, the museum is named in honor of Augustin Ehrensvärd (1710-1772), under whose direction most of the fortifications were build.
item.matko:open: In May (11.-31.5.) daily 10.30-16. In the summer season (1.6.-31.8.) daily 11-18. In September (1.-20.9) daily 11-16.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is not accessible.
item.matko:groups: Guide for school groups 95€
item.matko:services: The museum has a small museum shop.

item.title: Ekberg
item.description: The classic café Ekberg still serves the Napoleon cake and the Champagne Cork, favourite to many of its customers. The breakfast buffét is also a popular place to meet at. Weekdays a soup lunch is served.

item.title: Ekberg Extra
item.description: Ekberg Extra is a newly renovated hall for private occasions such as conferences, meetings, receptions, dinners and exhibitions. It is situated close to the city centre and can comfortably take 60 persons.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:services: Ekberg Party Service takes care of the catering.

item.title: Ekolo
item.description: Ekolo is a shop selling ecological and organic products and foodstuffs. Ekolo also promotes and gives information on sustainable consumption and production.

item.title: Ekolo
item.description: Ekolo is a shop selling ecological and organic products and foodstuffs. Ekolo also promotes and gives information on sustainable consumption and production.

item.title: Elannon näyttämö
item.description: Theatre and music performances

item.title: Eläintarha Sports Park
item.description: Eläintarha Sports Park, located behind Olympic Stadium and Swimming Stadium, is a popular training place for track and field athletes.

item.title: Eläintarha Villa / Bourgeois Home Exhibition
item.description: Bourgeois home exhibition is shown in one of the few remaining villas (1889) in the Linnunlaulu/Eläintarha district of the city. Three of the downstairs rooms are furnished in the style of the times and providing a glimpse of life in and the atmosphere of the house a century age.

item.title: Eronen
item.description: A record store, founded in 1977, that is specialized in eg.reggae, salsa, afro, latin, classic and jazz music.

item.title: Erottaja Night
item.description: Erottaja Night is both a nightclub and a karaokebar. Dance and sing to the latest hits from Finland and around the world.

item.title: Escape Room Helsinki
item.description: Escape Room Helsinki is a real life escape room adventure right in the centre of Helsinki. You are locked into a room together with a group of friends, family members or work mates and you have 60 minutes to get out. To succeed, you need to solve riddles, puzzles and mysteries, working together as a team. Everybody can do it! No physical force is needed, just observation skills and creative thinking. Activate our inner Sherlock Holmes!

item.title: Espa Stage
item.description: Espa is a summer stage located in the Esplanadi park. Over 200 different artist groups perform on the stage during the summer. The performers at Espa include both young artists beginning their careers and well known and respected artists. Jazz-Espa, which has been called the longest jazz festival in Finland, has a well established place in the summer programme. For years, the performers of both Province days and Helsinki Day have brought joy to Helsinki inhabitants and travellers promenading in the Esplanadi park.
item.matko:open: There are events on the Espa stage from 1 May until the end of August. Performances usually start at 4.30 p.m. Monday-Thursday, and at 10.30 a.m. on Saturday. On weekdays during the lunch hour, the stage is also a popular place to perform.
item.matko:services: The stage is rented out to outside organisers, but not for political or religious events. During autumn and winter, the Espa stage acts as an exhibition gallery. Inquiries: Office controller Tuula Miettinen, tel. +358-(0)9-3103 6564, e-mail: tuula.miettinen@hel.fi.

item.title: Esplanade Park
item.description: Situated in the heart of Helsinki, the Esplanade Park serves as a promenade for travellers and a place to relax for Helsinkians. The park and the Espa Stage host many popular events, including the Marimekko Fashion Show in June and the Jazz-Espa concert series on throughout July.
item.matko:ingress: Esplanade park is situated in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: Esprit
item.description: Founded in 1968, Esprit is an international fashion brand that pays homage to its roots and expresses a relaxed, sunny Californian attitude towards life. Esprit creates inspiring collections for women and men made from high-quality materials paying great attention to detail. All of Esprit's products demonstrate the Group's commitment to quality design and execution.

item.title: Euphoria
item.description: Euphoria is a modern and stylish Banqueting venue owned by the Council of Medical Students in Helsinki University. It is a penthouse and offers a magnificent view over the eastern parts of Helsinki. Euphoria has been recently renovated by famous architects and has a unique and cosy atmosphere. Venue has dining facilities for 120 people, conference facilities for 50 people and can be transformed to a festival hall for 250 people. We also offer a bar, sauna facilities, a high standard kitchen and grand piano lounge. All-inclusive services for conferences up to 50 people.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 14 km

item.title: Eurohostel Oy
item.description: Eurohostel is one of the largest hostels in Scandinavia open all year around. This city hostel is located close to the sea in central Helsinki - in a unique part of the town surrounded by Art Nouveau buildings and old red brick warehouses. The market square, sights, shops and restaurants of the city centre are all within walking distance and passenger ferries to Sweden, Estonia and Russia are only a few steps away. Eurohostel is also easy to reach by trams that arrive right next to the hostel. All the floors are equipped with a self-service kitchen, showers and washroom facilities for men and women. The reception is always open.
item.matko:location: Katajanokka district - City centre 2 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 135 rooms: 25 single, 100 twin, and 10 triple rooms. Traditional Backpackers category: bed, single, twin and triple. Modern Eurohostel category: single, twin and triple.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Katajanmarja serves breakfast, lunch, dinner, pizza and a la carte list. Fully licenced. 70 seats. Summer terracce.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Self-service kitchens on each floor, self-service laundry, Internet kiosk.
item.matko:ingress: Clean and comfortable Hostel at Katajanokka district.

item.title: Event Arena Bank
item.description: This distinctive restaurant at the very centre of Helsinki has been constructed in an old bank building which has been transformed into its current state honouring the original 1950's style. The result is a modern and versatile restaurant and event arena to hold meetings and celebrations. The Party Spot is an extremely versatile banquet space. It can be transformed from a setting suitable for a traditional dinner to an extravagant banquet room which matches any theme you can think of. Most of the 18 meeting rooms can be easily connected and adjusted to various needs.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lunch Club is a free-flow lunch restaurant for up to 200 persons; Bank Bistro has 80 seats and serves as a private evening restaurant. Party Spot is a private venue for meetings and cocktail parties for 1000 people. The whole Event Arena Bank can be booked for up to 1600 persons.

item.title: Exhibition Laboratory
item.description: The Exhibition Laboratory of the Academy of Fine Arts at the University of the Arts Helsinki is a multidisciplinary exhibition centre for students, scholars, artists, curators and other arts professionals as well as the wider public. There are six exhibitions per year, and a versatile program of public events.

item.title: Exhibition Laboratory Project Room
item.description: Project Room's exhibitions present the work of student artists emerging form the Academy of Fine Arts. Project Room's exhibitions are experimental and innovative, and they're intended to challenge and expand viewers' ideas about art and art practice today.

item.title: Fafa's
item.description: Street food from the east, crazy falafels...

item.title: Fairytale
item.description: Gay Bar

item.title: Fallkulla Domestic Animal Zoo
item.description: In Fallkulla it is possible to get aquainted with animals in a traditional farm: sheep, goats, pigs, cows, chicken, ducks, geese and horses. In Fallkulla children and the young 9-17years can also take part in animal care and help with work on the farm. Run by the City of Helsinki Youth Department.
item.matko:location: Local train I (or N & T) to Tapanila, c. 10-15min. walk. Also buses 76A and 76B from Malmi and Puistola train stations to the Domestic Animal Zoo.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Bookings in advance, tel.+358-(0)9-3108 9095 (Wed-Fri 13-14). Groups max.30persons.
item.matko:services: Farm Museum in the cowshed loft.
item.matko:ingress: In Fallkulla it is possible to get aquainted with animals in a traditional farm.

item.title: Farouge
item.description: When the Lebanese ask you kifak?, or how are you in Arabic, they are literally asking whether you are experiencing pleasure. Pleasure, or kaif in Arabic, comes from good food, good wine, and good company.

item.title: Fasaani Antik
item.description: A wide range of furniture and other objects, also some Finnish design objects

item.title: Fazer Café
item.description: Karl Fazers French-Russian café&cake shop was opened in Kluuvikatu 17.9.1891. As years have passed by the building, designed by Juslen, has been renovated and the interior of the café has been changed many times. The design of the cupola salon has been designed by interior designor Kaisa Blomstedt, who's well acquainted especially with interiors in functionalistic style. A part of the café&cake shops goodies are still made in Kluuvikatu, and it is possible to see the confectioners at work behind glass.

item.title: Feel The Nature Treks
item.description: Feel The Nature Treks is a Finnish tour operator specialized in active holidays and treks. Feel the Nature Treks wants to introduce the unique Finnish nature to its clients.
item.matko:open: Wilderness Canoeing Adventure in Nuuksio: Saturdays 10.00 am from May 24 to Sep 27 2014, also Tuesdays and Thursdays from June 24th to Aug 14th.

item.title: Feminett
item.description: Feminett is known for its high quality Fashionable collections from the capitols of European fashion. Feminett was established in 1949 and since then its principles have been unerring style, high quality products and a great service.

item.title: Fida Hakaniemi
item.description: Biggest second hand chain store in Finland. By purchasing our products you are helping children and young people in developing countries.

item.title: Fida lähetystori Malmi
item.description: Biggest second hand chain store in Finland. By purchasing our products you are helping children and young people in developing countries.

item.title: Fida lähetystori Maunula
item.description: Biggest second hand chain store in Finland. By purchasing our products you are helping children and young people in developing countries.

item.title: Fida lähetystori Puotinharju
item.description: Biggest second hand chain store in Finland. By purchasing our products you are helping children and young people in developing countries.

item.title: Fida Lönkka
item.description: Biggest second hand chain store in Finland. By purchasing our products you are helping children and young people in developing countries.

item.title: Fida Sörnäinen
item.description: Biggest second hand chain store in Finland. By purchasing our products you are helping children and young people in developing countries.

item.title: Filippa K
item.description: Timeless simplicity with contemporary edge.

item.title: Finlandia Hall
item.description: Finlandia Hall offers a unique environment, for everything from conferences and banquets to events and concerts - and helps turn them into unique experiences. A masterpiece by the world-renowned Finnish architect, Alvar Aalto, Finlandia Hall is worth a visit in its own right.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:open: Open only during events and guided tours. Servicepoint open Mon-Fri 9-19.
item.matko:admission: Guided tours: Adults 12,50€, senior citizens, students and children (under 16years) 10€
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, Inva-WC, induction loop system (amplification system for people with hearing aids)
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups (max.25pers.) by request, Info-Shop, tel.+358-(0)9-4024 211, guide fee during weekdays 120€, Sat-Sun and holidays 170€. Reservations www.finlandiatalo.fi.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Finlandia Restaurant is a private restaurant, which serves gourmet food; dinner for 1100 persons, cocktails for 2500. Tel. +385 9 6128 6400
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main building c. 4,000 m2, Congress wing c. 2,000 m2
item.matko:services: Regular guided tours open to the public. Further information at the InfoShop, tel.+358-(0)9-40241, e-mail:servicepoint@finlandiatalo.fi or www.finlandiatalo.fi (open Mon-Fri 9-17). Interval refreshments can be booked in advance from 9 to 16 on weekdays, tel. +358-(0)9-402 4500.
item.matko:ingress: Internationally most notable concert and congress hall in Finland.

item.title: Finlandia Hall
item.description: Finlandia Hall in Helsinki is the leading congress, event and entertainment venue in Finland. Centrally located, in park-like surroundings, Finlandia Hall is ideal for conferences and exhibitions, as well as for smaller meetings, concerts and light entertainment. A masterpiece by the world-renowned Finnish architect, Alvar Aalto, Finlandia Hall is worth a visit in its own right. Exhibition areas: Main building 4000 m2, Veranda 2200 m2, Congress Wing 2000 m2
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main building 4000m2, Congress Wing 2000m2

item.title: Finlayson
item.description: Finlayson has a rich heritage of manufacturing quality textiles since 1820. Even today, Finlayson Oy textiles and Familon bed concepts add a touch of luxury to private homes and public premises. Long-term cooperation with the Allergy and Asthma Federation of Finland guarantees our products are also ideal for people who suffer from allergy.

item.title: Finlayson outlet
item.description: Finlayson has a rich heritage of manufacturing quality textiles since 1820. Also today high quality Finlayson textiles and bed concepts as well as Familon duvets, pillows and mattresses add a touch of luxury and softness to private homes and public premises. In this shop you'll also find special collections and second rate products. In the same building you'll also find other outlets, eg. the Arabia outlet.
item.matko:location: tram nr.6 towards Arabia

item.title: Finnish Art Agency
item.description: Finnish Art Agency arranges art exhibitions.

item.title: Finnish Engineers' Association Building
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto (1948-1953).

item.title: Finnish Museum of Photography
item.description: The Finnish Museum of Photography is a special museum devoted to the art and practice of photography in Finland. The exhibitions throw light on the Finnish photography, both past and present. Also temporary Finnish and foreign photo exhibitions.
item.matko:location: tram 8, metro to Ruoholahti
item.matko:admission: 8/5/0€. Free admission on every month's last Wednesday 17-20.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is fully accessible.
item.matko:groups: Group entrance fee 5€/pers (min. 10 pers.). School groups (under 18 years) free of charge. Guidebookings tel.+358 (0)9 6866 3621 (Tue-Fri 9-12) or workshop@fmp.fi. Guidance fee weekdays 60€, Sat and holidays 75€. School groups 36€ (children under 18 years). Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English.
item.matko:services: Museum shop.

item.title: Finnish National Opera
item.description: Surrounded by park, the Opera, built in the beginning of the 1990's, is in the inner city and easily accessible by public transport. View from the main foyer over the sea and city centre. Performances six days a week as a rule: opera, ballet, premieres, concerts and other events. Main auditorium, intimate Almi Hall and impressive foyers. Guided tours by arrangement.
item.matko:location: City centre 1.5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:admission: Different ticket categories (1.-6.); students and schoolchildren -50% in ticket categories 1-4.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, Inva-WC, lift (doors opens automatically), easy access for visually impaired, wheelchair seats in the boxes of the 1st and 2nd balcony. When buying tickets for these seats, please notify the Opera at least a week in advance. Parking and entrance in Töölö Bay side. The libretto of some operas available in embossed printing. Induction loop system for people with hearing aids in the stalls and on the 1st balcony.
item.matko:groups: Tickets for groups: in ticket categories 1 and 2 discount -10€/person (Mon-Thu, min. 30 persons). Guided tours of the Opera House can be organized on request for groups. For further information and bookings, The National Opera sales service, tel. +358- (0)9-4030 2210, e-mail: housetours@operafin.fi .
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Opera Restaurant: 200-650 seats; catering in the foyer for 1500
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer
item.matko:additionalinfo: Guided tours on request, regular opera and ballet performances
item.matko:services: Guided tours in Finnish every Wed at 14.30 (8€/adults, 5€/children). Guided tours of the Opera House in English in other languages can be organized on request during the performance season. For further information and bookings, The National Opera sales service, tel. +358- (0)9-4030 2210, e-mail: housetours@operafin.fi . Café Opera in the main foyer is open Mon-Fri 12-17, exhibitions in the café.

item.title: Finnish National Theatre
item.description: Main theatre in Finland performing in Finnish
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchairs, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Group bookings, tel. +358 (0)9 1733 1332, guided tours of e.g. sets possible.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Café and restaurant Morkku (open Mon-Fri 15-24 and Sat 11-24) Restaurant also for groups as well as for private occasions. Small shop in connection to the ticket sales.
item.matko:services: Café and restaurant Morkku (open Mon-Fri 15-24 and Sat 11-24) Restaurant also for groups as well as for private occasions. Small shop in connection to the ticket sales.
item.matko:ingress: Main theatre in Finland performing in Finnish.

item.title: Finnish-British Society
item.description: Finnish-British Society has different size of classrooms for meetings.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Finnkino Tennispalatsi
item.description: Movie theatre complex. Under the same roof, you can enjoy movies and the arts, as well as cafés and restaurants.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Fish Foot Spa KutiKuti
item.description: Fish Foot Spa KutiKuti is a relaxing foot spa for a person who cares about animals and who wants to pamper feet.
item.matko:location: Ullanlinna, Helsinki
item.matko:open: Tue-Fri klo 11 am-19 pm, Sat-Sun 11 am-16 pm
item.matko:disabled: Street level
item.matko:groups: 1h 80 € (two available swimming pools), 1,5h 100 € (two available swimming pools)

item.title: Fishing Lords
item.description: Fishing Lords is a company providing services mainly in the Southern Finland since year 2000. Finland's fantastic fishing is what they specialize in and aim to excel in, but they do provide other events on the sea as well as on the land. They have several cottages for rent - all close the sea and ranging from smaller but high level cottages to big luxurious cottages. They also provide a gourmet level catering. Their service-minded, flexible and modern attitude can be seen in everything they do. They can provide anything from just one special request to all included corporate events.

item.title: Fishmarket
item.description: Located near the South Harbour in the heart of Helsinki, Fishmarket is the place to go for fresh, delicious seafood and crustacean. One of the best fish restaurants in town will surprise you with experiences that you cannot find anywhere else. Fishmarket offers freshly caught, delicious fish and fresh lobster, crayfish, oysters and shellfish, prepared just right, served unpretentiously and enjoyed in the best company.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, 19 km to the airport
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-96

item.title: Fleuriste
item.description: Fleuriste is a cosy café and salon de thé combining Parisian elegance, Finnish design, and smell of grandmother's kitchen. Homemade sandwiches, quiche, cakes, cinnamon rolls as well as salads and Saturday brunch are well-known in the town.
item.matko:open: Tu, Wed, Thu 10-18, Fri and Sat 10-17

item.title: Flower of Life, artpark for children
item.description: Flower Of Life artpark, a permanent art park with sculptures for all ages, especially for children under three years old.
item.matko:location: Pikku-Huopalahti, catch tram nr.10 to Tilkantori, from where a walk to Tilkanniitty
item.matko:ingress: Flower Of Life artpark, a permanent art park with sculptures for all ages.

item.title: Forenom Apartments
item.description: Forenom Apartments offers equipped and furnished apartments located all around Helsinki; from the city centre to suburbs. Forenom offers apartments of various levels, from basic to luxury, from studios to houses. All Forenom apartments are available for both short and long terms. An excellent, more homelike and flexible alternative to hotel accommodation.
item.matko:location: Around the capital region

item.title: Forenom Helsinki Herttoniemi Aparthotel
item.description: Forenom Helsinki Herttoniemi Aparthotel aims to provide modern, simple and hassle-free accommodation 15 minutes away from Helsinki city centre. The building has been completely renovated in 2012. Brightly decorated rooms include flat screen television, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and kettle. Some of the rooms also have a kitchenette with a hotplate. The rooms have a free wireless internet at your use. The apartment hotel uses easy keyless entry: after making your reservation, you receive an entry code via SMS to your mobile phone. This key code provides entry to the general front door and is unique to your apartment. Nearby the apartment hotel you can find a supermarket, restaurants, some shops, pharmacy and a gym.
item.matko:location: In Herttoniemi, about 500 meters from the nearest metro station. Helsinki city centre is 15 minutes and the airport 25 minutes away.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 144 Superior-level rooms, ranging in size from 13 m2 to 35 m2. Rooms can accommodate 1-4 persons depending on the room type.

item.title: Forenom Pop-Up Hotel
item.description: Forenom Helsinki Keskusta Aparthotel is located in the heart of downtown Helsinki in the vicinity of various services, while also offering a peaceful, noise-free environment. The self-service apartment hotel opened its doors in July 2014. Room rates include free wireless internet connection, linen and weekend clean-up. Visitors can choose between two and three-person rooms, which are of course available for single visitors as well. The rooms are very well equipped. In addition to a high-speed wireless internet connection, the rooms are equipped with a microwave oven, a mini fridge, a coffee maker, a water boiler, as well as a toaster and dishes. The location offers excellent access to other parts of Helsinki, with public transport routes running right next to the hotel. The adjacent street has several restaurant, a pharmacy, a grocery store, as well as Kamppi shopping centre. The hotel is just a short walk away from the bus terminal and metro station. The Helsinki railway station, as well as other services are also located within a short walking distance. Despite its central location, the hotel is very tranquil, ensuring a comfortable stay. Please contact customer service for reservations at +358 20 198 3420, e-mail: reservations@forenom.fi. You can also make reservations at online shop forenom.fi.

item.title: Formula Center Helsinki
item.description: Underground Karting track.
item.matko:location: Metro to Myllypuro.
item.matko:open: Mondays closed Tuesday - Friday: 14.00 - 21.00 Saturday: 10.00 - 19.00 Sunday: 14.00 - 20.00

item.title: Formverk
item.description: A Finnish company creating Scandinavian design, chairs, lighting fixtures, accessories etc.

item.title: Formverk Living
item.description: Furniture and decorations for your home.

item.title: Forum Box
item.description: FORUM BOX is a non-profit artist-run co-operative society, which was initiated in 1996 by sculptor Kain Tapper (1930-2004). Its main purpose is to maintain an art space in Helsinki in order to enrich and support the Finnish cultural life. Currently Forum Box co-op has 36 artist members, all of which are prominent Finnish artists and actors in the field of contemporary art.

item.title: Foto Cafe Postitalo
item.description: Foto Cafe is a modern and pleasant coffee shop in a historical milieu. The coffee shop is found in one of the most beautiful buildings, Postitalo (Postisali), in the middle of Helsinki, near the Central Railway Station. Foto Cafe offers a peaceful environment surrounded by busy capital. Foto Cafe has a wide range of different coffee and tea beverages, smoothies and juices, wines, beers and ciders as well as pastries, cakes and toasts etc. If you are even more hungry order a salad of your choice or the day´s lunch. Coffee shop provides free Wi-Fi for the customers.
item.matko:disabled: Foto Cafe provides bigger restrooms and an elevator for disabled customers.

item.title: Frankly My Dear
item.description: Frankly My Dear loves good quality contemporary clothing for women and children. The store offers clothes for everyday life, as well as for parties from labels such as Gant, Hilfiger, Esprit, Marimekko, Lego etc. Frankly My Dear believes in strong women such as Scarlett O´Hara who served as inspiration for the company's name. Everything is preloved and in very good condition. The shopkeeper is a history researcher and teacher so Frankly My Dear offers nice shopping moments with a pinch of Finnish history.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue, Thu, Fri 10-18, Wed 12.30-19, Sat 10-17, Sun closed.

item.title: Fratello Torrefazione
item.description: Fratello Torrefazione, located in the Kluuvi shopping centre, serves great coffees, both espresso and filter, supplied by Kaffa Roastery. Italian-inspired lunch, sandwiches, pastries, wine and beer are also available. The real speciality is the syphon bar, first of its kind in Finland.

item.title: Freedom
item.description: Sun terrace, karaoke bar, Open Air -Disco. Located in Töölö, next to the Olympic Stadium.
item.matko:open: During Summer Season; Mon - Thu: 14:00 - 2:00, Fri - Sun: 12:00 - 2:00

item.title: Frida Marina
item.description: Frida Marina is a 138m2 concept store in the Kallio district, offering second hand clothes, bags, shoes, jewellery, home accessories, textiles, tableware and other old and new treasures. At the same address, you can also find the lovely Moonk Shop, selling recycled, ethically and ecologically produced interior design products and jewellery. Store also serves Puro organic coffee and high-quality tea, that can be purchased home as well. On sale also a selection of organic cosmetics from Madara and Sante.

item.title: Friends of Finnish Handicraft
item.description: Friends of Finnish Handicraft offer services to both interior design professionals and homemakers. From the Friends of Finnish Handicraft you can find high quality textiles and gift items made with natural materials. For crafters the Friends of Finnish Handicraft offer complete ryijy rug and embroidery kits.

item.title: Fuga
item.description: Fuga, spezialiced in classic music, is located in the center of Helsinki within the Helsinki Music Centre premises. The shops selection consists of about 15,000 cd's and hundreds of dvd's.

item.title: Fun Bowling
item.description: Bowling has become a popular sports amoung different ages.

item.title: G. W. Sundmans
item.description: This top-class restaurant located in a historic house on the southern side of Helsinki harbour offers a diverse and functional space for occasions of all sizes. G.W. Sundmans has several private rooms and conference rooms of different sizes to choose from, and the restaurant also offers use of a pleasant wine cellar and an up-to-date auditorium. The delicacies offered by the restaurant's high-class kitchen complete the experience. The restaurant is set in the empire-style house of naval captain G.W. Sundman, which was designed to him in the 19th century by Finnish architect Carl Ludvig Engel. G.W.Sundmans guests can enjoy the best products of the Finnish kitchen, prepared from the finest ingredients.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: The restaurant is open on request.
item.matko:groups: Groups up to 30 people

item.title: Galerie Anhava
item.description: Galerie Anhava focuses on contemporary Finnish and Nordic art with an active role at the international level. The gallery's exhibition programme encompasses all forms of contemporary visual art, from painting and sculpture to photography, video and installation, with special emphasis on conceptual art.

item.title: Galerie Aspis
item.description: With more than 30 years of experience in fine art consultancy, Galerie Aspis is dedicated to selling the finest quality 20th century original prints and drawings to fine art collectors worldwide. We are experts in the field of limited edition graphic prints which include hand signed lithographs, etchings, aquatints, screenprints, linocuts, woodcuts and more. We sell masterworks in the best condition and ship anywhere in the world. We have a large stock of original prints from the world renowned artists such as Picasso, Braque, Chagall, Dali, Miro, Warhol, Solin, Vasarely and Lanskoy.
item.matko:open: The gallery is open by appointment only.

item.title: Galerie Forsblom
item.description: From emerging talents, to established artists, Galerie Forsblom presents exhibitions by leading Finnish and International artists.

item.title: Galerie Vision
item.description: The Gallery purchases, sells and mediates domestic and international high-class graphics, paintings and sculptures. You can have a one-of-a-kind bronze scuplture crafted by the artist (sculptor) Osmi Nyström.

item.title: Galleri Arbis
item.description: Works by student of Arbis

item.title: Galleria 4-kuus
item.description: Art Gallery

item.title: Galleria Alkovi
item.description: Window gallery

item.title: Galleria Ama
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Galleria Art Frida
item.description: Gallery

item.title: Galleria BE' 19
item.description: Galleria BE'19 was founded in 1989. The exhibition program consists of all aspects of contemporary art including design. Galleria BE'19 arranges 15-16 exhibitions per year. The exhibition period is three weeks. BE'19 concentrates mainly on Finnish contemporary art, but an interesting foreign artist can also be a part of the program. Galleria BE'19 acts as a dealer, agent and an individual consultant.

item.title: Galleria Bronda
item.description: Interesting exhibitions changing every 4 weeks, wide range of graphic art on sale.

item.title: Galleria Dix
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Galleria Esplanad
item.description: Galleria Esplanad is a shopping centre spanning an entire city block in the heart of Helsinki. The shopping centre offers an extensive and diverse selection of international quality brands for both everyday needs and special occasions. Galleria Esplanad has nearly 40 specialised shops as well as high-quality services and restaurants on three floors. Entrances: Pohjoisesplanadi, Mikonkatu, Aleksanterinkatu, Kluuvikatu

item.title: Galleria G
item.description: The gallery is maintained by the Association of Finnish Printmakers. The programme is focused on graphic arts and artworks on paper, but it also exhibits paintings, photographs, sculptures, and installations. The gallery houses also the sales collection of the Association of Finnish Printmakers which is a representative cross-section of new Finnish graphic art.

item.title: Galleria G12
item.description: Gallery for Finnish contemporary art.

item.title: Galleria G18
item.description: gallery

item.title: Galleria Heino
item.description: Gallery focuses on presenting, promoting and furthering the careers of established mid-career and emerging younger Finnish contemporary artists at national and international level. The gallery shows art in different media - painting, drawing, sculpture, photography, installation and moving image work.

item.title: Galleria Hopeinen Sivellin
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Galleria Jangva
item.description: Art gallery and Café

item.title: Galleria Johan S.
item.description: Galleria Johan S. is an artgallery in Helsinki, Finland. We present contempory art in it´s many forms. Our range varies from modern jewellery art to paintings and ceramics.

item.title: Galleria Kadieff
item.description: The exhibition programme aimes to expose the work of both new and established artists, mainly Russian but also Finnish and increasingly international.

item.title: Galleria Katariina
item.description: Finnish contemporary art in wide scale.

item.title: Galleria Keidas
item.description: Café/bakery offers lunch (brunch at weekends) with ecological breads, sandwiches and pastries.

item.title: Galleria Laura
item.description: framing of art

item.title: Galleria Luova
item.description: Photography gallery, art printing and bookstore.

item.title: Galleria Myymälä2
item.description: Myymälä2 has been a space for art on Uudenmaankatu since 2003. Situated at the Punavuori location, the idea is still the same: to provide an alternative to the hefty fees and endless waiting lists that are requisite to a traditional gallery show, thus allowing for less established artists and craftsmen to launch their careers.

item.title: Galleria Orton
item.description: Art gallery for contemporary Finnish art, also sculpture park.

item.title: Galleria Sattumankauppa
item.description: Galleria Sattumankauppa is the home for artisans and artists from all over Finland this summer. We have a constantly changing selection of beautifully hand-crafted jewellery, Finnish design, accessories and unique items of clothing from both local artisans as well as ones all the way from Lapland.
item.matko:disabled: 3 steps that will de difficult for wheelchairs, though not impossible.

item.title: Gallerie Donner
item.description: Galerie Donner is specialized in 18th century furniture, silver and objets d'art. Emphasis is on objects from the Baltic region: Sweden, Finland, St. Petersburg and the Baltic countries.
item.matko:open: Please e-mail, fax or telephone us for more information.

item.title: Gallery Ajatuksenpoikanen/Summer Cafe
item.description: A gallery with exhibitions changing every month, also a shop with Finnish handicraft by over 40 artsist and an arts workshop.

item.title: Gallery Arkki / School of Architecture for Children and Youth
item.description: Arkki, School of Architecture for Children and Youth is a nonprofit organization. Arkki is the first school in Finland specializing in providing architectural and environmental education to children as an after school activity. Arkki offers a variety of architectural courses to young people and creates educational curriculums for schools, museums and after school art and architecture clubs.

item.title: Gallery Huuto
item.description: Galleria Huuto is an independent artist collective located in Helsinki, Finland. Currently Huuto maintains two galleries, both located at the center of Helsinki. Galleria Huuto is not restricted merely within these premises, however, but can also be realized elsewhere in a form of various events, projects and visits. Annually Huuto organizes as many as 50 contemporary art exhibitions.

item.title: Gallery Huuto (Jätkäsaari)
item.description: Galleria Huuto is an independent artist collective located in Helsinki, Finland. Currently Huuto maintains two galleries, both located at the center of Helsinki. Galleria Huuto is not restricted merely within these premises, however, but can also be realized elsewhere in a form of various events, projects and visits. Annually Huuto organizes as many as 50 contemporary art exhibitions.

item.title: Gallery Kaj Stenvall
item.description: Well known duck paintings and art grafic in virtual gallery.

item.title: Gallery Maria
item.description: Art Gallery

item.title: Gallery Nunes
item.description: Galleria Nunes presents in its exhibitions all forms of pictorial art; from painting to photography, from sculptures to experimental and conceptional spatial compositions. Design and textile art are also part of our program.

item.title: Gallery Pirkko-Liisa Topelius
item.description: Art Gallery that is specialised for young and coming artist. New and experimental comes first.

item.title: Gallery Saima
item.description: Art Gallery

item.title: Gallery Sculptor
item.description: The gallery for the Association of Finnish Sculptors shows mainly Finnish sculpture, bul also arranges other art exhibitions of both foreign and Finnish artists. At the same time, there is a sales collection of small sculptures as well as bronze art medals from over one hundred of its various members.

item.title: Gallery Viileä Punainen
item.description: gallery

item.title: Gallery Womens Room
item.description: Art gallery in annual Womens Christmas fair.

item.title: Gardenia-Helsinki
item.description: A unique tropical garden, Gardenia, was opened in April 2001. It is situated in Viikki, in the heart of Helsinki, next to the Vanhankaupunginlahti Bay nature reserve and the Helsinki Univeristy campus area. The luxuriant tropical garden, covered by glass, is a beautiful and refreshing place to visit all year round. Out in the yard there is a genuine Japanese stone garden. Special exhibitions and events.
item.matko:location: City centre 10 km, airport 18 km. Bus 68 from city centre.
item.matko:admission: Adults 4€, pensioners 2,30€, children (3-17 y.) and students 2€. Family ticket: two adults & max. 5 children 9€.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, assistance needed. Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups 3€/pers. (min. 20 persons), children groups 1,50€/pers. (min.20persons). Guided tours in the garden and other theme tours eg. to the Viikki nature, by request. Guidebooking tel. +358 (0)9 3478 4050/+358 (0)9 3478 400. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English. Lunch for groups by request.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cafeteria and lunchrestaurant, 50 seats. During summer also an outside terrace. Offers coffee, refreshments and lunch. Tel. +358 (0)400 601 625.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 15m long exhibition wall for works of art and vitrine for smaller art objects.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Guided tours in the tropical garden and field trips to the nature.
item.matko:services: Café-restaurant Gardenia, tel.+358 (0)400 601 625., open Mon-Thu 10-16, Fri 10-14, Sat-Sun 11-15, outdoor terrace in summertime. Parking for 120 cars. Facilities for corporate and private occasions.
item.matko:ingress: The luxuriant tropical garden, covered by glass, is a beautiful and refreshing place to visit all year round.

item.title: Gaselli
item.description: Pub Gaselli is a british style pub in the heart of the Gaselli quarter, right by tRaffaello terace. Gaselli is known for its Finnish music and relaxed atmosphere.
item.matko:open: Tue-Thu 16-01, Fri-Sat 16-03, Sun and Mon closed.

item.title: Gastropub Stone's
item.description: Stone's invites you to enjoy the cozy athmosphere and to try their pub food prepared in a lavastone grill. There is a wide beer selection that includes both Finnish and foreign brands. Age limit: 20 years after 18.00.

item.title: Gaudete
item.description: Gaudete stocks a carefully selected range of womens clothes, shoes, accessories and jewelry.

item.title: GEMMI PopUp Shop and Showroom
item.description: The Finnish lifestyle brand Gemmi sets the standard for new luxury. Gemmi Oy designs and produces handmade, unique and ultralight fur garments for women and men, as well as luxurious cushions and throws from fur. Gemmi garments are a combination of first class craftsmanship, the highest quality Finnish fur and distinct Finnish design. Own production facilities in Finland guarantee high quality and flexibility to personalize fur products for individual customers. Gemmi represents the future of fur fashion: genuine, versatile and effortless everyday luxury.

item.title: German Church
item.description: The German Church dating from 1864 designed by Harald Bosse and C.J. von Heideken. It is popular with the people of Helsinki for weddings.

item.title: GLO Hotel Airport
item.description: GLO Hotel Airport is specialized in creating unique experiences for hotel guests staying at Helsinki Airport. All the public premises and services are available free of charge for hotel guests. GLO Hotel Airport has 37 rooms available in the heart of the Airport. You can spend a night in the airport or rest during some hours during the day in the hotel day rooms. A total of 20 rooms are GLO Standard rooms, 9 are GLO Double rooms and 6 are GLO Twin rooms. There are also available adjoining rooms and rooms for disabled guests at GLO Hotel Airport. There will be 37 new rooms at GLO Hotel Airport during 2014, and after the renovation, the GLO Hotel Airport will have a total of 74 rooms.

item.title: GLO Hotel Art (Hotel Linna)
item.description: The new GLO Hotel Art is a unique combination of a 1903-built Art Nouveau castle, with its variety of charming meeting and event facilities, and a new modern hotel. The stylish and modern 170 rooms of the hotel have been created together with Finnish designers. The individual needs of the customers have been taken into account when designing the range of services available for business visitors and families.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cellar Restaurant, Jugend Hall and Tower Sauna and Meeting room are open on request for meetings and private events.

item.title: GLO Hotel Helsinki Kluuvi
item.description: GLO is a modern and urban lifestyle hotel. The most important idea behind the hotel is customising the stay at the hotel to meet the needs of each individual guest. GLO offers its guests a staggering variety of recreational opportunities including sports, culture, dining, and health services in the hotel itself and outside its walls. GLO is situated in the centre of Helsinki at a spot which is pivotal for the culture, history, and economy in the city. The hotel has a direct entrance to the first-class shopping centre Kämp Galleria. The Palace Kämp Day Spa is located on the top floor of the hotel, and to reach some of the best restaurants in town you only need to step out of the hotel. Hotel GLO also cooperates with the leading ticket providers in Finland to provide its guests with the best seats in all culture events in Helsinki. GLO MEETS: GLO Meets represent new way of thinking. With ultramodern technology, video wall and videoconference possibilities your meeting will be success. The facilities were opened in the summer 2013 and are located in second floor of GLO Hotel Kluuvi. You are able to book separate rooms or the whole floor. Creativity, technology and relaxation meet in this modern venue. http://glohotels.fi/en/hotels/glo-hotel-kluuvi/meetings-events
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: The hotel has two different room types. 12 of the 144 rooms are suites the largest of which is 200 m2. The wonderfully spacious double rooms are 35 m2.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Hotel GLO's restaurant has been designed in a modern yet timeless style, exuding urban atmosphere, elegance and warmth.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Hotel guests are able to buy tickets from the reception to the P-Kluuvi parking (EuroPark) at the price of 23 €/24h.

item.title: GLO Hotel Sello
item.description: The Hotel Sello, which was completed in 2006, is an atmospheric and extremely stylish lifestyle hotel at the heart of Espoo. The modern hotel provides anything and everything you could desire - and more - regardless of whether you are a discerning business traveller or just there to enjoy a nice holiday with your family. The guests at the hotel have greatly appreciated its tasteful interior design and relaxed atmosphere. The Sello also provides rooms with kitchenettes to make longer stays more enjoyable and convenient, and what would a first rate hotel be without rooms perfectly suited for holding meetings and seminars.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 11 km, airport 16 km. Leppävaara, Espoo. 10-minute ride on a local train from Helsinki.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 140 rooms 35 of which have kitchenettes and to make longer stays more convenient.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: GLO Grill Kitchen offers high quality and delicious grill dishes and group menus designed for those who want to enjoy not only great company, but an enjoyable atmosphere and tasty food.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: GLO Sello has four different meeting rooms all located in the 9th floor of the hotel. Meetings in Sello can be arranged from 8 delegates up to 60 attendees conference, training day or similar. All the meeting rooms can be combined as a one multipurpose large space. The hotel kitchen caters the meetings and events, and is available for group menus as well as catered meeting packages.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Business Point which is located right next to the reception desk can be used freely to, for instance, read e-mail and use the internet free of charge. Free parking in the Sello shopping centre's parking carage.

item.title: Globe Hope Shop Kiseleff
item.description: Globe Hope is an innovative Finnish design company that makes ecological design out of recycled materials. Globe Hope re-defines used and leftover materials, turning them into unique design clothes and accessories. All Globe Hope production relies on sustainable development. Production is done by subcontractors around Finland and Estonia. Selection of SECCO products on sale.

item.title: Globe Hope Shop Lasipalatsi
item.description: Globe Hope is an innovative Finnish design company that makes ecological design out of recycled materials. Globe Hope re-defines used and leftover materials, turning them into unique design clothes and accessories. All Globe Hope production relies on sustainable development. Production is done by subcontractors around Finland and Estonia. Selection of SECCO products on sale.
item.matko:location: Lasipalatsi (Glass Palace)

item.title: Gloria Cultural Arena
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Goethe-Institut
item.description: German culture, concerts, exhibitions

item.title: Good Life Coffee
item.description: Kallio-based coffee bar & shop focused on serving premium coffee from its very own roastery and interesting Nordic coffee blends. Small snacks, yoghurt, muesli, croissants, sandwiches and juice also available, sometimes also coffee blends from other roasteries.

item.title: Goofin' Records
item.description: A large selection of eg. 50s, 60s, surf, rockabilly & psychobilly, on vinyl and CD.

item.title: GR8 Salmisaari
item.description: Gr8 Salmisaari is not a regular bowling alley, but a clublike entertainment center in Ruoholahti. Here you can try e.g. bowling, archery, segway-driving, golf with a simulator, pool, lazer games, minigolf, boxing. There is also a sports bar on the premises.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue (open on request), Wed-Thu 12-20, Fri 12-21, Sat 14-21, Sun 14-18

item.title: Habitat Helsinki
item.description: Habitat is an iconic European interior company that is especially known for its innovative, modern and functional design. Habitat has more than 50 stores in Europe.

item.title: Hagelstam's International Bibliophilic Antiquarian Bookshop
item.description: From Hagelstam's shelves you can find literature on architecture, design, music, philosophy, travel, topography, nautica, hunting and fishing, photography, cinema, gastronomy etc. Also rare books, maps and prints from 16th-21th centuries available.

item.title: Hakaniemi Market Hall
item.description: Hakaniemi Market Hall has approx. 70 shops in two floors. The shops on the 1st floor sell foodstuffs and the 2nd floor shops eg. souvenirs and handicrafts. The Market Hall, designed by Karl Hård af Segerstad, was opened in 1914.

item.title: Hakaniemi Market Square
item.description: Traditional market treats and atmosphere. Next to the market square is also the Hakaniemi Market Hall. Sunday market usually on the first Sunday of every month.

item.title: Haltia - The Finnish Nature Centre
item.description: The ecologically designed Finnish Nature Centre Haltia presents the most spectacular natural attractions of Finland in its modern exhibitions. The centre is located next to the Nuuksio National Park. Haltia will also host various temporary exhibitions. Haltia offers inspiring meeting space in an ecological building, which is built entirely of wood. With the architecture inspired by a story in the Kalevala, Finnish national epic, Haltia combines the fascinating features of Finnish culture and nature. Haltia offers a variety of meeting rooms for diverse functions. The venues vary from a smaller, exclusive 10- person boardroom with a sauna, to a 200-seat auditorium. The outdoor function area in the immediate vicinity of Haltia offers unique possibilities for combining an outdoor venue with a modern exhibition centre space. It is easy to combine nature experiences with meetings and events in the nearby nature trails, or in Nuuksio National Park. The whole building serves as a private venue outside the Nature Centre's opening hours.
item.matko:location: On the fringes of Nuuksio National Park. Helsinki City centre 35 km, Helsinki Airport 35 km.
item.matko:disabled: Accessibility taken into consideration throughout the building.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Haltia's 200-seat restaurant, serves local Finnish food. Different parts of the restaurant are easily divided into smaller sections. Lake view terrace can be divided into smaller parts for private purposes.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Total exhibition space: 673 m2. The whole centre can be reserved for private functions outside the Nature Centre's opening hours, enabling the use of the meeting rooms and auditorium, the 200-seat restaurant, a 150-seat terrace, a large foyer with a fireplace, and exhibition space featuring Finland's most spectacular natural attractions (main exhibition area and Helsinki Metropolitan Green Belt exhibition, 443 m2 and 73 m2).
item.matko:services: Guided tours and other outdoor activities can be combined with meetings both in the surrounding nature as well as in Nuuksio National Park.

item.title: Haltia - The Finnish Nature Centre
item.description: The Finnish Nature Centre Haltia presents all of Finland's nature under one roof. Haltia is also a modern and ecologically designed Conference and Event Center. The main exhibition will fascinate the visitor with its enthralling visualization of the Finnish nature.
item.matko:location: Haltia is located on the fringes of Nuuksio National Park, just 25 mins from helsinki.
item.matko:admission: Main exhibition: entrance 7e/adult, 2,5e/ under 18 years old, free entrance for children under 7 years. Free entrance to the Helsinki Metropolitan Green Belt exhibition.
item.matko:disabled: The whole building has been planned with the physically challenged in mind. A 1,8 km trail accessible for all starts from the vicinity of Haltia. On wheelchair an assistant is required on the outdoor trail.
item.matko:groups: Group entrance to the main exhibition on advance reservation: 5e/ person, min. 10 persons/ group. Guidance 70 e/ hour, max. 25 persons/ group.
item.matko:services: Haltia's restaurant and shop embrace nature themes in their products. 200 parking lots.

item.title: Haltiala Farm
item.description: The Haltiala farm is like a piece of the Finnish countryside. The farm gives visitors an opportunity to acquaint themselves with domestic farm animals.
item.matko:open: The animals are outside in summertime otherwise they are indoors and you can see them Mon-Fri 18-20 and Sat-Sun 11-18.
item.matko:groups: Group visits Mon-Fri 9.00-15.30. Pls contact Jari Kuusinen tel. +358-(0)500 607 444 in advance.
item.matko:services: Happenings during Christmas and Easter

item.title: Hanasaari - the Swedish-Finnish Cultural Centre
item.description: Ranked as one of the most high-standard conference centres in Finland, Hanasaari offers a venue ideal both for business and private events. It hosts international conferences and seminars for up to 230 attendees as well as small meetings, workshops and other activities. International guests appreciate especially the responsive and flexible service, the relaxed atmosphere and the unique location by the sea. Hanasaari also features a Scandinavian style hotel with 61 rooms. Hanasaari is located in Espoo, only a few minutes drive from the centre of Helsinki by bus or car. Free parking is available. Restaurant: Restaurant Johannes serves Nordic delicacies combined with a welcoming ambiance for luncheons, business dinners, family events and hotel guests. The restaurant, including a separate adjoining room for 30 persons, can seat up to 240 dinner guests and host cocktail-parties for up to 380.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 7 km, airport 25 km. Hanasaari Cultural Centre is located in Espoo, west of downtown Helsinki on a scenic archipelago headland where the sea is always close at hand.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Hotel rooms at Hanasaari Cultural Centre may be reserved by conference guests or by anyone in need of overnight accommodation. The hotel has a capacity of 92 guests in 30 single and 31 double rooms. An extra bed can also be provided in ten of the rooms enabling families of four to stay in the same room. All rooms have a window overlooking the scenic surroundings. Parking space is available free of charge for private motor vehicles and buses.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Johannes serves delicious Nordic cuisine combined with a welcoming ambiance for luncheons, business dinners, family events and hotel guests. The restaurant, including a separate adjoining room for 30 persons, can seat up to 240 dinner guests and host cocktail-parties for up to 380.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna suite with two saunas and a 17 meter swimming pool, various leisure possibilities in the surroundings, free of charge wireless Internet access in all premises, and free parking for 170 cars.

item.title: Hanna Sarén Summer Store
item.description: Hanna Sarén makes custom-crafted apparel, based on a unique blend of whimsical imagination, glamorous sophistication, and contemporary elegance.

item.title: Happy Jazz Club Storyville
item.description: Happy Jazz Club Storyville, situated behind the Parliament, entertain their customers by having both Finnish and international jazzorchestras play four evenings a week. In the streetlevel bar piano music is played in the early evening. Storyville's kitchen serves cajuncreole delicacies until 02 in the night. Age Limit: 18 years.
item.matko:open: Piano Bar, ground floor: Tue 18-02, Wed-Thu 18-03, Fri-Sat 18-04. Jazz club, downstairs (a la carte): Wed-Thu 19-03, Fri-Sat 19-04

item.title: Harakka Nature Centre
item.description: The Harakka ("Magpie") island is located off the coast of Helsinki where the peninsula of Helsinki reaches far to the bosom of the baltic sea. The island used to belong to the Finnish defence forces, and it was opened to the public in 1989. There are buildings from both the periods of Russian and Finnish armies. The Nature Centre facilities include, among others, barracs built by the Russians in 1908. Gardens, old enbankments, rocky fields, seashore meadows and little marshes provide a variety of habitats that allow biodiversity incomparable in the Helsinki archipelago.
item.matko:location: Connecting boat leaves from the Kaivopuisto park, next to Café Ursula. The white sign is to be rised five minutes before the departure. Return trip 3 € for adults & 1.50 € for children (aged 4-16).
item.matko:services: The Nature Centre of Helsinki Environmental Centre is working in the island. We are offering exhibitions, tours and events in the various historical buildings renowated for this use and the nature path circling the island.
item.matko:ingress: Gardens, old enbankments, rocky fields, seashore meadows and little marshes provide a variety of habitats that allow biodiversity incomparable in the Helsinki archipelago.

item.title: Hard Rock Cafe Helsinki
item.description: Hard Rock Café Helsinki is a 240-seater restaurant with an international and relaxed atmosphere. The rock shop sells Hard Rock Café merchandise on the street level. Multiple event spaces available for parties up to 300 people.
item.matko:open: Restaurant: Sun-Thu 11-00 (kitchen closes at 22), Fri-Sat 11-02. Rock shop open every day 10-23.

item.title: Harri Syrjänen
item.description: Goldsmith and a leather artist. Jewellery from all possible materials, leather bags etc.

item.title: Hartwall Arena
item.description: The Hartwall Arena is one of the liveliest centres of entertainment in Europe: concerts, operas, dance performances, top ice-hockey and other sporting events, and to an increasing extent private corporate events. These include conferences, seminars, AGMs, cocktail parties, product launches, etc. Various premises, both large and small, can easily be combined to suit the occasion, the theme or the product to be launched.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 13 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Golden Star Restaurant, Silver Star Restaurant, Lapin Kulta Restaurant, 13 fast food outlets, 3 hamburger restaurants, 3 Pizza Hut restaurants, Jokers Bar, Hocken Roll Café
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Hartwall Areena 2350 m2 (net)
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Hartwall Arena also hires out equipment for events held on other premises: chairs, tables, platforms, sound systems, etc.

item.title: Hawkhill Nature
item.description: Experience the silence and peace of Nuuksio National park and spend a night in log cottages located in Kaitalampi shore. Here you can enjoy the finnish sauna dip in lake Kaitlampi and beautiful Nuuksio nature. Hawkhill Nature offers accommodation of various standard in six cottages located in the wilderness of the Nuuksio national park near Helsinki.
item.matko:location: 45 minutes drive from airport or Helsinki city centre
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Hawkhill Nature offers accomodation in traditional log cottages. All of the cottages have own sauna, beach and rowing boat. Villa Armas is traditional summer house with wood heated sauna max 4 person, Villa Anna max 4 and Eino max 6 person are modern houses for easy holiday. Our newest luxurious dead wood Villas Taavetti max8 and Maria max 6 are also suitable for meetings
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Hawkhill Nature organizes also catering for groups. Meels by fire and catering for meetings.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Hawkhill Natures Klubitalo is special location for relaxed venues like weddings, summer parties etce. Maximum 60 person. Also accommodation for 10 person next door in Villa Toini.

item.title: Helka Hotel
item.description: The Helka Hotel has served its guests in the heart of Helsinki since 1928 and it has been renovated in 2006 as a theme hotel of Finnish Design and Nature. The bright and spacious rooms are furnished with products from Artek and Finnish top designers. Themes from design and nature are present everywhere: in furnishing, service, food and music. Helka has served its guests in the heart of Helsinki since 1928. Renovated in 2006 and located in the heart of Helsinki, the Helka Hotel is conveniently close to the main railway station the airport bus terminal and the long distance coach terminal, but equally important it is very near the shopping district and other attractions for the visitor.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, easy access for blind or partially sighted, two disabled rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 150 rooms: 58 single rooms, 87 twin rooms, 4 suites. All guestrooms have private bathrooms, a minibar, telephone and TV with satellite movie channels.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Aurinko has up to 160 seats for customers. Very popular lunch, but also very nice place for private or business dinners. Lounge bar 50 seats.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna
item.matko:services: The hotel offers 149 guest rooms - 59 single rooms, 86 double rooms out of which two for disabled guests, and four suites. There are five floors, one of them for smokers. Every room is equipped with automatic wake-up system, tv, free broadband Internet access, minibar and hairdryer. Laundry and ironing services, morning sauna and a small parking lot in the inner courtyard are also available.

item.title: Hellsten Helsinki Parliament
item.description: Hellsten Hotel Apartments offers spacious, furnished apartments for short or long term rent. All apartments are equipped with kitchenettes and some apartments even have sauna and balcony.
