Hellsten Helsinki Parliament is located in the city centre, near the Parliament House and the National Museum. There are 43 hotel apartments for 1-4 persons and room sizes vary from 21 to 75 square metres.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 43 Hotel Apartments: 21 One Bedroom apartments, 20 Studios 2 Two bedroom superior apartments with sauna. All rooms come equipped with Direct line telephone, Cable TV, Broadband Internet Access, fully equipped kitchenette, tiled bathrooms.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Within the building: Breakfast room, front desk open weekdays 8am-8pm, laundry facillity, iron/ironing board, sauna. A weekly cleaning service is also included.

item.title: Hellsten Helsinki Senate - Penthouse
item.description: Hellsten Hotel Apartments offers spacious, furnished apartments for short or long term rent. All apartments are equipped with kitchenettes and some apartments even have sauna and balcony. Hellsten Helsinki Senate is located in Katajanokka, one of the city´s most prestigious areas. There are 52 hotel apartments for 1-4 persons and room sizes vary from 20 to 160 square metres.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 14 studios and 37 one-bedroom apartments, some with a private sauna. A luxury penthouse is also available. All rooms come equipped with telephone, broadband internet connection, cable TV with VCR, clock radio, kitchenette, microwave, work area and steam iron. Within the building, residents will also find a laundry room, sauna and garage. A weekly cleaning service is also included.

item.title: Helsingin Golfklubi
item.description: Helsinki Golf Club (HGK) is the oldest and most prestigious golf course in Finland, founded in 1932. Located in the beautiful old park of Tali manor, the club is only 6 km from the center of Helsinki. HGK is also widely known by the name of the old manor. Tali has hosted more championships than any other club in Finland. For the last four years it has also hosted Ladies European Tour competition.
item.matko:location: Estate of Tali

item.title: Helsinki Apartment
item.description: Fourteen high-class apartments in downtown Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the vicinity of Töölöntori: city centre 1,5 km, airport 15 km. Downtown Helsinki / Töölö.
item.matko:disabled: There is a lift in all the apartment buildings.
item.matko:services: Wifi internet connection.

item.title: Helsinki Art Museum HAM
item.description: The Tennis Palace Art Museum is a part of the Helsinki City Art Museum. It arranges changing Finnish and international exhibitions from various periods and related happenings.
item.matko:location: Near central bus station, in Kamppi.
item.matko:open: The museum was closed for renovations 14.7.2014 and will be open on 25 September 2015.
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair-accessible. An accessible toilet and a lift.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups, duration of the approx. 50 min. Languages Finnish, Swedish, English. Preliminary booking obligatory tel. +358-(0)9-3108 7003. Possibility also for workshops, tel. +358-(0)9-3108 7054.
item.matko:services: Museum shop as well as other shops, cafés and restaurants and movie theatre in the Tennispalatsi building. Closeby Forum parking hall, entrance from the Eteläinen Rautatienkatu.

item.title: Helsinki Bed and Breakfast
item.description: Stay comfortably in a local home and relax in a room of your own but feel the life around you. In addition to the breakfast you will get the best hints on where to go and a personal view to the everyday life and celebrations in the Finnish capital. Alternatively you can rent the entire home for yourself - ideal e.g. for a family. There is a difference between a home and an apartment! Helsinki Bed and Breakfast will establish the contact between the guest and the local host. It will also safely manage your reservation and your payment. The level of accommodation varies from a small and cosy loft bed to a luxurious double room. The kitchen and the living room are usually in shared use.
item.matko:location: Homestay is available in different parts of the capital area.
item.matko:disabled: Yes
item.matko:groups: Distributed to more than one host
item.matko:services: Cook together Finnish home food -evenings. Babysitting. Visit to an allotment garden cottage in Helsinki. Daysail at sea in Helsinki archipelago. City walk. Bar marathon.

item.title: Helsinki Canoe Center
item.description: Canoes for hire and guided canoe tours to order. Restaurant services upon request http://www.toolontorppa.com/view/categories.asp?document_id=3&cat_id=3.
item.matko:location: Near to the Sibelius park, bus 24 from Erottaja.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Guides for groups (Finnish, Swedish, English), fee by appointment.

item.title: Helsinki Cathedral
item.description: The beautiful and historically significant Helsinki Cathedral is an Evangelic Lutheran church, and for many it is the symbol of Helsinki. The church was designed by architect Carl Ludwig Engel in the 19th century as part of the Empire-style-downtown Helsinki area. The cathedral was completed in 1852.
item.matko:open: Open daily 9-18, June-August 9-24. Closed during ceremonies.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs to the main church hall by the lift in the crypt (Kirkkokatu 18). Please call +358 9 2340 6120 in advance. An accessible toilet in the crypt.
item.matko:services: In summer (June-August) Cathedral Shop and Cafe Krypta (Kirkkokatu 18).
item.matko:ingress: The Cathedral is designed by C.L. Engel.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum
item.description: The Helsinki City Museum main building, a department store from 1913, presents an exhibition Mad About Helsinki. The exhibition tells the history of the city through the favourite places and storied of the Helsinki residents. Old documentary movies about Helsinki (mainly in Finnish) are shown at Kino Engel.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible by wheelchair, toilet for wheelchair-users, elevator. Possibility to borrow a wheel chair.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Palmia rents out the premises for private occasions Palmia Meetings and Catering Käpyläntie 8, 00600 Helsinki (P.O. Box 9500, 00099 City of Helsinki) Tel. +358 (0)9 310 27237 tai 050 534 9205 Fax +358 (0)9 310 86393 Email: kokous.juhla@palmia.fi Internet: www.palmia.fi
item.matko:services: Museum shop

item.title: Helsinki City Museum / Burgher's House
item.description: The oldest surviving wooden building in the city dates from 1818. The charming house is decorated in the style of a middle-class home of the 1860s.
item.matko:location: Trams 1, 1A, 7B, bus 18.
item.matko:open: The museum is closed for the time being due to indoor air quality problems in the staff facilities.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is not wheelchair-accessible.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum / Hakasalmi Villa
item.description: Next to Finlandia Hall is situated the elegant Hakasalmi Villa which is a branch of Helsinki City Museum. The villa was once the private home of Aurora Karamzin (1808-1902), the benefactress and founder of the Helsinki Deaconess Institute who once served in the Russian royal court. Karamzin lived here until her death.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 25 min. Next to Finlandia Hall.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible by wheelchair, toilet for wheelchair-users. Elevators outdoors and inside. The elevator outdoors is accessible by ringing the bell. The museum staff will open the elevator doors. Possibility to borrow a wheel chair. Wheelchair-users are recommended to call before their visit to ensure the outdoor elevator is in use.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Hakasalmi Villa can accommodate max. 200 persons for cocktails with a buffet. There is no kitchen in the premises. Palmia Catering Services will deliver the refreshments and set the tables.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Villa was built in 1846, and it represents Italian villa style as well as round-arched style. Nowadays it is a museum with exhibition rooms in both floors and a lift for the handicapped. The use of the premises varies according exhibitions. Helsinki city museum rents the space. Contact: Rita Raito, tel: +358 40 7516 841 or hkm.myynti@hel.fi
item.matko:services: Café

item.title: Helsinki City Museum / Tram Museum
item.description: Helsinki's oldest tram depot (1900) houses the Tram Museum and was opened in June 2008 as part of the new Korjaamo culture centre. The refurbished museum presents tram history at the grassroots level, from a passenger's point of view. Branch of the City Museum.
item.matko:location: Trams 3T, 4, 7A, 10.
item.matko:open: Daily 11-17. Please note that the museum hosts many private events, which is why it's recommended to check the opening hours before your visit.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is wheelchair-accessible and has both a lift and an accessible toilet.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cocktails for about 400 persons. There is no kitchen in the premises.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Museum presents the history of public transport in Helsinki. Trams have been in service for over 100 years in Helsinki - a regular service was started in 1891. There are old trams on display, including horse-driven trams. The Museum is located in the oldest tram depot in Helsinki, built in 1900. The great hall can accommodate 400 persons for cocktails. There is also a well-equipped auditorium for 50 persons.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum / Worker Housing Museum
item.description: The atmospheric Worker Housing Museum and its little "stove rooms" tell a fascinating story about Finnish everyday life in the past. The museum is located in the oldest apartments built by the city for its own workers in Helsinki.
item.matko:location: Trams 1, 1A, 3B, bus 23.
item.matko:open: During the summer season (15.4.-25.10.2015) Mon-Tue closed, Wed-Sun 11-17. Closed during the winter season.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is not wheelchair-accessible.

item.title: Helsinki City Museum/Sederholm House- Children's town
item.description: In 2012 the Helsinki City Museum opened the Children's Town. This new kind of children's museum invites children of all ages and their families to experience the history of Helsinki first-hand. In the Children's Town, children can play in boutiques and workshops from 18th-century Helsinki, sit at a school desk in a 1930s primary school class and visit a grandma's home from the 1970s. The Sederholm House, built in 1757, is the oldest building downtown.
item.matko:open: The museum closed in 2014 due to renovations and will reopen again in 2016.
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair-accessible. A lift and an accessible WC.
item.matko:groups: Guide bookings tel. +358 (0)9 3103 6639 or 3103 6491, in Swedish tel. +358 (0)9 3103 6632.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Catering: kokous.juhla@palmia.fi www.palmia.fi

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre
item.description: Drama, dance performances (Helsinki Dance Company, www.hkt.fi/tanssiryhma) and musicals. Performances in Finnish.
item.matko:location: Performances also in Studio Pasila, Ratamestarinkatu 5 (p.09-39401) and Lilla teatern.
item.matko:admission: Ticket sales, at Ensi linja 2 (Mon-Fri 9-18), at Eläintarhantie 5, ticket sales at the theatre Sat 12-19. Also tickets 1hour before at the door.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 8 cm) along the path, Inva-WC, lift, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, induction loop system - amplification system for people with hearing aids, inva seats for the big stage in the aisles, small stage and Studio Elsa on the back landing, Please inform staff in beforehand. tel.+358-(0)9-394 0277.

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre / Lilla Teatern
item.description: Swedish and Finnish theatre performances.
item.matko:disabled: Access by wheelchair, assistant required. Please notify in advance. No lift, Inva-WC.
item.matko:services: Box office is open one hour before performances start. Intermission service, fully-licensed.

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre / Theatre Studio Pasila
item.description: Helsinki City Theatre's stage in Pasila

item.title: Helsinki City Theatre, Arena Theatre
item.description: Helsinki City Theatre's stage in Hakaniemi.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cafe Talo: 80 seats. In the theatre the possibility to arrange a buffet for 500 persons.

item.title: Helsinki City Winter Garden
item.description: The Winter Garden, founded in 1893, has been a recreational meeting place for the residents of Helsinki for over a century. No matter what season it is, the elaborate oasis of exotic plants invites you to take a tour of the greenery. In addition to the plants, the splashing barbels in the pools delight visitors. In the summertime and even in the autumn, a passer-by can admire the marvellous Rose Garden in front of the Winter Garden.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 min, 25 min. to the airport
item.matko:open: Tue 9-15, Wed-Fri 12-15, Sat-Sun 12-16. Rose garden open in summer daily at 7-21.
item.matko:groups: Guide by request, tel. +358 (0)9 3103 9985.
item.matko:additionalinfo: A summery atmosphere prevails throughout the year. The more than 200 plants bloom in three different spaces: in the palms room, in the western wing and in the cactus room. Besides the plants, carps swimming about in their pond add to the charm of the Garden. When necessary, a tent can be erected in the yard. No stairs, premises accessible by wheelchairs.

item.title: Helsinki Climbing Center
item.description: In Helsinki Climbing Center (in Finnish Helsingin Kiipeilykeskus) you´ll climb on the finest indoor-climbing walls in Scandinavia. Walls up to 16 metres high, tens of ready-made-routes and more than 1 700 square metres of climbing walls are waiting for your magic touch! Guided experiences for groups in English, too. Helsinki Climbing Centre and Puistola Tennis Hall belong to Tapanila Sport Center.

item.title: Helsinki Club (Sokos Hotel Helsinki)
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Ruuat valmistetaan omassa keittiössä ja kannetaan pöytään vastavalmistettuina.

item.title: Helsinki Congress Paasitorni
item.description: Helsinki Congress Paasitorni operates in a more than 100-year-old building which has been skillfully restored. This unique conference centre is located close to the city centre and is easily accessible by public transport. Paasitorni offers an inspirational and memorable setting for conferences and congresses, dinners and festivities. The building hosts almost 30 functional and distinctive rooms from 8 to 800 people. Paasitorni's services were expanded considerably in 2012 with the opening of Scandic Paasi, a new 170-room individually designed hotel adjoining the conference centre. The facilities were also complemented with new conference rooms and restaurant.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 25 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: First class service in four unique restaurants. Restaurant Paasi with two adjacent private dining rooms (320 seats) and Restaurant Paasin Kellari (200 seats) for conference guests, groups and private events. Restaurant Graniittilinna for traditional Finnish cuisine à la carte. Restaurant Juttutupa for relaxed get-togethers. Coming up: new 200-seat floating restaurant pavilion Meripaviljonki.

item.title: Helsinki Conservatory
item.matko:services: Concerts

item.title: Helsinki Contemporary
item.description: Helsinki Contemporary offers cultural experiences at a contemporary art gallery in the heart of Helsinki Gallery District on the lively street Bulevardi. The gallery is located at a new renaissance-style building and offers a beautiful view to the Old Church Park. The interior of the gallery is very unique in style, designed by the acclaimed finnish designer Ilkka Suppanen. The gallery shows works by established and emerging finnish and international artists.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:groups: Presentations of the exhibitions in English, Swedish and Finnish by request.

item.title: Helsinki Day Spa
item.description: Helsinki Day Spa is a city spa which offers relaxation and harmony at a high level.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The Helsinki Day Spa is an excellent place to organise a refreshing event for your customers, cooperative partners or your own personnel. Organise a meeting in an atmosphere full of mental peace. A wellbeing package will motivate and thank them for their cooperation and support.
item.matko:services: Eg. massage, facial and body treatments, beauty treatments, body&mind-lessons (Yoga, Pilates, Stretching)

item.title: Helsinki Hall of Culture
item.description: The Helsinki Hall of Culture was designed by architect Alvar Aalto and is a venue for conferences, galas, trade fairs and concerts. Situated in the inner city, well served by public transport. The Aalto Hall has 1452 seats. There are seats both on the flat and in the raked auditorium. Seats on the flat can be removed for gala use. After complete renovation work, the venue can now offer nearly 10 different kinds of meeting rooms for 20-150 persons.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 min/2.5 km, airport 25 min/18 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: All areas are used for catering and are fully licensed. Catering up to 1.500 persons, services tailored to suit all kinds of events. Restaurant Kultti Cafe: 100 seats for dinners and 120 for cocktail parties.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The main entrance hall and lobby 900 m2/net, 1100 m2/gross. Catering and pause services in the same area.
item.matko:additionalinfo: * 499 seats on the flat and 889 in the raked auditorium. Sound, lighting and video services as agreed.
item.matko:ingress: A venue for conferences, galas, roadshows, trade fairs, concerts.

item.title: Helsinki Limo Oy
item.description: High quality Sedan cars and minibuses with excellent drivers who are willing to serve.
item.matko:location: City center.

item.title: Helsinki Metropolia University of Applied Sciences, Arabiankatu
item.description: Pop/jazz

item.title: Helsinki Museum of Civil Defence
item.description: Helsinki Civil Defence Museum introduces visitors both the history of civil defence and present-day arrangements for it in the city. The detailed illustrations of the situation in 1939-1944 include a mock-up of a wartime cellar bomb shelter complete with air raid sound effects. Technical equipment and other materials of post-war civil defence are also on exhibit.
item.matko:open: September-May on Saturdays from 10-14, other times by appointment only.
item.matko:groups: Finnish, Swedish, English by appointment

item.title: Helsinki Music Centre
item.description: The opening of the Helsinki Music Centre gave Helsinki an acoustically first-class concert hall as well as other facilities providing a wide range of musical experiences for people of all ages and a place to study music. The main users of the building are the Sibelius Academy, the Helsinki Philharmonic and the Finnish Radio Symphony Orchestra.

item.title: Helsinki Observatory
item.description: Designed by the architect C.L. Engel, the Helsinki Observatory, which dates back to 1834, was reopened to the public in October 2012. The building features a visitor centre, run by the Helsinki University Museum, which in introduces visitors to space and the history and future of astronomy. It is primarily aimed at children and young people but will be open to all visitors.
item.matko:open: Exhibitions are open: Mon closed, Tue-Wed 12-16, Thu 12-20, Fri-Sun 12-16.
item.matko:admission: 6/4/2/0€. Free guided tour every month's second Saturday.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance through the garden gate on the west side of the building. Press A1 or call +358 (0)50 318 5764 to activate the gate phone and open the gate.

item.title: Helsinki Playground - indoor play ground
item.description: Helsinki Playground is a great place for the children to come and enjoy playing every day of the week. The Playground offers many different kinds of fun, educative ja sporty activities for the kids. Spend the day with adventure bouncing castles, big play area, ball cannons, toddler area, climbing wall and ball pool etc. The Playground Café offers snacks and refreshments.
item.matko:location: Situated in Hakaniemi, entrance at Hakaniemi market square
item.matko:open: Open daily 10-20, periods 10-12, 12-14, 14-16, 16-18, 18-20. Entrance from Hakaniemi Market Square or when by car via the parking hall entrance in the beginning of Sörnäisten Rantatie.
item.matko:admission: Tickets 12€/3-14years/2h, 8€/children under 3 yrs/2h (max 150 persons at a time). Parents and grandparents accomanying their children free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Two parking spaces for disabled people in the parking hall, lift, inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Bookings in advance for groups minimum of 10 people, tel.+358 (0)20 710 9900.
item.matko:ingress: Helsinki Playground is a great place for all children to come and enjoy playing.

item.title: Helsinki Running Tours
item.description: Helsinki Running Tours organizes running tours, lectures and training for tourists and groups like congresses. We operate in the beautiful routes of Helsinki.
item.matko:open: We run througout the year. Schedule is on our web page.
item.matko:groups: Ask for an offer for a group running event

item.title: Helsinki Stand Up Paddle School
item.description: Helsinki SUP School brings professional SUP instruction and Stand Up Paddle boards to waters in Helsinki. Helsinki SUP School offers lessons daily for all levels of paddlers, rent boards and organize SUP-yoga and SUP-fitness classes. Helsinki SUP School operates in the most beautiful place in Helsinki with short distance to paddle around Seurasaari or to Munkkiniemi.

item.title: Helsinki Synagogue
item.description: The Jewish Community in Helsinki is one of the most northern Jewish communities in the world. It is located in Kamppi neighbourhood in the heart of Helsinki, the capital of Finland. The synagogue was inaugurated in 1906 and the community centre in 1961. The Jewish Community of Helsinki offers many activities and services to its 1,100 members from birth until old age.
item.matko:open: 1.5.-31.8.2015 guided tours at 10.00 and 14.00. You must be able to prove your identity.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5 euro, groups 65 euro, under 18 and school groups free.
item.matko:disabled: The synagogue is accessible.

item.title: Helsinki University Botanic Garden, Kaisaniemi
item.description: The University of Helsinki Botanical Garden at Kaisaniemi is one of Helsinki's most popular visitor attractions. The garden is situated very close to the city centre, and its glasshouses and surrounding grounds offer nature lovers a unique experience all year round. The gallery between the large and small glasshouses is used to host temporary exhibitions, mostly on themes related to nature.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:admission: Greenhouses: adults 8€, pensioners, students and children (7-17 years) 3€, children under 7 years free of charge. Outdoor garden free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Guide reservations tel +358-9 191 28855 (Tue-Fri 9-11) or opastukset@luomus.fi.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Well-lighted art gallery with an 18 m long exhibition wall and a separate 3x2 m sized vitrine
item.matko:additionalinfo: The biggest glass house, Palm House, can be hired for cocktail occasions in the evenings. A tent is available for garden parties. Meeting rooms Linkola and Elfving and a little kitchen. A souvenir shop. Reservations of Palm House, meeting rooms and guided tours tel. +358 9 1912 4453, 05+358 50 337 5271, e-mail hortus-botanicus@helsinki.fi
item.matko:services: Small museum shop in connection to the ticket sales. Restaurant Viola, Kaisaniemenranta 2, tel. +358-9-1311 4298, open only by appointment during summertime. The Empire-style wooden building, dating from 1823 and situated near the Kaisaniemenranta road provides a charming setting.
item.matko:ingress: The Garden offers an unique experience all year round.

item.title: Helsinki University Botanical Garden Kumpula
item.description: Kumpula Botanic Garden situates on a historical lands of Kumpula mansion. The Kumpula Garden collection comprises two parts: garden of cultivated plants and geobotanical garden.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children 3€, children under 7 years free entrance.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchair, Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups by agreement, tel.+358 (0)9 191 28855 (Tue-Fri 10-12), e-mail:opastukset@luomus.fi
item.matko:services: Café & shop

item.title: Helsinki University Museum
item.description: The Power of Thought, the new main exhibition of the Helsinki University Museum, tells the fascinating story of the University from its establishment as the Royal Academy of Turku to the present. The items on display feature a wide range of objects related to research, teaching and student life, including researcher presentations, short films and items from the University's art collection.
item.matko:disabled: Elevator, Handicap toilet

item.title: Helsinki Zoo
item.description: Helsinki Zoo Korkeasaari is one of the oldest zoos in the world (established already in 1889). In Helsinki Zoo you'll meet animals from the arctic tundra to the tropical rainforest. Approximately 200 different animal species reside in the Zoo, and there are almost a 1000 different plant species. Protecting endangered species is a heartfelt matter for the zoo. The zoos in Europe form a network which works to preserve a number of species. Zoos are often the last refuge for many endangered species. The rhino sign will take you to the animals that belong to the zoos' shared protection programme.
item.matko:location: Waterbus connection from Market Squareand Hakaniemi in summer. Bridge connection from Musetikkamaa year round. Zoobus nr.11 from the Railwaystation to Korkeasaari zoo all year round.
item.matko:open: May-August daily 10-20, October-March daily 10-16, September and April daily 10-18. Closed only on Christmas Eve.
item.matko:admission: By land 12/8/6/0€, by ferry 18/11/9/0€. Ferries run every year from 1 May.
item.matko:disabled: The Zoo's terrain is very hilly, making getting around without help in a wheelchair rather difficult. 3-5 accessible toilets in the Zoo and another one by the gates are open all year. Tours by car possible on Thursdays before 10 a.m., please contact the customer service in advance either by email at zoo.asy@hel.fi or by phone +358 (0)9 3103 7900.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours upon request, also guided tours with different themes. Languages Finnish, Swedish, English. Guidebookings tel.+358-(0)9-3103 7900 and zoo.asy@hel.fi
item.matko:ingress: Helsinki Zoo is one of the oldest zoos in the world.

item.title: Helsinki-Malmi airport
item.description: The functionalist style Helsinki-Malmi airport, opened in 1936, still serves as a center for general aviation. There are numerous air taxi firms, aircraft hire companies and flying schools based at this airport as well as flying and parachuting clubs. There has also been an enormous increase in helicopter flying in the recent years. It is possible to go see old aircrafts at Helsinki-Malmi airport.
item.matko:location: Bus 75, Railwaystation-Helsinki-Malmi or local train to Malmi station, bus 77A, distance approx.2km
item.matko:services: Restaurant-Café Hello Café, tel.+358 (0)40 900 3405 , also meeting facilities and catering service. SIL -shop, flight maps, flight materials and accessories, Finnish Aeronautical Association, tel.+358-(0)9-3509 3450.

item.title: Henry's Pub
item.description: The fourth Henrys Pub opened in Helsinki in October 2006. Music is being played both live and directly from the cd. Live music every Thursday night. Hot wings are served Mon-Fri 15-23 & Sat-Sun 12-23.
item.matko:open: Sun-Wed 14-01, Thu-Fri 14-03, Sat 12-03. Kitchen: Mon-Fri 15-23, Sat-Sun 12-23. Age limit 22 years.

item.title: Hercules Gay Night Club
item.description: Popular Gay NightClub located in the center of Helsinki. Customers are mainly gay men over 30 years, also leather guys.
item.matko:open: Open daily at 21-04. Age limit Fri-Sat 24years, Sun-Thu 20years.

item.title: Hernesaaren Ranta
item.description: Hernesaaren Ranta is a new urban restaurant area, event space and a summertime oasis straight on the beach. There are kiosk restaurants on the terrace as well as in the sunbathing area. Party mood and music pick up from early evening.

item.title: Herttoniemi Church
item.matko:open: Wed 12-18, other days 10-14. Service on religious holidays at 10.

item.title: Heureka Shop / Kamppi shopping centre,2nd floor
item.description: Heureka Shop is a souvenir shop that specialises in science products and products that are linked to Heureka's temporary exhibitions. Heureka Shop offers a selection of science items, puzzles and gifts as well as tickets to the science centre Heureka in Vantaa.

item.title: Heureka, the Finnish Science Centre
item.description: A science centre is a cultural and educational institution that explains science in an inspiring and understandable way, enhances the motivation of students, deepens the learning experience and influences the attitudes of parents and the career choices of young people. Besides the main exhibition, we have changing exhibitions on various themes. Heureka's exhibitions also extend outdoors. Science park Galilei is open during summer. Alongside the interactive exhibits, visitors can also get breathtaking experiences in Heureka planetarium, which primarily shows planetarium films with astronomy theme. Everything at Heureka is in Finnish, Swedish and English and partly in Russian and Estonian. Heureka, located in Tikkurila, Vantaa, opened its doors to the public in 1989 and is now open year-round. Heureka has averaged close to 300 000 visitors per year and is one of Finland's most popular leisure centers.
item.matko:location: Near Tikkurila railway station. From Helsinki city centre, Railwaystation, local trains R, H, K, T, N and I to Tikkurila station (20 min, 20 km). Airport 10 min, 7 km.
item.matko:admission: Adults: allround ticket 21-30,50€, exhibition 16,50/18,50€, one show at Planetarium 11€. Children (6-15 yrs): allround ticket 14,50-20€, exhibition 11,50/12,50€, one show at Planetarium 9€.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, all on the same level. Inva-WC. Drive up to inva-parking from Shell at Ring III/Tikkurila, end of Härkävaljakontie street. Induction loop in the Verne theatre and the auditorium Virtanen.
item.matko:groups: School groups: General ticket 8,50/11,50€, exhibitions 7€, Planetarium 5€. Guide available on request 36,60-61€ (Finnish, Swedish, English), Russian if booked one week in advance.
item.matko:services: Lunch restaurant Einstein, tel. +358-(0)9-857 9399. Open as Heureka, seating for 180. For groups also to by appointment, special menu for school groups. Banqueting services. Shop and free car park.

item.title: HIAP Helsinki International Artist-in-residence Programme
item.description: The Helsinki International Artist-in-Residence Programme (HIAP) is one of the most important international residency centers in Finland. Each year between 70 and 90 visual artists, dancers, choreographers, curators and researchers from around the world are offered a residence in Suomenlinna and at the Cable Factory. The HIAP Project Room arranges regular art exhibitions, lectures and other public events.

item.title: Hietalahti market hall
item.description: The Hietalahti hall provides a broad variety of fresh foods, seasoned with expert service. You can have a quick snack, or enjoy lunch or dinner at the popular restaurants and cafés at the hall.

item.title: Hietalahti Market Square
item.description: At Hietalahti market square you'll find a popular (especially in summertime) outdoor flea market. The market is open all year when the weather permits. The Hietalahti Market Hall is situated next to the square.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 8-18, Sat 8-16 and on Sundays in summer

item.title: Hietaniemi Beach
item.description: Hietaniemi offers a shallow and safe swimming area and is very popular on hot summer days. You can also enjoy beach volleyball and basketball. Children have their own play area. There is also a café. Nearby you will find minigolf and the Taivallahti Tennis Centre.

item.title: Hiisi
item.description: Finnish food in big portions. Hiisi is a restaurant that uses local and organic food made in traditional Finnish way, with a little twist of modern Scandinavian kitchen.
item.matko:location: Fenniapasaasi / Kaisaniemenkatu 4
item.matko:open: Lunch Mon-Fri 11-14. A la Carte Wed-Fri 17-21, Sat 13-21

item.title: Hilda Viola
item.description: Vintage apparel and latest fashion trends from Paris with affordable prices.

item.title: Hilton Helsinki Airport
item.description: Hilton Helsinki Airport is the airport's first upscale hotel, offering travelers state-of-the-art facilities and contemporary design with a Finnish twist. The hotel is well equipped for meetings, events and conferences for 2 to 340 guests. All hotel rooms and facilities are soundproofed. The modern facilities include a spacious Ballroom, Hilton Boardroom, 12 meeting rooms, a dedicated Executive Floor and Lounge, a 24-hour Business Centre and parking space in front of the hotel.
item.matko:location: Hilton Helsinki-Vantaa Airport is located at Helsinki Airport´s International terminal, easily accessible through a 200 m covered walkway. Helsinki city centre 20 km.
item.matko:disabled: 4 accessible hotel rooms, all conference rooms and the restaurant are accessible, elevators to all floors, toilet for disabled people in the lobby area.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 330 rooms; 180 Hilton Guest Rooms, 42 Hilton Executive Rooms, 19 Hilton Executive Plus Rooms with private sauna, 5 suites with 2 rooms and private sauna. Guest room facilities: air conditioning, in-room safe, in-room bar, wi-fi Internet access, hair dryer, coffee & tea making facilities, iron and ironing board, bath with separate shower. Enjoy your stay in the comfortable 28m²/301sq.ft room with large soundproofed windows. Catch up with work at the desk and stay in touch with wireless internet access. Curl up on the easy chair and unwind watching on-demand movies on the LCD flat panel TV. Re-energize in the luxury bathroom with separate bathtub and shower.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Gui for up to 250 seated guests.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Business center, executive lounge. Hilton Helsinki Airport has a range of adaptable, high quality conference rooms located at street level. All designed in the same natural, elegant Finnish style as the rest of the hotel. The Ballroom is the perfect venue for meetings, dinners as well as car shows.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Hilton Fitness by Precor Gym and saunas are available free of charge to the hotel guests. Arrival and departure flight information screens and self-service airline check-in in the hotel lobby. Parking facilities for 100 vehicles, 24-hour room service, luggage service, Wi-Fi.
item.matko:services: A spacious Ballroom, a boardroom, 12 meeting rooms, a dedicated Executive Floor and Lounge, a 24 hour Business Center and parking space for 100 cars in front of the hotel.

item.title: Hilton Helsinki Kalastajatorppa
item.description: Hilton Helsinki Kalastajatorppa has a long and diverse history. Many international conferences and events have been held here during the years. The unique surroundings, tasteful decoration, high-class restaurants and diverse meeting and banquet rooms together create exciting atmosphere for hotel stays and events of all kinds.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 18 km. Seaside location.
item.matko:disabled: 2 accessible hotel rooms, accessible conference rooms, restaurants are accessible, toilet for disabled people in public areas.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 238 rooms in total: 106 Hilton Guest Rooms, 48 Hilton Guest Rooms Plus, 76 Hilton DeLuxe Rooms, 7 suites with a sea view, 1 Presidential Suite.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Meritorppa seating 120 guests . Conference & Events Center for private functions: Pyöreä Sali (Round Room) for max 350 persons, Siirtomaasali up to 550 persons for seated dinners. Elegant Vanha Torppa - a glance from the history - is ideal for cocktails for 150 persons as well for dinners for 90 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Siirtomaasali (Colonial Room) 503 m2, Merisali 356 m2, foyer areas adjacent 200 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Gym, business centre, 24-hour room service, four saunas, swimming pool, private beach, massage, garage and plenty of parking space, car wash.
item.matko:services: Restaurant, bar, business center, 17 conference rooms, sauna, swimming pool, gym.

item.title: Hilton Helsinki Strand
item.description: Hilton Helsinki Strand, a stylish and comfortable downtown hotel, is located by the sea, within walking distance of the city centre and the historic sights of Helsinki. The location is ideal for both business and holiday travellers. In addition to the bright, spacious rooms, the hotel offers versatile meeting and conference spaces for small negotiations and big dinners alike.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km (10 min on foot), airport 17 km. Walking distance from the city center.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 4 cm) along the path, essential access, automatic slide door, automatic hinged door, opens towards arrival direction, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, two inva-rooms in the hotel.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 190 rooms: 94 Hilton Guest Rooms, 47 Hilton Guest Rooms Plus, 42 Hilton Executive Rooms, 7 suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Comfortable Restaurant Bridges for up to 150 seated guests. Bridges ' Corner is ideal for private functions, luncheons and get together for 80 persons. The Ballroom seats 200 persons for dinner, 300 for a cocktail reception.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Ballroom 220m2, foyer 120 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna & More Wellness treatments and services on the top floor with saunas, swimming pool and a magnificent view, gym, business centre, 24 -hour room service, luggage service, and garage.
item.matko:services: Executive Floor & Lounge, 6 conference rooms, restaurant, bar, sauna and swimmingpool, gym

item.title: Hippie Shake Records
item.description: Hippie Shake Records is specialized in rare 60/70s rock and hard rock records. The shop stocks thousands of 7" & 12" -singles, LP's, CD's and CD-singles from all over the world.

item.title: HKI+
item.description: HKI+ is a coffee shop that mixes the best quality of coffee and bakery goods with excellent service. HKI+ also offers authentic Vietnamese coffee and Pho soup.

item.title: Hobby Point
item.description: Hobby Point is a hobby material shop in the city centre. The shop also stocks a wide range of eg. model railroad equipment, RC-cars and boats and miniature models for cars, boats and airplanes.

item.title: Hohtogolf West Coast Helsinki
item.description: Hohtogolf West Coast introduces a new style of glow-in-the-dark indoor mini-golf in Europe! Neon lights and special effects make playing in the dark fun and exciting! When you putt, something surprising happens! There is even a horror area with chilling special effects, while at the bar you can relax and enjoy cool drinks. Minimum age: 7 (Friday and Saturday evenings after 8pm: 18)

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki - Vantaa Airport
item.description: The modern Holiday Inn Helsinki - Vantaa Airport is a good choice for a restful stopover. The complimentary shuttle bus makes getting to and from the airport a breeze. The hotel is located in the Aviapolis business district close to local companies and 20 minute drive from the Helsinki City Centre. Unwind at the hotel's cozy bistro or take a 5-minute walk to Jumbo shopping mall full of shops or visit the Flamingo Spa.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 19 km, airport 1 km
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair accessible rooms available.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 280 non-smoking rooms. 258 standard rooms with queen size bed or twin beds, 21 executive rooms with queen or king size bed. All rooms have a hospitality tray, ironing equipment, ADSL broadband and wireless connection.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 2 saunas, Minigym
item.matko:services: Restaurant Bistro Fiore, Minigym and two saunas, free airport transfer, Business Corner, 7 meeting rooms.

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki City Centre
item.description: Holiday Inn Helsinki City Centre is located next to the Central Railway Station and offers you Scandinavian-style guest rooms, overlooking Helsinki Music Centre and Finlandia Hall or bustling Eliel Square. A Finnair shuttle bus stop is located in front of the hotel. Hotel also offers free internet, a Business Corner, restaurant, Gym and Finnish sauna.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km.
item.matko:disabled: Two wheelchair accessible rooms. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 174 rooms of which are all non-smoking. 148 standard rooms with queen size bed or twin beds, 26 executive rooms with queen or king size bed. All rooms have a hospitality tray, ironing equipment, ADSL broadband and wireless connection free of charge.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Verde located on the second floor. The cuisine is based on classic international food flavoured with Scandinavian specialities.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Business Corner, Conference room, Parking Hall P-Eliel, MiniGym, 2 saunas.
item.matko:services: Restaurant Verde, Lobbybar, Business Corner, Sauna, Minigym

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki Messukeskus
item.description: Located right next door to Messukeskus Helsinki, the Holiday Inn Helsinki Messukeskus provides the guest with a truly unique, functional range of services. Convenient connections to Helsinki-Vantaa Airport, Helsinki Railway Station and downtown Helsinki puts the Holiday Inn hotel at the centre of the Finnish conference scene. Messukeskus Helsinki in connection with the hotel offers guests a wide range of exhibition and conference facilities. With its great location for business and leisure travel, this high-standard hotel offers 244 spacious rooms. Amenities include ADSL and wireless broadband connection, coffee & tea making facilities, in-room safe and an ironing center. The hotel offers free access to Minigym and Finnish sauna.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, automatic slide door, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, light connected to the phones, which light up when the phone rings, 5 rooms for disabled. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 244 rooms of which 205 standard, 7 disabled, 34 executive rooms and 5 suites. All rooms have hospitality tray, ironing equipment, ADSL and wireless broadband connection free of charge.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Brasserie Terra Nova serves a wide range of Finnish and international cuisine. The lively bar at Terra Nova welcomes guests for cocktail or a glass of wine before dinner. Winter garden also available for banquets.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Business Centre with broadband internet access, Minigym, 3 saunas, garage.
item.matko:services: Business Centre with broadband internet access, Minigym, 3 saunas and garage.

item.title: Holiday Inn Helsinki West - Ruoholahti
item.description: The Holiday Inn Helsinki West - Ruoholahti is set in the vibrant Ruoholahti business district. Breathe in fresh sea air with a walk along the nearby shore, or hop on a metro and reach Helsinki's lively city centre in just five minutes. Unwind in the MiniGym and sauna and mingle over aperitifs in the relaxed Lobby bar. Finnish and international dishes are served in stylish Fokka Restaurant.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair accessible rooms. There is an induction loop system at the reception and guests with hearing impairment can borrow a portable vibrating alarm system.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 256 non-smoking rooms of which 125 Twin rooms, 99 Queen rooms and 32 Executive rooms
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Fokka Restaurant & Bar serves breakfast, lunch and dinner
item.matko:services: Restaurant Fokka, Lobby bar, Sauna, Minigym, garage, Sauna cabinet, Business Center, conference room.

item.title: Holy Trinity Church
item.description: Helsinki's oldest Orthodox church from 1827. Summer café. Church and summer café is open 3.6-15.7.2013 on Mondays at 13-17.
item.matko:open: Vigil Sat. at 6.pm(Slavic), liturgy Sun at 10am(Slavic) Evening service Mon-Thu at 5pm.(Finnish)

item.title: Hoochie Mama Jane
item.description: Colourful vintage paradise in Kallio, selling mainly clothing and accessories, evening dresses, cocktail dresses and also everyday-wear. Also a wide selection of shoes, bags and jewellery from past decades.

item.title: Hostel Academica
item.description: Hostel Academica is a summer hostel located right in the Helsinki city centre. There are 229 modern single and twin rooms which all have private toilet, shower and kitchenette with a fridge inside the room. Bedlinen and towels as well as morning sauna and swimming are included in the prices. In most of the rooms guests are able to have a WLAN internet connection. When staying at Hostel Academica, you´ll easily reach restaurants and cafes, shopping centers, beautiful green parks, beach and main sightseeing attractions in the city. They are all within a walking distance from the hostel.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:open: 1.6.-1.9. Office is open all year round.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Single & double rooms, also rooms for 3-4 persons. All rooms have private shower and bathroom. Rooms are spacious; 26-29 m2.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: UniCafe restaurant downstairs.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna and swimming pool for 20 persons.

item.title: Hostel Auris
item.description: Spacious and moderately equipped hostel most suitable for families with kids. The guests have a shared kitchen, living room and play area. There is a kids' playground in the inner court, and additionally a ball park and a larger kindergarten playground at a close vicinity to the house.
item.matko:location: Twenty minutes to city centre and to the airport. As of July accessible to the airport also by train. Close to major roads in Haaga, so easily accessible by car.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Ten accessible and spacious family rooms with basic equipment most suitable for families with small children. Private bathrooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Breakfast lounge, serving proper and nutritious breakfast, for example porrigde, orange juice, full grain bread and vegetables. Very convenient with kids.

item.title: Hostel Erottajanpuisto
item.description: The small and cosy Erottajanpuisto Hostel is located right in the centre of Helsinki. The friendly and atmospheric hostel has 15 cosy rooms. The rooms range in size from single room to 8-bed dormitory. All rooms include sink and linen, and in smaller rooms also TV. The toilets and showers are in the hallway.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:disabled: Hostel is in the 3rd floor, no lift available.
item.matko:groups: Group prices for minimum of 12 persons in big rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 15 rooms: 3 x single rooms, 3 x double rooms, 3 x 3-persons rooms, 3 x 4-persons rooms, 3 x 6-persons rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: the hostel doesn't have an own restaurant but there are two restaurants in the same building and many more on the same street.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Every room has a TV and hand basin, bedclothes and towels. Toilet and shower is in the corridor.

item.title: Hostel Suomenlinna
item.description: Hostel Suomenlinna lies in Helsinki, Suomenlinna. Enviroment is peaceful and historical. Hostel serves both groups and individual travellers. It takes only a 15 min ferry trip from the city center and Market Square (Kauppatori).
item.matko:location: Ferry to city centre 15 min, airport 20 km + ferry to Helsinki 15 min
item.matko:open: Hostel is open all year round. Mon-Sat 8-16.15, Sun & holidays 8-12.15
item.matko:groups: The hostel is mainly targeted for groups.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Together 40 bedplaces in rooms for 2-10 persons. Toilets and showers in the corridor.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Café
item.matko:additionalinfo: Common room, self catering kitchen.
item.matko:services: Hostel Suomenlinna has 34-39 beds: 24 beds in dorms for 6, 8 and 10 people and 10 beds in twins and triples. We have a small lounge area where the sofas form to 4-5 beds, if necessary. Showers and toilets are shared ones and in the corridor. There is a small self service kitchen corner in the hostel and a free wireless internet connection.

item.title: Hotel and Restaurant Museum
item.description: The Hotel and Restaurant Museum is situated close to the city centre in Cable Factory, in Ruoholahti area. Museum's meeting room is in the middle of exhibitions and it's suited for private occasions such as meetings, small seminars and lectures. Museum's new permanent exhibition is an adventure appealing to all senses. The museum also puts on temporary exhibitions on specific themes and offers a wide range of programme. Entrance fees to the exhibitions are included in the room rent.
item.matko:location: City centre 8 min, airport 30 min
item.matko:open: Tue-Sun 11-18. Archives open Tue-Fri 9-15 or by appointment (free entrance).
item.matko:admission: Adults 7€, children, students and pensioners 4€, one child under 15yrs with accompanying adult
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed (entrance G), lift and Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, e-mail: varaukset(at)hotellijaravintolamuseo, tel.+358 (0)44-747 4109 (Tue-Fri 9-11). Languages: Finnish, Swedish or English, duration 45 min.
item.matko:services: Coffee and salad lunches can be arranged for the meetings.

item.title: Hotel and Restaurant Museum
item.description: The Hotel and Restaurant Museum is specialised in the history of hotels, restaurants, tourism and Finnish culinary culture. It is situated close to the city centre in Cable Factory, in Ruoholahti area. Museum's permanent exhibition "At Your Service" is an adventure appealing to all senses. The museum also puts on temporary exhibitions on specific themes and offers a wide range of programme.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed (entrance G), lift and an accessible WC.

item.title: Hotel Anna
item.description: Cosy hotel with 64 rooms on walking distance from major department stores and sights. Hotel Anna serves breakfast and there is a good selection of restaurants and trendy pubs in the area around the hotel. All rooms are fully equipped with TV, telephone, minibar, WC, shower, hairdryer, umbrella, WLAN (free of charge).
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 64 rooms: 30 singles, 6 superior singles, 20 twins, 5 superior twins and 3 junior suites.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The use of the meeting room free of charge for hotel guests.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, parking space in a garage nearby, wireless broadband internet system accessible in the hotel.

item.title: Hotel Arthur
item.description: Built in 1907, Hotel Arthur has 182 rooms and 400 beds in the heart of Helsinki, 200m from the central railway station. The rooms have a private bathroom with a shower and WC, as well as a telephone, television, radio, hairdryer, and, in some, also a minibar and electric kettle. All rooms have free wireless Internet access. The single and double rooms are comfortable and cosy. Hotel Arthur is also suitable for families and groups, offering three and four person rooms, as well as two spacious suites.
item.matko:location: In the city centre 300 metres from the main railway station, airport 17 km.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 18%, lift; essential for access, easy access for blind or partially sighted, one inva-room, no separate toilet for wheelchair users in the restaurant, a steep hill to the gateway where an easier entrance, easier entry from the nearest gateway
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 182 rooms, 400 beds, several family rooms for 3-5 guests, Sir Arthur Suite.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant: 240 seats, lobby bar/café, terrace in summer; the conference facilities can also be used for banquets.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 450 m2 at different levels.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Three private restaurant cabinets can also be used as conference rooms.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 3 family saunas.
item.matko:services: Restaurant for 240 persons, conference rooms 10, biggest ball room for 200 persons, 3 saunas.

item.title: Hotel AVA
item.description: Hotel AVA is a cosy hotel in a peaceful environment. Connections to the city centre, Helsinki-Vantaa Airport and Pasila railway station are excellent. There are totally 75 non-smoking guest rooms from single rooms to six persons' apartment with reasonable prices. There is a TV and bathroom in every room. In studio rooms and in the apartments there are kitchen facilities with microwave and refrigerator. Hotel AVA also has a sauna, free parking even for large vehicles, laundry, WLAN and movie channels.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 13 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 75 rooms from single rooms to apartments for up to 6 guests
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Buffet-breakfast restaurant. Seats for 40-50 persons. There is possibility to make a group reservation for the lunch or dinner. Also for private functions.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, computer room, free parking

item.title: Hotel Avion
item.description: Hotel Avion is a privately owned, modern and comfortable hotel and restaurant in Helsinki Malmi. All the rooms have a minibar, TV and air-conditioning. We also have allergy rooms. Good connections to the city centre. Local train goes every five minutes and the trip takes 10 minutes. Air-port, exhibition centre and ice-stadium Hartwall Arena are also near. There is a possibility to use a computer in Avion (wireless ADSL) and we have an internetbar
item.matko:location: City centre 14 km, airport 8 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 39 rooms: 12 single, 24 double (separate beds), 3 suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Breakfast, daily lunch buffet, a la carte restaurant.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Other meeting facilities available in the same building.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna
item.matko:services: Air-conditioning, minibar, phone, TV and shower in every room. Also non-smoking rooms and rooms for allergic. Computer with internet access available for hotel guests.

item.title: Hotel Cumulus Kaisaniemi Helsinki
item.description: The newly renovated Hotel Cumulus Kaisaniemi welcomes you to Helsinki! The hotel's location in the very centre of Helsinki only two blocks from the main railway station across the street from a metro sta-tion makes it easy to reach the Cumulus Kaisaniemi. Add pleasant service and comfortable rooms - sure to enjoy your stay!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 17 km
item.matko:disabled: elevator, one room especially suited for persons with disabilities
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 104 rooms: standard single and twin rooms, most of them for non-smokers.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Huviretki, about 100 places dinner restaurant.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna, garage nearby.
item.matko:services: sauna, cumulus shop, ironing room

item.title: Hotel Fabian
item.description: An elegant, continental style 58-room boutique hotel was opened in August 2010. A special feature of the new hotel are loft-like rooms and nine extended stay rooms for those who wish to spend a longer time in Helsinki. Architecture of the building plays a key role in hotel's interior design creating a unique identity for the Hotel Fabian.
item.matko:location: Kaartinkaupunki, city centre 0.5km, airport 20 km

item.title: Hotel Finn
item.description: Situated on the top floors of a historical building, the Hotel Finn will offer you a modern and intimate setting during your stay in Helsinki. The Hotel Finn is located a short walk from the central railway station, bus station and right next door to the well-known Stockmann department store. Customers will be able to enjoy the convenience of staying in a lively quarter within walking distance to Helsinki's shopping areas, tourist attractions and parks, theaters and restaurants, while experiencing a calm and serene atmosphere. The hotel consists of 27 bedrooms varying from different sizes and prices. Each one of them is equipped with the essential amenities to ensure a comfortable stay.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 27 rooms for one, two, three or four persons. Most rooms have a shower or bath. All rooms have a toilet and sink as well as phone and television.

item.title: Hotel GLO Bar
item.description: The stylish and easily accessible GLO Bar at street level has become a popular meeting place for all who want to enjoy the pleasant atmosphere with some good friends and simply relax.

item.title: Hotel Haikko Manor & Spa
item.description: Hotel Haikko Manor & Spa provides sunny service, genuine manor house ambience, fantastic archipelago and pampering spa treatments for adult taste. Haikko Manor has also one of the best conference and banquets centre in Finland. Hotel Haikko Manor is located in the middle of a beautiful park by the sea,only half an hour´s drive from Finland´s capital Helsinki. The picturesque old town Porvoo is located within five kilometers from Haikko.
item.matko:location: Porvoo centre 10 min. Airport 35 min. Helsinki city centre 45 min.
item.matko:groups: 20 conference rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Hotel Haikko Manor, The elegant Hotel Haikko Manor & Spa functions in 2 separate buildings: the Manor house with 24 hotel rooms and Spa hotel with 199 hotel rooms. The distance between the buildings is only 30 m. The Manor rooms have individual interiors in a luxurious manor house style. There are 4 suites, 5 imperial double rooms with balcony and 15 classic double rooms. The Spa hotel has 2 suites, 46 superior double/twin rooms and 151 standard double/twin rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The historic Manor House has two elegant, large dining rooms and several charming smaller rooms. Antique furniture, lovely details and historic ambiance of the Russian imperial era. The relaxed atmosphere in the Manor Club and the Spa Café suits well for more casual events.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Hotel Haikko Manor, Finland has a wide variety of different conference and meeting premises for various needs. We can host large international conferences, training events, trade fairs & exhibitions, meetings and informal get-togethers. Haikko has modern conference equipment and service-minded conference staff at your disposal.
item.matko:services: Spa, spa treatments, restaurant, hotel, conference center.

item.title: Hotel Haven
item.description: Hotel Haven, Finland's first member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World chain, is designed to provide homely warmth, exclusive comfort and high-quality service for the discerning guest. First class service is supported by high-quality restaurants; G.W.Sundmans, Sundmans Krog and Havis serve both business and leisure guests. Additionally, conference services, altogether four meeting rooms and an auditorium, makes it possible to organize meetings for up to 120 persons within the hotel. In an elegant, yet cosy lobby, guests can relax by a fireplace and browse through daily papers. Bar Haven serves both hot beverages and relaxing drinks.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Hotel Indigo Helsinki - Boulevard
item.description: The Hotel Indigo® Helsinki -Boulevard opens its doors in early March. Behind the handsome zinc metal sheet façade are 120 individualized rooms, two restaurants; Bröd Punavuori and Soup & Juice, Boardroom meeting room, 35-slot car park and a unique Body, Mind & Soul studio.
item.matko:location: City Centre 10 mins, Airport 30 mins
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Of the 120 rooms of Hotel Indigo® Helsinki-Boulevard, there are 105 Deluxe Standard rooms, 14 Executive rooms and one Junior Suite. Hotel rooms are fitted with state-of-the-art cooling system, Nespresso-coffee machine, Personal Media Network system and a free mini-bar; bathrooms are supplied with top quality Aveda-products.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Two new restaurants - Restaurant Bröd Punavuori and Soup & Juice - will be open in the new Hotel Indigo Helsinki-Boulevard. Bröd Punavuori is an urban bistro-style restaurant, based on Scandinavian cuisine. The restaurant is open from morning till night. The other restaurant, Soup & Juice, serves fresh salads, soups, bread and juices. Soup & Juice is all about fresh flavours. Chef, restauranteur and entrepreneur Henrik Poulsen is behind the concepts of both restaurants, Bröd and Soup & Juice.

item.title: Hotel Kämp
item.description: Hotel Kämp is one of the most valued historical buildings in central Helsinki and the first deluxe 5 star hotel in the Nordic countries. Offering luxurious facilities and unsurpassed service in Finland, Hotel Kämp is located in the very heart of the city at Pohjoisesplanadi with its neo-classical architecture, designer shops and elegant Esplanade Park. It is within a few minutes' walk of the harbor and close to all major cultural sites. The hotel provides outstanding service and excellent banqueting facilities, as well as 179 rooms and several suites, including the famous Mannerheim Suite. Valet service is available, and the hotel is within walking distance of the shops and sights of Helsinki.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Fully accessibility, automatic slide door, toilet for wheelchair users, parking for disabled, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting poor at places, the hotel has specially fitted rooms fro persons who use wheelchair, in emergency situations, priority of assistance to motion handicapped, easier entry from Kluuvikatu 2.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 179 rooms of which 133 Deluxe rooms single/double, 31 Executive Rooms single/double, 8 Junior Park Suite, 4 Kämp Suites, 2 Executive Suites, 1 Presidential Suite. Luxurious marble bathrooms are equipped with bath and separate walk-in shower. The biggest suites have also in-room sauna. All the rooms have televisions with satellite, film and radio channels, 3 direct-dial telephones with voicemail, wireless internet connection, air conditioning, safe deposit, Mini Bar and 24h Room Service.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Brasserie Kämp; Restaurant Yume: modern Japanese cuisine;
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The most elegant banquet facilities in the city, the legendary Mirror Room and three multifunctional meeting rooms offer new kind of tastes, atmosphere and experiences for parties, meetings and cocktail receptions.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Kämp Spa

item.title: Hotel Rantasipi Airport
item.description: The high-standard and comfortable Rantasipi Airport is an effective airport hotel that is ideal for busy conference delegates as well as individual guests. The hotel offers pleasant sauna and pool facilities, excellent restaurant and catering services, a Business Corner and a lobby bar. A scheduled airport shuttle free of charge operates between the hotel and the airport.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city 18 km, airport 2 km.

item.title: Hotel Room
item.description: Can you call it a hotel, if all the rooms are located in different cities of the world? Sure you can. And we call it a hotel even though only the first room, room number one, is open for business. It's located in Kallio district, in Helsinki, Finland. A 30m2 fully furnished flat with complete kitchen and a funky interior, suitable for 1-2persons (3 if one is comfortable sleeping on the couch).

item.title: Hotel Seurahuone Helsinki
item.description: The Hotel Seurahuone Helsinki is a high class hotel in the heart of Helsinki. Historically over 180 years old Seurahuone is one of the most traditional hotels in Finland. The hotel's 118 stylishly decorated rooms feature individual alternatives; Standard Single, Standard Double and Seurahuone Club classes as well as four Junior Suites. The hotel's Banquet Floor offers an exceptional venue with traditional setting coupled with high-quality and modern service. The hotel's legendary restaurant and bar have undergone a major renovation. The new Brasserie Le Havre restaurant harks back to the Hotel Seurahuone Helsinki's first seafront location by the Market Square. The name also honours the core of European food culture, the French brasserie-style cuisine.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, low step (8 cm) outside entrance door, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, door opening 75 cm, no special inva-rooms but rooms can be accessed with wheelchair, entrance from outside the restaurant, ten steps to the hotel bar, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 118 rooms: 96 standard rooms, 18 Seurahuone Club rooms, 4 Junior suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Brasserie Le Havre, Bar Socis.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Banquet Floor with six private banquet rooms, Business Point, ironing room.
item.matko:services: Brasserie Le Havre, Bar Socis

item.title: Hotel Sofia
item.description: Sofia is situated in Helsinki in a peaceful nature by the sea, just 15 km from the centre and the airport. The hotel has 3 different types of hotel rooms and can accommodate 150 persons. 12 meeting and conference facilities for 450 persons - the largest one is an auditorium for 220 persons.
item.matko:location: Vuosaari, Helsinki. City centre 15 km, Vuosaari metro station 2 km, airport 20 km.
item.matko:groups: Groups only by appontment, min. 8 persons
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant 220 seats, Lobby bar 60 seats, Retro club 100 seats and Brass room 30 seats.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main lobby + lecture rooms nearby (450 m2).
item.matko:additionalinfo: 4 saunas, one by the sea, 17 m long swimming pool, gym room, sports hall, own beach, free internet services, own free parking area for 130 cars.
item.matko:services: Conference-, hotel and restaurant services.

item.title: House of Nobility (Ritarihuone)
item.description: The Swedish-born architect G. T. Chiewitz draw the neo-gothic plan for the palace and it was was completed in 1862, suitably for the Diet of all four estates in 1863. The interior of the palace is largely designed by the decorators of that time. The west wing of the building is rented for private functions, whereas the east wing is for the purposes of the nobility. The assembly hall and board room is 464 sq. meters and is rented to companies, organizations and societies for banquets, cocktail receptions, concerts and meetings in a unique milieu.
item.matko:location: City centre 0.5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:ingress: Banquets, cocktail receptions, concerts and meetings.

item.title: HTC Helsinki (Sodexo)
item.description: HTC Helsinki is located in Ruoholahti, by the sea. It was built in 2002 and consists of five different buildings: Nina, Pinta, Santa Maria, Vega and Kon-Tiki. Auditorium Kolumbus seats 235 persons, seminar rooms Magalhaes and Vasco da Gama 20-70 persons. There are also five small conference rooms for 12 persons/room. There are also two special saunas: Albatrossi and Pohjankiisla which are located in the top floor with roof gardens. There is a meeting room and a lounge in both saunas.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurants Explorer (180 seats) and Acqua (80 seats) serve lunch on weekdays from 11am to 2pm. Other times Restaurant Explorer can host events for 170-225 persons, cocktails for up to 450 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Pinta house's entrance hall, about 300 m2; auditoriums and seminar rooms for catering and cocktails. The entrance hall can also be used as exhibition space.

item.title: Huone Events Hotel
item.description: Located in the up and rising Jätkäsaari, Huone Events Hotel is the first Events Hotel in the world. Opened in November 2012, the hotel offers living rooms instead of bedrooms. There are 8 living rooms, 3 saunas, 1 common lounge and 1 terrace. The living rooms are all different themed, available for meetings in the daytime, but parties in the evening. All the rooms are sound-proofed and equipped with AV-system, 65' Flatscreen TV, free WIFI, Flip chart etc. Huone has the all-in-one solution for small events organising, from food, space, programme, entertainment, transportation, sauna to your own event coordinator.
item.matko:location: City centre 8mins, airport 30mins.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Not available. There is a hotel offering accomodation in the same building, but nearby areas there are 2 hotels.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Huone offers Italian, Finnish and Asian cuisine for their customers. From breakfast, lunch and dinner to cocktail snacks and late-night supper. Food can be served to the rooms or enjoyed in the lounge.

item.title: Huopalahti Church
item.matko:open: Mass on Sundays at 10 and on Wednesdays at 19.30.

item.title: Hupipuisto SnadiStadi
item.description: An inside adventure park SnadiStadi is designed for family fun. SnadiStadi offers a wide range of activities. There is a traffic park, parks for younger and older children, a small cinema, a huge sandbox and own areas for street games and ball-games and a lot more. There is also plenty of space for children to climb, jump and play around. Theme birthday parties and other family events can be organized as well. Minors under the age of 18 have to be accompanied by a parent or an adult guardian at all times while in the park. Children under the age of 18 are the responsibility of the parent or a guardian. With the entrance wristband there is an unlimited time in the park during the same day.
item.matko:location: Ruoholahti shopping centre, 5th floor.
item.matko:admission: Entrance fees: Babies under the age of 1: 0 €, children under the age of 4: 12 €, children over the age od 4: 16 €, adults 2 €
item.matko:services: Piknik-kahvila, elokuvateatteri, ja kauppakatu.

item.title: Hurjaruuth Dance Theatre
item.description: Hurjaruuth is a dynamic dance theatre company founded in 1981. Dynamic, courageous and exciting theatre performances combined with music, arts, circus, dance and theatre.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchair. Inva-WC and lift.
item.matko:groups: Reductions for school groups
item.matko:services: Café, 350 seats, coffee 1€.
item.matko:ingress: Hurjaruuth is a dynamic dance theatre company.

item.title: Huvila Festival Tent
item.description: The Huvila Festival Tent is a unique concert venue at Hakaniemi. The box office and restaurant are open from 6pm. The restaurant is an excellent place to enjoy the balmy August nights after your show. Please note that the minimum age for admittance to the tent is 18 years.

item.title: Huvilan kahvila
item.description: Café Huvilan kahvila is located at Villa Hakasalmi between the Finlandia Hall and the Music Centre.

item.title: Hymy Raw Food Café
item.description: Hymy Raw Food Café located in the heart of the Tori Quarters is a café that serves locally produced cakes, pastries and raw chocolate. The ingredients used in the pastries and cakes are organic. The café has also a wide selection of literature on raw food and raw food products.

item.title: Höyhentämö
item.description: Theatre

item.title: Ice Cellar
item.description: In the Ice Cellar everything has a form. There local art and culture actors will be able to present their creative work. It will give a permanent setting for different, even spontaneous events. It has a light organisational structure, and those responsible for its activities are open to new, diverse thoughts. The aim of the project will be to find new ideas for and develop cultural tourism products and services. This side of the operations in the Ice Cellar will be supported by an art shop and culture café.

item.title: Icepark
item.description: Helsinki Icepark at the Railway Station Square is a perfect way to enjoy Finnish winter in an urban way. It makes it easy to enjoy skating or simply a cup of coffee in the café while watching the others skate. The Icepark offers its visitors entertaining and instructive programs including regular skating lessons by licensed instructors. Skates are available for rent, ice hockey sticks are not allowed. The Park also hosts all kinds of events from live music to special performances.
item.matko:open: During winter season with weather reservation: Mon-Fri 12-21, Sat 10-21, Sun 10-18.
item.matko:services: Skate rental, café

item.title: Ichiban Sushi
item.description: Ichiban Sushi is a Japanese run family restaurant with a cozy and friendly atmosphere. The restaurant serves hand-made sushi. Lunch menu Mon-Fri 11-14.

item.title: Iguana Mannerheimintie
item.description: Iguana Mannerheimintie is a self-service based food and drink restaurant on two floors. We serve pizzas, burgers, pastas, salads and tex-mex foods. We serve Finnish and international drinks, come and taste our excellent strawberry margarita. Iguana has also a cozy cellar restaurant. The restaurant is open daily from 5 pm, till 3 am when needed. The premises can also be rented during daytime for reunions and meetings. 50 seats. Video screen and A.V. equipment available.

item.title: Iittala Shop
item.description: Finnish design-tableware. The heart of Iittala's design philosophy is formulated along Kaj Franck's early thinking. According to Franck, "objects should always be appropriate, durable and functional."

item.title: Impuls Oy
item.description: Hairdresser

item.title: InsideOut Escape Games
item.description: InsideOut Escape Games is the first and original Real Life Room Escape Game in Finland, founded by three Hungarian women. Since 2014 the InsideOut Escape Games have challenged players to overcome themselves, think in new ways, and co-operate with their group members in order to solve riddles. The speciality is the combination of theatre and entertainment, which helps to immerse the players in the experience right at the front door! From Kallio, just by the church, you will find the following games: Escape from the Surprise Party, The Appointment, and the Blocks. The following rooms are located in Best Western Hotel Rantapuisto in Vuosaari there: The Bar of Monsters and Madmen, The Ministry of Future Investments, and Sensation. InsideOut Escape Games' Vuosaari location is perfect especially for companies. From the hotel you can find for example an auditorium, 15 conference rooms, sauna, restaurants, an exhibition hall - and now also three unique escape rooms, in which you can fit even 20 people altogether to work on their teamwork! The InsideOut Escape Games put adrenalin running and group spirit on test; and hour has never passed so fast!
item.matko:open: Every day of the year, see more at www.insideoutescape.com.

item.title: Institut francais de Finlande
item.description: Since 1968, the French Institute is a piece of France in Finland. It aims to increase French and Finnish cooperation in the fields of culture, Francophony, tourism, science and education. Institute provides French courses from beginners to advanced levels as well as the possibility to pass examinations and get certificates awarded by the French Ministry of Education.
item.matko:open: Reception Mon-Fri 9-17, library and information centre Tue-Fri 15-19, Sat 10-16.
item.matko:services: The library and information centre is open to all and offers information about France. The collection includes books, music CDs, films (video, DVD), journals and CD-ROMs.

item.title: International Cultural Centre Caisa
item.description: Multicultural exhibitions, concerts, events

item.title: Isonkarhun Kauppa- teddy bear store and museum
item.description: The shop sells all sorts of soft toys and teddy bears for both young and old. Also eg. STEIFF-products. It's also possible to fill your own teddybear. The shop also houses the Teddy Bear Hospital that takes care of soft toys that need attention and Teddy Bear museum.

item.title: Itis Shopping Centre
item.description: Itis (until 2012 Itäkeskus) is largest shopping centre in the Nordic countries and includes near 300 shops and restaurants.
item.matko:services: Some services, eg. restaurants, have their own exceptional opening hours.

item.title: Itäkeskus Swimming Hall
item.description: A family recreation centre big enough for 1000 persons at a time, quarried inside a rock (Also a fall-out shelter for 3,800.) Children's pool and water chute, 50 meter pool, 6 saunas, jacuzzi, turkish bath, cold-water pool, massage (advance booking). 3 and 5 m diving boards and solarium.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, electronic doors, own changing room, lift and handicap toilet.

item.title: IVANAhelsinki
item.description: Contemporary Finnish design combining modern Scandinavian style with a traditional Slavic touch. Designer Paola Suhonen is internationally recognized and her clothes are handmade in Finland.

item.title: Jam in the Box
item.description: Jam in the Box is a shop specialized in roller derby supplies for the players, but the store, situated on Vaasankatu in the heart of Kallio, carries also a selection of bold, fun and casual street fashion.

item.title: Jetty Barracks Gallery
item.description: Maintained by the Helsinki Artists' Association, the gallery hosts exhibitions of top quality contemporary art.

item.title: Johan & Nyström
item.description: A serious place for coffee lovers! The Johan & Nyström Cafe and Roastery in the Katajanokka district offers a specialty coffee experience, as well as good selection of teas and delicious pastries. In addition to coffee, cafe also sells machines and other equipment.

item.title: Johanna Gullichsen
item.description: Johanna Gullichsen Textile Craft & Design offers an extensive lifestyle collection for modern living. The collection consists of fabrics for upholstery and furnishings, kitchen and table-linen, bath-linen, bed-linen, kimonos and other home accessories. Johanna Gullichsen´s textiles reflect elements of modern living.

item.title: Jollas Institute
item.description: Jollas Institute is beautifully situated in Jollas, at the waterfront of the Gulf of Finland.
