Jollas is part of the isle of Laajasalo, some ten kilometres east of the centre of Helsinki. The Institute offers an unique venue for a variety of needs: well-equipped conference rooms, spacious festival and restaurant halls, a waterfront sauna, a cosy Sámi hut and a yard suited for a variety of outdoor activities. The restaurant prepares from scratch tasty food for small meetings as well as for large events, preferring organic, locally produced foodstuffs.
item.matko:location: City centre 20 min, Airport 30 min
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 46 double rooms with separate beds. The rooms are equipped with a shower/toilet, TV, wlan, laminate flooring, bedding suitable for allergic people and a hair-dryer.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Ankkuri offers a variety of menus that can be tweaked to suit various needs. If you have a theme for your event, our kitchen will come up with a menu that will reflect the theme perfectly and charm your guests. The restaurant prepares savoury and sweet treats for all group sizes, from small ones to parties or conferences with hundreds of participants. The restaurant seats a maximum of 150 guests. The restaurant caters to private parties as well as corporate events.

item.title: Jone's Karaokebar
item.description: Karaokebar in Kaisaniemi around the corner of Railway station.

item.title: Joutsen
item.description: Joutsen Finland is the northernmost down products manufacturer in the world. Joutsen manufactures products for three product groups: down wear, down bedding and down sleeping bags. The quality of Joutsen products is acknowledged even outside Finland.

item.title: Juan Apartments
item.description: Charming room in a 1920s house. Located in a quiet area of the bohemic Kallio. Good facilities for 1-3 persons + 1 extra bed possible. Excellent location: theaters, music house, opera, restaurants, amusement park, sports facilities and Töölönlahti within walking distance. Its our home during autumn, winter and spring and so we are there daily. In summertime we pop into the scene when/if needed. We are happy to give hints where to go and what to see on your stay. We speak fluent English, Swedish and German.
item.matko:location: 10 minutes from center, 25 minutes from airport, 20 minutes from ferry
item.matko:accomodationinfo: One king size bed and one single bed. Room price includes linen and towels, TV, CD/DVD player, radio, hair dryer, iron, fan and wireless internet. The apartment has a functional stove.

item.title: Juju Jewellery
item.description: Juju Jewellery sell silver jewellery by four finnish designers.

item.title: Jukka Rintala Shop
item.description: Fashion designer Jukka Rintala is known for his wonderful eveningwear and unique creations. His ranges also include accessories and interior textiles.

item.title: Jurkka Theatre
item.description: Performances in Finnish
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, please notify beforehand. Assistant needed (1-3 stairs).
item.matko:groups: Pensioner groups 15€/person (over 20 persons), school groups by appointment.
item.matko:services: Café/restaurant, seating for 50, fully licensed. Open 1 h before performance. Coffee and pastry 5€. Parking in street.

item.title: Jädelino
item.description: Jädelino offers fresh handmade Italian artisan ice cream free from any artificial colours or additives.
item.matko:location: Teurastamo, Kalasatama

item.title: Jätkäsaari
item.matko:location: Next to the Western Terminal, the nearest metro station: Ruoholahti

item.title: Kaarle Xll
item.description: The popular "Kalle" has operated since 1976 with the same business idea and name. There is a relaxed atmosphere in the restaurant that consists of six bars on two floors, one of the bars beeing the ever so popular Suomibaari (nowadays Bar 4), a bar with solely Finnish pop music. Artist evenings are mainly on Fridays in Bar 4 starting at 23.
item.matko:open: Mon-Wed open on request, Thu 20-04, Fri-Sat 20-04, Sun closed. Age limit 24 years.

item.title: Kaarna bar & kitchen
item.description: Kaarna bar & kitchen is a relaxed Finnish restaurant that offers fresh, clean and simple flavours of the Finnish kitchen with a Scandinavian touch.

item.title: Kabuki
item.description: Traditional Japanese restaurant that has been serving its loyal customers for over 15years. This small restaurant is very popular so table reservations are recommended. Also take-away service.

item.title: Kadetti Restaurant
item.description: The Kadetti Restaurant is in a Jugend building designed by Eliel Saarinen in the beautiful Munkkiniemi district of Helsinki. Conferences, training events and congresses welcome on weekdays. In the evenings and at weekends the Kadetti is a private restaurant for individually tailored events. Many of the rooms are suitable for a variety of events, the Kadetti and Tornisalonki for banquets. Free parking and well served by public transport.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 20 km

item.title: Kafe Moskova
item.description: Time stands still at the Brezhnevian era's last monument Kafe Moskova located in central Helsinki. The cozy 26-seated bar offers a genuine atmosphere of the Soviet Union: cold beer and freezing service. It is possible to book Kafe Moskova early in the evening for private parties.

item.title: Kaffa Roastery
item.description: Kaffa Roastery is a Helsinki-based coffee roastery located in the hip neighborhood of Punavuori. In addition to the specialty coffees, the small roastery offers freshly roasted coffee beans, as well as espresso machines and an array of high-quality coffee equipment.

item.title: Kahvila Sävy
item.description: Kahvila Sävy in Kallio district offers high quality coffee produced by small roasteries.

item.title: Kaisa House
item.description: The Kaisa house functions as the Main Library of Helsinki University. The house has gathered several architectural awards and is a stunning example of modern library architecture. It has an curvilinear brick facade. Architects AOA (2012).
item.matko:services: Cafe Gaudeamus

item.title: Kaisaniemi Park
item.description: Situated alongside the Central Railway Station, Kaisaniemi Park is a great place for recreation and includes the University Botanical Gardens.
item.matko:location: Next to the Railway Station (eastern side)
item.matko:ingress: Park is a great place for recreation.

item.title: Kaisla
item.description: Kaisla, entrance from Vilhonkatu and Vuorikatu, by Kaisaniemi metro station, instantly opens up the world of beer in all its glory to those who visit. The city's most impressive row of taps catches the eye and fills pints with 30 of the finest beers from all over the world. An expedition into the world of bottled beers lasts as long as adventures in bygone days: about 200 varieties are served.

item.title: Kaivohuone
item.description: Restaurant Kaivohuone, in a unique setting, is situated in the middle of the most beautiful Helsinki in the park of Kaivopuisto. The restaurant has served both Finnish and international guests from 1838. Behind seven bars the competent personnel serves the thirsty party people with excellent customer service. Kaivohuone can also be hired for private occasions. During winter only open upon request. Age limit: 18 years
item.matko:open: Wed, Sat 21-04, Fri 21-04. Terrace Wed, Fri, Sat 18-02 depending on weather.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Seats up to 1000 persons, terrace for up to 500 persons, in use May-August. Full lighting and sound reproduction system, audio-visual equipment and a large stage.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open Mon-Fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Kaivohuone is part of Night people Group.

item.title: Kaivopuisto Minigolf
item.description: 18 holes and beautiful views to the sea.
item.matko:location: Eiranranta
item.matko:admission: 8/5/0€. The box office closes one hour prior to park closing time.

item.title: Kaivopuisto Park
item.description: Helsinki's oldest and best known park is surrounded by embassies and villas. The nearby sea, rock cliffs and green lawns offer many opportunities to relax and enjoy the outdoors. At the highest point of the park is the Ursa Observatory. There are several cafées and restaurants along the shore and on the islands.
item.matko:ingress: Helsinki's oldest and best known park.

item.title: Kaivopuiston antiikki
item.description: Furniture from the 18th and 19th century, also porcelain, silver and jewellery.

item.title: Kakkugalleria
item.description: Cafe and bakery serving handmade cakes, pastries, truffles and other tasty treats.

item.title: Kalevala Koru & Lapponia Jewelry outlet
item.description: Kalevala Koru outlet is located in the same building as the factory. In the outlet shop it is possible to find the whole Kalevala koru collection as wellas parts of the Lapponia Jewelry collection. Here you can also find special items, eg. jewelry collections that are no longer manufactured.
item.matko:location: In Pitäjänmäki

item.title: Kalevala Koru Shop
item.description: Kalevala Koru is the largest jewellery manufacturer in Finland who designs, produces and sells high quality gold, silver and bronze jewellery. The ground of design is strongly based on Finnish and Scandinavian culture combining the historical heritage with modern life alike.
item.matko:services: Also a shop at Kamppi shopping centre. Factory shop: Strömbergintie 4, tel. +358 (0)20 7611 214

item.title: Kallio Bear Park Cafe, kiosk in Karhupuisto park
item.description: The kiosk in the Karhupuisto park serves coffee, Helsingin jäätelötehdas ice cream, fresh cinnamon rolls (Korvapuusti, a Finnish sweet pastry), the Karhupuisto parks own ice tea and Laitilan Wirvoitusjuoma-soft drinks. The park is named after the statue "Bear on an anthill".

item.title: Kallio Church
item.description: This grey granit church was planned by Lars Sonck in 1912. The church is one of the purest representatives of the Romantic nationalism style in Finland. The church is decorated with Art Nouveau style murals. Jean Sibelius composed a melody for the bells.
item.matko:disabled: The vestibule of the church is dark.
item.matko:services: Helsinki Organ Summer concerts on Mon at 19.30.

item.title: Kallio Ice Rink
item.description: The Kallio artificial ice rink which is located in the Kallio district is a popular open-air ice skating rink with playback-music and warm juice and hot chocolate for sale. The rink has been shared in two sections: for skaters with and without ice-hockey sticks. Skates are available for rent. It is forbidden to skate with racing- and tour skates during public skating. In the summer time you may enjoy the atmosphere of football and baseball matches at the rink.
item.matko:location: In Kallio, trams 1, 1A, 3B, 3T and 8
item.matko:services: Skate rental, café.

item.title: Kamera Gallery
item.description: Photo gallery of largest camera club in Finland.

item.title: Kampin Hodari & Hummeri
item.description: Hot dogs and cool lobsters. Street food

item.title: Kamppi Bowling Center & Bar
item.description: Bowling in Kamppi is not just a sport, it's much more!
item.matko:location: Kamppi shopping center, 4th floor.

item.title: Kamppi Chapel of Silence
item.description: Kamppi Chapel of Silence is located in a corner of the Narinkkatori square in Helsinki, at the entrance of the Kamppi shopping center. The Chapel is intended to be a place where people can have a moment of silence and meet each other. It offers an opportunity to calm down in the middle of perhaps the busiest area in Finland. The entrance to the chapel works as an exhibition area as well where it is possible to the meet the priest and the social worker.
item.matko:disabled: The Chapel is fully accessible.

item.title: Kamppi Shopping Centre
item.description: Shopping Center that offers cafes, restaurants and clothing to every generation in it´s five levels.
item.matko:disabled: All levels are accessible via lifts.

item.title: Kankurin Tupa
item.description: Handicrafts and souvenirs. Here you'll also find Christmas decorations all year.

item.title: Kanneltalo
item.description: Exhibitions, concerts
item.matko:location: City centre 11 km, airport 14 km
item.matko:admission: Free admission to exhibitions, admission fee for concerts
item.matko:services: Café, library

item.title: Kansalaistori Square
item.description: Kansalaistori is a new square and lawn area in the heart of the city located between the Music Centre and Museum of Contemporary Art Kiasma along Mannerheimintie. The square is partially paved and in the summertime popular especially among skateboarders. The area has plenty of benches to sit and relax and watch all the activity around. The artificial turf playground located in the area provides a possibility for different kinds of sports activies, e.g. basketball, and there's a paved bicycle route running through the area. Kansalaistori serves also as a venue for various events, such as Taste of Helsinki and Picnic Cinema during the annual Helsinki Festival.

item.title: Kansallissali (Kämp Group)
item.description: Unique national romanticism and robust design in the heart of Helsinki. Kansallissali has conference facilities for up to 200 people. Easy to reach and Hotel Kämp's kitchen takes care of quality cuisine.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Entire hall 200 m2

item.title: Karaokebar Populus
item.description: Nostalgic, everyone knows. Restaurant Operations since 1937. Karaoke begins every morning 9.00

item.title: Karhu Concept Store
item.description: Nearly 100 years after the brand was born, Finland's legendary running brand Karhu opened its first stand alone store in Lasipalatsi. The selection is focused on Performance running and retro inspired Karhu Originals lifestyle segment. Legend tells that Karhu (bear in Finnish) had the rights for the three stripes, but sold that to then unknown Adidas for 1600 euros and two bottles of whiskey. Cult classic!

item.title: Karjalatalo, Restaurant Karelia
item.description: Built in 1974, the Karelia has a quiet location well served by public transport. Main hall, foyer and restaurant on the ground floor (can be combined), private dining rooms on three floors. Karelian traditions and customs reflected in the interior and décor.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Karelia, private restaurant: 100 seats, Takatasku Pub
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main hall 290 m2 + stage 75 m2, foyer 350 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna + sauna lounge, sauna for 10 at a time, lounge for c. 26, small ecumenical chapel adjoining the Galleria room, Käpylä Keep Fit Club in the same building

item.title: Kart'in Club
item.description: Karting on a racy and safe indoor track.
item.matko:location: Bus 55 from the Railway Square
item.matko:admission: Adults from 15€, children from 12€ (please see website for more details).
item.matko:services: Single, groups, meetings, saunas etc.

item.title: Karuna Church, Seurasaari Island
item.description: The Karuna Church situated in the Seurasaari outdoor museum on Seurasaari island was built in 1685 and moved to Seursaari in 1912. The church is one of the most popular churches in Helsinki for summer weddings.
item.matko:services: On Wednesdays in summer evening concerts at 19.00 and summer Sundays service at 12.30.
item.matko:ingress: Popular church for weddings in Helsinki.

item.title: Kasvisbaari
item.description: Lunch restaurant serving vegetarian food. Gluten-free and vegan alternatives available daily.
item.matko:location: Taiteidentalo/Kuvataideakatemia

item.title: Katajanokan Kasino
item.description: This traditional restaurant was opened in 1913 and entirely renovated in 1996. The architecture and decor of Katajanokan Kasino - from the spacious Kenraali dining room to the distinctive and historical private rooms - represent a fascinating aspect of Helsinki's restaurant tradition. Traditions are also upheld by the restaurant's high quality kitchen. The seaside location and a spacious terrace make Katajanokan Kasino a real jewel of summer Helsinki, and with its private rooms, it is also a suitable setting for a variety of conferences and other occasions all year round.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:groups: Groups up to 160 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The venue has few fixed furniture, and can thus cater for all kinds of needs. Restaurant services are of the highest quality in both food and wine, and incorporate everything from breakfasts to suppers.

item.title: Katajanokka Studio Apartment
item.description: A unique studio apartment of 40 m2 / 3,75 m high in Katajanokka is for rent for 1-2 persons, preferably on a weekly basis. The apartment is located on the 5th Floor. The unique original elevator, with faceted glass, is the original one. A joy to ride in with its link to the past, when artisanship, beauty and functionality went hand in hand. The apartment was renovated in 2005/2009. These include the ceiling, hand-painted walls and hand-carved original doors and wooden floor as well as . The original 1903 hallway paintings have been fully restored. Katajanokka, home of many embassies, has some of the finest examples of art nouveau architecture in the world. Satamakatu 5 was designed by Selim A. Lindqvist in 1903. The main market place in front of the Presidential Castle is 2 minutes walking distance away. There are guided cruises to the beautiful archipelago departing from the harbour of the Market Place.
item.matko:admission: 550e / week Contact beforehand preferably by mail. Rental agreement will be made with every customer.
item.matko:services: Facilities: Broadband WLAN Internet connection. Widescreen 32" TV. DVD-player. Radio. C-casette player. Facilities outdoors: In the neighbouring house there is a food store open every day. There are several restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood. Connection: From the city center to Munkkiniemi by tram number 4 which runs until 01.40 AM. Although Katajanokka stands on it's own peninsula the city centre is only 10 minutes away by foot. View: Overlooking Katajanokka Park (see picture). Breathtaking views the Uspenski Cathedral and the Presidential Castle.
item.matko:ingress: Studio Apartment in Katajanokka for rent.

item.title: Katri/n boutique
item.description: Katri/n is known for elegance and beauty, enhancing femininity with a skillful play of fabric. Refined drapings have quickly become a signature feature of the label. The designer behind katri/n is Katri Niskanen, winner of the first Finnish Project Runway competition in 2009.

item.title: Kattilahalli
item.description: A historic steam-electric power plant has been converted into a modern event centre. The over century-old building designed by S.A. Lindqvist has unique architectural value and is officially protected by the National Board of Antiquities. It is located in the dynamic new district of Kalasatama with excellent transportation connections to the city centre. The former boiler hall of the power plant covers an area of approximately 1,600 square meters, allowing it to accommodate large exhibitions, meetings, banquets and other events of up to 1000 guests.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 17 km

item.title: Kaunis Veera
item.description: High-quality brand clothing, primarily new clothes but also vintage finds.

item.title: Kaurila sauna
item.description: The woodheated Kaurila log sauna is situated in the old part of Meilahti in Helsinki.
item.matko:location: 5km to city centre, bus 24 or tram 4
item.matko:services: You can bring your own food and bewerages.Towels and seat covers are available for guests. It is also possible to buy handmade sauna products at Kaurila.

item.title: Kellari Yökerho
item.description: Night club in eastern Helsinki.

item.title: Kellariteatteri
item.description: Helsingin Kellariteatteri (The Helsinki Cellar Theatre) is a traditional Finnish youth amateur theatre. Founded in 1956, we still operate at the original location, a basement facility formerly used to store firewood - hence our name. Our motto is to learn though participating. The theatre is run on a non-commercial basis. We produce approximately ten plays per year. Our members are chosen through auditions - new members join every year to maintain Kellariteatteri as a jolly bunch of young theater enthusiasts.

item.title: Keltainen Jäänsärkijä
item.description: Sells, buys and exchanges, CD's, vinyls and music DVD's. Over 10 000 titles.

item.title: KIILA Food & Bar
item.description: KIILA Food & Bar is located in the heart of Helsinki and it is open every day from dawn till dusk. The restaurant serves breakfast, Sunday brunch, lunch and dinners with a great view.

item.title: Kindergarten Museum
item.description: The Kindergarten Museum, maintained by the Ebeneser Foundation, is located in the Sörnäinen district of Helsinki. In the museum, you will discover a century of activity in the Ebeneser Kindergarten. There is room to play and build in the kindergarten's large hall. The museum contains things to discover and do for children and adults alike.
item.matko:open: Open on Wednesdays from 12-18. Groups by appointment.
item.matko:groups: Groups by appointment

item.title: Kino K-13
item.description: Movie theatre

item.title: Kirpilä Art Collection
item.description: Kirpilä Art Collection comprises Finnish art from the end of the 19th century to the 1970's. It is named after Dr. Juhani Kirpilä (1931-1988), who donated his home and art collection to the Finnish Cultural Foundation.

item.title: Kitch Eat & Drink
item.description: A bistro-style restaurant that operates according to the principles of sustainable development, favoring organic, fair trade and recycled products.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-14 and 16-22 Wed-Fri 11-14 and 16-23 Sat 12-23 The kitchen closes 1,5 h before the closing. Lunch on weekdays 11-14.

item.title: Kivikko Ski Hall
item.description: The Kivikko Ski Hall is located only 15 min away from the Helsinki city centre and the Helsinki-Vantaa airport. The basic route along the ski tracks is ca 850 metres and the extra track is 200 metres. The ski runs are are 6-8 metre wide. In the ski hall there are many different services: a café, a gym, a sports park for children and the Winter World, that offer other winter activities and experiences.
item.matko:location: In Kivikko district, 12 km and 20 min from Central Railway Station. Bus 94 B from Kontula Metro Station. 15 minutes away both from the Helsinki Airport and the city center.
item.matko:open: Mon-Sun 8-21, the ski hall closes at 22
item.matko:admission: Adult €14; pensioners, students, youth (12 - 18-yo), unemployed €12; kids (7 - 11-yo) €10
item.matko:disabled: Accessible WC, elevator.
item.matko:services: Winter World offers snowy antics in any weather. No ski rental so far. The ski hall also includes a children´s sports park and gym.

item.title: Klaus K Hotel
item.description: Klaus K is a personal contemporary hotel inspired by the emotional contrast of Finland's national epic, its nature and concept. All 171 rooms including 2 suites, are provided with state-of-the-art equipment ranging from custom made beds and mattresses to laptop size safe to oversized robe and towels to LCD television to high speed internet - wireless and wired. Rake Sali Ball Room, in connection with the Klaus K Hotel, is perfect for example for seminars, conferences and celebrations with all banquet services provided by Klaus K Hotel.
item.matko:location: Right in the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Disabled facilities
item.matko:groups: The hotel welcomes groups and is happy to tailor its services to fit group needs
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 171 rooms in different room categories: 76 x Passion / Mystical: 20m2 saakka 49 x Desire: 20-25 m2 15 x Envy: 30-24 m2 11 x Sky Studio 20-30 m2 7 x Sky Studio with Balcony 24-30 m2 10 x Sky Loft 30-35 m2 2 x Sky Suites 50m2
item.matko:restaurantinfo: LIVINGROOM private events for up to 540 persons; Toscanini 72 seats, private events for up to 120 persons; Bar/Club Ahjo for 350 persons.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Klubi is a meeting space with a sauna, in connection with the Helsinki Day Spa. Wintti is a unique meeting space for up to 12 persons (seated) on the top floor of the Rake Building. The long board room table is surrounded by two spacious seating areas.

item.title: Kledju
item.description: Kledju is a Helsinki based secondhand and vintage store that sells secondhand clothes with 90's and 80's touch for women. The purpose of Kledju is to be an option for big global fast fashion chains, offering the same trends straight from the catwalk, but in an ethical and fun way. Their first Fall Winter 2014 collection consists of garments collected mostly around Finland. They also buy items from private people and from abroad with the aim to constantly broaden their network of wholesale traders.

item.title: Klockrike Theatre / Diana-stage
item.description: The theatre was founded (1994) on three basic ideas: to develop and deepen the actor's expression, to create the best possible space for each text and to choose texts we find important in the moment without being trendy. Klockriketeatern has made itself known for a stylized and humoristic touch and a core of credibility in the actor's expression.

item.title: Kluuvi Shopping Centre
item.description: Located in the centre of Helsinki, Shopping Centre Kluuvi focuses on international brand selection and current quality domestic concepts. The fashion selection includes a variety of well-known brands such as Fred Perry, Tiger of Sweden and Superdry, Sandwich and Gaastra. There are also multibrand stores such as The Brand New Maranello and Showroom8, which sells the popular clothing line, Desigual. The hungry shoppers will find comfort in the diversity of restaurants at Kluuvi. The basement level provides delicious locally produced food and wine in Armas restaurant. Hanko Sushi in the second floor is a popular for its fresh sushi lunch. Belge in two floors is focused in Belgian food and beers. Kluuvi provides also high quality cafes and a tearoom as well as fast food, which are served in Subway and McDonalds. Daily groceries can be bought from the Alepa in the basement. The shopping center has a wireless network available to customers without a charge. A giant sports and leisure equipment store XXL was opened in November 2014 in Kluuvi.
item.matko:open: The shopping center is open Mon-Fri 10am-9pm, Sat 10am-6pm, Sun 12-5pm. Opening hours may vary depending on store. Specific opening hours for each store are available at www.kluuvi.fi.

item.title: Kokomo Tikibar & Room
item.description: Aloha! Kokomo Tikibar & Room is the first Tiki-restaurant in Finland. Idea of Tiki is based on relaxed living and enjoying. Kokomo is located in a busy Uudenmaankatu right next to the center of Helsinki. Kokomo is a restaurant, a coctail bar and a club. Decoration of Kokomo is atmospheric and Tiki style. In Kokomo you could enjoy rich and multiple lunch at week days from 11 to 14. At the night time Kokomo offers exotic and delicious a´la carte menu. Menu has got influence from Asian and Hawajian tastes. With the restaurant there is a Coctail bar where you can get multiple and fancy coctails in every opening hours. At weekends Kokomo changes to club trough the night pulse which stays open untill 4am.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-15, Wed-Thu 11-23, Fri 11-04, Sat 15-04, Sun suljettu. Age limit Fri-Sat 20 years.

item.title: KokoTeatteri
item.description: Theatre with plays from drama to contemporary dance performances. BarKoko is open during the performance nights until midnight.
item.matko:groups: Information on group discounts (min.10persons) from the theatre office.

item.title: KOM Theatre
item.description: Performances in Finnish
item.matko:open: Box office at Kapteeninkatu 26, open one hour before performances start, tel. 09-684 1841; Box office open Mon-Fri 10-16.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Adult groups (over 20 persons) 16-20€.
item.matko:services: Café open in interval. KOM-restaurant in connection with the Theatre.

item.title: KOM-restaurant
item.description: The KOM-restaurant is in connection with KOM Theatre and is popular amongst both theatre and culture people as well as locals. During daytime the restaurant serves as a cafe and lunch restaurant with free internet access. In the evenings the retaurant is an a la carte restaurant with a relaxed atmosphere. Programme usually on Monday evenings (sometimes also on Thursdays).

item.title: Konepajan Bruno
item.description: A flea market in the former railway engine workshop of the Finnish State Railways (VR).

item.title: Kongressikoti
item.description: Kongressikoti Ltd., an apartment hotel located in the prestigious Kruununhaka district of Helsinki, the capital city of Finland. The premises have an excellent array of services and choice of transport available within walking distance.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:services: Rooms includes TV, washbasin and refrigerator. Extra beds upon request.

item.title: Kontoret
item.description: Kontoret (Office) offers small meeting rooms (1-8 persons) and tools to efficiently hold meetings and work, alone or in teams. By creating an account, for FREE, you receive your own access code. We charge for the exact time you use.
item.matko:location: From Train station (600m) and Kamppi (900m) walking distance to Kontoret. The trams 10, 3B, 6 and 6X and buses 20 and 24 stops at Erottaja.
item.matko:services: Fast Wi-Fi, coffee and printing included in the prize. Discount of 20% for parking in Qpark Erottaja. Taxistop Erottaja just outside the front door.

item.title: Kontula Ice Rink
item.description: Kontula Ice Rink is located in the Eastern Helsinki. The kiosk is open according to the opening hours of the rink.

item.title: Kontula skateboard hall
item.description: Finland's largest indoor skating hall. ca. 2000 m2 of space where people can skateboard.

item.title: Korea House
item.description: Korea House is the first and only Korean restaurant in Finland. The restaurant serves you tasteful and traditional Korean food in a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere.

item.title: Korjaamo bar & kitchen
item.description: Breakfast and lunch is served on weekdays combining traditional home cooking with mediterranean and Asian influences. Brunch is served on weekends. The brunch includes a selection of salads and warm foods as well as cakes and desserts. Bar & kitchen serves bistro style food also in the evenings.

item.title: Korjaamo Café
item.description: Take a break and have a lunch or a coffee in a unique, tranquil environment guarded by old trams. If the weather is nice, you can also enjoy Korjaamo's summer garden, which is a green oasis in the middle of the city (open from June to August). Lunch is served on weekdays 11 am to 3 pm and options include a salad buffet and soup + toast. As a desert you could choose a special coffee or tea with something sweet from our selection of bakery. Korjaamo also serves brunch on Saturdays and Sundays.

item.title: Korjaamo Culture Factory
item.description: Korjaamo Culture Factory is one of the largest arts centres in the Nordic countries, which produces arts events accross various fields including music, theatre, fine arts and talks. Newness, open-mindedness and interaction with audiences are top values in Korjaamo's programme. Every August, Korjaamo hosts Stage - Helsinki Theatre Festival, which showcases a top-notch selection of domestic and foreign theatre pieces. Korjaamo has its own gallery, Korjaamo Galleria, which produces approximately 20 exhibitions a year. During summer, Korjaamo's garden is packed with free programme, including open-air theatre, gigs and DJ's. Korjamo has a bar and a café that is open every day.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:services: Wine Bar/café, terrace.

item.title: Koskenranta Event Centre & Restaurant
item.description: The Koskenranta Event Centre is located by the Old Town Rapids, close to the main transportation infrastructure. The red wooden building used to serve as the cold flow laboratory of energy company Fortum but has now been fully renovated inside and out. The building's largest hall can accommodate up to 1200 guests for cocktail events, exhibitions and production launches, for example, and 1000 guests for banquets and meetings. The concept behind the large and light space is that it can be furnished individually for each event according to the customer's wishes. There are also two meeting rooms for 10 to 30 people. A large sauna, suite and free parking add to the appeal of the new venue.
item.matko:location: City centre 8 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The complex includes a 100/150-seat restaurant with a separate 200-seat terrace.

item.title: Kosmos
item.description: A classic in Helsinki's restaurant scene, Kosmos is frequented by a diverse clientele. The elegant dining room décor dates back to the 1920s and 1930s. Vorschmack and fried Baltic herring are among the best-known delicacies of the restaurant's Finnish-international cuisine.

item.title: Kotiharju Sauna
item.description: Kotiharjun Sauna is the last genuine wood-heated public sauna in Helsinki and has welcomed sauna-goers since 1928. Hardy washing ladies are still on hand to scrub the living daylights out of you, should you wish, and massages and other treatments are also available.
item.matko:location: In Kallio
item.matko:open: Tue-Sun 14-20 (doors close as indicated but the saunas are in use until 21.30).
item.matko:admission: Adults 12/10/8,50/7/6€. Washing service 9 €, available Tue & Fri-Sat 16-19.
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs, lots of steps.

item.title: Kotihotelli Oy
item.description: Kotihotelli can offer homelike accommodation for longer or shorter periods of stay. The flats are situated in the city of Helsinki, some in the heart of the city, others further from the city centre.
item.matko:location: In the city centre and in the metropolitan area, airport 18 km
item.matko:admission: 55-120 e/night. The main rental period is seven days. The flats can be rented even for shorter periods of time, however advance bookings cannot be taken nor confirm the shorter stays.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: From studios to larger flats
item.matko:additionalinfo: TV set, VCR, stereo, washing machine and other smaller appliances, as well as linen, all kitchen utensils and crockery. There is a telephone line for local calls (in the Helsinki area, which also includes Espoo, Vantaa and other nearby cities).

item.title: Kotimaailma Apartments
item.description: Kotimaailma offers its customers an excellent alternative to a hotel. Our furnished apartments are always located within walking distance of city center services. Very well decorated and equipped, our studio, two room and three room apartments are available in the central area of Helsinki, Turku, Tampere, Oulu, Raahe, Rovaniemi, Lappeenranta and Porvoo. The period of residence may vary from one day to as much as 36 months. In the case of extended stays the price may always be negotiated on a case-specific basis (periods of longer than 2 weeks). Our prices always include value added tax, contents insurance, sheets and other bedding, final cleaning, water and electricity charges plus all the equipment to be found in every Kotimaailma apartment. Our apartments are fully equipped, which means customers only need to bring clothes and toiletries with them. Check-in weekdays 10am-5pm or as agreed.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Kuja Bar & Bistro
item.description: Located just around the corner from the vibrant Hakaniemi square, Kuja's kitchen relies heavily on fresh ingredients, offering tastes of both traditional French and American bistro cuisines. Legendary hamburgers!

item.title: Kulmakahvio - Bear Park Kulma
item.description: Kulmakahvio is a small gay cafe in Karhupuisto, Kallio.
item.matko:location: Kulmakahvio cafe is on the corner of Agricolankatu and Kaarlenkatu in Kallio
item.matko:services: Coffee, tea, soda, soft drinks and bakery are offered.

item.title: Kulosaari Casino
item.description: Built in 1915, the Kulosaari Casino is a traditional, high standard restaurant with the most beautiful sea view in Helsinki. Acclaimed for its cuisine and unique atmosphere, it is one of the city's most popular places for festive occasions - for groups both large and small. The spacious dining room offers a splendid view of the Gulf of Finland. Function rooms are available for parties of different sizes. Around the year, the Kulosaari Casino is a popular setting for festivities. At the end of the summer, the beautiful sea view makes the Kulosaari Casino one of the most popular locations for crayfish parties. The core of the restaurant is the stylish Merisali dining room. Its two wings, the Wellamo and the Kippari can be turned into function rooms. The separate Hopeasalmi function room is suitable for groups of 30 to 80 people. The summer restaurant (Sun Marine) can be used either individually or together with the rest of the Casino.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:groups: Groups max 350 people

item.title: Kulosaari Church
item.matko:address: Kulosaarentie 40, entry Kyösti Kallion tie 1 a

item.title: Kulttuurisauna
item.description: Architect Tuomas Toivonen´s and Nene Tsuboi´s ecological design -sauna in the shadow of sculptural Merihaka district. Wood pellet heated saunas for men and women. Seat covers included in admission, towels can be rented. Open all year round, ice swimming in winter.
item.matko:groups: No own drinks allowed, no reservations, limited entry for groups.

item.title: Kumpula Outdoor Swimming Pool
item.description: Kumpula outdoor swimming pool was built for the Olympics 1952 and it is the third oldest outdoor swimming pool with tracks. It was recently renovated maintaining the original outfit. The pools: pool 25 m, children's pool, wading pool, diving pool.
item.matko:services: Weight lifting space, chess area, basketball court, volleyball court, children's play area, jumping castle, café, parking lot. Café tel. +358-(0)9-877 6558. Swimsuit/towels for rent 3 €, seat cover/soap 0,50€.

item.title: Kunsthalle Helsinki
item.description: Each year, the Kunsthalle Helsinki hosts 8-10 major exhibitions as well as a similar number of studio shows, in addition to events, concerts and a cross-disciplinary programme. The focus of the exhibitions is on contemporary art but the exhibition programme also includes design and architecture. Kunsthalle Helsinki does not have a collection of its own, but serves as a venue for changing exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue, Thu-Fri 11-18, Wed 11-20, Sat-Sun 11-17.
item.matko:admission: 10/7/0€. Free admission on every month's first Wednesday from 18-20 (when exhibitions are open).
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel.+358 (0)45 7731 4316, groups max.25pers.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Exhibition space appr. 600 m2, restaurant 120 m2
item.matko:services: Museum shop. Restaurant Farang, is a modern Asian restaurant, situated in the Kunsthalle Helsinki building.

item.title: Kupla Vintage
item.description: Vintage store with fashion and beauty from the past decades. Possibility to repair and have clothes made for you. In addition Kupla Vintage offers makeup help.

item.title: Kupla-Lookout tower
item.description: This sculptural wooden structure is situated in Korkeasaari island and was designed by architect Ville Hara as a graduation project (2002).

item.title: Kuudes Linja
item.description: An underground live club with cult status.
item.matko:services: Opening hours vary, please see website. Age limit 18 years, Fri-Sat 20 years.

item.title: KuuKuu
item.description: KuuKuu opened in 1990 and has been the livingroom of many locals and artists ever since. Serving classic dishes for every taste KuuKuu is both a restaurant and a bar with 36 seats for diners and 18 seats in the bar. The outdoor terrace is open in the summertime and has places for 40 people. KuuKuu also hosts two cabinets (for 16 and 10 persons). KuuKuu was chosen as HelsinkiMenu restaurant of the year in 2013.

item.title: Kuurna
item.description: Kuurna is a small and cozy restaurant in the Kruununhaka neighbourhood. The menu changes every two weeks and there are also a few daily specialities. All the ingredients are carefully chosen and the menu consists of mostly Finnish classics with a modern twist. Kuurna offers two seatings each weekday evening: the first from 6pm until 8pm and the latter one starting at 8.30pm. On Saturdays there is an earlier seating from 4pm till 6pm.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri seatings from 6pm to 8pm and at 8.30pm. On Saturdays from 4pm to 6pm, from 6pm to 8pm and at 8.30pm.

item.title: Kuutio Auditorium
item.description: The Kuutio auditorium can accommodate 110 persons. The auditorium is known for its good acoustics and comfortable seats. A few smaller rooms can be arranged for workshops and the lobby can be used for exhibition purposes.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lunch restaurant 110 seats. Meals and refreshments varying from breakfasts to cocktail parties can be arranged by the restaurant next to the auditorium.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer
item.matko:additionalinfo: The auditorium is equipped with the state-of-the-art technology. Best Western Hotel Haaga is located within walking distance. Free parking. Good traffic connections to the city centre.

item.title: Kämp Private Dining
item.description: Private dining experience at Kämp offers our guests the opportunity to enjoy an experience that exceeds all expectations. Our three luxuriously appointed private dining rooms named in honour of famous Finnish artists and writers - Helene Schjerfbeck, J.L. Runeberg and Eino Leino - can accommodate eight, 12 and 20 people respectively, with diners enjoying the attentive, individual service for which we are renowned. It is also possible to arrange private events in the new Upper Lounge, and enjoy the private dining services there.
item.matko:location: Located in the centre of Helsinki circa 35 minutes to the Helsinki-Vantaa Airport by taxi.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: In keeping with Kämp's commitment to excellence, guests can enjoy bespoke a la carte menus created to exacting standards with the finest quality ingredients. Dishes draw on everything from Yume's Asian delicacies to time-honoured classics from our Brasserie - and everything in between. Whether it's embracing a new day with a finely crafted breakfast, taking a sumptuous lunch with associates, or relaxing with an indulgent dinner to delight the senses, the only limit is your imagination.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: J.L. RUNEBERG The venue has views to the Esplanade Park from its big windows and balcony access. Floor space: 32m2 - Max capacity: 12 people EINO LEINO The venue has views to the Esplanade Park from its big windows. Floor space: 36m2 - Max capacity: 20 people HELENE SCHJERFBECK The venue has views to the Esplanade Park from its big windows. Floor space: 20m2 - Max capacity: 8 people Upper Lounge The venue has views to the Esplanade Park from its big windows and is perfect for cocktail events. Floor space: 91m2

item.title: Kämp Spa
item.description: Kämp Spa is an oasis of ultimate relaxation and rejuvenation. Kämp Spa offers a range of holistic spa treatments based on the most exquisite berries and plants of the Nordic nature.
item.matko:location: Kämp Spa is located on the 8th floor of the historical Hotel Kämp and the modern Hotel Glo Kluuvi.
item.matko:groups: The groups should book Spa treatments or Spa packages in advance.
item.matko:services: Day and Medical Spa treatments. Gym and sauna facilities.

item.title: Käpylä Ice Rink
item.description: Ice rinks for skating with sticks or without sticks.

item.title: Käsityöläisten OMA Kauppa - Artisans OWN Shop
item.description: From historical Bock House you can find this boutique that sells finnish handicrafts by the slogan "Originals Made by artisans".

item.title: La Famiglia
item.description: La Famiglia is a relaxed, easy-going, cosy and unpretentious Italian-American restaurant. In addition to à la carte dishes, La Famiglia's rustic Italian milieu offers three different menus: America, Italy and Finlandia. There is also a bar for relaxing aperitifs before dining and an area for the little ones to play in and watch videos.
item.matko:groups: La Famiglia's dining room and the La Famiglia Banquet facility downstairs, seating 100, provide an excellent setting for a diversity of functions.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: La Famiglia's dining room and the La Famiglia Banquet facility downstairs, seating 100, provide an excellent setting for a diversity of functions.

item.title: La Torrefazione
item.description: Coffee shops and roastery. Lunch possibility.

item.title: Laakso Hippodrome
item.description: Riding stadium

item.title: Lady Moon
item.description: Lady Moon is an intimate nightclub in central Helsinki, located right across the street opposite to the central Railway station. Nightclub Lady Moon is one of the few clubs in Helsinki that draws a big crowd of party people seven nights a week.

item.title: Laituri
item.description: Helsinki City Planning Department's information and exhibition space. Open place where plans, changes and development projects can be examined.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, in the old bus station building in Kamppi

item.title: Lappish Restaurant Saaga
item.description: The Saaga Restaurant brings you the magic of Lapland in good food and a warm atmosphere - a piece of the rugged and beautiful Lappish countryside, a kitchen full of Lappish flavours and a restaurant full of the exotic northland. Saaga serves both traditional and more modern Lappish delicacies. The à la carte includes game, reindeer and fish from Lapland together with mushroom and berries. The restaurant can seat a total of 120 guests on two floors. The private room Shaman has seats for 10 clients and the ground floor dining room can accommodate private parties of 50. The work of artists and craftsmen from Lapland features strongly in the design of the restaurant, both in the broad strokes of the space and in the detail.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min (20 km)
item.matko:disabled: No Inva-WC. Toilets not possible to acces with wheelchair (ladies downstairs, gentlemen upstairs). Stairs to the 2nd floor, no lift.
item.matko:groups: The restaurant can seat a total of 120 guests on two floors. The private room Shaman has seats for 10 clients and the ground floor dining room can accommodate private parties of between 30 and 50. Lunch and dinner can be arranged for groups, private parties, meetings, cocktail parties.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Lappish & Finnish restaurant, 120 seats in 2 floors; downstairs dining room for 50 persons, upstairs for 60 persons and the private room Shaman for 10 persons, à la carte, dinners, lunches for groups, private parties, meetings, cocktail parties, food prepared using only Finnish ingredients.

item.title: Lapponia Jewelry
item.description: Founded in Finland in 1960, Lapponia Jewelry has always followed its bold intuition. Björn Weckström, who designed the first collection, established a new sculpture-like jewelry, drawing his inspiration from the shape and matte surface of gold nuggets from Finnish Lapland. Lapponia's trademark, unique motifs and genuine design, was born. Weckström was also first to combine silver and acrylic in jewelry designs. At first this combination was considered strange, but that soon changed when in 1975 John Lennon appeared in the Dick Cavett show with Yoko Ono who was wearing Weckström's Petrified lake acrylic ring. TV camera was taking several close-up shots of the ring in Yoko Ono's finger and soon everyone was interested in acrylic jewelry. Today, Lapponia employs an international team of jewelry designers. Traditional Finnish jewelry manufacturer Kalevala Koru acquired Lapponia Jewelry in August 2005.

item.title: Lasikammari
item.description: Buys and sells Iittala glass since 50 years. Finnish glass and tableware for table settings
item.matko:location: In Kruununhaka
item.matko:open: Tue-Thu 12-17, Mon, Fri, Sat 12-14, at other times by appointment

item.title: Lasipalatsi
item.description: Functionalist building known as the Glass Palace was designed by architect Viljo Revell in the 1930s and has well-preserved modernist interior.
item.matko:location: City centre
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs (1st floor), lift.
item.matko:services: Restaurants, cafées, shops., tel. 09-3108 5000.

item.title: Lasipalatsi gallery
item.description: Art gallery maintained by Lasipalatsi Media Centre right in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: Lasipalatsin Bio Rex
item.description: Nowadays the old and famous movie theater Bio Rex can be rented for private occasions. Bio Rex offers an unique space for different kinds of functions and parties. In our concept, we combine all the important things: great milieu and ambience, high class restaurant services and diverse technical capability.
item.matko:location: City centre 0 min, airport 30 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Lasipalatsi organizes the renting and restaurant services of Lasipalatsin Bio Rex.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The foyer area is about 300m2.

item.title: Lassila Ice Rink
item.description: Ice rink
item.matko:services: Café / Pohjois-Haagan Urheilijat, tel. +2358 (0)9 562 2288

item.title: Laterna Magica
item.description: Art gallery/bookshop. A meeting place for friends of books and photos.
item.matko:services: Second-hand bookshop, book gallery.

item.title: Lavaklubi
item.description: Finnish National Theatre´s bar and club where audience meets artists. Indie bands, jazz, movies, rants etc. in bohemian atmosphere.
item.matko:open: Sun-Mon closed, Tue-Thu 17-24, Fri-Sat 17-02. Opening hours may vary.

item.title: LeBonk
item.description: LeBonk is a club that spans three floors, plus Helsinki's most fashionable roof terrace. The interior of this designer nightclub was created by the artist Alvar Gullichsen - best known for his Bonk Art, which is displayed on two floors of the club.
item.matko:open: Sun-Tue closed, Wed-Thu 19-02 (04), Fri 21-04, Sat 19-04. Age limit to music events 18 years, on Fridays 22 years, on Saturdays 24 years.

item.title: Lepakkomies
item.description: Rock club in two floors. Upstairs cozy bar and billiard, downstairs live gigs four nights a week. Mainly punk, heavy, hip hop and indie rock bands.

item.title: LéSPACE
item.description: LéSPACE is a theatre, bar and an event space. All kinds of events are possible - from meetings to parties of up to 180 people.
item.matko:location: To Helsinki Center 15 min, Pasila 5 min, to the airport 25 min.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: LéSPACE is a transformative, easy place to hold any kind of an event. Split across two floors and into various different rooms, LéSPACE can accommodate up to 180 people at a time. A fully licensed bar offers convenience when organising an event, and food catering is possible as well. We happily cater both private and corporate occasions.

item.title: Levykauppa Äx
item.description: Shops also in Fredrikinkatu and Vaasankatu. www.recordshopx.com

item.title: Liberty Or Death
item.description: Liberty Or Death is an innovative cocktail bar. In the bar you can enjoy high quality beverage products and a more personalized service. The monthly changing cocktail menu includes twisted classics and new trends from around the world.
item.matko:location: Helsinki Design District.

item.title: Library 10
item.description: Located at the Main Post Office, the library combines services of the Pasila Music Station and the Cable Book Library. The library has the most diverse music collection in Helsinki. The Library 10 offers also many new services for varied work. At the Studio premises you can even make your own music video or play library's instruments. Wireless network and accessories on loan such as scanners and headphones enable a customer to build a workplace according to his lights. The stage functions as a stage for culture performances for bands and as well as for other performers. Lending and returning material is carried out by automatons.
item.matko:address: Elielinaukio 2 G, Main Post Office Building
item.matko:location: Entrance: the wing situated on the Railway Station side, 2nd floor

item.title: Liike
item.description: Liike presents collections from Finnish designers and offers them sales facilities. Featuring currently i.a. vainio.seitsonen, Tikit, Jaana Haaksiluoto, Tyra Therman and Nomen Nescio. Accessories, shoes and other interesting design from new designers.

item.title: Linnanmäki Amusement Park
item.description: Linnanmäki has entertained families since 1950. The amusement park has an enormous selection of fun rides, from ultra scary to more easy-going. The special wooden rollercoaster is over 50-years-old and remains the most popular ride. Linnanmäki also has many arcade halls with the latest games as well as an outdoor stage presenting entertaining performances. Supporting child welfare workover 60 years.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:open: Summer season 20.4.-18.10.2015. Opening hours change daily, please see http://www.linnanmaki.fi/en/opening-hours.
item.matko:admission: Free entrance. Wristbands from online shop 45/37€, from the park 39/38/30/28€.
item.matko:disabled: Linnanmäki is otherwise fully accessible, but the terrain very hilly and therefore disabled guests will need an assistant. The park personnel will help where possible. An assistant to a paying customer of limited mobility can accompany his/her client for free with a special permit which can be picked up on the visiting day from the Juhlatori ticket sales and Main Information Point. Disabled toilets are located all over the park.
item.matko:groups: Companies and groups, tel. +358 (0)10 5722 220 , e-mail:myyntipalvelu@linnanmaki.fi (Mon-Fri 9-16). Class trips, tel.+358 (0)10 5722 224, e-mail:luokkaretket@linnanmaki.fi

item.title: Linnanmäki, Meeting premises
item.description: Linnanmäki offers premises for meetings, conferences and exhibitions all year round. The amusement park environment is a colourful setting for a memorable work day, for serious discussion and relaxed conversation alike. During breaks or to crown a fruitful meeting, participants can enjoy amusement park rides, games and delicacies. Linnanmäki can be reserved for private occasions, such as personnel or customer events for up to 7,000 people. The package includes the unique environment, amusement park rides, games, restaurants and other forms of entertainment. The Carnival of Light and Ice Pearl WinterFest bring fun and excitement into the peaks of autumn and winter.
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Linnanmäki restaurants are always available upon order. They offer high-quality catering for meetings, breakfast, light snacks, rich buffet meals, dinners, cocktail events and coffee servings.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Every amusement park visitor helps children. The Children's Day Foundation collects funds for child welfare work, and maintains and develops the Linnanmäki amusement park.

item.title: Lokal
item.description: We are a concept store and home to independent Finnish art, design and craft. Besides the unique art pieces in the gallery space, we offer a wide array of selected products from some of the leading names in ceramics, furniture, art prints, kitchen ware and home textiles. We believe in the value of handmade items, craftsmanship and small scale production. The coffee roasted by Helsingin Kahvipaahtimo is always brewing and the themed group exhibitions change every month.

item.title: London Pub
item.description: Pub
item.matko:services: Live music, jam session every Monday

item.title: Lonna
item.description: Lonna is an island next to the Suomenlinna Sea Fortress. It's open during the summer seaso offering concerts, restaurant and café.

item.title: Louis Vuitton
item.description: The French fashion house, established in 1854, is one of the most recognized luxury brands in the world. Its products include leather goods, handbags, trunks, shoes, ready-to-wear, watches, jewelry and accessories.

item.title: Luckan
item.description: Information Centre
item.matko:services: Exhibitions, films

item.title: Lume Media Centre, University of Art and Design Helsinki
item.description: Lume is the audio-visual R&D centre of the University of Art and Design Helsinki. Its premises are available for seminars, conferences, meetings, galas, festivals, performances and trade fairs. Lume also serves as a venue for film, TV, new media and theatre productions, all under the same roof. Material filmed in the studios can be edited and mixed and the premiere celebrated in the Sampo Hall, which is also a full-sized cinema.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Catering possible in the upper foyer; seated dinners for 60, buffets for 400. Free catering, no license for spirits.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Gallery space: 185 m2, 37 metres x 5 metres, height 5.3 metres
item.matko:additionalinfo: TV-studio (tv equipment, 4 cameras), film studio (500 m2, includes lifting equipment). Stage, film and tv studio, plus exhibition space (height 11 metres) can be combined. Total space 1346 m2 for around 1500 people.

item.title: Lumi Supermarket - Flagship boutique
item.description: The renowned Finnish designer handbag brand Lumi Accessories offers handbags and accessories with Nordic simplicity and functionality.

item.title: Lumiparkki Snow Park
item.description: Lumiparkki Snow Park will be opened in Helsinki's Kivikko-suburb once there is enough snow. The Snow Park has trails for all levels of skiers. The park has rails, boxes, jumps and an area for general trickery and fooling around. The Snow Park is a diverse place, having challenges even for the most experienced skiers. There are also suitable routes for beginners in downhill skiing or snowboarding.

item.title: Luomupuoti Satumarja
item.description: Organic foodstuffs - vegetables, fruits, juices, dried fruits etc.

item.title: Luxbag
item.description: Luxbag represents iconic and cutting-edge fashion labels such as Céline, Balenciaga, Givenchy, Lanvin, Fendi, Loewe, Valextra and offers selection of bags, accessories, womens ready-to-wear and shoes from their collections.

item.title: m/aux Kathrina
item.description: Kathrina is an old wooden vessel built in 1949 that can be chartered for cruises in Helsinki 3.9.-16.9.2013.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Macu
item.description: Macu is a stylishly and modernly furnished restaurant situated on the first floor of Crowne Plaza hotel. Macu offers delicious dishes in a cozy environment. Macu has also a big selection of quality wines.
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-150 people

item.title: Made in Kallio
item.description: Made in Kallio is a heart for local design, goodies and happenings. There is a bubbly design shop, café and co-working space under the same roof.
item.matko:services: Cafe & boutique

item.title: MadeBy Helsinki
item.description: The Bock House was originally built in the 1700s and modified according to Engel's design in 1816-1818, after which it served as the Town Hall. Nowadays the premises host a new handicraft and arts & design shop by the collective Made by Helsinki. One of the 13 collective members is always present when the shop is open.

item.title: Mai Niemi Finnish Fairytale Shop
item.description: Mai Niemi Finnish Fairytale represents new, unique Finnish and Nordic design, modern folk fashion, which is a combination of primordial experience, practical well-being and closeness to nature. The product range includes knitwear, ethnic accessories and organic textile jewelry. All products are handmade in Finland using natural and ecological materials. Fashion designer Mai Niemi finds inspiration in the Finnish nature and culture, in particular Kalevala and fenno-ugric origins. Her designs are modern, timeless, ergonomic and a combination of art, fashion, fantasy and well-being. Finnish Fairytale Shop is located in the prestigious historical Bock's House in Helsinki's Senate Square.

item.title: Main Guard Post
item.description: The Main Guard Post was designed by C.L. Engel and it was completed in 1843. Its functions included guarding the Imperial Palace, now the Presidential Palace. Nowadays it is used by the Helsinki garnison.

item.title: Maisonet
item.description: French ceramics, textiles and other home accessories.

item.title: Make Your Mark Gallery
item.description: Graffiti, Street Art and Photography.

item.title: Malmitalo
item.description: Malmitalo is the cultural centre for the northern parts of Helsinki. Completed in 1994 it offers events, theatre presentations, concerts, exhibitions and films for children and adults. The building also has conference facilities for hire.
item.matko:location: City centre 13 km, airport 11 km. In Malmi, local trains K or I to Malmi
item.matko:additionalinfo: More information: http://kulttuuri.hel.fi/malmitalo
item.matko:services: Library, Ticket Sales Point by Lippupalvelu

item.title: Mann´s street
item.description: Gaybar. Karaoke Mon-Sun from 20.00 onwards. Dancing every first Saturday of the month.

item.title: Mannerheim Museum
item.description: Mannerheim Museum is the home of Baron G. Mannerheim, Marshal of Finland. The museum shows his medals and decorations, uniforms and documents that relate events from his life and from the contemporary Finnish history. Guided tour incl. in entrance fee during opening hours (last tour at 15.00).
item.matko:location: In Kaivopuisto, trams 3T/3B
item.matko:disabled: Difficult for wheelchairs (thresholds, exhibits on two floors), no lift, assistant needed, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Guides are recommended to be booked in advance for groups as well as for groups or private individuals, who wish to begin a tour at a specific time. The maximum size of a group is 60 persons. Guide bookings tel. +358 (0)9 635 443. Guided tours available in Finnish, Swedish, English and by appointment in German, French, Spanish and Russian.
item.matko:services: Small museum shop, books, cards and posters for sale. Parking outside the Museum.

item.title: Maranello
item.description: A concept store that offers todays fashion for youthful adults.

item.title: Marian Helmi
item.description: Marian Helmi (Mary's Pearl) is a real treasure for all beer lovers. The cozy beer restaurant is located in Kruunuhaka and is popular especially among students. Here you will find a large selection of both Finnish and international beer and cider brands.

item.title: Marimekko
item.description: Marimekko Corporation is a leading Finnish textile and clothing design company that was established in 1951. The company designs, manufactures and markets high-quality clothing, interior decoration textiles, tableware, bags and other accessories under the Marimekko brand, both in Finland and abroad.
item.matko:services: Shops also at several shopping centres, e.g. Kamppi Centre. Factory outlets: Hakaniemi Market Hall, tel.+358-(0)9-753 6549 & Kirvesmiehenkatu 7 (in Herttoniemi), tel. +358 (0)9 758 7244 (open Mon-Fri 10-18, Sat 10-16).

item.title: Marimekko outlet
item.description: Design clothes and textiles. Also a small outlet shop at the Hakaniemi Market Hall in Helsinki city centre.

item.title: Market Square
item.description: Located in the South Harbour at the very beginning of the Esplanade Park, the Market Square is Helsinki's most international and famous market. The booths here sell traditional market foods and treats, as well as handicrafts and souvenirs. There is also a heated café tent where you can comfortably sip steaming hot coffee even on the coldest days in winter.
item.matko:location: Located on the South Harbour at the end of the Esplanade Park.
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 8-16, during summer season also Sundays 10-17.

item.title: Marski Bar & Restaurant
item.description: Marski Bar & Restaurant is a Mediterranian style restaurant and bar, located right in the centre of Helsinki. The bar is a perfect meeting point and is also the perfect place to drop in and relax in between shopping or after a busy day at work.
item.matko:open: Restaurant: Breakfast Mon-Fri 6.30-10, Sat 7-10.30, Sun 8-11. Lunch buffet Mon-Fri 11-13.30. Dinner (à la carte) Mon-Sat 18-23 Sundays on request. Bar: Mon-Thu 11-01, Fri 11-02, Sat 12-02, Sun 18-24.

item.title: Marttiini
item.description: Marttiini is the most famous knife manufacturer in Finland. Marttiini's product selection consists of all kinds of knives for home and outdoor use. Marttiini is known for high quality, and their Lappish knives are also very popular gift items.

item.title: Master Jeweller Tarkkanen
item.description: We produce wedding and engagement rings by traditional methods from high quality materials. Unique jewellery is drawn into sketches in a cooperation between the client and goldsmith.This is then fabricated to tell a story about it´s giver, receiver and maker.

item.title: Maxim
item.description: Movie theatre

item.title: Maxine
item.description: Biggest party with the best view in Helsinki every weekend! Picture tells more than thousand words.
item.matko:location: Keskustaan 0 minuuttia, lentokentälle 25 minuuttia.

item.title: Maya Bar & Grill
item.description: Maya Bar & Grill is the place to go for modern Latin American cuisine. The restaurant is located in downtown next to National Theatre and the Central railway station. Maya Bar & grill´s delicious menu items include salads, tortizas, fajitas, steaks and vegetarian food. Try the Minidillas as starters!

item.title: mbar
item.description: Mbar is an atmospheric bar, terrace & café in the heart of Helsinki. While during the day it is a place to drop by for coffee, lunch, and net access, in the evenings an interesting line-up of djs turn mbar into a lively nighttime venue. In the summer time mbar also has a fabulous terrace on Lasipalatsi plaza.

item.title: Megazone Laser Game
item.description: Megazone laser tag is a fun, futuristic and exciting game that is suitable for all ages. Laser tag is played in a dimly lit, fog-filled, multi-level arena where players are provided with high tech vests and awesome but harmless laser guns. Players then try to score points by deactivating other players' vests and destroying their bases.
item.matko:location: Salmisaari sports center
item.matko:admission: Open rounds 9€/person (25 min) Possible reservations by phone or e-mail.
item.matko:disabled: No access with wheelchairs.

item.title: Meilahti Church
item.description: Meilahti Church was designed in 1954 by architect Markus Tavio. The lamps, altar candelabras and the font was designed by Paavo Tynell and the communion utensils by Birger Gardberg. The swedish speaking parish, St. Thomas, is located in the same property.

item.title: Mekkomania
item.description: Vintage clothes and accessories.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue-Fri 12-18, Sat 11-15, Sun closed.

item.title: Memphis Hesari
item.description: Memphis is a relaxed bar and restaurant and a good meeting point for friends, a place to relax, dine and listen to music or to spend the whole evening.

item.title: Menuetto Business Center
item.description: Menuetto Business Center is located in Munkkivuori, Helsinki. Restaurant Menuetto offers great possibilities for networking and business meetings. The restaurant caters both business and family occasions.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Kokousvieraiden käytettävissä ovat muun muassa 150-paikkainen ravintolasali, useita kabinetteja, 60-paikkainen luentosali sekä kahvila. Tilat ovat käytettävissä myös ilta- ja viikonlopputilaisuuksiin. Lounas tarjoillaan arkisin klo 10.45 -13.30.

item.title: Mereija
item.description: Green clothing and sewing services. Repairs, modifications and tuning of old clothes. Funky sustainably produced souveniers.
item.matko:location: Opposite National Opera

item.title: Messukeskus, Expo & Convention Centre Helsinki
item.description: Messukeskus is one of the leading congress centres in Northern Europe and the largest of its kind in Finland. It is a high-quality, centrally located conference venue, where all of Finland's major conferences and similar events take place. The centre offers 53 fully adaptable meeting rooms and seminar halls, of various sizes, as well as plenty of high-quality exhibition facilities. A hotel with 244 rooms is conveniently located under the same roof.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, parking for disabled near the eastern and northern entrances, easier entry Eastern entrance, no permanent induction loop but can be installed if desired by the customer.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Holiday Inn Helsinki Messukeskus adjacent, 244 rooms
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Terra Nova á la carte restaurant: 80 seats. Combination of Winter Garden cabinet, Buffet Restaurant and Restaurant Piazza is ideal for dinner and cocktail receptions for up to 1000 participants. Numerous restaurants and cafes are open during fairs and events. Large, versatile banqueting facilities.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 7 exhibition halls, gross exhibition area 58 000 m2. Congress wing halls and foyers also suitable for exhibitions. Hall 3 can be divided into 7 meeting rooms a-g (250-450 pax/room). Hall 5 can be divided into 6 separate halls, three of them can be used at the same time, halls a-f 750-1000pax/hall. Hall 6 can be divided into 4 sections a-d (a: 4498m2, b: 4752m2, c: 3654m2, d: 4240m2). Either halls 5A-5C or 5E-5F can be used at the same time.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Hotel accommodation, restaurant services, AV-services, cleaning services, forwarding services, stand planning and construction services, parking for 4 600 cars.

item.title: Metropolia Ammattikorkeakoulu, Hämeentie
item.description: Theatre performances
item.matko:location: tram 6

item.title: Metropolia University of Applied Sciences, Helsinki Conservatory
item.description: konserttisali

item.title: Michel Restaurant & Cocktail Bar
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 7.30 until late, Fri 7.30-03, Sat 10-03, Sun 10-15.

item.title: Midhill Citykäytävä - CLOSED
item.description: Modern American burgers with taste twists from Greece, Korea and Japan. There's also breakfast and brunch available.
item.matko:open: Mon 11-16 (Deli open, Brgr closed) Tue-Thu 11-21 (Deli open, Brgr closed) Fri 11-22 (Deli open, Brgr 16-23) Sat 12-22 (Deli open, Brgr 15-23) Sun 12-17 (Deli Brunch, Brgr closed)

item.title: Military Museum
item.description: From Hakkapeliittas to peacekeepers-exhibition tells basic facts and interesting details about Finland's military history. Weapons, uniforms, equipment, medals and badges of honour, flags and war-themed art from various times on display.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is accessible. The wheelchair lifet is temporarily out of order.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours should be booked in advance
item.matko:services: Picture collection.
item.matko:ingress: The museum displays military equipment: weapons, colours, decorations, arms and uniforms.

item.title: Military Museum's Manege
item.description: The exhibition From autonomy to Atalanta-an exhibition on Finnish military history on the Military Museum´s Manege presents the history of Finland's defence forces and Finnish soldiers as well as wars involving Finland from the 17th century to the present day.
item.matko:location: Suomenlinna Fortress, by ferry from the Market Square about 15 min
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistance needed. Accessible WC.

item.title: Milliklubi Bar & Disco
item.description: A new night club in the city centre, opposite of the Railwaystation. For each night there is something going on, from club nights to live music. On request the nightclub also offers party packages to small groups (6-10 persons).
item.matko:open: Open every evening 21-04. Age limit 24 years.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Yksityistilasuuksia varten tiloja on kolme:Bank, Millionaires Disco ja Vegas. Bank käsittää noin 80 asiakaspaikkaa ja on suosittu tila pienemmissä yksityistilaisuuksissa. Bankista löytyy pieni stage. Istumapaikkoja on reilusti. Isompi tila Millioniares Disco palvelee tanssi-, biletys- ja seurustelutilana, siihen voi tarpeen mukaan rakentaa buffet- ja viinipöydät. Myös Millionaires Discosta löytyy pieni stage. Vegas palvelee peli- ja yleisenä seurustelutilana. Peleistä meiltä löytyvät ruletti ja Black Jack sekä lukuisia peliautomaatteja. Tilavuokrat on asetettu asiakasmäärien ja tilaisuuksien pituuden mukaan. Isoin ryhmäkoko on 315 henkilöä. Ruokatuotantoyhteistyökumppaneita on lukuisia, niiden mm. ravintola Seurahuone ja Delicatessen

item.title: Minna Parikka Universum
item.description: The Minna Parikka brand was born the day that 15-year-old Minna decided shoes were her life's true calling. Since then, the Helsinki-based designer's creations have graced the feet and physiques of adventurous women around the globe, including Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, Paloma Faith and Beth Ditto. Minna's concept boutique on Aleksanterinkatu offers shoes (and Bunny Sneakers) and accessories from her collections in playful settings.

item.title: Miä&Siä
item.description: Experience Finnish cottage vibe in the center of the city! Pop-up cottage Miä&Siä has ecological and traditional Finnish rugs, organic snacks and home products. Come feel the atmosphere and bring back perfect souvenirs!

item.title: Moko Market & Café Punavuori
item.description: Moko Market & Café is a concept store, combining an interior design store and a café, located in the trendy design district Helsinki. Moko sells various interior design related objects and furniture such as a collection of vintage items, old Indian cabinets, unique pieces from here and there. There is another Moko Market & Cafe located in Sörnäinen at Vilhonvuorenkatu 11.

item.title: Molly Malone's Irish Bar
item.description: Selected as one of the top 50 Irish Pubs in Europe, Molly Malone's Irish Bar offers its customers, with the strength of two floors, three bars and a competent bar staff together a genuine and happy Irish atmosphere right in the heart of Helsinki. Molly's has also Irish live music every night.

item.title: Moomin Shop
item.description: All items related to Tove Jansson's beloved Moomins.

item.title: Mulberry
item.description: British luxury brand noted for its classic leather bags, accessories and womenswear collections.

item.title: Munkkiniemi beach
item.description: At the area: cabins, toilets, children's playground, showers, beach-volley ground, weightlifting area and kiosk.

item.title: Murulandia
item.description: Indoor theme park for the whole family. Instructive and interesting things to do for all ages. Play room, children and adults light room, adventure track, laboratory, art workshop, planetarium, etc.
item.matko:disabled: 1. floor. Inva toilet.

item.title: Museum of Contemporary Art Kiasma
item.description: Kiasma is a museum of contemporary art under the umbrella of the Finnish National Gallery. Its primary role is to educate the public on contemporary art and to strengthen the status of art in Finland in general.The basic functions of the museum are organising changing exhibitions and augmenting its collection, along with research and presentation of the works. Together with active audience work and the programming of the Kiasma Theatre, they constitute a living whole. Augmenting the collection is a major aspect of the operations of Kiasma. The primary focus in the museum collection is on Finnish contemporary art. The collection is also supplemented by commissioning new work. The collection is presented to the public in annually changing thematic exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue 10-17, Wed-Fri 10-20.30, Sat 10-18, Sun 10-17.
item.matko:admission: 12/8/0€. Free entry on every month's first Friday 16-20.
item.matko:disabled: Kiasma is fully accessible. All floors can be accessed by lifts. Accessible toilets can be found on the first and fifth floors.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours (for 1-25 people) should be booked at least one week in advance, either by phone +358 (0)294 500 500 (Mon-Fri 9­-15) or by e-mail bookings@nationalgallery.fi. Tour languages are Finnish, Swedish, English, Russian and Italian.
item.matko:services: The newly-opened Kiasma Museum Shop offers an elegant selection of different gifts, literature, jewelry and childrens' items for all friends of contemporary art and museum shops.
item.matko:ingress: Kiasma is a part of the Finnish National Gallery.

item.title: Museum of Cultures
item.description: The Museum of Cultures studies and represents the peoples and cultures of the world and records their cultural heritage. The emphasis of the collecting and research activities is documenting present-day cultural phenomena.
item.matko:disabled: The accessible entrance is at street level on Mannerheimintie under the main staircase. There is a phone at the door for contacting museum staff who will open the door. The accessible toilet is on the ground floor near the entrance and the public lift leads to all floors.

item.title: Museum of Finnish Architecture
item.description: The Museum of Finnish Architecture offers rich new perspectives, discussion openers and meaningful experiences of architecture. Our mission is to activate a personal connection with the built environment and provide tools for understanding architecture. The museum offers Finnish and international tourig exhibitions and a permanent exhibition on 19th Century Finnish Architecture. A bookshop, specialized public library and collections are also at your service. The museum organizes a great variety of events including visiting lectures, guided tours, architecture walks and workshops. Guided tours from tel. (09) 8567 5100. The museum has two locations in Helsinki, a neo-renaissance building in the inner-city Design District of Kaartinkaupunki and a wooden villa in Kaivopuisto.
item.matko:location: City centre 0.5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:admission: 8/4/0€. Free entrance on every month's first Friday.
item.matko:disabled: The most accessible entrance is from the backyard of the museum. At the door there is an accessible ramp over a 5-cm step, after the step, a 4-cm threshold. At the door you can ring a buzzer for assistance.
item.matko:groups: Free entrance for schoolgroups with teatcher. Guide booking for groups tel. +358-(0)9 8567 5100.
item.matko:services: Library, archives and a bookshop.

item.title: Museum of Herttoniemi Manor
item.description: Herttoniemi Manor House Museum is the former home of Vice-Admiral Carl Olof Cronstedt in a manor house built in 1813. Park in the French and English style with the long linden alleys, grass parterres and ornamental bushes complete with gazebo. There is also a farmstead museum in buildings transferred to the site from the nearby region.
