item.matko:open: During winter season (October-April) every month's first Sunday 12-14. During summer season (May-September) every Sunday 12-14, guided tour 14-15.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups upon request.

item.title: Museum of Technology
item.description: Museum of Technology presents the history of technology and industry in Finland from the late 19th century to the present day. It shows the history of various branches of industry (metal, chemical, wood-processing, mining, building) communications, computer technology, domestic appliances and electric power technology, printing and surveying. The numerous permanent and special exhibitions are held in a delightful old industrial milieu on a beautiful stretch of river.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:open: During winter season (1.1.-1.6. ja 1.9.-31.12.) Mon closed, Tue-Wed and Fri 9-17, Thu 9-19, Sat-Sun 11-17. During summer season (2.6.-31.8.) Mon closed, Tue-Sun 11-17, Thu 11-19.
item.matko:disabled: Access with wheelchair, lift and Inva-WC, assistant needed.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups (min.10pers.) 4€/person. Guidebooking Riina Linna, tel +358 (0)9 7288 4422, riina.linna@tekniikanmuseo.fi.
item.matko:services: Museum shop, auditorium. In museum area also a café restaurant. Combined ticket with Power Station Museum 8€/adults

item.title: Music Hunter
item.description: Record store specialized in music collectibles, also cd´s, vinyls, music books, notes etc.

item.title: Music Theatre Bolero
item.description: Music Theatre Bolero presents dance and theatre performances for culture enthusiasts.

item.title: Music Theatre Kapsäkki, restaurant Allotria
item.description: Theatre performances, concerts

item.title: Musta Kissa
item.description: Musta Kissa has a large selection of beers, wines and cocktails. It is located in the heart of Kallio. Here is where Finnish 70's vintage, conviviality, and good music meet. Live music & experimental art supported.

item.title: Mustasaari
item.description: Mustasaari is a unique summer paradise with a possibility for many activities. Owned by the Helsinki Parish, the island is open for everybody and situated long enough from the buzz of the city, yet close enough for a quick access: only 15-minute ferryride away from the mainland. Dogs cannot be taken to the island.
item.matko:location: Boat connection from Taivallahti Pier: Adults 4€, children under 10 yrs free of charge. Timetable: www.jt-line.fi
item.matko:open: Early summer (2.-18.6.): Mon closed, Tue, Fri 9-18, Wed-Thu 9-12. Midsummer Party 19.6. at 14-21, closed 20.-21.6. Rest of summer (23.6-16.8.): Mon closed, Tue, Fri-Sun 9-18, Wed-Thu 9-21. For ferry timetables, please see the website (in Finnish only).
item.matko:admission: Ferry return ticket 4 €, children under 10-years-old free with their parents. Please note: cash only!
item.matko:disabled: The island is accessible for people with limited mobility.
item.matko:groups: All group visits must always be cleared beforehand with the island staff either by phone +358 (0)9 2340 2590 or by email mustasaari@evl.fi. Mustasaari is an ideal venue for recreational activities, meetings and training days.
item.matko:services: Cantine and a lunch restaurant with a capacity to serve foor for a maximum of 60 people. In addition to the main building there are other facilities on the island, for example, a chapel and an auditorium that lends itself for small meetings and training days.
item.matko:ingress: Beach, café, playground for children etc..

item.title: Mustikkamaa beach
item.description: Toilet, showers, volleyball ground and weightlifting area.

item.title: Muu gallery
item.description: The exhibition profile of the international contemporary art gallery MUU includes installations, video art, as well as shows of traditional art forms. Besides exhibitions, MUU also arranges performances, concerts, discussion forums, video presentations, workshops as well as lectures by visiting artists and curators.

item.title: My o My
item.description: Fashion. Sweets. Design. Art. My o My is an award-winning concept store group for women and men. The selection includes premium hand-picked fashion and design brands around the world including e.g. See by Chloé, Phillip Lim, Raf Simons and Viktor & Rolf.

item.title: Myllypuro Ice Hall
item.description: During winter season Myllypuro Ice Hall offers free-of-charge public skating hours. There's also a possibility to have your skates sharpened.
item.matko:location: Metro to Itäkeskus, from where bus 92

item.title: Myllypuro Tennis Centre
item.matko:location: In Myllypuro, metro connection from the city centre

item.title: MysticALArt
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Mäkelänrinne Swimming Hall
item.description: Swimming hall with eg.50 metre swimming pool, diving pool, 10 m diving boards, children's pool (water +32C), teaching pool, cold-water pools, solarium, massage (advance booking needed).
item.matko:admission: Adults 6,50€, children (7-16v.) and pensioners 3,30€/person, children under 7years free.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, Inva-WC.
item.matko:services: Private saunas, conference facilities and solarium. Café Uppopulla, open as swimming hall.

item.title: Namaskaar Bistro
item.description: The oldest Indian restaurant in Helsinki, also dishes from Bangladesh. A la carte and evening buffet. 108 seats. There is another Namaskaar restaurant at Bulevardi 6. Other Namaskaar Express restaurants are located on the Central Railway Station (Elielinaukio 3), in the Fennia House (Vuorikatu 14) and in the Forum Shopping Centre (Mannerheimintie 20 B).

item.title: Namu
item.description: Namu is located right in the center of Helsinki and next to the railway station. If you're looking for a good party, Namu is THE place to be.
item.matko:open: Wen 22-04, Fri 22-04, Sat 22-04 and Sun 22-04. On summer Tue-Sun 22-04

item.title: Nanking
item.description: Chinese restaurant

item.title: Nanso
item.description: Known for their comfortable and true reliability, high quality and strong design, Nanso's collections feature all the elements of tomorrow's favourite clothes. They exemplify your casual elegance and sense of everyday beauty. The Lempivaate collection is all about comfort.

item.title: Nasta
item.description: Funny objects, clothes and shoes from the past decades.

item.title: National Museum of Finland
item.description: The National Museum of Finland illustrates Finnish history from prehistoric times to the present day. Major archaeological finds, the historical, numismatic and ethnological collections have been put together for over 200 years. Workshop Vintti on the third floor is an interactive exhibition especially designed for children, where visitors can study the history of Finland and its culture using their hands and heads. VINTTI is suited to everyone over the age of seven. Younger children can visit in the company of adults. There is no upper age limit. Temporary exhibitions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue-Sun 11-18. Workshop Vintti is open Tue-Sun 12-16.
item.matko:admission: 9/7/0€. S-Etukortti holders 8 €. Free entrance on Fridays 16-18.
item.matko:disabled: The accessible entrance is at street level on Mannerheimintie, under the main staircase (door A2). There is a phone at the door for contacting museum staff who will open the door. The accessible toilet is on the ground floor near the entrance and the public lift leads to all floors.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking tel.+358 (0)40 1597 679 (Tue-Fri 9-12). Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, German, French, Russian. Group size max. 30pers., schoolgroups max. 25 pers. and kindergarten groups max. 15pers.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The cafe-restaurant seats 50 and in the summer months there is an outdoor café for 50 persons. Food and refreshments for the auditorium are served in the adjacent lobby.
item.matko:additionalinfo: In addition to its museum and exhibition activities, the National Museum of Finland has high-standard facilities for arranging various kinds of functions, such as conferences, seminars and media launches in its spacious and wellequipped auditorium. Situated on the ground floor of the museum, the auditorium seats 212. There is separate access from street level to the conference facilities. Functions and conferences can be combined with a visit to the museum's permanent or temporary exhibitions. Guided tours by request.
item.matko:services: Café (tel.+358 (0)9 4050 9530, open Tue-Sun 11-17, approx. 50 seats, a terrace in summer, lunch Tue-Fri 11-14. Museum shop, information centre. Auditorium (212 seats). Guided tours available in July-August
item.matko:ingress: Finnish history from prehistoric times to the present day.

item.title: National Pensions Institute
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1953-57.

item.title: Natural Flavour Tea House
item.description: First Chinese Tea House in Helsinki. High quality teas from different countries. Art-designed tea wares. Special Asian snacks. Fresh ice tea, Dim sum, brewed tea & coffee.

item.title: Natural History Museum
item.description: The Finnish Natural History Museum's exhibitions show the diversity of nature. The exhibition that tells about the Finnish nature takes the visitor from the summery archipelago to the wintry Lapland with its mountains. The "History of Life" exhibition presents the course of the evolution from the Big Bang to dinosaurs and larger mammals of the Ice Age. Through the exhibition "World Nature" the visitor is taken on an exploration excursion that begins from the polar areas and ends in the tropical warmth. The secrets of the bones are introduced in the exhibition "Story of the Bones". Different theme events and visiting exhibitions are a part of the museum's activity.
item.matko:open: During winter season (1.1.-31.5. and 1.9.-31.12.) Mon closed, Tue-Wed & Fri 9-16, Thu 9-19, Sat-Sun 10-16. During summer season (1.6.-31.8.) Mon closed, Tue-Wed & Fri-Sun 10-17, Thu 10-19.
item.matko:admission: 10/5/0€. Free entrance on every month's first Thursday at 17-19.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is fully accessible. An elevator and an accessible toilet are located in the museum lobby. When arriving by wheelchair, please contact the cash desk (+358 (0)294 128 800) to activate the accessible entrance in the backyard.
item.matko:groups: Guide bookings tel. +358 (0)9 1912 8855 Tue-Fri 9-11, or by e-mail opastukset@luomus.fi.
item.matko:services: Museum shop and café

item.title: Neuf
item.description: Manoush, La fée maraboutée, IKKS and Anti-flirt: french fashion for women, à bientôt !
item.matko:location: Between Bulevardi and Uudenmaankatu
item.matko:services: Shop

item.title: New Bamboo Center
item.description: New Bamboo Center is Asian restaurant specialised on curries. Cheap prices.
item.matko:location: Next to Kamppi Centre

item.title: Next Hotel Rivoli Jardin
item.description: Rivoli Jardin is located at the very heart of Helsinki, just a stone's throw from the Esplanade Park, and the most beautiful shopping and walking streets. Design District Helsinki, as well as the best restaurants, are within walking distance. The hotel has wireless Internet access and all rooms are individually air-conditioned.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 6 cm) along the path, essential access, lift; essential for access, easy access for blind or partially sighted, one disabled suite, steep hill to the inner yard where the hotel is situated
item.matko:groups: Small groups, max 30 persons.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 8 single, 46 double rooms and one suite. Apartments 31-69 sqm.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Breakfast room and bar.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Small meeting room for 8 persons
item.matko:additionalinfo: Business office with PC, printer and internet access, sauna
item.matko:services: Lobby bar, breakfast room, sauna, meeting room ( max. 8 persons), gym.

item.title: Nina's
item.description: Nina's boutique offers a beautiful collection of designer shoes and bags as well as ready to wear. Brands include Christian Louboutin, Dries van Noten, Carven, Chloé and Proenza Schouler.

item.title: Noolan
item.description: The lifestyle collection NOOLAN is a trailblazer in environmentally conscious clothing design. The starting points of the design are the special characteristics and functions of the different materials. The structural solutions strive for ultimate simplicity, avoiding any excess "decoration" and energy consumption, based on the "less is more" principle. Ecological soundness and minimizing the environmental burden caused by the products are part and parcel of this thinking. Its extensive and long-lasting collection gives the consumer the opportunity to choose a selection with a personal look and to supplement it over the course of time.

item.title: Nordea Bank Museum
item.description: Nordea Bank Museum traces the history of Finnish banking from 1862 onwards in a bank interior designed by architects Gesellius, Lindgren and Saarinen at the beginning of the 20th century. Old banknotes on display.
item.matko:open: The opening hours vary and are announced on the museum's website. Open for groups by appointment.

item.title: Nosturi
item.description: Nosturi is a versatile live music venue located close to downtown Helsinki, operated by the Live Music Association (ELMU ry). Nosturi takes pride in providing a platform for a broad spectrum of culturally relevant events such as concerts, raves, youth discos, theater and art gallery functions from all walks of life - everything from unknown underground bands to the largest mainstream acts.
item.matko:open: Opening hours change, for more information please see the website.

item.title: NUDGE
item.description: Nudge offers stylish and ecofriendly clothes and accessories for women, men and children. Our selection includes ecological products for interior decoration and biosertified natural cosmetics.
item.matko:location: City Centre

item.title: Nuuksio National Park
item.description: Go to Nuuksio to enjoy the quiet of the wilderness. Walk along the duckboards and paths, roam and ramble, ski along the tracks or work your way through the unbeaten snow, pick berries or gather mushrooms, fry sausages and make a pot of coffee on a camp fire, take a swim or do some fishing. Ease off for a while, come on your own or with a group, enjoy the sounds and smells of the wild.
item.matko:location: Bussi number 85(A) from the center of Espoo.

item.title: O-gallery
item.description: Conseptual art in the fields of textile-, glass-, ceramics- and jewellery design.

item.title: O'Malley's
item.description: O'Malley's Irish Bar started in 1981 as the first Irish bar in Finland. O'Malley's offers its customers a relaxed Irish pub scene with a wide variety of specialty beers and whiskeys. The friendly staff, weekly live music and the popular Irish Jam Session every Wednesday ensure that the atmosphere is fun and welcoming. It's also possible to order traditional "pub foods" to satisfy the feeling of hunger.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 17-24, Wed-Thu 16-24, Fri 16-02, Sat 14-02, Sun closed.

item.title: Office building at Fabianinkatu
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1960-65.

item.title: Olaus Petri Church
item.description: Olaus Petri church was founded in 1932. The architect is Ture Rydberg.

item.title: Old Church
item.description: The Old Church (by C.L. Engel) was built in 1826 and was the first Lutheran church to be built after Helsinki became the Finnish capital. In the park are graves and memorials to Finnish and German soldiers who died in the Civil War of 1918.
item.matko:open: Mon-Wed and Fri 12-15, Thu 12-20.30 and in connection with events.
item.matko:disabled: Entrance from Lönnrotinkatu side, via door marked with a wheelchair sign.
item.matko:services: Organ music on Tue at 12noon.

item.title: Old Market Hall
item.description: The Old Market Hall in Helsinki has served its customers since 1889. Merchants sell everything from cheese, fish, shellfish, vegetable, fruit and cakes to spices, coffee and tea. They are also more than happy to help with any special orders.
item.matko:disabled: The Old Market Hall is almost entirely accessible. The main doors open automatically and have only a very small step. There hallways are wide enough to move about, for example, on a wheelchair. A few cafés have high steps.

item.title: Old Student House
item.description: The Old Student House has been one of the main scenes of events in the city since 1870 but has nevertheless moved with the times. Superb location on about the most central site in Helsinki, magnificent and varied premises available for all kinds of events: galas, conferences, briefing sessions, seminars and receptions.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 16%, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, door opening 63 cm, toilet for wheelchair users in the restaurant kitchen, can be used when the kitchen is open, no access with wheelchair to the second floor of the building, easier entry from the patio
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Main hall 480 m2, upper floor total 170 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Caters for all kinds of special occasions on the turnkey principle, wide range of AV equipment, own sound and lighting, including design

item.title: Olo-huone second hand & lifestyle
item.description: Olo-huone is a second hand & lifestyle store in Kallio selling vintage clothes, furniture, candles, jewellery and handicrafts. The store also offers unique atmosphere for a cup of coffee.

item.title: Olofsborg
item.description: One of the most loved Jugend -style buildings in Helsinki. The second runner-up of public vote for the most beautiful jugend -style building in Helsinki organized by Helsingin Sanomat in 2007. Architects were the famous trio Herman Gesellius, Armas Lindgren & Eliel Saarinen. The towers of the building are inspired by the Olavinlinna Castle. Completed in 1903.
item.matko:ingress: One of the most loved Jugend -style buildings in Helsinki.

item.title: Olympic Stadium
item.description: The Olympic Stadion, built in 1938, was designed in functionalistic style by the architects Yrjö Lindegren and Toivo Jäntti. The Olympic Games were held in 1952 in Helsinki. Today the Olympic Stadium hosts both national and international sporting events and outdoor concerts. The Stadium Tower is 72 meters (235 feet) high and in the top you can admire the urban landscape and all of central Helsinki. Tickets for the tower can be purchased at the Stadium (Tower lobby).
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:open: Stadium Tower: Mon-Fri 8-21, Sat-Sun 9-18. The tower is closed during competitions and events.
item.matko:admission: Stadium Tower: 5/2/0€, two adult tickets for one for Veikkaus Card holders.
item.matko:disabled: There is an accessible stand and accessible toilets in the Stadium. Please note that the Tower is not wheelchair-accessible.
item.matko:groups: Entrance to the tower: group discount when over 10persons. Lunch for groups upon request, Sodexho, www.sodexho.fi/olympiastadion
item.matko:restaurantinfo: A restaurant for 100-250 persons
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Stadium Tower (72 meters high), panorama over the whole city. Stadion Hostel, rooms
item.matko:services: Eg. the Sportsmuseum of Finland (www.urheilumuseo.fi), Stadion Hostel (www.stadionhostel.fi), café-restaurant Olympia Bistro (open Mon-Fri 9-16, lunch served Mon-Fri 11-14, Sodexho, www.sodexho.fi/olympiastadion)
item.matko:ingress: National and international sporting events and concerts.

item.title: Ombrellino
item.description: Toys and interior decorations for nurserys, mainly international brands. Ombrellino was founded in 1978.

item.title: Omena Hotel Yrjönkatu
item.description: Omena Hotel Yrjönkatu is located in the center of Helsinki on the corner of Eerikinkatu and Yrjönkatu close to Forum Shopping Centre. All the services you need are on the doorstep from shops and department stores to restaurants, bars and clubs.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, main railway station 300m, airport 20 km
item.matko:services: The hotel doesn't have its own parking. Car parks at the Forum shopping centre and at Stockmann are both within easy reach of the hotel.

item.title: Omenahotelli Lönnrotinkatu
item.description: Omena Hotel Lönnrotinkatu enjoys a prime location in the heart of the Finnish capital. All the services you need are on the doorstep from shops and department stores to restaurants, bars and clubs. Helsinki's famous Stockmann department store and the Kamppi and Forum shopping centres are all just a stone's throw away. Stylish and spacious, Omena rooms can comfortably accommodate four adults. There are 147 rooms in the hotel.
item.matko:location: in the centrum, to the airport 18 km.
item.matko:groups: groupreservations@omenahotels.com

item.title: OmNam
item.description: Omnam (vege restaurant & café) serves many kinds of vegetarian dishes inspired by cuisines from all over the world. Tasty, fresh, beautiful and nutritious vegetarian dishes are served daily for breakfast and lunch. Also coffee house products and cafeteria products.
item.matko:location: Near Kamppi, in the inner courtyard on Annankatu 29 B

item.title: On the Rocks
item.description: On The Rocks is a rock bar and live club in the heart of Helsinki, on Mikonkatu next to the Railwaystation. Live music, stand up-nights, jams, dj-clubs and different events. Street bar is a nice place for the rock people and all the thirsty people in the city: nice company, cool atmosphere, good music and different programs from the afternoon until night. The club downstairs has live gigs four nights in the week: The Rock Club is open from Wednesdays to Saturdays and on weekends all the party people can listen to live bands and rock dj:s.
item.matko:open: Bar open every day 16-04. Downstairs club Wed 20-04, Thu 20-01, Fri-Sat 20-04, open on other days during musical events.

item.title: Opa outlet
item.description: Opa Muurikka manufactures eg. cooking ware for homes and for hiking. In the same building you'll find also other outlets, eg. the Arabia factory outlet
item.matko:location: tram nr.6 towards Arabia

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Albert
item.description: Original Sokos Hotel Albert is a cosy, relaxed hotel in a trendy residential area in downtown Helsinki. The hotel's warm-hearted atmosphere and caring staff bid guests a warm welcome to their living room in the Punavuori neighbourhood. Favoured by locals, the Papa Albert Restaurant and the Papa Albert Bar, specialising in Italian wines and specialty coffees, ensure customers enjoy their visit. In the vicinity of the hotel, Punavuori's Design District boasts a wide range of other restaurants, cafés and bars. Welcome to Albert - a hotel with personality!
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min. Located in Helsinki Design District.
item.matko:disabled: 2 rooms for disabled, large elevator, washroom for disabled. Easy entrance to hotel and restaurant.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 95 non-smoking rooms of which 85 standard and 10 superior. 2 rooms for disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Ristorante & Bar Papa Albert.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Restaurant cabinets for private occasions (max 18 persons).
item.matko:additionalinfo: Wireless broadband connection in all rooms. Guest sauna daily.
item.matko:services: Guest sauna and restaurant.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Helsinki
item.description: Honest, easy-going and a favourite with staying power, Original Sokos Hotel Helsinki is located on the pulse of the city, between Ateneum Art Museum and Senate Square in the centre of the capital with its busy shopping area. All hotel rooms have a youthful Scandinavian theme. Its cosy Fransmanni and Memphis restaurants serve a versatile menu in a relaxed atmosphere. Customers can use the newly opened EasyFit gym, for a low-price charge. On the highest storey, above the rooftops of Helsinki, you'll find cosy sauna facilities for the enjoyment of business travellers and holidaymakers alike. You can't get any closer to the heart of Helsinki than this. Welcome!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 16%, lift; essential for access, the entrance is dangerous, the vestibule is dark and there are steps, the door blocks the ramp, persons who use wheelchair need assistance, disabled rooms
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 202 non-smoking rooms: 54 single rooms, 123 double rooms, 20 superior rooms, 5 suites (2 of these boast a sauna). 3 rooms for the disabled. All rooms refurbished in 2006-2007.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Cosy French-style restaurant with cabinet for 35 persons and summer terrace, trendy Memphis restaurant, night club Helsinki Club.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: 1 conference room with adjoining VIP sauna suite for max 12 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: All rooms feature a wireless internet connection. Laundry service, Europark Kluuvi garage.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Pasila
item.description: The hospitable Original Sokos Hotel Pasila is situated right next to the action, close to he vicinity of Helsinki Exhibition and Convention Centre, Hartwall Arena, Linnanmäki Amusement Park and Helsinki's Central Park. Easily accessible, the hotel has good train, tram and bus connections, which makes it a favourite of exhibition, conference and sports event visitors. The hotel's versatile range of facilities includes accommodation, meeting and restaurant services and comfortable saunas. Welcome to easy-going Pasila!
item.matko:location: City centre 4 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 178 non-smoking rooms: 53 single rooms, 100 double rooms, 19 superior rooms and 6 suites. One suite boasts a sauna. 63 family rooms and 2 rooms for the disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Conference meals are buffets set in the conference and banquet restaurant Pasila. The restaurant is also available for private occasions, banquets and cocktail parties for up to 140 persons. Spanish-style restaurant Sevilla and a lobby bar
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: All conference rooms can be used as exhibition facilities: the room height is 2.9 m, except in suites 1 and 2, where it is 2.4 m. 100 sq.m coffee court/general resting area.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 2 saunas and 1 sauna lounge, parking.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Presidentti
item.description: The Original Sokos Hotel Presidentti event house is located next to Kamppi Shopping Centre in the midst of Helsinki, surrounded by its culture events and versatile shopping opportunities. Presidentti serves you in every situation. The hotel offers many different kinds of conference and event facilities, also for larger occasions. Presidentti's Spanish-styled Sevilla Restaurant and its Adjutantti Pub ensure your enjoyment along with the Pressa Restaurant and its entertainment. Meetings, lodging, fine food and good fun - under one roof. It's nearly impossible not to enjoy yourself at Hotel Presidentti. Welcome!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, but access with wheelchair to Restaurant from outside through the inner yard or through the kitchen, automatic slide door, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, inva rooms and toilet for wheelchair users also in the entrance hall.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 494 rooms: 47 single rooms, 408 double rooms, 34 superior rooms, 5 suites with a sauna. 423 rooms for non-smokers, also rooms for allergic persons and 4 rooms for the disabled available.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Conference and banquet restaurant Presidentti for up to 650 guests. Available for private occasions, banquets, cocktail parties, etc.; fixed video projector, sound reproduction system for speech, parquet floor for dancing. Spanish-style restaurant Sevilla and a lobby bar, Pub Adjutantti.
item.matko:services: 494 rooms (423 for non-smokers) 455 standard rooms (Scandinavian design, twin beds or a double bed, divan or swing chair, parquet floor) 34 superior rooms (standard room with flat screen TV, safe deposit box, electric kettle, bathrobe, and slippers) 5 suites (Standard suite: 78 m2, Scandinavian design, drawing room, bed alcove, dressing room, and sauna. President suite; 97 m2, stylish international design, drawing room, bedroom, dressing room, sauna, and hot tub, carpet floor)

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Tapiola Garden
item.description: Espoo's Tapiola Garden is the heart of Tapiola's continuously developing garden city. It has a tangible cosy character and friendliness. The hotel has good traffic connections and is located near a large shopping centre, a cultural centre and the WeeGee Exhibition Centre. The Spanish-style restaurant of this newly refurbished hotel as well as its spacious lobby bar/café adds to its openhearted atmosphere. Almost all the comfortable hotel rooms have a balcony. Fitness room, great outdoor possibilities, saunas, sauna cabinet and swimming pool offer easy relaxation after a busy day. It's easy to enjoy life here. Welcome!
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Sevilla Bar & Restaurante is a Spanish-style restaurant with a relaxed ambiance serving a full menu featuring sangria, delicious tapas dishes and juicy steaks. You can read newspapers and enjoy a wide selections of drinks in the cosy lobby bar. Coffee and snacks are served in the lobby's Coffee bar.

item.title: Original Sokos Hotel Vaakuna Helsinki
item.description: The functionalist Vaakuna building, completed in 1952 for the Olympics, is situated in the best location in the city - at its very core. Its soundproof windows keep city noises out and ensure peaceful dreams. Rich with atmosphere, the Loiste Restaurant serves you from breakfast till late in the evening, with terraces boasting rooftop panoramas on Vaakuna's 10th floor. Original Sokos Hotel Vaakuna is a great place to spend a family holiday in Helsinki. Onni the Squirrel's playroom and a Sony Playstation gaming room in the summertime guarantee the enjoyment of both young and older children. A Hotel with a capital "H". Welcome!
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift does not meet the spatial requirements of a wheelchair, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, two disabled rooms, risk to bump into the ramp in the entrance hall, spacious personnel lift available if necessary.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 270 rooms: 160 single rooms, 76 double rooms, 22 superior rooms and 12 suites. All rooms feature an Internet connection over a wlan network. All rooms are for non-smokers, the rooms on the 9th floor come with a balcony. 2 rooms for the disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurants Loiste (seating 205) and Kaarre (seating 120), located at the 10th floor of the building, offer a great view over the city. A rooftop terrace through the summer season. Seven conference rooms. The entire tenth floor of the hotel (restaurants and conference facilities) is available for corporate events, banquets, and cocktail parties for max. 700 participants.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: A 30 sq.m coffee corner in the lobby of the conference facilities.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 2 saunas, Eliel underground car park, entrance opposite the main entrance to the hotel.

item.title: Orion Cinema
item.description: Orion is an cosy cinema that shows known and unknown classics in beautiful Art Deco settings.
item.matko:location: City centre, airport 19 km

item.title: Ostrobotnia Banquet Floor
item.description: The Ostrobotnia Banquet Floor is the perfect place for events both small and large. You can choose between eight rooms differing in style, size and ambiance. Ostrobotnia is located beside the Parliament House and the National Museum. The facilities are situated on the second and third floor of the building. There are tree separate rooms: Jääkärihuone, Snellman and Runeberg. The Ball Room can be combined with the Chydenius room.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Manala restaurant 176 seats. St. Urho`s pub 100 seats.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sound and lighting system in the Ball room. Internet connection.

item.title: Oulunkylä Ice Rink
item.description: Oulunkylän liikuntapuisto artificial skating rink. Bandy, skating, speed skating and figure skating.
item.matko:services: Possibility to have your blades sharpened.

item.title: Oulunkylä Recreation Centre
item.matko:location: Bus number 72 from the Railway Square.

item.title: Oulunkylän Curling Hall
item.description: Curling Hall in Oulunkylä, Helsinki.

item.title: OVVN
item.description: OVVN is a store for 10 different brands. The idea of the shop is to offer design clothing, -jewellery, -shoes and accessories for both women and men that are out of the ordinary mainstream fashion. The shop offers mainly handmade unique objects as well as small collections. The prices vary between street fashion and design.

item.title: Pacifico
item.description: Bar Pacifico, located in the heart of Kallio, is known for its warm, international atmosphere, great music and delicious brunch during the weekend.

item.title: PAJA a local design shop
item.description: Paja is an artisan studio and jewellery shop where you can observe Finnish designers at work and the jewellery-making process from the initial idea to the ready-made piece. Here you will find an interesting collection of modern handcrafted jewellery. 100% made in Helsinki. Welcome!

item.title: Paloheinä Golf Ltd
item.description: An open for all golf course in the north Helsinki area. A large driving range and a 9-hole course (only one in the party needs to have a green card). At Paloheinä Golf it is also possible to rent the equipment.
item.matko:location: City centre 13 km, buses 67 and 66A, airport 10 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Big Horn Steak House includes 80 seats indoors and 80 seast terrace. Big Horn Steak House also for parties or meetings.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: A cabinet for 20 people
item.matko:additionalinfo: All the rights to serve alcoholic drinks

item.title: Paloheinä Ice Hall
item.description: During winter season Paloheinä Ice Hall offers free-of-charge public skating hours. There's also a possibility to have your skates sharpened.
item.matko:location: Bus 66/66A

item.title: Paloheinä Recreational Centre
item.description: Paloheinä is the most popular cross-country skiing centre in Helsinki and is easy to get to by bus or car. The skiing trails are opened as early as November and can be skied on as late as April, snow conditions permitting. Most of the trails are lighted until late in the evening. Ski service is available for waxing and preparation of skis. Ski package (including boots, skis and poles), snowshoe and small sled rentals. Also skiing courses!
item.matko:location: Approx. 9 km from the centre of Helsinki; buses 66, 66A from the city centre.
item.matko:open: The Paloheinä Skiing Service skirental is open during wintertime according to the snow situation in Helsinki
item.matko:services: SNOWSHOE HIKING Snowshoe hiking has become increasingly popular in Finland in recent years. The snowshoes attach to your own boots and allow you to walk across snowfields without sinking. Snowshoe hiking can be enjoyed by anyone, regardless of age or physical condition. You can try out snowshoe hiking on your own at several outdoor recreational centres, for example at the Paloheinä Recreational Centre.

item.title: Park Hotel Käpylä
item.description: Park Hotel Käpylä is a cosy conference hotel in an idyllic garden district of the city and easily accessible by car or public transport. There is ample free parking in the surrounding streets. The meeting facilities can be converted to suit a number of purposes, from wedding receptions to seminars. Sauna department with three saunas and a swimming pool.
item.matko:location: City centre 6 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 40 rooms: 1 single ja 39 double rooms, extra beds available
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant with indoor terrace and bar, total of 120 seats. Sunny outdoor terrace with 50 seats in the courtyard.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Conference lobby 100 m2
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: For the conference clients, the hotel provides spacious and comfortable meeting facilities for up to 120 persons. AV-equipment is included in the price of the meeting package. Internet access available.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna

item.title: Parliament
item.description: Finland's 200-seat parliament gathers in this impressive building representing 1920s Classicism. The facade of the building is made of red granite from Kalvola. The main facade includes 14 Corinthian columns. In the Little Parliament (Arkadiankatu 3), an annex on the left side of the actual Parliament building, operates Visitors' Centre whre you can find information about the Parliament and about the European Union. Open Mon-Fri 10-16.
item.matko:open: The Parliament House will be closed from 14 March 2015 due to renovations. Guided tours will not be held before the renovations are finished in 2017.
item.matko:disabled: There are many steps and inclines in the Parliament building. Accessible entrance in the north wing (the right side). Accessible toilets available. Disabled visitors should contact the guide service prior to their visit either by phone +358 (0)9 432 2027 or by email oppaat@eduskunta.fi.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours are arranged for groups (6-25pers.) upon request Mon-Fri 9-16.15, tel. +358-9-432 2027. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English & German. All tours are free of charge. Entrance to the guided tours on the left side of the main entrance.

item.title: Pasila Sports Hall
item.description: Sports hall

item.title: Pasila's Old Roundhouse
item.description: 100 years old roundhouse is situated in the middle of Pasila, near center. Scenery is peaceful railway yard where trains are running every now and then. Horseshoe shaped building offers an unique architecture and space. Area is 680m2, height is 7,5m and whole venue can be divided in two with double doors. Capacity during dinner is 300 and 400-500 cocktail. Old Roundhouse is sunlit, roomy and lovely with arcs reaching to the roof. The walls are white, the floor is blue, and beautiful arcs underlines spacious feeling. Venue has been equipped with movable estrade, light and audio system used in speeches and background music. You can bring your own goods or we can tailor an offer including only the services which you are externalizeing.
item.matko:location: City centre 3.5 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Interior can be easily changed from one arrangement to another in order to serve better the customer and to back up the goal of the event . Capacity is 300 during dinner and 400-500 cocktail. You can bring your own beverages but the catering is exclusively of Crepperie Oy.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Room 1: 147 m2 Room 2: 147 m2 Room 3: 219 m2

item.title: PASSIO Keittiö ja Baari
item.description: Passion and lust in food, beer and wine. The dishes are made of ingredients from local sources combined with spices and flavors from all over the world, the wines are produced by Panimoravintola Huvila in Savonlinna, also selected wines from european quality winery's.

item.title: Pataässä Karaoke Bar
item.description: The first Karaoke Restaurant in Helsinki.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 17-02, Wed-Thu 17-03, Fri 15-03, Sat 09-03, Sun 09-02. Karaoke can be sung all day under opening hours.

item.title: Patricia
item.description: Patricia - luxury from Finland since 1912. Patricia is a Finnish lingerie and swimwear brand which is very well-known for its high quality and exceptional customer service. Patricia offers a versatile and contemporary selection of styles and colours for all occasions. Bra cup sizes from AA to H and measurements between 30-44 (65-100).

item.title: Pelago Bicycles
item.description: Pelago is a Helsinki-based bicycle company, producing strong and practical products with a retro feel for the needs of urban transport, alternative travelling and other pedal powered activities. From their Kalevankatu store you can also get some nice t-shirts for souvenier.

item.title: Penny Lane
item.description: Vintage clothing shoes, bags and other accessories. Also for men.

item.title: Pentik
item.description: Pentik is an finnish interior design retailer. The company designs a versatile range of products under its own brand in cooperation with carefully selected international partners. Store also in Kamppi.

item.title: Pentik outlet
item.description: A home decorated with Pentik designs has the modern and relaxed feel of a place where you feel happy and comfortable. The Pentik style combines Scandinavian simplicity with rustic charm and touches of the exotic to create a beautiful and harmonious whole. Eg. Arabia outlet is located in the same building.
item.matko:location: tram nr.6 towards Arabia

item.title: Perho
item.description: The Restaurant Perho functions as the training restaurant of Finland's first restaurant school, founded 11.1.1935. The students work on their on-the-job learning periods both in the kitchen and in the dining room of the Restaurant Perho. Dinners, group lunches, meetings and family events can be arranged.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 11-22, Sat 14-22, Sun 11-15. Outside the opening hours on request.
item.matko:disabled: Possible to access with wheelchair. Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Both private and corporate occasions can be arranged upon request.
item.matko:services: Approx. 120 seats. Three private rooms, a total of approx 100 seats. Entrance to the private rooms from the Perhokatu side. The private function restaurant is open on agreement.

item.title: Peuramaa Ski Center
item.description: Peuramaa Ski Center is located near Helsinki region.

item.title: Photographic Gallery Hippolyte
item.description: Photographic gallery Hippolyte is the oldest and leading photographic gallery in Finland. Hippolyte is located in the center of Helsinki in the premises of a former movie theatre. The gallery exhibits and deals mainly Finnish contemporary photographic art. In addition to the monthly changing exhibitions it is possible to buy photographic art prints, books and postcards from the gallery. Hippolyte is maintained by the Photographic Artists' Association in Finland.

item.title: Pihlajasaari Island
item.description: Pihlajasaari is a former villa island that is now a versatile outdoor recreation area. It still has a few old villas set amongst rocks, wooded areas, groves and beaches. Varying terrain, good location and services have made Pihlajasaari the most popular summer island in Helsinki. Sun worshipers are attracted by Pihlajasaari's sandy beaches, there is also a naturist beach. Also cooking shelters, boat harbour, sauna to rent, café-restaurant Pihlajasaari (www.pihlajasaari.net) and possible to camp during Fri 12noon-Mon 12noon.
item.matko:open: The JT Line ferry goes every day from Merisatama 9.5.-30.8.2015 and 5.-6.9.2015 and from Ruoholahti 13.6.-9.8.2015.
item.matko:groups: Possible to book the restaurant for private occasions. Menus and buffet menus available for groups (menus min. 5persons, buffet menus min.20persons), restaurant Pihlajasaari (+358 (0)40 546 5350, www.pihlajasaari.net)
item.matko:ingress: Pihlajasaari is a former villa island that is now a versatile outdoor recreation area.

item.title: Pirkkola Ice Hall
item.description: The Ice Hall of the Pirkkola Sports Park is located in the Central Park in Northern Helsinki. During winter season the Ice Hall (hall 2) offers free-of-charge public skating hours.
item.matko:location: Buses 51, 62 and 63 near the ice hall. Also buses 42, 52, 54, 79, 512 and 522 further outside

item.title: Pirkkola Sports Park
item.description: Pirkkola Sports Park is located in the middle of Helsinki Central Park, and with its outdoor routes, sports fields and other sports facilities it makes for an active exercise hub. The Sports Park area, right in the middle of a forest, is about 66 hectars.
item.matko:open: Dressing rooms in summer season (2.5 -30.8.2015): Mon-Fri 7-21.30, Sat 7-21, Sun 8-21, in winter season (31.8.2015-30.4.2016): Mon-Sat 7-21.30, Sun 8-21.30. Exceptions to the opening hours: please see the website (in Finnish only).
item.matko:disabled: An accessible elevator, sauna, wc and dressing room in the swimming hall.
item.matko:services: The Sports Park has facilities for the following sport: ice skating, ice hockey, football, weightlifting, powerlifting, skiing, general physical exercise, volleyball, athletics, swimming, table tennis, gymnastics, cheerleading, badminton, public ice skating.

item.title: Pizza Hut Citykäytävä
item.description: Pizza Hut Citykäytävä offers a comfortable setting even for a whole family pizza time, lunch to dinner. In addition to pizza, the menu includes ie. pastas, salads, finger food, drinks and desserts. All the pizzas can also be ordered as a take away. Along with Pizza Hut Citykäytävä also Pizza Hut Tennispalatsi (located in Fredrikinkatu 65), Munkkivuori Take away and Hartwall Arena's Express serve you in Helsinki.
item.matko:disabled: Disabled toilets, accessible entrance (ask staff for guidance)

item.title: Pjazza
item.description: Your authentic italian restaurant in the heart of Helsinki. Food with a roman touch. Live music everyday - jazz twice a week. Lunch, dinner and sunday brunch. Cocktail bar and a courtyard terrace.
item.matko:disabled: Weelchair accessible.

item.title: Play It Again, Sam
item.description: Vintage clothing from the late 19th century until the beginning of the 70's

item.title: Police Summer Home
item.description: The Police Summer Home is a fine venue for parties and other events and is situated on the shore in the Lauttasaari district of Helsinki.
item.matko:location: Lauttasaari, Länsiulapanniemi. City centre 5 km, airport approx. 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Upon renting the space, the customer is free to arrange catering, music and other entertainment according to his wishes. The customer is also responsible for decorating and cleaning up.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Projector and screen available upon request for both rooms. Rental period is from 9am to 12midnight, after which one hour is allowed for cleaning up. Owned by the Helsinki Police Summer Home Association (Helsingin poliisilaitoksen kesäkotiyhdistys r.y.)
item.matko:services: Two banquet halls, one seating 180 persons and the other 50-60 persons. The house can provide up to 180 chairs. Two saunas, one for 15-20 guests and the other for 8-10 guests.

item.title: Pompier Espa
item.description: Restaurant Pompier, located next to the Esplanade Park, serves lunch as well as á la carte (after 17). Restaurant Pompier at Albertinkatu serves lunch in hall of the Helsinki Volunteer Fire Deparment and is at other times open by agreement.

item.title: Ponke's The Shop
item.description: A store specialized in skate- and snowboarding equipment and clothes.

item.title: Pop & Jazz Conservatory
item.matko:location: In Arabia, tram 6 and 8

item.title: Porthania
item.description: Porthania is an institute building for Helsinki University. It was designed by Aarne Ervi and completed in 1957 using periods latest building techniques, including concrete elements. Porthania is included in the DOCOMOMO-listing as a landmark of Finnish modern architecture.

item.title: Porvoonkadun Baari
item.description: Porvoonkadun baari has a stylish interior and an extensive selection of wine and other drinks such as coffees. To this place dogs are also welcome!

item.title: Pressa
item.description: Pressa is a stylish nightclub designed for mature taste, where the demand for pleasant atmosphere and diverse and high-quality entertainment meet.

item.title: Presto
item.description: Presto is a fun new Italian restaurant. It is all about mouthwatering, genuine flavours, made from the best Italian ingredients.
item.matko:groups: Trattoria: 2- 120, Caffè bar: 2-60, Prosecco lounge: 2-80 (cocktail event)

item.title: Primavera Interiors
item.description: Interior and decoration boutique. Also some vintage furniture.

item.title: Public House Black Door
item.description: A beer restaurant with a wide selection of beers and whiskeys from the British islands. Live music or DJs on weekends.

item.title: Puistolan Palloiluhalli
item.description: You´ll find the enjoyable tennis and badminton courts in Puistola Tennis Hall. Please also note the possibility for golfing on our simulator´s 35 different 18-hole-virtual-courses. Puistola Tennis Hall and Helsinki Climbing Centre belong to Tapanila Sport Center.

item.title: Pukkisaari Iron-Age Trading Place
item.description: A trading place from the latter Iron Age is built right beside the Seurasaari island. It is possible to visit on occasion and during events, During summer visitors can also occasionally see a genuine ancient vessel, Sotka, with its crew in the pier of Pukkisaari Island. More information: Sommelo ry, www.sommelo.fi
item.matko:open: Buildings are open on the last weekends of every month at 12-16 and during events.
item.matko:groups: Organized tours and workshops for groups by request, inquiries: Sommelo ry/Julius Väliaho e-mail: julius.valiaho -at- luukku.com
item.matko:ingress: A trading place from the latter Iron Age is built right beside the Seurasaari island.

item.title: Pulmu baari
item.description: A small bar in Kallio with a cosy atmosphere.

item.title: Punnitse & Säästä
item.description: The Punnitse & Säästä-shops ("weight & save") sell a couple of hundred bulk foodstuffs as well as a hundred prepacked special products. Specialized in nuts, beans, lentils, dried fruit etc. Majority of their products are organic and great for a healthy snack. Other stores at Helsinki: www.punnitse.fi/myymalat/helsinki

item.title: Puotila Chapel
item.matko:open: Thu 13-19 and in connection with events.

item.title: Puotilan kartano
item.description: The Puotila Villa (Puotilan kartano) has a history that dates back around 250 years. Puotila Villa houses some 150 seats for diners and different kind of events. During the summer season there is also an open-air terrace with 75 seats. Outside area can also be arranged events for even 3000 persons. The restaurant offers à la carte menu from Monday to Sunday, lunch buffet from Monday to Friday and brunch on Sundays. Pehtoorin Tupa (Steward's House) Café Svenkka (situated next to the Villa) houses some 75 seats open-air terrace
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Stewart house Café Svenkka offer also an excellent stage for different kinds of exhibitions.
item.matko:services: Restaurant houses larger conference room/dining room and three smaller rooms for up to 150. Outside can be arranged events for even 3000 persons. Kitchen serves seasonal food combined with a welcoming ambiance for example for luncheons, business dinners and family events. The restaurant can seat up to 150 dinner guests and host cocktail parties for up to 200.

item.title: Puro, Sähkötalo Office Building
item.description: Building planned and designed by architect Alvar Aalto in 1965-1975.

item.title: Putte´s Bar & Pizza
item.description: Bar and pizzeria with skillfully made delicious pizzas. No reservations needed.

item.title: Puu-Käpylä wooden district
item.description: A wooden garden city built in the early 1920's. Built for working class. Architects Martti Välikangas and Akseli Toivanen.
item.matko:services: A restaurant, hotel, grocery store and small park café along Pohjolankatu.

item.title: Puu-Vallila wooden district
item.description: Puu-Vallila and New Vallila form together a wooden district that was built for working classes during 1910's and 1920's. Architects Karl Hård af Segerstad, Armas Lindgren, Jussi Paatela and Toivo Paatela.
item.matko:services: Restaurants and cafées.

item.title: Pyöräkrossiparkki (BMX Race Park)
item.description: Pyöräkrossiparkki (BMX Race-park in english) is Finland's first international level BMX race track in Helsinki, in the Kivikko sports park. Pyöräkrossiparkki's main purpose is to introduce the sport of BMX Race to kids, youth and adults in a fun and safe way. Pyöräkrossiparkki will be open daily during the summer season. It's operations are run by the club BMX Helsinki ry. Operations include training sessions, weekly racing, BMX-birthday parties, BMX days for companies etc. Pyöräkrossiparkki will also host Finland's BMX Cup races, national championships, and other international races in the future.
item.matko:admission: Aikuiset 8€, opiskelijat ja lapset 5€, BMX Helsinki ry -jäsenet ilmaiseksi.

item.title: Päivikki and Sakari Sohlberg Home Museum
item.description: Päivikki och Sakari Sohlberg Home Museum consists of the home, carefully preserved just as it was in the days of its former owners, of Päivikki and Sakari Sohlberg. In the course of their long lives this lawyer couple acquired a large collection of utility items and works of art spanning the entire 20th century at their apartment in a Jugend block in the Katajanokka district of Helsinki.
item.matko:open: By appointment, especially for groups. Guided tours on Mondays at 15.30 & 17 (not in June-August), prebooking recommended.

item.title: Päivälehti Museum
item.description: Päivälehti Newspaper Museum profiles Finnish journalism, printing techniques and the history of the daily newspaper Helsingin Sanomat from the 19th century to the present day. The Päivälehti Museum also regularly offers special exhibitions and theme events, providing information on different aspects of journalism. On the Museum premises, one can also watch old movies, read webmagazines, and newspapers, or search for news in the electronic archive.
item.matko:open: ATT! Closed due to reparation 20.8.-december 2015. Otherwise open Tue-Sun 11-17. Also by appointment.
item.matko:disabled: The museum has an accessible toilet, a lift and a wheelchair-ramp.
item.matko:groups: Guidebooking, tel. +358 (0)9 122 5210, free of charge, duration 1h. Languages: Finnish, Swedish and English.
item.matko:services: The museum also has a printing room, a strip cartoon gallery and temporary exhibitions. Museum shop and children's corner.

item.title: Pörssitalo: Restaurant Pörssi
item.description: Pörssitalo offers six unique halls for meetings of 20-500 people. Restaurant Pörssi is a restaurant for many occasions. This historical restaurant, with its unique and impressive architecture, is a fitting location for both large banquets and feasts as well as corporate and cocktail parties, business negotiations and small gatherings. High quality space - from comfortable private rooms to the large main dining room - is available for all purposes.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:groups: Groups max 300 people

item.title: Qulma
item.description: We serve a soup buffet that will blow your socks off! Best soups in town! Sallads and a lovely roast potato buffet are also really good options. Try our breakfast package Mon to Fri 8.30-10.30. It was voted third best in Helsinki by City Magazine. Saturdays we serve hearty Saturday brunch from 10.00 am to 1,30 pm (from August 23).
item.matko:location: Kruununhaka district
item.matko:open: Mon 8.30am-3pm (lunchtime ends 2,20pm). Sat 10 am-2pm. Sun and bank holidays:closed
item.matko:disabled: Toilet for handicapped

item.title: R/H Store & Studio
item.description: R/H is a Finnish womenswear label, established in 2010 by Hanna Riiheläinen ja Emilia Hernesniemi, offering a collection rich on playful details combined with nordic minimalism, insightful feminine cuts, colorful prints and a certain spirit of black magic - still light and easy to wear.

item.title: Radisson Blu Espoo
item.description: After a full day at work, it is time to relax. At Radisson Blu Hotel Espoo, technology and business are interlaced with nature and excellent sports facilities. With a pleasant seaside location, the hotel lies within walking distance of one of the major high-tech concentrations in Finland as well as Aalto University. Dipoli Congress Centre is located practically next door; Helsinki centre is just 15 minutes away and the airport approx. 30 minutes. The beautiful wooden flooring and wallpaper depicting the Espoo archipelago bring nature into the hotel rooms. The Magic Dreams intelligent beds which conform to every individual guarantee you relaxing sleep. The sauna section on the top floor houses three saunas, a pool, a bar and a terrace complete with a spectacular sea view. Rent a bicycle and explore the surroundings or try out Nordic walking and take a tour to the nature or the architectural classics in the area. The hotel is also an excellent choice if you are travelling on holiday or with your family - pets included! Our goal is 100% guest satisfaction and we guarantee it. The hotel has been rewarded with TripAdvisor® 2013 Certificate of Excellence award. • Superb seaside location in peaceful surroundings. • 209 rooms, most overlooking the sea. All rooms renovated in 2010. • Enjoy a delicious lunch or dinner in Restaurant Ranta. Lobby Bar is just right for a get-together with colleagues. • Super Breakfast buffet or Grab & Run takeaway breakfast. • Top-floor sauna section with a sea view: three saunas, a pool, a bar, lounge and rooftop terrace. • Full free Wi-Fi coverage. • Experience Meetings: functional teamwork facilities, good food, excellent service, satisfaction guaranteed, and sustainable development. • Two meeting rooms for 30 persons: wooden floors, lots of light, overlooking the hotel courtyard and the sea. • A short walk to Dipoli Congress Centre, Aalto University and the largest technology village in Northern Europe. • Easy access by car; free parking in front of the hotel. • Good connections: just 9 km to Helsinki centre, 28 km to Helsinki Airport. • The Swan, the Nordic Ecolabel, is testimony to our environmentally responsible operations.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: A fitting name for this informal, seaside restaurant, the word Ranta translates to "shore." Guests can enjoy a relaxing holiday in Espoo in this friendly, home-like atmosphere that presents a sea-inspired menu with Italian flare. The terrace offers a beautiful view over the Gulf of Finland, providing the ideal place to relax during warm months.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Radisson Blu Espoo boasts two conference rooms that span more than 93 square metres. These meeting rooms can accommodate up to 30 guests each and feature wooden floors and natural daylight. Free high-speed wireless Internet access is provided to all guests and delegates, and a business service centre is also available.

item.title: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel
item.description: At Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel all rooms are equipped with the amenities of a first-class hotel, such as Magic Dreams intelligent beds, free Wi-Fi and MediaHUB connectivity panels. Start off with a sumptuous Super Breakfast, enjoy the various flavours in Kitzens, work out in our gym or pop down to our urban H.U.B. meeting point.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km. Hotel is located in the heart of Helsinki, next to the central railway station. The main bus station, underground and tram stops are all a short walk away.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, revolving door, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, 6 inva-equipped rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 291 rooms including Business Class rooms and suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Kitzen is a new, exciting culinary experience, where iconic design and innovative dining come together in a historical setting. Kitzens offers delicacies from five different types of cuisine, with each meal prepared to the customer's wishes. Kitzens is also the first restaurant in Finland to provide menus on tablet computers. Across from the restaurant, Bar 7 Bling serves some of the most sparkling drinks in Helsinki. HUB bar & lounge in at the hotel lobby is open 24/7. http://www.kitzens.fi/ http://www.bar7blings.fi/
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: All areas have free wireless wlan. Jalmari meeting room has a Smartboard. Elegant Boardroom is a place for high profile meetings and events.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna available for all hotel guests. A small fitness room.
item.matko:services: Hotel has a guest sauna and small gym area. High-speed and/or wireless Internet access is free of charge for all guests throughout the hotel.

item.title: Radisson Blu Royal Hotel
item.description: At Radisson Blu Royal Hotel Meetings & Events section is your best choice for both meetings for six and conferences for up to 300 people. The premises are also suitable for private and business celebrations. Weddings, birthdays, trade shows, exhibitions - with us you will succeed. Located next to Kamppi centre and excellent connections.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km. Located in the heart of Helsinki next to the city's newest and largest business, shopping and entertainment district.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, automatic slide door, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting poor at places, two inva rooms, access through the hotel to the hotel restaurants and bar, easier entry from Malminkatu.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 262 rooms including Business Class rooms and suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Grill It! offering the best steaks in town, Royal Buffet for private occasions, Coffee Bar in the lobby open 24/7.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Most of the meeting rooms suitable for exhibitions, conference lobbies being break out areas. The largest exhibition area is the Ballroom with 252 m2, break-out area (lobby) 160 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna available for all hotel guests, a heated garage for extra charge.
item.matko:services: Hotel has two guest saunas and warm parking hall (extra charge). High-speed and/or wireless Internet access is now free of charge for all guests throughout the hotel. Coffee bar in the hotel lobby open 24/7.

item.title: Radisson Blu Seaside Hotel
item.description: Top-notch service, rooms decorated with a personal touch, modern restaurants and the sea just outside create a great setting for a pleasant stay, just as you want it to be. Spacious family rooms, Magic Dreams intelligent beds and Wi-Fi. For you and your company, Katto Sauna & Lounge tops off the sensations with a spectacular sea view. Restaurant Viola serves mouthwatering Italian food. Of the hotel's 12 meeting rooms, the largest is suitable for conferences for 150 participants or cocktails for 200 people.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, by the sea, tram stop is in front of the hotel, metro is 500m away, design boutiques are at a walking distance. Helsinki-Vantaa airport: 40-min-drive.
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 337 rooms including Business Class rooms and suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Italian restaurant Viola (120 seats), Seaside Hall (280 seats), the Katto Lounge for up to 40 guests on the top floor for private occasions, Coffee Bar in the lobby open 24/7.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Virtanen 1 + 2: 170 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: Sauna available for all hotel guests. A small fitness room. Katto Sauna & Lounge for private parties. A heated garage for extra charge.
item.matko:services: Hotel has guest saunas and modern gym. High-speed and/or wireless Internet access is now free of charge for all guests throughout the hotel.

item.title: Raffaello
item.description: Mediterranean-style Raffaello Café is a restaurant for dining and spending time together. The restaurant menu is Mediterranean-style. In summer a popular courtyard terrace, often with live music.

item.title: Rake Sali Ball Room
item.description: Rake Sali Ball Room, in connection with the Klaus K hotel, is perfect for example for seminars, conferences, weddings, birthday parties, dinners and other celebrations with all banquet services provided by Klaus K Hotel. The venue is set in a national romantic era building, at the top of Helsinki's Esplanadi and the crossroads of the city center main streets Mannerheimintie and Erottaja. All the best shopping in the city is just across the street.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Rantasipi Airport Congress Center
item.description: The Rantasipi Airport Congress Center includes 31 conference rooms, a 650m2 multipurpose hall and comprehensive restaurant and catering services. The facilities are easily adapted to meet the needs of the event. The lobby area of Congress Center can be used for organizing cocktail events and small fairs. The Executive section offers exclusive conference & lounge rooms for top meetings, and the 650m2 multipurpose hall is sizable enough to drive in. Congress Center has 3D technology in use which allows to present products and services in real scale in a three-dimensional space. After successful meeting day nearby Flamingo Spa Rantasipi Partner offers great relaxation to our guests.
item.matko:location: Airport 3 km, Helsinki city centre 18 km, Tikkurila 6 km. The complimentary shuttle bus makes 3-4 runs per hour, according to a set timetable, between the Congress Center and the airport.

item.title: Rastila Camping Helsinki
item.description: 5-star Rastila Camping Helsinki is located in Vuosaari in eastern Helsinki and is one of the most popular camping sites in Finland. It has a wide range of accommodation services, maintenance buildings, saunas, a restaurant and a beach. Winter swimming and equipment rentals are also offered. Rastila also has a summer hostel that is suitable for families. In winter it is possible to stay for long periods. The camping is open year round.
item.matko:location: The metro ensures an easy access to Helsinki´s attractions in 18 minutes. The camping is situated in the eastern Helsinki next to the Rastila metro station.
item.matko:open: Open every day all through the year.
item.matko:disabled: Some of cottages are suitable for disabled. One of the servicebuildings is equipped with ramp and shower/toilet for disabled.
item.matko:services: MEETING ROOMS WITH SAUNA Beach sauna 1 the sauna premises provide a great venue for both meetings and pleasant evening with friends for 15-20 persons - shower, kitchen, fridge, dressing rooms, living/meeting room with video projector available, terrace and a barbecue - price €85 / hour Beach sauna 2 - for 15 persons - shower, lounge, fridge, dressing rooms, living/meeting room, terrace and a barbecue - price €75 / hour (min. 2 hours) Sauna 3 - located on the seashore and is suitable for meetings for 1-5 persons - shower, fridge, small lounge, terrace - price €30 / hour RESTAURANT LÄHIÖ tel. +358 9 310 78515 varaukset@lahio.fi www.lahio.fi

item.title: Rauhankatu 1 (The Pearl of Kruununhaka)
item.description: The Winner of public vote for the most beautiful jugend -style building in Helsinki organized by Helsingin Sanomat in 2007. The building presents the early phases of Jugend -style but has still some remains of the eclectism from the end of 19th century. Every floor is styled differently. Completed in 1900, architects were Onni Törnqvist (Tarjanne) and Lars Sonck. This hilly district is known for its architecture and have many other interesting buildings from the Art Nouveau perioid.
item.matko:location: Kruununhaka
item.matko:ingress: The most beautiful jugend -style building in Helsinki.

item.title: Rautatalo Office Building
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1951, 1955 and 1957.

item.title: Ravintola Alia
item.description: Beautiful restaurant for lunch, dinner, parties and weddings.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible by wheelchair and trolley.

item.title: Ravintola Kolmon3n
item.description: Ravintola Kolmon3n offers modern high quality home cooking. The dishes are created using clean flavours sourced from the best local and nordic ingredients. The tasty lunch changes daily and is themed on Finnish home cooking whilst our á la carte menu served only on friday and saturday evening gives a more modern day Finnish bistro cuisine. Saturday mornings are reserved for a relaxed breakfast-lunch menu.
item.matko:groups: Max 28 people, groups on weekdays after 14:00

item.title: Ravintola La Maison
item.description: Modern European restaurant and wine bar.

item.title: Ravintola Laulumiehet
item.description: Restaurant Laulumiehet has been running for over 50 years already as a made-to-order restaurant. During this time all kinds of events have been organized in the facilities; from weddings and funerals to schooling events. The banquet hall can be easily modified and suits therefore every occasion.
item.matko:location: in Kamppi, 500 m from the city center
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Perinteinen keittiö ja eksoottisiin ruokalajeihin erikoistunut juhlapalvelu. Juhlatiloissa anniskeluoikeudet

item.title: Ravintola Lämpö
item.description: Easy going restaurant in Suvilahti in the shadows of two old gasometers. We serve breakfast, lunch, brunch. In the evenings you can enjoy menu inspired by the area. Or come just for a cup of coffee.
item.matko:location: Five minute walk from Kalasatama metro station
item.matko:disabled: Inva toilet
item.matko:groups: Ask for an offer for group lunch
item.matko:services: Free wi-fi

item.title: Ravintola Pelmenit
item.description: Pelmenit is an uncomplicatedand cosy Ukrainian restaurant in the Sörnäinen district that offers extremely affordable Slavic home cooking. Pelmeni is a type of dumpling similar to ravioli that is filled with minced meat

item.title: Ravintola Pompei
item.description: Said to be the first pizzeria in Helsinki, Pompei seems to have been transported straight from Napoli to the classical Finnish Kruununhaka district.

item.title: Ravintola Solna
item.description: Restaurant Solna has been operating in the heart of Munkkiniemi since 1966. This cosy, homely restaurant offers modern French and Continental cuisine, prepared from the freshest raw ingredients by our chefs.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:additionalinfo: Kokousvieraille ruokasalin takana on rauhallinen 8 hengen kabinetti.

item.title: Ravintola Wanha Mylly
item.description: Restaurant Wanha Mylly is situated in the 18th century farm steward's house of the Herttoniemi Manor.
item.matko:location: Herttoniemi Manor
item.matko:open: Mon 11-20, Tue-Thu 11-21, Fri 11-22, Sat 12-22 and Sun 12-20. Holidays 12-20.

item.title: Red Apple Apartments
item.description: Red Apple Apartments has a variety of fully furnished studio, 1 bedroom, and 2 bedroom apartments in the heart of Helsinki for both business and leisure travellers. All the apartments come with fully equipped kitchens.
item.matko:location: City Centre

item.title: Redhill Records
item.description: Redhill records is a second-hand record store in Helsinki, Finland. Sells, trades and buys vinyl records, C-tapes, CDs, books and DVDs. Rock, folk, metal, disco, funk, soul, reggae, jazz, rap, world music, soundtracks, sound FX etc.
item.matko:disabled: No lift, 3 steps of stairs, no customer toilet.

item.title: Regus Luna House
item.description: Regus Luna House is based in a beautiful, impressive building ideally located in the very heart of the city. The centre has five conference and meeting rooms and the professional team can help to ensure the success of meetings.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:services: The meeting rooms are equipped with fast Internet connections, whiteboard, flipchart, conference phone, notepads, pencils and water. An LCD-projector is available for all conference and meeting rooms. Videoconferencing can be organized with high tech equipment using either IP or ISDN connections.

item.title: Remake EkoDesign
item.description: Remake is part of the EkoPuoti consept where you can find a eco-hairdresser and eco-beauty services. Remake is a ecodesign shop/showroom and studio.
item.matko:location: Remake Ekodesign is located at Hakaniemi square, behind the old market hall.

item.title: Restaurant Aino
item.description: Aino is a Finnish restaurant in the centre of Helsinki located by the historical Esplanad Park. The à la carte menu seeks inspiration from traditional Finnish cuisine. The kitchen uses mainly Finnish seasons ingredients. The rustic atmosphere of the arched cellar offers a delightful place for evening dining. Special occasions can be catered for in cabinets for 25, 12 or 8 persons.

item.title: Restaurant Aito
item.description: Restaurant Aito, seating 36 persons, is an intimate and casually stylish dining and meeting place for locals and visitors alike. Restaurant Aito offers genuine, straightforward, modern and traditional food, relying on Finnish ingredients with an international twist. Aito aims to serve seasonal gastronomic experiences from a frequently changing menu. Monday to Friday from 11 am to 2.30 pm also a daily changing lunch dish, soup of the day and lunch menu.

item.title: Restaurant Arthur
item.description: The Restaurant Arthur seats up to 250 guests in a wonderful chandeliered room that is perfect for company parties, banquets and weddings. Lunchbuffet, suitable also for groups. The restaurant also offers the Helsinki Menu.
item.matko:groups: Lunchbuffet, suitable also for groups.

item.title: Restaurant Ask
item.description: Ask is a small and intimate restaurant in Kruununhaka that offers 4 or 8 course menus with carefully selected beverage menus. The restaurant sources its produce from small farmers and producers. All products come from organic or biodynamic farming, except the game, wild fish and other foraged products. Restaurant Ask was chosen as restaurant of the year 2014 by The Gastronomic Association of Finland. The restaurant received its first Michelin star in 2014.

item.title: Restaurant Bellevue
item.description: The oldest Russian restaurant in Helsinki, located near the Uspenski Cathedral.
item.matko:groups: max. 70 persons/group

item.title: Restaurant Boat Wäiski
item.description: The only restaurant boat open all year round in Helsinki. Lunch is served during weekdays, but Wäiski is a good place also for a cup coffee or a drink. In the summer there is a terrace on the deck. The restaurant boat also hosts all sorts of events.

item.title: Restaurant Boathouse
item.description: BoatHouse is a fresh summer restaurant, offering a relaxed atmosphere and good summer food. The Boathouse kitchen offers seasonal treats with flavours from the New World. The connection ferry to Liuskasaari leaves from Merisatama. It is located between restaurant Carusel and Kompassi pier. The return ticket can be charged with the restaurant bill. There is also connecting bridge between Liuskasaari and Uunisaari.
item.matko:location: Located on the isle of Liuskasaari off Kaivopuisto shore. City centre 15 min, airport 45 min.
item.matko:open: 1.5.-26.9.2015 Mon-Sat 17-24, Sun 12-18 (Lazy Sunday Brunch 7.6.-16.8.2015). Saturdays are usually booked for private occasions.
item.matko:groups: Groups max 200 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant's capacity for sit-down functions is max 200 people.

item.title: Restaurant Bollis
item.description: The restaurant is situated in the Sonera Stadium.

item.title: Restaurant Café Chapman
item.description: In the daytime Café Chapman, which is close to the Visitors Centre, is a good spot for lunch for the whole family. The pleasant courtyard terrace is an ideal place to enjoy refreshments.
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair accessible, handicap toilet. There are many cobbled sections of road on Suomenlinna, where it can be somewhat difficult to move around in a wheelchair or with a stroller.

item.title: Restaurant Cantina West
item.description: The Cantina West has been the flagship of tex-mex food culture in Finland since it was opened in 1990. Good food, friendly service, music and relaxed atmosphere are both characteristic and important to the restaurant. The kitchen prepares mexican delicacies always from fresh ingredients.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Restaurant Carelia
item.description: An international restaurant situated in a former farmacy. The menu seeks its inspiration from different parts of Europe and combines this with fresh Finnish ingredients. The clientele is influenced by the National Opera which is situated opposite of the restaurant. Table reservatios are highly recommended.

item.title: Restaurant China
item.description: Restaurant China is the first Chinese restaurant in Helsinki and was founded in 1973. It is specialized in the cantonese kitchen of South-China and has 65seats. Situated in the city centre, on Annankatu, this restaurant offers also north Sze-Chen delicacies and a special menu for asian travellers. Lunch Mon-Fri 11-15.
item.matko:groups: Special menu for asian travellers. Special offers for school groups.

item.title: Restaurant Copas y Tapas
item.description: Family owned and run restaurant concentrating in local produce in the spirit of "cocina de mercado" - market kitchen.

item.title: Restaurant Demo
item.description: Demo serves their guests high class home made food combined with personal and friendly service. Demo is owned by two talented chefs Tommi & Teemu. Their goal is to offer a change to top quality dining, in a relaxed and cozy environment. Restaurant Demo was chosen as restaurant of the year 2006 by The Gastronomic Association of Finland. In 2007 the restaurant received its first Michelin star.
item.matko:groups: There are 46 seats in the restaurant, but by table arrangements max 50 people
item.matko:services: In the restaurant there are generally 46 seats, but by special arrangements 50 seats.

item.title: Restaurant Elite
item.description: Elite has been a unique cultural restaurant and living room for artists since its establishment in 1932. Actors, musicians, authors, dancers and artists have enjoyed themselves for years here in the theatre of real life. Paintings by some of its artist patrons can be admired on the walls of the Elite. The Finnish-international restaurant serves eg. sirloin steak with creamed onion à la Tauno Palo (inspired by the famous Finnish actor), vorschmack and creamy "pyttipannu".
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-140 persons

item.title: Restaurant Farang
item.description: Farang is a restaurant which serves modern Asian cuisine, located within the premises of the historical Kunsthalle Helsinki. Farang offers unique and fresh flavors from Southeast Asia. Farang's simplified, modern and atmospheric decor combined with the warm service and strong expertise in Asian cuisine creates an excellent setting for a comprehensive dining experience. The restaurant's versatile dining areas can easily be arranged to accommodate various kinds of events.
