item.matko:open: Tue-Fri Lunch menu 11.30 am-1.30 pm (kitchen will be closed for new orders at 1.30 pm) Tue-Sat Dinner menu 5 pm-midnight (kitchen will be closed at 10 pm) Sun closed Mon closed

item.title: Restaurant Gaijin
item.description: Restaurant Gaijin is Tomi Björck and Matti Wikberg's second restaurant. Gaijin takes you on a journey to North Asia. Located in an excellent spot on the corner of Bulevardi and Yrjönkatu, the restaurant opened its doors in April of 2011. Gaijin offers unique flavors by combining traditional Japanese and Korean dishes with dishes from the North of China, in a modern way. The restaurant's facilities are suitable for various kinds of events and gatherings. The dining room has a warm intimate atmosphere suitable for a private dining experience, whilst the bar is a relaxed lounge area with long communal tables and a sunny terrace which offers something for everyone.
item.matko:open: MONDAY (no lunch) 5pm - 10pm Dinner menu 5pm - 00 TUESDAY 11.30am - 00 Lunch 11.30am - 1.30pm Dinner menu 5pm - 10pm WEDNESDAY - THURSDAY 11.30am - 00 Lunch 11.30am - 1.30pm Dinner menu 5pm - 10.00pm FRIDAY 11.30am - 00 Lunch 11.30am - 1.30pm Dinner menu 5pm - 10.00pm SATURDAY (no lunch) 5pm - 00 Dinner menu 5pm - 10.00 SUNDAY (no lunch) 5pm - 10pm Daily menus (3/6 dishes)

item.title: Restaurant GLO Art Kitchen
item.description: New Restaurant GLO Art Kitchen is situated in the 100-year-old cellar of a magnificent Art Nouveau building. The restaurant serves food focusing on Nordic ingredients: high quality meat, Finnish fish and classic burgers. GLO Art Kitchen suits perfectly for private occasions and parties. Its two separate meeting rooms can host a cozy dinner for 10 as well as a bigger party for over 20 guests.

item.title: Restaurant Graniittilinna
item.description: Situated in Hakaniemi, restaurant Graniittilinna is the newest addition to the already renowned and loved Marco Polo and Juttutupa. Located directly adjacent to Marco Polo, Graniittilinna offers exquisite a la carte dishes based on traditional Finnish fare using local ingredients. In addition to its extensive a la carte menu, Graniittilinna provides its customers with weekly-changing lunch menus, along with a superior selection of fine wines. HelsinkiMenu is served here. The restaurant was voted HelsinkiMenu restaurant for the year 2005.
item.matko:open: Mon 11-22, Tue-Thu 11-23, Fri 11-24, Sat 14-24, Sun closed

item.title: Restaurant Grotesk
item.description: Restaurant Grotesk was opened in November 2007 by Teemu Aura and Tommi Tuominen who also own the Michelin-star rated restaurant Demo. Situated in a great place, Grotesk offers something for everyone: excellent and bubbly drinks for the thirsty as well as tasty food for the hungry. Michelin Bib Gourmand honourable mention.
item.matko:open: Tue-Fri 11.30-14 and 17-24, Sat 17-24. Bar: Tue-Sat from 16.

item.title: Restaurant Haaga Inn
item.description: Pop in for a cup of coffee or stay a bit longer enjoying tasty food. The Best Western Hotel Haaga restaurant Haaga Inn offers one a trendy and cosy atmosphere which is designed to make one feel comfortable and welcomed. Lunch on weekdays 11-14. Helsinki Menu is served here.
item.matko:location: In Haaga, city centre 10 min, airport 20 min
item.matko:services: Banquet restaurant, conference facilities and sauna department with 4 saunas and a swimming pool.

item.title: Restaurant Havis
item.description: Havis is a restaurant specialized in fish and crustacean. The menu includes also vegetarian and meat dishes daily. The restaurant has three different sides: traditional Havis with 54 seats, modern/relaxed Kitchen with 32 seats and an outdoor terrace in summer with 40 seats. Havis was voted 'Best Helsinki Menu Restaurant' in both 2006 and 2007.
item.matko:location: Next to the South Harbour
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-80

item.title: Restaurant Helkan keittiö- Helka's kitchen
item.description: Helkan Keittiö - Helka's Kitchen - is inspired by Finnish design and nature. In addition to stylish surroundings the restaurant is centered upon tasty dishes which are prepared to honour Finnish ingredients and dishes.
item.matko:groups: Ask for an offer for group dining

item.title: Restaurant Helmi
item.description: Restaurant Helmi, founded in 1993, is a cozy and comfortable restaurant with a DJ on weekends, who plays music until four in the morning for all the night people.

item.title: Restaurant Hima & Sali
item.description: Hima & Sali restaurant at the Cable Factory offers a wide variety of lunches Mon-Fri and the café is open until the evening also at weekends. The premises are available, by agreement, from weekday afternoons until late at night and weekends, even round the clock. We don't charge rent at all for use of the main festive hall when booked in conjunction with other orders. The unique Sali Hall is an almost ten-metre-high Dining Hall in an old cable factory. Clean-lined furniture and an easily adaptable space make this an excellent venue for dinner for a few dozen people or 250-person banquette. The DIning Hall can cater for up to 150 seated dinner guests.
item.matko:groups: Groups by appointment.
item.matko:services: Catering service

item.title: Restaurant Janoinen Lohi
item.description: The famous Janoinen Lohi (the thirsty salmon) is a cozy beer restaurant with a relaxed atmosphere. Good for different kinds of occasions and events.

item.title: Restaurant Juttutupa
item.description: With a warm and relaxed pub-style atmosphere, Juttutupa combines bohemian flair and age-old tradition in Art Nouveau settings.

item.title: Restaurant Juuri
item.description: Authentic flavours, wanton passion, wild herbs, crazy ideas, love for artisan produce and the skill to make incredibly tasty food. This is what Juuri is made of.
item.matko:services: Catering.

item.title: Restaurant Kaisaniemi
item.description: Restaurant Kaisaniemi, founded in 1827, is one of the oldest restaurants in Finland. It is located in the Kaisaniemi park, just a few minutes away from the main railway station. Kaisaniemi's customers have included such distinguished Finns as poet Eino Leino, field marshal C. G. Mannerheim, poet J. L. Runeberg, writer Z. Topelius and composer Jean Sibelius. Today, a secret passage used by Mannerheim can still be found in the Marski Room. Also suitable for meetings and conferences.
item.matko:location: City centre 0,5 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 11-22, Sun 12-20, open also on request at other times.
item.matko:groups: Good venue for group lunches, dinners and functions with organised programme. Groups max 250-400 depending on the occasion.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: 350-870 seats

item.title: Restaurant Kappeli
item.description: The Kappeli restaurant serves classical Finnish dishes with140 years worth of experience. The dining room has a unique atmosphere and is at once cosy and stylish, comprising the beauty of Esplanadi park, the spaciousness of the glass veranda and the dignified essence of the house. The café is a traditional meeting place offering sweets and salty snacks, as well as a good selection of beers and wines. The bar is the oldest part of Kappeli and a good place to meet and relax after work.

item.title: Restaurant Kiltakellari
item.description: The restaurant occupies the old brewery founded by Nikolai Sinebrychoff on the Bulevardi in 1819. The building has since been modernised, but with full respect for the old milieu and retaining the sturdy pillars and old brick walls. The main hall is reached via a narrow vaulted passageway. Fully licensed, full-service catering for conferences, private occasions and dinners for up to 250. Also lunches.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 20 km
item.matko:groups: Only by appointment
item.matko:services: 3 cabinets for 12, 10 and 6 persons

item.title: Restaurant Kokki
item.description: Restaurant Kokki is the training restaurant of the hotel, restaurant and catering-students at Helsingin palvelualojen oppilaitos- Helsinki City College of Culinary Art, Fashion and Beauty . The facilities can be used for many purposes. 120 seats and a cabinet for 8 persons. HelsinkiMenu is served Tue-Fri.
item.matko:location: City centre 9 km, airport 23 km. In Roihuvuori
item.matko:open: During the school year Mon-Fri 11.15 - 14.00, at other times by request only (closed in Summer).
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Kokki is the training restaurant of the hotel, restaurant and catering students at Helsingin palvelualojen oppilaitos - Helsinki City College of Culinary Art, Fashion and Beauty.
item.matko:additionalinfo: All conference facilities are equipped with modern conference equipment. Conference facilities are open by agreement. Also sauna facilities available for 10 persons.

item.title: Restaurant Kolme Kruunua
item.description: Interior from the 1950s and traditional Finnish cuisine such as meatballs, "Pyttipannu" ('hash') and fried Baltic herrings.
item.matko:open: Restaurant: Mon-Thu 16-01, Fri-Sat 16-03 and Sun 14-01. Kitchen: Mon-Sat 16-24, Sun 14-23.

item.title: Restaurant Koto
item.description: Traditional Japanese restaurant.

item.title: Restaurant Kuu
item.description: Established in 1966 restaurant Kuu has offered classics carefully prepared from Finnish ingredients and offers Finnish cuisine with a modern twist. The atmosphere is suitable for a business lunch or for an intimate dinner. A wide selection of own imported, pure and interesting wines. Exellent location close to National Opera and Helsinki Music Centre. 60 seats, in summetime also 30 outdoors. Awarded as the best HelsinkiMenu restaurant in 2009.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 11.30-24, Sat 14-24, Sun 14-22. Kitchen closes one hour prior to closing time.
item.matko:groups: Groups for max. 40 persons at the same time

item.title: Restaurant Lappi
item.description: The first Lapland style restaurant in the heart of Helsinki. "Kelonkolo" Bar is a quaint bar situated to the front of the restaurant. Menu available in 11 languages.

item.title: Restaurant Lasipalatsi
item.description: Restaurant Lasipalatsi is restored honouring the Functionalism style of the 1930's and the atmosphere is therefore unique. Voted best HelsinkiMenu restaurant in 2001. The restaurant serves HelsinkiMenu. In addition to popular classics, Restaurant Lasipalatsi serves seasonal delicacies at their best. The chefs take great pride in ensuring that guests can always enjoy fresh, domestic fish, cheeses and berries. The Lasipalatsi building, also home to the film theatre Bio REX, offers an excellent functionalist style backdrop for various social receptions. In addition to a well-lit functionalist style dining hall, three quiet cabinets can be rented for events ranging from breakfast meetings to gala dinners. The stylish and welcoming Aquarium cabinet, Helsinki cabinet and the Winter Garden with its real palm trees offer sit-down meals for groups from 10 to 60. The private function rooms have windows and their interiors match the restaurant.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 4 cm) along the path, essential access, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted.
item.matko:groups: max 100 in restaurant, altogether (restaurant + cabinets + Winter garden) = 200

item.title: Restaurant Lehtovaara
item.description: Restaurant Lehtovaara is one of the most traditional restaurants in Helsinki. It was founded in Helsinki in 1940. The Restaurant Lehtovaara has earned a reputation over the decades as a fine establishment for Finnish and international cuisine. Restaurant Lehtovaara has received several acknowledgements, e.g. the Rôtisseur-shield in 2002. 120 seats. Also a popular glass terrace that is open all year round. The restaurant also serves the HelsinkiMenu.

item.title: Restaurant Loiste
item.description: The Restaurant Loiste is a warm-spirited restaurant in the very heart of Helsinki. The restaurant, situated on the 10th floor, is suitable for lunch as well as for a la carte dinner. You can also sit outside and enjoy the spectacular views from the Loiste's terrace, one of the city's most magnificent locations all through the year, original wooden interior is also noteworthy.
item.matko:location: City centre
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The Loiste's beautiful private dining rooms are excellent locations for conferences, meetings and all kinds of private parties or banquets. The magnificent views add the final touch to a successful meeting and pleasant evening. Private dining rooms 1-3 can be combined to form a single large space. An overhead projector, screen, flap chart, video projector, DVD player, video recorder and cordless microphone can be obtained for all meeting rooms.

item.title: Restaurant Lyon
item.description: Restaurant Lyon is a traditional French-style restaurant situated opposite the National Opera. Voted 'Restaurant of the Year' in 1996 by the Finnish Gastronomy Association. Lyon was also voted 'Best HelsinkiMenu Restaurant' in 2003.

item.title: Restaurant Meripaviljonki
item.description: Meripaviljonki represents the top quality of the Finnish kitchen. The restaurant favours domestic seasonal products, without forgetting the Nordic flavours. Fresh seafood is available every day, and the kitchen pays close attention to the changing seasons. In the summer the restaurant focuses on fresh vegetables, berries as well as classic fish and crayfish delicacies. The building's shape and glass walls allow customers to enjoy the surrounding scenery and natural light from morning till night. Meripaviljonki is open year round, seven days a week.

item.title: Restaurant Meritorppa
item.description: Restaurant Meritorppa is situated in Hilton Helsinki Kalastajatorppa's Seaside Wing, on the ground floor. The restaurant seats approx. 80 persons. There is also a separate cabinet for 20persons. A magnificent sea view from both the restaurant as well as the outdoor terrace (in summer). Meritorppa serves both Finnish and international cuisine and a wide range of wines.

item.title: Restaurant Messenius
item.description: Restaurant Messenius is a traditional restaurant, founded in 1937.
item.matko:location: In Töölö

item.title: Restaurant Mestaritalli
item.description: Mestaritalli is a traditional summer restaurant. The summer season begins at the end of April and continues until autumn. The restaurant has a summer terrace with a seaview with 200 seats. Located in a beautiful park, the restaurant is popular especially for weddings. Not to forget the Meritalli, partly buildt on the sea, which is popular among sunloving, thirsty people. Mestaritalli is open all year and serves regular guests on weekdays and private occasions on weekends.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, one step, Inva-WC, lighting intensity 50-150 lux.
item.matko:groups: Group menus, Restel Tapahtumaravintolat sales, tel. +358 (0)9 733 5814, e-mail: ravintolat.mestaritalli@restel.fi
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Mestaritalli is perfect for different occasions. It is possible to have seats for 150 persons in main hall and in the cabinet for is suitable for up to 40 persons, however 5-22persons is recommended. The cabinet is also perfect for a small private party.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Parking for 30 cars.

item.title: Restaurant Muru
item.description: Restaurant and wine bar, there ingredients for the food are seasonal, pure and simple.

item.title: Restaurant NJK
item.description: The villa-type restaurant, located on the small island of Valkosaari, was built in 1900. It is one of the most popular locations for festivities during the summer season, as well as one of the most popular crayfish restaurants in town - and a wonderful setting for a tasty meal. The tall, spacious hall is surrounded by a bright covered veranda with large windows and a view of the Market Square and Katajanokka. The connection ferry departs from Valkosaari pier close to the Olympic terminal.
item.matko:open: Open in the summer from 5.5.2015 Mon-Sat 17.00-24.00 (on Saturdays there are often private occasions), Sun closed.
item.matko:groups: Groups max 170 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The yacht club restaurant is located in the heart of seaside Helsinki. Restaurant is wonderful for both large and small occasions. The restaurant can hold up to 200-300 guests and function rooms can also be used separately by smaller parties. The Club function room is suitable for smaller private occasions.

item.title: Restaurant Nokka
item.description: Every visit to a restaurant holds a story. A unique series of events which are created of details, also those invisible ones. However, the most important ones are those hand-picked, high quality ingredients. In Restaurant Nokka the story is influenced by chef Ari Ruoho and his pure ingredients. The duck is from Alhopakka, the ceps come from the known pickers and the lamb from Bovik, Snappertuna. The eagerness of each producer, subjective responsibility and the ethical level of the whole occupation indeed shows - and tastes. Nokka was voted 'Best Helsinki Menu Restaurant' in 2002, 2008 and 2011 and also 'The Best Restaurant in Helsinki' in 2012.
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-90 people

item.title: Restaurant Nuevo
item.description: Nuevo is situated in a peaceful street in the heart of Helsinki between the Market Square and Senate Square. Nuevo's decor and profile is modern, and it has a pleasant bar. The homely atmosphere is perfect for an exploration of the world of Spanish food and wines. The kitchen is inspired by the gastronomic regions of Spain, with regularly changing themed menus providing variety throughout the year.
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-54 people

item.title: Restaurant Olo
item.description: Olo is a modern Nordic gourmet cuisine restaurant at the heart of Helsinki. Olo's kitchen represents the modern Nordic cuisine, where traditional raw materials of the North are well-respected. The cuisine aims to offer clarity of design and generous flavours as known from our grandmothers' times. The menu follows the yearly cycle of the Nordic nature, bringing to the table only what is at best at a given time. The natural and clean flavours of land and sea reign in Olo's kitchen. The restaurant has had a Michelin star since the year 2011.
item.matko:services: Olo is also a wine cabinet and olo cabinet, perfect for private and business-related arrangements.

item.title: Restaurant Palace
item.description: Restaurant Palace is a first class restaurant in Helsinki. Get a taste of classic 50's feel and enjoy the most beautiful sea view in Helsinki. Restaurant Palace is located on the 10th floor of a historical building designed for the Helsinki Olympics in 1952. In addition to the à la carte restaurant, Restaurant Palace offers private rooms for meetings and events for up to 500 guests. In the Restaurant Palace of today, traditions come together with new trends and innovations. The menu includes deliciously creative dishes which are prepared using the finest Finnish ingredients of the current season. Chef de Cuisine Lasse Koistinen leads the restaurant with an innovative touch. The selection of wines is in a league of its own: over the years the wine cellar has been filled with carefully selected first-rate wines.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:groups: The maximum capacity for groups is 220 pax seated in round tables in Suurkonferenssisali
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Restaurant Palace has 70 seats and offers the best of Finnish and Scandinavian cuisine.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Organize unforgettable summer parties at Restaurant Palace's 10th floor! Invite your friends and family to enjoy a unique restaurant experience with the best sea view of Helsinki. Weddings, graduation parties, birthdays... Anything you want to celebrate! Restaurant Palace offers two different summer celebration packages, both of which include facilities in Merisali and a private terrace with a beautiful sea view, sparkling wine, and swinging background music. When the weather is sunny, you can enjoy the sunshine until the late evening at the terrace. Restaurant Palace is especially famous for the best crayfish parties and August's kickoff parties in Helsinki.

item.title: Restaurant Pihlajasaari
item.description: Restaurant Pihlajasaari is located on Pihlajasaari island, only 10 minutes by boat from Kaivopuisto. The island is one of the most popular summer oases. The fully-licenced café-restaurant of the island has served customers for over 80 years in an 120-year-old wooden villa called Villa Hällebo. Restaurant Pihlajasaari has 190 seats, 90 of which inside the villa and the rest on two outside terraces. There is an excellent view of the open sea from the front terrace situated on natural rock whereas from the smaller terrace there is a nice view of Helsinki. The restaurant provides Finnish specialities, e.g. smoked salmon from the own smokery and home made doughnuts. Private occasions can be arranged on request. The connection ferry to Pihlajasaari leaves from Merisatamanranta behind Cafe Carusel and also from Ruoholahti. On the island there is a boat harbour for those who come with their own boat.
item.matko:location: Restaurant Pihlajasaari is located on the island of Pihlajasaari in front of Helsinki near Kaivopuisto
item.matko:open: Current opening hours on the restaurant's website.

item.title: Restaurant Pyysaari
item.description: Restaurant Pyysaari is a legendary island restaurant that opened during the olympic games in Helsinki in 1952 in order to take care of the international participants of the sailing competitions. The restaurant has been open every summer since then. It is possible to reach the island both by ferry or bus. The ferries depart from Laajasalo and Kulosaari, and there is a guest pier for private boats on the north side of the island. The bus 88 departing from Herttoniemi metro station stops by the Tuulisaari park from which it is possible to walk to the island.

item.title: Restaurant Pääposti
item.description: The Pääposti Restaurant and its conference facilities are situated right in the heart of the city centre: the main railway station, Kiasma Museum of contemporary Art, Sanoma House and Sokos department store around the main Post office in the busy downtown district. Under the glass ceiling of the restaurant, it is possible to enjoy a variety of truly memorable parties.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 18 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Restaurant is perfect for various theme parties and formal dinner banquets. Cocktail parties for up to 400 persons and dinners/lunches for up to 225 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Restaurant 578m2 with a small hall 34m2.

item.title: Restaurant Rivoli
item.description: Rivoli is a french restaurant that is specialized in fish and shellfish dishes. Specialties from the Finnish and French cuisines during lunch, dinner and Saturday brunches. Business meetings and private events can be organized as well.

item.title: Restaurant Saari
item.description: Restaurant Saari is located on the Sirpalesaari island just a short distance from the city centre. The restaurant provides Finnish and archipelago specialities as well as magnificent views of the Gulf of Finland. On Sundays brunch is served. The restaurant can also be booked for bigger private parties. A boat connection is available from Merisatama pier. The crossing (about 200 m) takes just a few minutes. It is also possible for quests to arrive with their own boats.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, airport 23 km
item.matko:open: Current opening hours from the restaurant's own websites.
item.matko:disabled: Stairs to the boat, assistant and lifting needed. An asphalted, evenly rising walk from the pier to the restaurant. Access with wheelchair to the outdoor terrace, bar Pursi and the private room Sampo. Stairs to the restaurant. No Inva-WC.
item.matko:groups: Groups max 200 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Finnish restaurant, summer restaurant, open 30.4.-30.9., dining room 180 seats, Belvedere balcony 22 seats, private room Sampo for 12 persons, Jacht bar for 25 persons, outdoor terrace for 75 persons. A la carte, dinners, lunches for groups, private parties, crayfish parties, food prepared using only Finnish ingredients, boat connection 200 m/3 min.

item.title: Restaurant Saaristo
item.description: Restaurant Saaristo is a beautiful summer restaurant, located on a small island "Luoto - Klippan" near Kaivopuisto. During summer, restaurant Saaristo operated by A&S Restaurants offers high-quality lunch and á la carte dinner as well as seasonal specialities. Ferry from the pier close to the Olympic terminal.
item.matko:location: Located on the islet Luoto off Kaivopuisto shore. City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:groups: Groups max 400 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant's capacity for sit-down functions is max 430 people. As a venue for summer weddings and other summer parties, Luoto is one of Helsinki's best.

item.title: Restaurant Salutorget
item.description: Restaurant Salutorget opened in May 2009 next to the Market Square in the oldest genuine bank hall in Finland designed by Emil Fabritius. Salutorget is a restaurant complex with a restaurant and bar.

item.title: Restaurant Saslik
item.description: Saslik, the most legendary restaurant in Finland, has honourably cherished the food tradition and the atmosphere of the Czarist era since 1972. In over 40 years Saslik has grown from a restaurant to a landmark. Among both Finns and foreign guests, the restaurant is one of the best-known restaurants in Finland and a sight in itself. Uniquely decorated milieu together with Czarist hospitality and food culture offer unforgettable experiences for all senses. Saslik's à la carte menu includes classics of the Russian cuisine as well as classics and novelties of the House. Restaurant is also world famous for its exotic bear dishes, which are served the year round. Russian specialities can also be found on restaurant's drink list.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km (trams 3B, 3T, 10), airport 21 km
item.matko:disabled: Access by wheelchair. No separate Inva-WC. Toilets not possible to access by wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-230 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Russian restaurant, 230 seats, 2 dining rooms & 8 private rooms for 2-50 persons, meetings, lunches, dinners, private parties, à la carte, live Russian music (Wed-Sat nights), open on Sundays, special dinners for private groups: Catherine the Great party.

item.title: Restaurant Sasso
item.description: Genuine tastes, good company and a classy milieu. The bounty of the modern kitchen reflects the fantastic gastronomic traditions of Northern Italy. In Sasso the food is served in a relaxed style, in the Northern fashion.
item.matko:location: In the centre, 19 km to the airport
item.matko:groups: Groups 2-92 people

item.title: Restaurant Savotta
item.description: Savotta's authentic logging site atmosphere and distinctive servings are both inspired by the rich Finnish forests, thousands of lakes, the world famous Finnish "sisu" and strong traditions. The à la carte menu includes Finnish fishes, game specialities and traditional Finnish dishes. All dishes are prepared by our chefs using only the finest Finnish ingredients. The restaurant has 60 seats downstairs, 12 seats in the upstairs private room and 40 seats in the outdoor summer terrace. Savotta is located in the center or Helsinki - by the Senate Square, opposite side of the Cathedral. Restaurant is open every day of the year.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 30 min
item.matko:open: Mon-Sat 12-23, Sun and Public Holidays 17-22 Savotta is open daily, also during Christmas and Midsummer.
item.matko:groups: Groups max 70 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Finnish restaurant, 70 seats, summer terrace for 40 persons, dowstairs dining room for 60 persons, a private room for 12 persons, à la carte, dinners, lunches, private parties, food prepared using only Finnish ingredients.
item.matko:services: 70 seats, approx. 50 downstairs and approx. 20 upstairs. There is also a summer terrace with 40 seats.

item.title: Restaurant Savoy
item.description: Restaurant Savoy has been at the very top of Helsinki's restaurant scene since the 1930's. Field marshal Mannerheim (or "Marski") was among the most well-known regulars, and his favorite dishes can still be found on the menu - from the vorschmack and pike perch a la Mannerheim to his filled-to-the-rim favorite shot. The milieu created by world-renown architect Alvar Aalto sets the scene for an elegantly timeless dining experience. Savoy was chosen Restaurant of the year 2007 by La Société des Gastronomes Finlandais.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:groups: Groups max 100 people
item.matko:additionalinfo: Restaurant Savoy is also a popular location for special occasions. The second floor is reserved exclusively for private parties - from intimate soirees to press/educational conferences, and even receptions of up to 120 people. There are six private rooms of a variety of size, that can also be opened up into a single space.

item.title: Restaurant Savu
item.description: Restaurant Savu, situated on Tervasaari Island, next to Kruununhaka, is located in building built in 1805 as a tar storage. At Savu all appetizers and main courses are smoked with various methods or seasoned with smoke aromas. The dining room seats 90 guests and in the storehouse loft there are two private rooms for 32 and 28 persons. In summer, the outdoor terrace seats 170 persons and on the storehouse balcony there are some smaller tables for 2 persons. The historical storehouse provides a unique milieu for meetings and bigger private events.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:groups: Groups max 90 people

item.title: Restaurant Seurasaari
item.description: Taste some of the delicious sandwiches, salads and pastries available at the cafe or enjoy the sea view on the outdoor terrace. At the old ball room "1890" & cabinets also delicious à la carte specialities are offered in a unique restaurant milieu. Restaurant Seurasaari was elected the HelsinkiMenu restaurant of year 2012.
item.matko:open: Café open from 1.9. Sat-Sun 11-17. The restaurant is open only for orders during the winter season.
item.matko:groups: Groups 100-500 people depending on the occasion

item.title: Restaurant Sipuli
item.description: The Sipuli Restaurant is set in a restored brick warehouse. The kitchen at Sipuli Restaurant is renowned for its combination of Nordic traditions and new international cuisine. The restaurant has a versatile facilities which makes it one of the most popular choices for conferences and banquets in Helsinki. Rooms can be combined to meet specific needs and spacious banquet hall is fully equipped for meetings, conferences and corporate training events. The large and bright Winter Garden can accommodate even the largest banquets and cocktail parties.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 8 cm) along the path, essential access, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted.
item.matko:groups: Groups are requested to order a single set menu five business days before their reservation. Groups max 320 people.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Á LA CARTE: The spacious à la carte restaurant with an open kitchen is located at the heart of Restaurant Sipuli. A large skylight window offers a splendid view of Uspenski Cathedral. Max. seats for 110 persons. Suitable for private lunch and dinner parties 50-100 persons. WINTERGARDEN: Complete with a glass ceiling, stretches for over 400 m2. It provides an excellent setting for special occasions. THE BANQUET HALL: Built in the spirit of the old storehouses it now replaces - a spacious and versatile hall for meetings and banquets. BAR KANAVA: Bar Kanava with its maritime atmosphere provides a comfortable street level space for more informal gatherings for 30-110 persons. PRIVATE ROOMS II-FLOOR (4): Private rooms decorated in light colours separated only by partition walls can easily combined into one 98 m2 hall.

item.title: Restaurant Skiffer
item.description: The trendy restaurant Skiffer combines dining, great drinks and ultimate comfort into one perfect package. The unique atmosphere consists of modern design and traditional maritime elements.
item.matko:open: Open every day in the summer from 1.5.

item.title: Restaurant Skiffer Erottaja
item.description: Restaurant Skiffer offers delicious pizzas baked in a stone oven and is located at the heart of the design district next to the Diana Park. The restaurant has also a carefully selected list of European wines.

item.title: Restaurant Spis
item.description: Restaurant Spis is a 18-seat Nordic restaurant. The food that Spis prepares uses the freshest Nordic ingredients. The menu is based around vegetables but Spis always offers at least one fish and meat entré. The Gastronomic Association of Finland chose Spis as the Restaurant of the Year 2015.

item.title: Restaurant Sundmans Krog
item.description: Situated on the ground floor of the Sundmans building opposite the Old Market Hall, Sundmans Krog is an ideal venue for get-togethers, parties and fine dining. The atmosphere is pleasantly relaxed, and the menu features exquisite seafood as well as international dishes. With its central location, Sundmans Krog is a nice place to eat and meet friends. The restaurant also features the Helsinki Menu.

item.title: Restaurant Sunn Senaatintori
item.description: Continental restaurant. Three reception rooms and three private rooms reserved for private use.
item.matko:location: In the Kiseleff house, in the city center.
item.matko:groups: Special group menus (seversal dishes), also buffet available

item.title: Restaurant Suomenlinna Brewery
item.description: Restaurant Suomenlinna and the Brewery pub in the Jetty Barracks welcome you to taste local beers next to the ferry harbour. Built in 1870, the arched dining room offers possibilities for events such as banquets, cocktail parties and conferences. Conference room with sea view. Additional space in the sunny garden during the summer months.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, with a ferry boat 15 minutes from the Market Square, airport 22 km
item.matko:open: Current opening hours on the restaurant's website.
item.matko:disabled: Fully accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, easier entry from the inner yard of the building.
item.matko:groups: Open for groups outside opening hours.

item.title: Restaurant Suomenlinnan Upseerikerho
item.description: The sauna at the officers' club has a lounge equipped with a fireplace. The facilities cater for a maximum of 15 people. The sauna is usually only rented to members, but on Wed-nesdays and Thursdays it is available for non-members to rent. It is possible to order food and drinks to be delivered to the sauna from the restaurant.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 22 km

item.title: Restaurant Särkänlinna
item.description: Restaurant Särkänlinna is located in a fortress on the island of Särkkä. It has beautiful views of Helsinki and the open sea. Särkänlinna is a high quality à la carte restaurant with immemorial history and an atmosphere that makes time stand still in the most pleasant of ways; here you can savour every moment. The kitchen of the Särkänlinna restaurant combines French and Finnish traditions spiced up with some Russian influences. Boats to the island depart from the Ullanlinna pier in the Kaivopuisto park.
item.matko:groups: Groups max 140 people
item.matko:restaurantinfo: 130 - 150 can be seated in the high class a la carte restaurant. In Piper Hall's restaurant open on order there is space for max. 130 people.

item.title: Restaurant Teatteri
item.description: Restaurant-club-café. Something for all hours of the day. An interesting restaurant complex, including a 22-metre-long bar.
item.matko:open: Wine & Deli: Mon-Fri 9-19, Sat 11-19, Sun closed. Teatterin Grilli Restaurant: Mon-Thu 11-24, Fri-Sat 11-01, Sun closed. Teatteribaari Bar: Mon-Thu 11-01, Fri-Sat 11-02, Sun closed. Clock Bar: Wed-Thu 22-04, Fri-Sat 19-04, Sun-Tue closed. Nightclub: Thu-Sat 23-04, Sun-Wed closed.
item.matko:groups: Groups: Wine & Deli 2-70, Teatterin Grilli 2-98, Teatteribaari 2-195, Kellobaari 2-83, Klubi 2-300 people

item.title: Restaurant Toca
item.description: Savory food and pleasurable drinks in the cozy restaurant Toca. Toca opened in May 2013 on Unioninkatu which is a quick 4 minute walk from the shops and sights on downtown Helsinki. Munch on some lunch from Tuesday trough Thursday starting at 11 am. Make a reservation for dinner which is served Tuesday through Saturday beginning at 17:30. Toca offers an eclectic taste of food and drinks.
item.matko:open: Lunch from Tue-Thu 11am-1pm, dinner Tue-Sat 17.30-23pm (kitchen open until 21pm)

item.title: Restaurant Tori
item.description: An intimate local restaurant that is always popular, especially on weekends. Serves both Finnish and international dishes.
item.matko:open: In winter Mon-Fri 11-18, Sat-Sun 12-19, in summer Mon-Fri 11-20, Sat-Sun 12-19.

item.title: Restaurant Torni
item.description: Restaurant Torni was established in 1931, the same year that the adjoining hotel was opened. The restaurant was fully renovated in 1995 in the true original classic style of the building, Finnish functionalism. Torni is known for its food, the menu features trendy dishes created using traditional Finnish ingredients. The restaurant was voted Best HelsinkiMenu restaurant in both year 2000 and 2004. Helsinki Menu is also served here. In the same building also the Ateljee Bar, very famous for its magnificent view over the city (entrance via the hotel main entrance on Yrjönkatu side)

item.title: Restaurant Troikka
item.description: Russian restaurant in the heart of the trendy Töölö district. Unique atmosphere and traditional russian dishes.
item.matko:disabled: Access by wheelchair. No separate inva-wc. Toilets not possible to access by wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: The restaurant can serve larger groups outside opening hours when requested

item.title: Restaurant Töölönranta
item.description: The Töölö Bay's unique park atmosphere combined with modern Finnish architecture and design provide very special surroundings. The Restaurant Töölönranta offers well-lighted and comfortable seating that can be flexibly arranged for special occasions. The Töölönranta is ideal for summer cocktail parties. The popular brunch is served twice on Sundays, at 12-14.30 and 15-17.30.
item.matko:location: City centre 1.5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: February: Thu-Fri 16-22, Sat 16-23, Sun 12-17.30 (brunch at 12 pm and 15 pm) March: Thu-Fri 16-22, Sat 16-23, Sun 12-17.30 (brunch at 12 pm and 15 pm)
item.matko:groups: Groups max 180 people

item.title: Restaurant Uunisaari
item.description: An attractive, fully-licensed restaurant, a café with a sun terrace and three saunas on an island just off Kaivopuisto Park. The main building was renovated in 1999 under the supervision of the National Board of Antiquities. Red brick walls creating a warm and festive atmosphere. Ferry from Merisatamantori.
item.matko:open: Exact opening hours on the restaurant's facebook site.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Dining room for 120 persons, café for 60 persons, terrace for 250 in summer
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: 2 function rooms from 18 to 100 persons
item.matko:additionalinfo: Beach and rocks popular with sunbathers, 3 saunas for 8, 10 and 15 persons

item.title: Restaurant Vespa
item.description: Vespa is an Italian restaurant in the city centre, next to the Esplanade park. The second floor restaurant has large windows towards the park. Bar & Deli on the ground floor is open from early morning until late night. From the Deli it is also possible to take away. Trattoria in the cellar is a cosy cellar restaurant which is suitable also for bigger groups. In summer season there is an additional outdoor terrace in front of the Bar & Deli.
item.matko:open: Vespa Ristorante 2nd floor: Mon 11-23, Tue-Fri 11-24, Sat 13-24, Sun 14-23. Bar & Deli: Mon 8-24, Tue-Thu 8-01, Fri 8-02, Sat 10-02, Sun 14-23. Trattoria: Tue-Sat 17-24

item.title: Restaurant Viola
item.description: The wooden Empire-style villa on Kaisaniemenranta nestles in the botanical gardens and embodies a fascinating era in Helsinki's history. Finnish vineyard products, a light summery lunch, sweet and savory baked goods, and the enchanting gardens opening up in front of you create as unique café experience. The welcoming old-world atmosphere of Viola is a lovely setting for a special occasion. Viola is in an old, neo-classical timber building that has been completely restored. It is a cozy yet festive setting that is inspiring and set in park-like surroundings. Viola has a main restaurant hall and adjoining smaller rooms that can accommodate up to 60 dinner guests at a time.
item.matko:location: A short walk from the railway station through the Kaisaniemi park

item.title: Restaurant Vltava
item.description: Czech Restaurant on several floors, good for dining and for an evening out with friends. Czech beers and food as well as a wide selection of international beers.

item.title: Restaurant Walhalla
item.description: Restaurant Walhalla is a gourmet restaurant located on the historic grounds on the fortified southern edge of the Kustaanmiekka isle, Suomenlinna. The restaurant offers, besides the beautiful surroundings of its main dining hall caponiere Delwig, also a bar, a stunning sea view terrace and the Pizzeria Nikolai. The restaurant is open from the First of May till the crayfish season in autumn. The restaurant is open for orders all year. In summertime the JT-Line waterbus takes you directly to the King's Gate, close to Walhalla. From the HKL public transport ferry pier (all year) it is an approx. 1,5km walk. Both ferries depart from the Market square.
item.matko:location: 20 minutes by boat from the Market Place
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, 3 steps, toilet for wheelchair users, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux, level differences but also ramps inside the restaurant.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Caponieres Delwig & Boije The caponiere Delwig is the beautiful main dining hall of the restaurant, its windows made out of the former loopholes. Walhallas cabinet, Boije, is located in the caponiere which it's named after. The Castle square offers more spacious surroundings for bigger celebrations. Delwig seats 180, Boije 40 and the Castle square (in tents) up to 250 diners. Please phone for further details on reservations.

item.title: Restaurant Wellamo
item.description: A charming traditional Finnish restaurant offering food for body and soul since 1975. The luch menu changes daily. The restaurant is also an art gallery.
item.matko:open: Tue-fri 11-14 and 17-23. Sat 17-23, Sun 13-20. Closed on Mondays.

item.title: Restaurant WTC Helsinki
item.description: World Trade Center Helsinki is the premier international business resource in the city center of Helsinki. The building is an old bank building which dates from 1929. Inside the building Fazer offers new restaurant, meeting and event facilities to use.
item.matko:location: In the city centre
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant offers a delicious lunch on weekdays at 11.00-13.30.

item.title: Restaurant Yläkerho/Restaurant of the Suomenlinna Petty Officers' Association
item.description: Traditional Finnish military club dating back to 1920. The summer terrace has a wonderful view of the sea and the city centre of Helsinki. There are also sauna facilities.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, airport 22 km

item.title: Restaurant Zetor
item.description: Zetor is a legendary Finnish restaurant where you sit among tractors and other countryside memorabilia. Big portions of Finnish home cooking.

item.title: Restaurant Åke
item.description: Restaurant Åke consists of two parts. Åke Bar is a relaxed bar with a wide selection of both domestic and foreign beers and ciders. Åke night-club is open on weekends and the DJ plays dance music into the small hours of the night.
item.matko:location: Vuosaaressa, keskustaan 20 min
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Ravintola Åke tarjoaa rauhallisen ja inspiroivan ympäristön kokouksille ja seminaareille. Åkessa voi yhdistää kokouspäivään ainutlaatuisen mahdollisuuden korkeatasoiseen liikuntaan tai rentouttavaan hoitoon. V.I.P. Åken saunaosastolla voi nauttia loistavista löylyistä ja siirtyminen illanistujaisiin rennompaan tunnelmaan ravintolan baariin sujuu mutkattomasti.

item.title: Restroom Karaokebar
item.description: Karaokebar build to an old public toilet.

item.title: ret&vin
item.description: Brick and mortar store specializing in Finnish retro and vintage dishes. We sell out of production items in prime condition from Finnish manufacturers: Arabia, Pentik, Kermansavi, Kupittaan Savi, Hackman, Fiskars, Iittala, Nuutajärvi Glass, Riihimäki Glass , Wiiala and Kauklahti Glass.

item.title: Riihitie block of flats
item.description: Block of flats planned by Alvar Aalto in 1952-1954.
item.matko:ingress: Block of flats planned by Alvar Aalto.

item.title: Rikhardinkatu Library
item.description: Library, exhibition hall

item.title: Ril's Shop
item.description: Ril's is a total clothing concept for a modern woman. The collection includes coordinated collections for both everyday use and celebration. The collection emphasizes timeless elegance, clear lines and modern thinking. The collection has merited several design prizes during its existence.

item.title: Ristorante Dennis
item.description: Ristorante Dennis is a cosy restaurant with delicious pizzas and pastas, á la carte dishes, tasty desserts and more. Other locations: Ristorante Dennis Kamppi Kansakoulukatu 1, 00100 Helsinki Ristorante Dennis Bulevardi Bulevardi 32, 00120 Helsinki

item.title: Ristorante Gastone
item.description: Italian restaurant in the city centre

item.title: Robert's Coffee Corner
item.description: Robert's Coffee is the largest coffee shop chain in the Nordic countries. The selection of Robert's Coffee includes original coffees, own blends, espressos, flavoured coffees, decaffeinated coffees and a wide selection of teas. Most Robert's Coffee shops also have free internet access for their customers. See more information on their website: www.robertscoffee.com
item.matko:services: Free WiFi

item.title: Roska Helsinki
item.description: Roska is a bar that is decorated with recycled materials. "Roska is pretty ugly, but not a bad choice for an evening out."

item.title: Rosso Citykäytävä
item.description: Rosso has served as an Italian-style family restaurant for over 35 years. Our delicious recipe for success is a mix of fresh, authentic Italian ingredients and a warm atmosphere.

item.title: Russian Scientific and Cultural Centre
item.description: Cultural centre presenting films, exhibitions etc.

item.title: Rutumin Kartano Ky
item.description: Rutumi Manor, originally built in 1794 evokes the spirit of the past. Manor is located 90 km from Helsinki. The hostess of the manor introduces the interesting history of the manor and after that you'll enjoy manor's traditional Finnish delicious buffet table which is served in the former bakery-room, including a shot of traditional Rutumi schnapps.

item.title: Ruutu-Rouva
item.description: High-quality vintage clothing

item.title: Ryhmäteatteri
item.description: Performances in Finnish, summer theatre in Suomenlinna.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, Inva-WC. Please notify in advance since only 2 Inva places available per performance.
item.matko:groups: School groups 10-12€.
item.matko:services: Box office open weekdays 11-14, tel. 09-718 655. Café-bar open 1 h before performances, also in interval. Coffee and pastry 3-5€. 300 seats in Pengerkatu, 450 in Suomenlinna.

item.title: Ryijypalvelu
item.description: Specialized in handmade "ryijy" wallrugs. Collection of over 200 rugs from 1700-century to modern stylings.

item.title: Rymy-Eetu
item.description: A Bayern - Finnish restaurant at Erottaja, where the music plays and the beer flows. Rymy-Eetu has live music, drink chants, retro food, good laughs, day beers and long lunches. In other words, there is a great May Day - feeling every day. Prost!
item.matko:open: Sun-Mon closed, Tue-Thu 17-02, Fri-Sat 17-04. Restaurant is closed in summer season 18.6-13.8. Summer terrace (Eteläesplanadi 24) is open from 1.5.

item.title: Rööperin taidesalonki
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: S-Galleria
item.description: Art Gallery that also have Windowgallery in Sokos department store at the center of Helsinki.

item.title: Sailor's Tears Original Vintage Store
item.description: Sailor's Tears in a small Vintage store selling handpicked unique pieces in mint condition mainly from USA.

item.title: Salvation Army Museum
item.description: The Salvation Army Museum depicts the history and present of the Finnish Salvation Army.
item.matko:open: During spring season (13.1.-26.5.2015) Tue 13-18, every month's first Saturday 11-15.

item.title: Salve
item.description: The restaurant, that has been operating already in the 19th century as a seamens bar, is nowadays a relaxed dinner restaurant where both artists, professors, businessmen as well as ordinary working people enjoy the atmosphere and classic dishes, eg. the Salve's fried herring.

item.title: Sampo Puppet Theatre
item.description: The Helsinki based Puppet Theatre Sampo was founded in 1977. Masterly use of different puppet theatre techniques combined with intensive musical presence are special characteristics of the Sampo theatrical art. High-class puppet theatre and temporary exhibitions of art and theatre puppets.
item.matko:location: Two minutes' walk from Puotila metro station.
item.matko:open: Puppe Theatre Shop open Mon-Thu 10-15, Fri 10-16.30
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, please notify beforehand tel. 09-323 6968.
item.matko:groups: School groups and guided children's groups 6€/hlö. Guide can be booked (Finnish, English, Serbo-Croatian, Czech).
item.matko:services: Café open in weekends. Plenty of free parking space. Puppet theatre material on sale.
item.matko:ingress: High-class puppet theatre and temporary exhibitions of art and theatre puppets.

item.title: Samuji Shop
item.description: SAMUJI is a new fashion label created by the former Marimekko creative director Samu-Jussi Koski. Samuji Collection comprises of two individual lines: classics and seasonals. Classics consist of timeless, high-quality garments whereas Seasonals is more experimental and trendy.

item.title: Sarjakuvakeskus (Comics Center)
item.description: Sarjakuvakeskus is an open cultural center for comics and related art. It houses a gallery, comics bookshop and a café. It also organises courses and workshops for various kinds of audiences.
item.matko:location: Sarjakuvakeskus (Comics Center) can be reached from the center of Helsinki by buses 68 and 71 (stop Kaironkatu) and trams 6 and 8 (stop Arabia).
item.matko:admission: The gallery, bookshop and cafe can be visited free of charge.
item.matko:disabled: Sarjakuvakeskus can be reached with a wheelchair. It does not have sanitary facilities suitable for wheelchair users.

item.title: Sarjakuvakeskus (Comics Center)
item.description: Sarjakuvakeskus (Comics Center) is an open cultural center for comics and art. It is located in the Arabianranta district with excellent public transport connections. Sarjakuvakeskus houses a gallery, bookshop and a little cafe. Comics courses and workshops are an integral part of its activities. The workshop rooms can be hired for private events.
item.matko:location: City centre 20 min, airport 60 min.

item.title: Satkar
item.description: Nepalese cuisine Satkar was founded in 1998 and is well known for its food and friendly service.

item.title: sato HotelliKoti Kristianinkatu
item.description: sato hotelhome is your choice when you need quality accommodation, 4 nights onwards, in downtown Helsinki. you will be living in totally renovated apartments that are fully furnished and equipped with complete kitchen. modern electronic appliances are also found from the apartments. our service includes weekly and end -of- stay cleaning, bed linen and towels, wireless internet connection.
item.matko:location: Helsingin keskusta, Kruunuhaka
item.matko:admission: Varies accoding to flat type and lengt of stay. Prices starts from 93€/ night in short accommodation in single room apartment.

item.title: SATO Hotellikoti Oy
item.description: SATO Hotelhome is your choice when you need quality accommodation, 7 nights onwards, in downtown Helsinki. You will be living in totally renovated apartments that are fully furnished and equipped with complete kitchen. Modern electronic appliances are also found from the apartments. Our service includes weekly and end-of-stay cleaning, bed linen and towels, wireless internet connection. Located in the central Kruununhaka district of Helsinki, the Kristianinkatu 11-13 building was renovated in spring 2013. All of the apartments are stylishly decorated with respect for the original spirit of the building, which was constructed in the 1930s. Click on the links above to see pictures of the apartments and their floor plans. Our service includes weekly and end-of-stay cleaning, changes of bed linen and towels as well as a free wireless internet connection. Kristianinkatu 11-13 is located in the heart of Helsinki in the peaceful Kruununhaka district, which is one of the most prestigious and sought-after areas in the city. You will find lots of small grocery shops and boutiques as well as restaurants in the neighbourhood. Helsinki's main railway station is within a pleasant walking distance and so are the city's most important attractions, such as the Helsinki Cathedral and the Market Square. Kristianinkatu also provides you with easy access to Helsinki's seaside pleasures. Read more on how to get there and local services.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 35 min
item.matko:accomodationinfo: The apartment building includes 77 apartments ranging from 27m2 up to 73,5m2 in size. Apartments feature complete kitchen and modern electronic appliances. Doors are equipped with electronic locks, thus keys are not needed.

item.title: Sauna Arla
item.description: Sauna Arla, founded in 1929, has a long tradition in public saunas in Helsinki. One of the three remaining public saunas in Helsinki the sauna is heated by natural gas and wood.
item.matko:admission: 12 €/person, students, unemployed and senior citizens 10 €, children with accompanying adult free of charge.
item.matko:services: Cupping and massage upon request. Also towels, bath whisks and refreshments available. It is possible to bring ones own refreshments.

item.title: Sauna Hermanni
item.description: Sauna Hermanni is one of the three remaining public saunas in Helsinki serving its customers since 1953. Their Iki-Kiuas stoves give you nice mellow and relaxing experience. Saunas are separate for women and men. You can rent a towel, so you don't need to bring anything but yourself. In the dressing room you can order little snacks for example toast, sausages or snack plate which includes olives, cheese, soft drinks and pickles. Reservations are not needed and you can stay in the sauna as long as you like. The Sauna Hermanni is located on Hämeentie 63, easily reacheable by bus or by tram numbers 6 and 8.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 15-20, Sat 14-18 (it's possible to enjoy the sauna still one hour after closing). Closed 1.7.-3.8.2015.
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, children 3€ (children under 12yrs free), students, senior citizens and unemployed 8€.
item.matko:groups: It is possible to hire the sauna for private occations on Fri-Sun
item.matko:services: Cupping and massage available upon request (reservations, tel.+358 (0)40 838 8963)

item.title: Sauna2 Malmi
item.description: Spacious and comfortable Sauna2 Malmi is a good place to have a bigger sauna evenings and family celebrations. Sauna2 Malmi private sauna facilities consist of a big lounge area, 2 dressing rooms, showers, bath tub and saunas.
item.matko:location: Sauna2 Malmi is located 20 minutes train ride from the Helsinki city centre. By car/taxi it is around 15 minutes ride to the Helsinki-Vantaa international airport.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: There is a set of dishes for 24 people in Sauna2 Malmi. Sauna2 tableware includes: glasses for wine, sparkling wine and cocktails, dining plates, cutlery, and serving tableware. Also available is a convection oven, coffee maker and kettle. Own drinks and food allowed. Welcome!

item.title: Sauna2 Punavuori
item.description: Sauna2 Punavuori is a suitable venue for team events and small parties around 30 guests. After sauna our quests can enjoy themselves in a jacuzzi. It is possible to bring your own food and drinks to the venue.
item.matko:location: Sauna2 Punavuori is located in the Helsinki city area, only 5-10 minutes walk from the city centre. By car/taxi it is a 20 minutes ride to the Helsinki-Vantaa international airport.

item.title: Sauna2 Tapiola
item.description: Sauna2 Tapiola facilities consist of a lounge, kitchen, big terrace and of course a spacious sauna. Tapiola's private saunas special feature is the large windows from which you can watch the scenery of Tapiola. Sauna2 Tapiola is equipped with a big negotiating table where you can also have dinners and parties.
item.matko:location: Sauna2 Tapiola is located in the Espoo city area, only 10-15 minutes car ride from the Helsinki city centre. By car/taxi it is a around 20 minutes ride to the Helsinki-Vantaa international airport.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: There is a set of dishes for 24 people in Sauna2 Tapiola. Sauna2 tableware includes: glasses for wine, sparkling wine and cocktails, dining plates, cutlery, and serving tableware. Also available is a convection oven, coffee maker and kettle. Own drinks and food allowed. Welcome!

item.title: Saunamarket Finland
item.description: Everything for the sauna.
item.matko:location: Kiseleff House

item.title: Saunas at Rastila
item.description: Rastila Camping Helsinki rents two small and cosy family saunas as well as one beach sauna. One of the family saunas is located near the seashore and can also be used as a meeting room.
item.matko:location: At Rastila Camping in Vuosaari district, Rastila metro station.
item.matko:open: For the current opening hours, please visit Rastila's homepage (the link below).

item.title: Saunasaari - Sauna Island
item.description: Saunasaari is an island reserved mainly for groups and corporate hospitality. Three "smoke" saunas.
item.matko:groups: Groups: 4-40 persons.
item.matko:services: Transport can be arranged beforehand by taxi-boat or waterbus. Refreshments to order, bathers should bring any alcoholic beverages they wish to drink.

item.title: Savoy Theatre
item.description: The Savoy Theatre, run by the City of Helsinki Cultural Office, provides a stage for numerous Finnish and foreign artists. In addition, many events of the leading City festivals are arranged at the Savoy theatre. Joint productions and the Cultural Office's own productions are also held here. Over 200 visiting performances every year. Music, dance and theatre performances. 705 seats. Exhibitions in the foyer.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:open: Box office is open during theatre season Mon-Fri 12-14.30 and 15-18, during evenings and weekends 1hour before the performance.
item.matko:disabled: Seats with wheelchair on the 5th and 6th row. Inva-WC, ramps on the stairs for the entrance to the stalls.
item.matko:services: The box office also sells all tickets sold by the Lippupalvelu (www.lippupalvelu.fi) ticket office. Restaurant Katsomo tel +358-(0)9-6128 5350 or www.royalravintolat.com.

item.title: Scandic Espoo
item.description: The hotel features 96 rooms, most of which are non-smoking. Rooms with disabled access available. Sofa beds in some rooms. Some rooms with connecting door. All rooms have wood floors, air-conditioning, TV and Radio, minibar, telephone, modem and fax points, wireless internet access, safe, ironing board and iron. Bathrooms are equipped with underfloor heating, a hairdryer and an illuminated mirror. Easy access internet point at the lobby area. 24 h SHOP at the lobby area with food & drink, books, toys, gifts, games and products to help you relax.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 13 km, airport 25 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, handicapped parking spaces 20 meters from the hotel, steep ramp in path essential for access - gradient over 40 %, doors can be opened automatically, there are no level differences or threshold at the entrance, lift; essential for access, lift doors open automatically, lift buttons are accessible from a wheelchair, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is buttons marked in Braille, but not any voice announcement in the lift), 1 inva room.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 96 rooms: 68 twin rooms, 23 double rooms and 5 single rooms.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Colonial Bar & Kitchen has 220 seats. The summer terrace provides an additional 80 seats. Part of the restaurant is separable for 80 guests, and a private room for 12 is available. Buffet Breakfast, lunch and á la carte dinner. Room Service during restaurant opening hours.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Meeting breaks at the restaurant Colonial or in the Meeting room.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Indoor swimming pool 12 m, 4 saunas, outdoor terrace. Exercise bike, stepper and rowing machine. Bikes and Nordic walking poles can be borrowed at the reception.

item.title: Scandic Grand Marina
item.description: Scandic Grand Marina presents unique architecture by the sea and charms with its milieu and scenery. Scandic Grand Marina and Marina Congress Center are located nearby the Market square and all the facilities of the Helsinki city centre are only a short walk away. Scandic Grand Marina and Marina Congress Center offer splendid settings for successful meetings, congresses and events which can be arranged for even up to 2500 persons. In our saunas you can refresh before a long day or relax after having one.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 30 min
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, handicapped parking spaces 20 meters from the hotel, steep ramp - gradient over 22,5 %, doors can be opened automatically, no threshold at the entrance, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors open automatically, lift buttons are accessible from a wheelchair, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lighting intensity 50-150 lux, 8 inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 462 rooms: 20 Economy single rooms, 332 Standard twin rooms, 64 Standard twin rooms with sofabed, 26 Superior rooms, 20 Suites.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Makasiini Restaurant & Bar: The visitor entering the Makasiini Restaurant is greeted by an enchanting early 20th century milieu and nice view of the harbour. Lobby Bar & Key West Pub.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The hotel has 6 meeting rooms, complimented by 11 more in Marina Congress Center across the street.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: See Scandic Marina Congress Center.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Meeting rooms, Hair-dresser/barber, Scandic Shop, gym, garage, self service laundry, business corner, play area, free wireless internet access.

item.title: Scandic Marina Congress Center
item.description: Scandic Marina Congress Center is a unique congress center located right in the heart of the city. Its waterfront location, only a short walk from Helsinki centre, makes Marina Congress Center an incomparable venue for conference and gala events. The magnificent sea view towards the Helsinki archipelago creates extra value throughout the year. Marina Congress Center offers 11 meeting rooms with exceptionally flexible space solutions. The facilities are ideal for hosting conferences and congresses for 10-700 persons, also exhibitions and banquets for even up to 2500 people. The meeting rooms vary from spacious halls to a private dining room with seaside view. Accommodation of meeting guests is easily arranged in Scandic Grand Marina hotel across the street.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 35 min
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, toilet for wheelchair users, parking for disabled, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted, induction loop system for people with hearing aids.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Scandic Grand Marina opposite (462 rooms and 7 conference rooms).
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The international cuisine, prompt service and delicious meals are the assets of Scandic Marina Congress Center's restaurant services. The restaurant facilities are easily adapted to suit the client's needs. For instance the Restaurant can seat up to 250 persons and the Fennia halls can seat up to 500 person. A separate Marine Room overlooking the harbor can be divided off from the Restaurant hall as a superb venue for special occasions for up to 60 persons.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: 1st floor foyer 900 m2/gross, 300 m2/net; 2nd floor foyer 730 m2/gross, 275 m2/net.

item.title: Scandic Marski
item.description: Scandic Marski, a hotel with comfortable rooms, theme restaurant, street bar and friendly service. The hotel is located right in the heart of Helsinki, in the core of the city´s business, shopping and sights. Parking space for 100 cars in its own underground garage. The hotel has seven meeting rooms, all located on the first floor, suitable for meetings with 2-160 participants or other events for up to 300 people. The hotel's gym, three saunas, their comfortable lounge and the wide roof terrace provide well-earned relaxation after a long day. The entire cultural and leisure offering of the city is within walking distance.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, handicapped parking spaces in front of the hotel, doors can be opened automatically, there are no level differences or threshold at the entrance, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; lift doors open automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lighting intensity 50-150 lux, lift buttons and buffet breakfast bar are accessible from a wheelchair, 3 inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 289 rooms: 9 rooms with private sauna ja 6 suites with city view. - 47 king superior category - 6 queen room category - 59 queen superior category - 65 twin room category - 28 twin superior category - 39 single room category - 39 family superior category - 6 junior suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Marski Restaurant offers Grill & Chill tastes in a casual atmosphere from breakfast until late at night. The restaurant has 130 seats and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Many seasonal themes are served during the year. Marski Bar, with 85 seats and Brazilian-style Cofi, with 50 seats have a casual atmosphere, versatile variety of drinks along with snacks and pastries.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Private saunas, gym, business centre, garage, Scandic SHOP, free wireless internet access.

item.title: Scandic Paasi
item.description: Scandic Paasi, conveniently situated in the Helsinki city centre, is in an attractive location by the sea and benefits from good transport links. The area has several theatres and museums that offer unforgettable experiences for all culture lovers. Helsinki's main shopping streets and restaurants are just a stone's throw away from the hotel. In addition, the hotel has two exciting restaurants of its own, each with an inimitable style.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 min, airport 25 min
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 170 rooms: 47 superior level rooms and one master suite, 11 rooms with private sauna, 43 with balcony, 16 rooms with kitchenette, all decorated in three different styles; "spectacular", "leisure" or "conscious".
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Four unique restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the congress centre: Graniittilinna, Paasiravintola, Paasin Kellari and Juttutupa.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Lobby bar, meeting rooms, well equipped gym, Scandic shop, free wireless internet access, panoramic sauna for groups, play area for children.

item.title: Scandic Park Helsinki
item.description: Scandic Park is located close to the very centre of Helsinki, facing beautiful Töölö bay. The hotel has undergone an interior transformation, uncovering a hidden urban park for guests to discover and enjoy. The hotel will deliver meetings with imagination, festive moments to remember and not least a perfect night's sleep. In January 2014 the hotel presented 232 rooms with a totally new look. The renewed meeting and banquet rooms offer ideal surroundings for meetings and celebrations of all different sizes. The entirely renovated restaurant will open on the hotel's ground level in May 2014.
item.matko:location: City Centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, 4 handicapped parking spaces in front of the hotel, disabled entrance, doors can be opened automatically, no threshold at the entrance, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors open automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lighting intensity 50-150 lux, lift buttons and buffet breakfast bar are accessible from a wheelchair, no inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 523 rooms
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Bar Continents, 120 seats: A cosy bar where one can enjoy classic cocktails, get together to discuss the day's topics after a long round of meetings and relax with a glass of beer or sparkling wine. Restaurant Lastu, 200 seats. Menu and wine list can be found at www.scandickeittio.fi.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Ballroom 511 m2, Nordica 379 m2, Fennica 230 m2.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Own Finnair/oneworld Check In, hotel packages including limousine service, Business Centre, sauna and swimming pool, well-equipped gym with Turkish sauna, Ambassador lounge exclusively for guests in Ambassador rooms.

item.title: Scandic Simonkenttä
item.description: Scandic Simonkenttä combines modern design and Scandinavian architecture. The 360 modern rooms are furnished with environmentally friendly materials, yet making no compromises on comfort. The meeting rooms, all with plenty of light and equipped with modern technology, are suitable for meetings of two up to seminars of 80 people. The meeting rooms are all located on the ground floor, except Pavilion, which is a meeting room on the top floor. All rooms have large windows on at least one wall, allowing abundant natural light. The standard equipment in all meeting rooms includes overhead projector, screen and flipchart.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:disabled: Full accessibility, doors can be opened automatically, there are no level differences or threshold at the entrance, there is a doorbell at night, which is accessible from a wheel-chair, toilet for wheelchair users, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, easy access for blind or partially sighted (there is no buttons marked in Braille or any voice announcement in the lift), lift buttons and buffet breakfast bar are accessible from a wheelchair, 5 inva rooms.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 360 rooms; 12 rooms with balcony and private sauna, 2 suites
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Simonkatu with 170 seats has a modern, young and airy interior with a relaxed international atmosphere. The restaurant offers the best of Nordic cuisine, prepared in open kitchen. The modern and airy Café Simonkatu with 100 seats serves small snacks, special coffees and cocktails. A sunny terrace with 60 seats is available in summer.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 3 saunas, gym, Scandic SHOP, business corner, free wireless internet access

item.title: Schooner Zangra
item.description: Kuunariristeilyt organise cruising trips in Helsinki area and archipelago. Schooner Zangra is a stable and confortable 57 footer oceangoing yacht, and she is designed and built in Finland. Day cruises for 12, overnight trips for 8 passangers.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Cabins for 8 people.
item.matko:services: Refresments; sandwiches, espresso, cappuccino and caffe latte for sale on board.

item.title: Schulman Antiques
item.description: Art from the 18th and 19th century, also furniture and other objects.

item.title: Sea Horse
item.description: A classic Finnish "artist haunt" restaurant serving traditional Finnish home style food. The restaurant dates back to 1934.
item.matko:groups: Max. 34 persons in Musta Hevonen cabinet, group menus available www.seahorse.fi
item.matko:services: NB! No table reservations by e-mail!

item.title: Sea Life Helsinki
item.description: Sea Life takes you on a voyage from the tropical oceans to the Arctic Sea, stopping at the Baltic Sea along the way. Discover strange and fascinating underwater worlds, home to crabs and starfish as well as sharks and rays. Visitors can step inside the ocean tank through a transparent tunnel. The exhibitions present many species whose environments are threatened by pollution and other environmental damage caused by humans. Helsinki's Sea Life is part of the pan-European Sea Life network. The aim is to enlighten visitors about the need for protecting the sea environment and the biggest threats, such as pollution and over fishing.
item.matko:location: Sealife Centre Helsinki is located next to the Linnanmäki Amusement Park. Trams 2 and 9 from city centre.
item.matko:open: Sealife is open daily (closed only on Christmas eve, and Christamas day), please see opening hours at www.sealife.fi
item.matko:admission: Adults 16,50 €, children 3-14 years 12,50 €, children under 3 years free
item.matko:disabled: Accessible with wheelchair, some hight differences along the route, an assistant might be needed. Inva-WC (in café premises) and lift.
item.matko:groups: Group reservations and guidebooking, tel.+358 (0)9 5658 200, e-mail:info@sealife.fi . Group discount available for groups over 10persons. A well equipped class room and studymaterial for school groups.
item.matko:services: Gift shop, café, parking.
item.matko:ingress: Sea Life takes you on a voyage from the tropical oceans to the Arctic Sea, stopping at the Baltic Sea along the way.

item.title: Seikkailupuisto Zippy
item.description: High tree rope park Zippy offers sports and entertainment outdoor activities right in the heart of Helsinki. Adventure park Zippy stretches over several hectares, and offers exciting courses, during which you will move from one tree to another using ropes, trapezes, swings, climbing walls, ladders and other equipment. High Tree Rope Park Zippy is great fun for the whole family, team of friends or colleagues, as our courses are suitable for people of all ages. High Tree Rope Park Zippy offers variety of courses, unique Finnish nature and guarantee of your safety!.
item.matko:open: 25.5.-16.8.2015 open Mon-Sun 10-22, 17.8.-18.10.2015 the opening hours in Fall and possible changes in the opening hours at www.facebook.fi/seikkailupuisto or www.zippy.fi.

item.title: Semifinal
item.description: Rock club and live music.
item.matko:open: Sun-Thu 20-01, Fri 21-03, Sat 20-04. Age limit 18 years.

item.title: Senate Square
item.description: The Senate Square and its surroundings form a unique and cohesive example of Neoclassical architecture. The square is dominated by four buildings designed by Carl Ludvig Engel between 1822 and 1852: Helsinki Cathedral, the Government Palace, the main building of the University of Helsinki and the National Library of Finland. Helsinki Cathedral is arguably Finland's most famous and photographed building; it celebrated its 150th anniversary in 2002. The oldest stone building in Helsinki is the Sederholm House located on the southeast corner of the square. The main building of the City Museum can be found on the Sofiankatu museum street. The Senate Square also hosts a sound installation called the Sound of the Senate Square. It is a modern version of the European glockenspiel and can be heard every day at 17:49 as it travels from one building to the next. The composition runs for 5 minutes and 18 seconds and is composed by Harri Viitanen and Jyrki Alakuijala.
item.matko:location: In the heart of the city, in the corner of Unioninkatu and Aleksanterinkatu streets.
item.matko:open: Helsinki Cathedral is open daily 9-18, in June-August daily 9-24. Closed during services.
item.matko:ingress: Unique and cohesive example of Neoclassical architecture.

item.title: Serena Ski
item.description: Serena Ski Center has five slopes with lights and a slope for children. Serena Ski Center offers a lot of challenge for more advanced skiers and snowboarders. On the Serena street you may see some of the top skiers in Finland. Some of the slopes are suitable for everyone, also for beginners. There are two street-slopes for Snowboarders and new school-skiers. Children and beginners can use two ski lifts free of charge. Serena has the only downhill ice-skating rink in Finalnd, ICDH-track. The track is suitable for beginners and enthusiasts.
item.matko:location: Serena is next to the Korpilampi Hotel, at Lahnus, Espoo, 23 km from Helsinki. Bus 339 from Helsinki bus station platform 14.
item.matko:services: Ski rental (downhill skis, cross-country skis, snowblades, snowboards and snowshoes), ski service and ski school (www.serenahiihtokoulu.com). Serena villas, completed in 2004, provide high-level accommodation facilities for tourists. Serena also rents Aurinkolampi holiday villas in the immediate vicinity of the resort. In the near future the aim is to build a full-fledged course and a training course to improve conditions for competitors. Serena Ski is hosting downhill skating World Championships in 2014.

item.title: SES Auditorio Ltd
item.description: Auditorium with 150 seats and foyer, where it is possible to arrange exhibitions and serve meals and cocktails.
item.matko:location: City centre 0.5 km, airport 35 min
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer
item.matko:additionalinfo: Technical equipment: 35 and 16 mm filmprojectors, Dolbystereo sound, data/videoprojector, VHS, Beta SP and DVD players, slide projector, overhead projector, microphones, internet connection

item.title: Seurasaari Beach
item.description: In 1906 a bathing beach was built for the citizens on the west side of Seurasaari. It still has its old look from the years back. Women and men have separate sections. Nowadays the beach is a nudist beach, but everyone can enjoy it for two days a week and on those two days a swimming suite is obligatory. The nearby rocky sand beach is also a popular place to enjoy the sun.
item.matko:services: Swimming, winter swimming, cabin, toilet, showers, kiosk. The Seurasaari Open Air museum is located on the same island.
