item.title: Seurasaari Open-Air Museum
item.description: The Seurasaari Open-Air Museum provides an insight into Finnish housing in days gone by and Finnish folk tradition. The buildings and interiors transferred to the Museum from the Finnish provinces reflect the life of crofters, peasants and gentry from the 18th to the 20th century. Guides in national costumes lead visitors back to the cottages and salons of former times.
item.matko:location: Bus 24 from Erottaja to the end of the bridge to Seurasaari or tram 4 to Pikku-Huopalahti from where a walk approx. 10 min.
item.matko:open: Outdoor museum buildings are open in winter season (15.-31.5. and 1.-15.9.) Mon-Fri 9-15, Sat-Sun 11-17, and in summer season (1.6.-31.8.) daily 11-17. Closed on Midsummer Eve 19.6. The island is open for public all year. From 15.6. to 15.8., English guidings start from the museum's ticket kiosk at 15, and they're included in the ticket price.
item.matko:disabled: Most of the inner yards of the museum buildings are accessible, but high doorsteps, stairs and dimly-lit indoors in some of the buildings can make moving about difficult.
item.matko:groups: Guide bookings by phone +358 (0)940 509 660 or by email seurasaarenulkomuseo@nba.fi.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Seurasaari (tel.+358 (0)9 626 625, www.sinunjuhlasi.fi). A beautiful, idyllic cafeteria built in 1880. Seating for 645.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Café Antin Kaffeliiteri, meals to order, seating for 50. Also Museum Shop tel. 09-4050 9662.
item.matko:services: Café Antin kaffeliiteri and museum shop, open as open-air museum. Restaurant Seurasaari (tel.+358 (0)9 626 625, www.sinunjuhlasi.fi). Also kiosks and a beach. Karuna church (inquiries from the open-air museum, tel.+358 (0)40 128 6374).
item.matko:ingress: The Seurasaari Open-Air Museum provides an insight into Finnish housing in days gone by and Finnish folk tradition.

item.title: Shaker
item.description: Shaker is a show cocktail-bar with an extensive drinklist and the best flair-bartenders in Finland. Here glasses and ice fly!

item.title: Shoes Like Candy
item.description: Shoes Like Candy is located in the heart of Helsinki, right next to Café Esplanad. In Autumn-Winter season store is filled up with warm UGG Australia shoes, gloves and scarves. In Spring-Summer season Pretty Ballerinas will impress you with magnificent and feminine ballerinas with a playful twist. See more at www.shoeslikecandy.com.

item.title: Shopping Centre Forum
item.description: The city's oldest shopping centre, Forum, was completed almost 60 years ago for the Olympics. In the last 25 years the shopping centre has developed into a block of fashion and entertainment. Todays Forum concentrates on three themes: fashion, leisure and a versatile restaurant world.
item.matko:services: Parking hall P-Forum beneath the Forum shopping centre (www.forump.com). Entrance through Simonkatu and Eteläinen- & Pohjoinen Rautatiekatu. By foot also via Forum, Stockmann and Kamppi as well as Kalevankatu 3, Urho Kekkosen katu 1 and Fredrikinkatu 42 / Malminkatu 12.

item.title: Shopping centre Ruoholahti
item.description: Shopping Centre Ruoholahti has over 20 shops and businesses under its' roof. Biggest enterprises are K-citymarket, K-rauta and Alko.
item.matko:location: Metro to Ruoholahti, bus 15A
item.matko:open: Public premises Mon-Fri 7-21, Sat 8-18, Sun 12-18, parking hall daily 6-22. Shops have own opening hours.
item.matko:services: Parking hall (over 1500 places), free parking for 3 hours for customers.

item.title: Sibelius Academy
item.description: The Sibelius Academy is the only music university in Finland and one of the biggest in Europe.

item.title: Sibelius Monument
item.description: In the Sibelius park is the world famous composer Jean Sibelius' (1865-1957) monument by Eila Hiltunen. It was unveiled 7 September 1967. The Sibelius Monument, resembling organ pipes, is made of welded steel with the bust of the composer on one side. The monument is one of Helsinki's most popular statues and one of the most well-known tourist attractions. The monument is 8,5 m high, 10,5 m wide and 6,5 m deep. It is built of over 600 pipes and weighs 24 tons.
item.matko:location: In Taka-Töölö, between Merikannontie and Mechelininkatu. Bus 24.

item.title: Sibelius Park
item.description: This park was named after Finland's greatest composer Jean Sibelius on his 80th birthday in 1945. A favourite destination for tourists is the Sibelius Monument designed by Eila Hiltunen.
item.matko:location: Mechelininkatu
item.matko:ingress: This park was named after Finland's greatest composer Jean Sibelius.

item.title: Sibelius Park Minigolf
item.description: 18 holes.
item.matko:location: Sibelius Park

item.title: Siltanen
item.description: The trendiest hipster-filled restaurant in the Kallio district.

item.title: Silvoplee
item.description: Specialized in raw unprocessed foods. Also warm vegan dishes and a new Smoothie bar & cafe.
item.matko:location: Next to Hakaniemi metro station

item.title: Sinebrychoff Art Museum
item.description: The Sinebrychoff Art Museum houses Finland's most significant collection of paintings by old foreign masters from the 14th to 19th centuries and an interior museum of Paul and Fanny Sinebrychoff illustrating Finland's connections to the centuries of tradition in European art and antiquities. Fine collection of miniatures, porcelain and silver. Also special exhibitions. The museum is a part of the Finnish National Gallery.
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 20 km.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue, Thu, Fri 11-18, Wed 11-20, Sat-Sun 10-17.
item.matko:admission: 12/10/0€. Free entrance on every month's first Wednesday 17-20.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance is located on the left-hand side of the museum building, opposite Café Fanny. Staff will accompany customers to the museum. An accessible toilet is on the first floor, close to the lift.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking, tel.+358 (0)294 500 500 (Tue-Fri 10-17). Languages Finnish, Swedish, English, German, French, Italian and Russian, also sign language and for the visually impaired.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Art Museum Sinebrychoff rents facilities both for corporate and private occasions. The arched cellar facilities (Holvisali) seat approx. 100 persons.
item.matko:services: Cafe Fanny (tel.+358 (0)50 414 3332). In the charming little museum shop you can make many great finds from the Sinebrychoff Art Museum's world.

item.title: Sinebrychoff Park
item.description: Many years ago Nikolai Sinebrychoff built a brewery and house here. For his back garden he laid out a pretty geometric park complete with ponds, an observation tower, beautiful flowers and benches to sit on. Greenhouses were added later. Today Sinebrychoff Park also has a fun playground, a public toilet and the Café Fanny.

item.title: Sinne
item.description: Sinne is a venue for Finnish and international contemporary art with a particular concentration on young and experimental art.

item.title: Sir Eino
item.description: Sir Eino is a pleasant and cosy pub next to the Esplanade park.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-24, Wed 11-01, Thu 11-02, Fri 11-03, Sat 16-03, Sun closed.

item.title: Sis. Deli + Café
item.description: Sis. Deli serves food made from local ingredients, delicious and healthy meals, also take-away. No artificial ingredients used. SIS. Deli+Cafés in Helsinki are located in Ullanlinna, Punavuori and Töölö.

item.title: Skatepark Micropolis
item.description: Micropolis is made out of granite, concrete, grass, bushes and trees. The main idea was to create a public skatepark that would offer an architectural experience for a regular citizen and would feel as a natural streetspot for a skater. Natural means that it would have its own character as permanent public space and wouldn't seem that it's built just for the skater.
item.matko:location: Trams 3T, 3B and 7A/B. Skatepark locates in the central park of Helsinki.

item.title: Sling In Bar & Cafe
item.description: This bar has got the city's longest drink list and skilled bartenders.
item.matko:address: Mikonkatu 8, 2nd floor (entr. from the inner yard)
item.matko:open: Bar: Mon-Thu 17-02, Fri-Sun 17-03. Cafe: Mon-Thu 11-18, Fri 11-02, Sat 17-02, Sun closed.

item.title: SOFiNAH
item.description: SOFiNAH Shop is packed with FiNE FASHiON STORiES! Are You on the hunt for something unique and special? SOFiNAH keeps an eye out for young, authentic labels that really stands out when it comes to good design and high quality. The handpicked selection of clothing, accessories and make up is both laid back and chic. Wardrobe favorites -with a soul. Selection includes labels such as Zoe Karssen, AIAYU, Karen Walker eyewear, Dogeared jewelry and Laboratorio olfattivo perfumes.

item.title: Sokos Department Store
item.description: Sokos offers the latest trends of the season, the most inspiring ideas and the most exhilarating fashion tips for dressing up, beauty, home and hobbies.

item.title: Solo Sokos Hotel Aleksanteri
item.description: The old building offers individual, high-quality rooms and many memorable details. For instance, the hotel boasts a Rock 'n Rose room, designed by Finnish rock music icon Remu Aaltonen, as well as burlesque art and Scandinavian design. Aleksanteri shows a classy collection of great styles. Individual, pleasantly surprising and always in tune with the times, the hotel's individual service has earned praise. The new Olipa kerran ... ('Once Upon a Time ...') restaurant features a menu of fresh, seasonal menu of delicacies honouring client wishes.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 20 km. Located in the Helsinki Design District.
item.matko:disabled: 4 rooms for disabled, washroom for disabled. Easy entrance to hotel and restaurant.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 151 non-smoking rooms of which 126 standard and 21 superior. 8 family rooms, 4 rooms for disabled.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant Fransmanni.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 1 private sauna for 12 people. Business Center, gym. Internet access through the TV set in all rooms. Alexander Theatre parking lot adjacent to hotel.
item.matko:services: The hotel houses the Olipa kerran restaurant and bar, as well as two meeting rooms. Guest sauna, gym

item.title: Solo Sokos Hotel Torni
item.description: Torni is a lively classic in the heart of Helsinki. As a Solo hotel, it is much more than a building and an address: it has unique character and personality. Torni's spirit is built on individual service, a comprehensive art experience and thousands of stories. Every room is a world of its own, with small details such as tile stoves, works of art and on bathtubs on claw foot pedestals. On the highest floors, impressive city views add a final touch. At the Torni Restaurant, delicious tastes meet striking visuality. The Ateljee Bar, American Bar and Irish-inspired O'Malleys are local meeting places, each with a special atmosphere of its own.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 152 rooms: 36 single rooms, 69 double rooms, 27 superior rooms and 20 suites. All rooms feature an Internet connection over a wlan network. Part of the rooms feature a balcony.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Ravintola Torni, food culture since 1931. Trendy food from Finnish ingredients in nostalgic surroundings. Extensive wine list. Ateljee Bar, a tower with a view since 1951. Bar, terrace and a breathtaking view. Monthly art exhibitions on the premises. American Bar, a happy mixture of the 1930s and today. An international cocktail bar, ideal for an evening in style. O'Malley's Irish Pub, a wide selection of Irish beers in a genuine atmosphere. Live music two nights a week. Summer terrace on the inner yard.
item.matko:additionalinfo: 4 saunas.

item.title: Solvalla-Swinghill
item.description: Skiing center Solvalla-Swinghill is situated near Solvalla sports academy in Nuuksio, northern Espoo. Solvalla-Swinghill has three slopes, of which one is for children, one for families and a steeper one for competitions. From the skiing center there are beautiful views over Nuuksio's Pitkäjärvi-lake. Halfway up the slopes there is a atmospherical skiing hut with a cafeteria, rental services and amenities. The height of the slopes in Solvalla-Swinghill are 75 meters.
item.matko:location: Nuuksio.
item.matko:open: Weekends: 10.00 - 18.00 Weekdays; monday - thursday: 17.00 - 21.00 Closed Fridays

item.title: Somsola
item.description: Vast selection of stonejewellery, also finnish design. A vast selection of minerals and decoration items of minerals.

item.title: Sonera Stadium (Sodexo)
item.description: Sonera Stadium is a football stadium, located next to the Olympic Stadium, with a capacity of 10,770 spectators. It is also the home stadium of the Helsinki-based football team HJK (Helsingin Jalkapalloklubi). The stadium is a multi-purpose arena which can easily be used by multiple types of events.

item.title: Soppakeittiö
item.description: More properly called a soup shop than a restaurant, Soppakeittiö is a local secret you don't want to miss. Bouillabasse has developed a legendary reputation.
item.matko:location: Old Market Hall

item.title: SOUL Vintage
item.description: Soul Vintage is a small, cosy boutique located in Kallio near the Sörnäinen metro station, offering a selection of vintage clothes, accessories, interior design items and a small selection of furniture. Works also as an art gallery for upcoming artists.

item.title: South Harbour
item.description: The South Harbour is Finland's largest passenger port. Currently over six million passengers pass through it annually.

item.title: Soutupaviljonki
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Sweet Pepper Catering takes care of the catering.

item.title: Speed Club
item.description: Speed Club is an exclusive private club that offer event services for mainly corporate customers. Speed Club is specialised in virtual driving simulator experiences and has two of the most realistic and hars motion simulators in Finland. Force Dynamics 301 and its new four axle version model 401 are something to experience.
item.matko:location: City centre 5 km, airport 23 km

item.title: Sport Museum of Finland
item.description: The Sports Museum is located in the extension wing of the Helsinki Olympic Stadium. The Sports Museum is a national specialized museum entrusted with the task of preserving, researching and displaying a national collection in the field of sport.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 16 km
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 11-17, Sat-Sun 12-16. The museum is closed from 25th October 2015 till 2019 due to renovation.
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility (e.g. high thresholds). An accessible WC.
item.matko:groups: Guide bookings tel.+358 (0)9 434 2250
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Caterer: Sodexo Service Center. Private events can be organized outside the opening hours (open: Mon-Fri 11-17, Sat-Sun 12-16).
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Meeting facilities for 30-50 persons.
item.matko:services: Museum shop, sport library, sport archives of Finland.

item.title: Sports Academy
item.description: Sports Academy rooms 1000 people and is good for eating and drinking, sauna, and watching sports. The 66 plasma screens and 6 giant screens guarantee the best front row seats at matches and sports events.
item.matko:location: In the city centre
item.matko:open: 1st floor: Mon-Sun 11-03. 2nd floor: Mon-Thu 11-23, Fri 11-01, Sat 12-01, Sun 12-23.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Saunan erikoisuuksia ovat ylelliset saunatuolit ja plasma-tv sekä näkymä baarin puolelle. Saunakabinetin puolelta löytyy myös PlayStation3 ja kabinettiin voi tilata buffet-ruokailun.

item.title: St. Henry's Cathedral
item.description: Catholic Church
item.matko:disabled: There is wheelchair access to the Cathedral. For the wheelchair ramp, please enter from Tehtaankatu.

item.title: St. John´s Church
item.description: St. John's Church is designed in Neogothic style by the Swedish architect A. E. Molander and built in 1893. It is the biggest church in Helsinki and has excellent acoustics, making it a popular place for concerts of large choral works in particular.
item.matko:services: Helsinki Organ Summer concerts on Wed at 20

item.title: St. Matthew's Church
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 10-20, Fri 10-16, Sat 12-18, Sun 9-18. In summer (1.6.-31.8.) daily 10-15.

item.title: St. Urho's Pub
item.description: "Urkki" is a pub for beer lovers with a selection of over 100 beers. In Urkki one does not have to go hungry either.

item.title: StadiHome Apartments
item.description: All StadiHome apartments are situated in the heart of Helsinki, in quiet surroundings. The apartments are cosy and fully equipped, with comfortable beds for two in all apartments. Bed linen is included in the price. Additional beds available at request. In all apartments there is a TV, microwave oven, coffee machine and washing machine. Some of the apartments also have a dishwasher. Possibility for Broadband Internet connection in all apartments.
item.matko:location: City centre 2 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:admission: Prices per week for two persons: 250-350 EURO one-room apartment, 400-450 EURO two room apartments, 500 EURO for apartment with sauna and balcony + VAT 8 %. Prices are subject to change.

item.title: Stadium tower
item.description: The stadium tower is 72 metres high and offers a spectacular view over Helsinki. Lift to the tower.
item.matko:admission: Adults 5€, children 2€, children under 6 years may enter for free. With the Helsinki Card: Adults/3€, children may enter for free.
item.matko:disabled: Access to a separate balcony with wheelchairs, inva WC. Cafeteria and inva WC in connection with the information point, easy access for partially sighted. No access to the tower with a wheelchair.
item.matko:groups: Entrance to the tower:groups over 10persons 1,50€/person. Lunch for groups by request, tel.+358-(0)9-447 591/Sodexho
item.matko:services: Eg. the Sportsmuseum of Finland (www.urheilumuseo.org), Stadion Hostel (www.stadionhostel.com), café (open Mon-Fri 10-14.30, lunch served Mon-Fri 11-14, Sodexho, tel.+358-(0)9-447 591)

item.title: Stefan's Steakhouse
item.description: The restaurant carrying the name of Stefan Richter - American Top Chef finalist - serves dishes with gorgeous presentation and exquisite flavours that bear comparison with any other world-class restaurant. Besides top steaks, Stefan's offers exquisite starters and desserts as well as grilled fish dishes. Stefan's Steakhouse is The restaurant can accommodate about 150 guests.

item.title: Stella Polaris Theatre
item.description: Stella Polaris is the oldest professional theatre in Finland specialising in improvisation.
item.matko:location: Tram 8, metro to Ruoholahti
item.matko:open: Performances always Wed-Sat, except during last week of month, when Mon-Wed at 19.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed. Inva-WC and lift, please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Groups (min. 10 pers.) 11€. Guide service by appointment.
item.matko:services: Restaurant Hima & Sali in the Cable Factory.

item.title: Stoa
item.description: Stoa is a lively and varied culture centre for East Helsinki situated by the metro station in Itäkeskus, next door to the Itis Shopping Centre. The high quality events at Stoa attract visitors of all ages from all over Helsinki. Stoa's programme includes Finnish and international contemporary dance and circus, theatre, music, children's performances and exhibitions. Stoa's auditorium is one of the best venues for contemporary dance in Helsinki. City of Helsinki Cultural Office is responsible for events at Stoa.
item.matko:open: Mon-Thu 9-20, Fri 9-18, Sat-Sun 10-16. Closed on Sundays from May to August.
item.matko:disabled: Inva-WC, areas for wheelchair users in the auditorium.
item.matko:services: Ticket sale tel. +358-(0)9-3108 8411 and Lippupalvelu. Café Stoa is open Mon-Fri 10am-5pm and in conjunction with events. Lunch from 11am to 2pm.

item.title: Stoa Mariapassio
item.description: Gallery

item.title: Stockmann Department store
item.description: Located in the centre of Helsinki, the Stockmann department store offers a wide selection of products from foods to top fashion and electronics across 538,000 square feet of shopping space. An exhibition hall on the 5th floor features sales exhibitions on varying themes. This summer's exhibition, Feels like Finland, is dedicated to tourists and travellers, offering selected products from brands like Arabia, Iittala, Marimekko and Aarikka. On the 7th floor, a Visitor Centre provides visitors with advice and help on tax free issues. Opposite to the department store, on Keskuskatu, lies one of the largest bookstores in Europe, Akateeminen Kirjakauppa. Stockmann department stores can also be found in Itäkeskus, Tapiola and Jumbo in the greater Helsinki area.

item.title: Stora Enso Oy Headquarters
item.description: Building planned by Alvar Aalto in 1959-62. No entrance to the building.

item.title: Street Gastro/Kallio
item.description: Street Gastros food is all about freshness: the bread is baked every morning with their own awesome recipe, and the full flavour comes from the use of fresh herbs and vegetables, and beautifully marinated meat. Vegetarian friendly.

item.title: Street Gastro/Kamppi
item.description: Street Gastros food is all about freshness: the bread is baked every morning with their own awesome recipe, and the full flavour comes from the use of fresh herbs and vegetables, and beautifully marinated meat. Vegetarian friendly.

item.title: Strindberg
item.description: On the second floor is Strindberg à la carte, a restaurant which combines the ever-popular Nordic home cooking -"husmanskost"- with contemporary international flavours. The spacious bar, with its soft couches and lounge area, and its wide variety of cigars and magazines, has become a popular rendez-vous spot for many. Downstairs is the popular Café Strindberg.

item.title: Studio Aalto
item.description: Alvar Aalto designed the building at Tiilimäki 20 in Munkkiniemi as his own office in 1955. The building is only a short walk from Aalto's own house, where the office had previously been located. Because of a number of large commissions, the office needed more space to work in. Studio Aalto is one of the best of Alvar Aalto's 1950s buildings.
item.matko:open: During 1.10.-30.4. Tue-Sat entrance and guided tour at 11.30 NB! only one tour. During 2.5.-30.9. Tue-Sat entrance and guided tour at 11.30 and 12.30 NB! two tours. In August daily at 11.30 and 12.30. Max 20 persons /guided tour.
item.matko:admission: Adults 17€, students and pensioners 8€, groups (over 10 persons) 12 €/person
item.matko:groups: Groups are requested to make a reservation in advance, and their guided tours are arranged outside the regular opening hours.

item.title: Studio em
item.description: Timelessness and modernity are the signatures of design at Studio em. Natural materials like linen, wool and bamboo also play an important role in the sculptural designs. The boutique offers high quality design, jewelry and accessories mostly from Finnish designers. The collection is manufactured in Finland as unique pieces or small series.

item.title: Submarine Vesikko
item.description: The Military Museum's submarine Vesikko is a 250-ton coastal submarine of the Second World War. The only existing submarine from the Finnish fleet, which served under the name of Vesikko from 1936 to 1947. Vesikko saw action in convoys and on protection and patrol duty in the Gulf of Finland. The submarine base was located in the shipyard section of Suomenlinna.
item.matko:location: Suomenlinna Fortress, by ferry from the Market Square about 15 min.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is not accessible.
item.matko:ingress: Vesikko is a 250-ton coastal submarine of the Second World War.

item.title: Summer Hostel Karavaani/Rastila Camping Helsinki
item.description: Hostel Karavaani, a family friendly summer hostel offers private rooms for 1-5 persons, bed places in a dormitory and family rooms. Self-service kitchens, indoor play facilities for children and a lounge.
item.matko:location: 12 km to the city centre, 22 km to the airport. With metro towards Vuosaari from the city centre, to Rastila station in 18 minutes
item.matko:services: The summer hostel is situated in connection to Rastila Camping. The campsite has caravan and tent places, cabins and cottages, saunas, rental of equipment and a public beach.

item.title: Summer Kino Engel
item.description: Cinema theatre in inner yard. Closed for renovation, reopens year 2011

item.title: Suomenlinna Church
item.description: Suomenlinna Church was built as a Russian Orthodox garrison church in 1854 and was converted into an Evangelical-Lutheran church in the 1920s, when also the appearance of the church was changed. You are welcome to visit the church and to take part in our activities. The church also functions as a lighthouse.
item.matko:open: Wed-Sun 12-16, June-August Tue-Sun 12-16. No sightseeing during worships, weddings, funerals and such especially on Saturdays and Sundays.
item.matko:disabled: The church is accessible for wheelchair users, please call +358 9 2340 6126 in advance.

item.title: Suomenlinna Conference and Banquet facilities, Governing Body of Suomenlinna
item.description: In Suomenlinna sea fortress there are nine venues of different sizes and types available. The venues in the 18th century fortress and a Unesco World Heritage site are suitable for hosting variety of events such as seminars, conferences and banquets. The venues were originally part of the military fortification during the periods of Swedish and Russian rule, and were used as a gunpowder magazine, a granary, a church and a barracks. There are museums, guided tours and other group activities available. There is no public transportation on the island but all the venues are within walking distance from the main quay.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, ferry to city centre 15 min, airport 22 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: There are ten restaurants and cafés in Suomenlinna. Some are open all year round and some only in summer time.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Suomenlinna Museum.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Catering services, activity service, museums, guided walks, multivision show on the history of the maritime fortress.

item.title: Suomenlinna Museum
item.description: Suomenlinna Museum is situated in the old navy inventory chambers, which were built in the early 1780s. The permanent exhibition presents the construction of the fortress and the eventful history of the islands from the 18th century to the present day. The visitors can get to know the life of Swedish officers, Russian merchants as well as Finnish civil war prisoners, who all lived in the fortress. The museum also features temporary exhibitions and information about UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The wide-screen show Suomenlinna Experience offers spectators an excursion to the absorbing history of Suomenlinna. The show starts every 30 minutes. The Suomenlinna Visitor Centre hosts also the Suomenlinna Tourist Information
item.matko:location: In the Visitor Centre
item.matko:open: During spring and autumn seasons (2.1.-30.4. and 1.10.-31.12.) daily 10.30-16.30. During summer season (2.5.-30.9.) daily 10-18.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is located on two floors in the Suomenlinna Centre. The exhibition on the ground floor has wheelchair access. The staff will help you access the first floor by lift with automatic sliding doors from the Centre's office. The museum auditorium has wheelchair access. The building also has accessible toilet facilities.
item.matko:groups: Entrance fee for groups 4€/pers. (min.10pers.) Guidebooking: +358 (0)9-4050 9691. Guided tours 44€/1h, museum opening fee outside opening hours 50€/h. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English. School groups free entrance. Guided tours for school groups 20€/30min. or 40€/1h. Reservations for widescreen show tel. +358 (0)9 4050 9691. Several cafés and restaurants on the island. More information on Suomenlinna at www.suomenlinna.fi.
item.matko:services: A 25-minute Suomenlinna Experience widescreen show, commentary in seven languages: Finnish, Swedish, English, German, French, Russian, Japanese.

item.title: Suomenlinna Sea Fortress
item.description: Suomenlinna is one of the biggest sea fortresses in the world, founded in 1748 and built by Field Marshal Count Augustin Ehrensvärd on islands off the coast of Helsinki. Suomenlinna remains as one of the most popular attractions in Finland and was included in UNESCO World Heritage List in 1991 as a unique monument to European military architecture. An important part of any visit to Suomenlinna is a good meal or a refreshing break at one of its cafés. The fortress has a selection of restaurants and charming cafés. The Visitor Centre and Suomenlinna Museum, situated in the middle of the fortress, are a base and information point for visitors as well as the starting point for the walking tours. Suomenlinna is explored on foot. In summer there are daily guided tours in English, Finnish, Russian and Swedish, in winter the tours are held on Saturdays and Sundays in English and in Russian.
item.matko:location: Just off the coast of Helsinki city centre. Public transport ferry (all year) or waterbus by JT-Line (in summer) from the Market Square. Traveltime approx.15min. Timetables www.hsl.fi & www.jt-line.fi
item.matko:open: Suomenlinna island is open all year. Suomenlinna Visitors' Centre and Museum and some other services are open also during winter.
item.matko:admission: No entrance fee to the fortress. You only have to pay for the ferry ride. Each museum has its own separate entrance fee. In summer you can also buy a combined ticket to all six museums on the island.
item.matko:disabled: There are many cobbled roads on the islands, where the use of a wheelchair or baby carriage may be somewhat difficult.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours and programme for groups on request, Ehrensvärd Society, tel. +358-(0)9-684 1850, www.suomenlinnatours.com
item.matko:services: Eg. museums, cafés, restaurants, guided tours etc. Please see the Suomenlinna webpages for more information.
item.matko:ingress: Suomenlinna fortress is one of the biggest sea fortresses in the world.

item.title: Suomenlinna Toy Museum
item.description: The Suomenlinna Toy Museum presents old toys, the oldest of which go back to the beginning of the 19th century. The newest toys are from the 1960's. The private collection features hundreds of old dolls, approximately one hundred antique teddy bears, and other toys full of history. The toys of the collection origin in Finland and they reflect the Finnish culture and game tradition. Of great interest are for example the toys and games of wartime. Café and museum shop.
item.matko:location: Suomenlinna Fortress, Iso Mustasaari. By ferry about 15 min.
item.matko:open: From 3 to 6 April daily 11-17. From 11 April to 3 May on weekends 11-17. From 9 May to 19 June and from 31 August to 27 September daily 11-17. From 20 June to 30 August daily 11-18.
item.matko:disabled: Access for wheelchairs, assistant needed, steep uphill, accessible toilet.
item.matko:groups: School and other groups, 10-40 persons, by arrangement, also outside opening hours. Group discount -10% when group min. 20 persons. Schoolgroups group discount -20% (min.10pers.). Group discount only when all tickets are purchased at one go.
item.matko:services: Café, open when museum is open. Toy Museum boutique shop sells genuine Steiff and Hermann teddy bears and Käthe Kruse dolls. There is also a wide selection of postcards.

item.title: Suomenlinna Visitor Centre
item.description: Suomenlinna Visitor Centre is conveniently located in the heart of the fortress, providing tourist information and also housing the Suomenlinna Museum. The information desk sells books, postcards and souvenirs. Guided walking tours also start from the Suomenlinna Visitor Centre.

item.title: Sushibar + wine Korjaamo
item.description: Sushibar + Wine is a Restaurant specialized in cold Japanese dishes and wine. The wine list consists of over 50 different wines mostly from small organic vineyards.
item.matko:open: Mon-Wed 11-21, Thu 11-22, Fri 11-23, Sat 14-23, Sun closed.

item.title: Suvilahti
item.description: The historically unique area combined with its interesting tenants are creating an internationally significant cultural centre. Suvilahti comprises nine buildings, two large gasometers and 2.5 hectares of open-air yard space. The cultural centre will be formed gradually as the buildings are renovated and tenants move in. The original buildings were designed over a century ago by Selim A. Lindqvist, who was inspired in part by the Art Nouveau architecture in Vienna. Also in the area: Open graffiti wall and D.I.Y skatepark
item.matko:services: Restaurant and open graffiti wall.

item.title: Svenska Teatern
item.description: Theatre performances and musicals in Swedish. The building of Svenska Teatern was renovated in 1935 and richly decorated facade of the building was replaced with a new facade representing functionalism by architects Eero Saarinen and Jarl Eklund. Renovation was Eero Saarinen´s first realised project after graduating from Yale University. More information at www.mfa.fi/saarinenhelsinkieng
item.matko:open: Box office: Mon-Fri 10-18, Sat 12-18 and hour before the performance. Tickets can also be bought from Lippupiste www.lippupiste.fi. and R-kioskis throughout the country.
item.matko:disabled: Wheelchair access to big stage, lift and Inva-WC, assistant needed. Please notify in advance.
item.matko:groups: Tickets for groups, tel.+358-(0)9-6162 1433 (Mon-Fri 9-16). Guide (Finnish, Swedish) tel. 09-616 211, guide fee 25€.

item.title: Swengi Karaoke Nightclub
item.description: Karaoke restaurant.

item.title: Swimming Stadium
item.description: Outdoor swimming area consisting of four different pools: 50-metre pool, diving pool, children's pool, wading pool.
item.matko:admission: Adults 3,80€, children (7-17 yrs) 1,90€, children under 7yrs free.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible for the disabled.
item.matko:services: Water slides (1.6.-11.8. from 12-18, 5€), children's play area, weight lifting place, beachvolley, basketball, table tennis, meeting room for 20 persons, café. Locker room. Reservations for the premises +358-(0)9-3108 7800 (Mon-Fri 9-14). Swimsuit, towel (rent) 2€, seat cover 0,50€.

item.title: Tablo Ateneum
item.description: Ateneum's restaurant at the bottom level of the museum offers food from around the globe, carefully made of fresh ingredients. Delicious pastries, cakes, coffee drinks, and a wide selection of non-alcoholic beverages.

item.title: Taidesalonki
item.description: Founded in 1915 by Leonard Bäcksbacka, the Taidesalonki gallery presents mainly modern Finnish artist. In addition to functioning as a gallery, Taidesalonki also sells art and antique (19th and 20th century Finnish art, silver etc.).

item.title: Taiga Colors
item.description: Taiga Colors - Colorful interior design and bag collection. Made in Finland.

item.title: Taito Shop Helsky
item.description: Taito Shop Helsky prsents both traditional and modern Finnish handicrafts, eg. ceramics, glas and textiles for home decorations, setting the table and for the sauna,

item.title: Taitotalo Congress Centre
item.description: Fakta auditorium for congresses and training events. Various premises for seminars, all with modern AV equipment. Attractive restaurant. Free outdoor and indoor parking.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 12 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Talentti Restaurant: 150 seats (cocktail parties for 200), Variantti lunch and private restaurant: 250 seats (cocktail parties for 400).
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Foyer 300 m2, covered patio in summer 120 m2.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Strategia and Visio meeting rooms can be divided.

item.title: Taivaanranta Grill & Craft Beer
item.description: Taivaanranta Grill & Craft Beer is a classy and cosy restaurant in the center of Helsinki. The menu consists of fresh fish, finest beef and seasons specialties. Beers and ciders are brewed by Teerenpeli Brewery.
item.matko:open: Mon-Tue 11-22, Wed-Thu 11-23, Fri 11-24, Sat 12-24, Sun closed.
item.matko:disabled: Handicap toilet

item.title: Taivallahti Tennis Centre
item.description: Tennis Centre

item.title: Takeoff Simulations
item.description: Takeoff offers for the first time in Finland a highly realistic and fun experience flying a commercial airline like never before. The Airbus A320 simulator is the same size as the real one and with high definition visual screens, realistic sound effects and a highly detailed cockpit that guarantees an unforgettable experience.

item.title: Talma Ski
item.description: Talma is a ski resort particularly favoured by young snowboarders and "new school"- skiers. The drive from central Helsinki to Talma takes about 30 minutes. Talma's eight slopes offer challenges for all skiers and snowboarders. Those more advanced can play tricks in the snow park presses, kickers, rails, corners, and boxes. There is also a half-pipe and an air-jump mattress. The three slopes located in the back of the area cater more for those in search of traditional downhill-skiing experiences.
item.matko:services: Equipment rental, restaurant services, ski school

item.title: Tamminiemi
item.description: Tamminiemi Villa is located in Meilahti adjacent to Seurasaari museum island on a beautiful park estate which used to be President Urho Kekkonen's official residence during his period in office between 1956 and 1981. In those days it was known as the centre of Finland's political and governmental life. Tamminiemi is furnished the way it was in Kekkonen's time.
item.matko:open: Wed-Sun 11-17, in October-April guided tours in Finnish at 12, 14 and 16, Sundays in Swedish at 12.30, Sundays in English at 14.30. In May-September guided tours in Finnish 11-16, in Swedish at 12.30 and in English at 14.30
item.matko:disabled: Lift available. Handicap toilet in main building as well as in café building.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours upon request. Also possible outside regualar opening hours. Inquiries and booking tel.+358-(0)9-4050 9650. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English, German and Russian.
item.matko:services: Café Adjutant, tel. +358-(0)9-4050 9650, 20 seats.

item.title: Tapanila Sports Centre
item.description: Welcome to the sport center with million smiles! Tapanila Sport Center offers the most diversified possibilities for in-house sports and other leisure activities in the metropolitan area. There´s a yearly customer usage time of over one million hours with tens of different choices in sport and leisure! Please note Puistola Tennis Hall and Helsinki Climbing Centre as parts of Tapanila Sport Center. Not to mention the Bowling Hall in Tapanila or the Gym. In addition to athletes companies and schools use our facilities regularly for their own work-welfare programs and sports days, customer and marketing events.
item.matko:location: City centre 16 km, airport 10 km
item.matko:open: Sports Centre Mon-Fri 8-22:30, Sat 9-22, Sun 9-22. Bowling Hall Mon-Fri 11:30-22, Sat 10-22, Sun 12-21.

item.title: Tapas Barcelona
item.description: Tapas BarCelona is a small and intimate tapas bar in the heart of the city, in Wanha Kauppakuja by Alexanterinkatu. A buffet lunch is served during the week, on weekends and evenings you can enjoy different tapas with vine, beer or other drinks. The secret behind the tapas are the traditional and high-quality ingredients.

item.title: Tapettitalo
item.description: Finnish wallpaper design. Tapettitalo is specialized in historic styles but contemporary ones as well and their collection of 2,000 wallpapers includes vintage designs by Finnish designers such as Birger Kaipiainen (Kiurujen yö), Tapio Wirkkala, and Ritva Kronlund.

item.title: Tarsala Creation
item.description: Tarsala Creation's philosophy is to design unique and classic womens shoes of good quality for demanding customers.

item.title: Tavastiaklubi
item.description: Tavastia is one of Europe's oldest still active rock clubs. The club, built in 1970, features live concerts with international artists as well as top Finnish artists. Every saturday, after the gigs, the DJs play indie/pop/rock music from the best classics to the latest hits. The restaurant Ilves offers lunch on weekdays and snacks till the wee hours of the night.
item.matko:open: Sun-Thu 20-01, Fri 21-03, Sat 20-04. Age limit 18 years.

item.title: Teatteri Takomo
item.description: Theatre performances

item.title: Technopolis Ruoholahti
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 21 km

item.title: TeeMaa
item.description: Art gallery

item.title: Teerenpeli Kamppi
item.description: Brewery bar with a large selection of whiskey, beers and wine. The restaurant's speciality is Teerenpeli's own brewery products.

item.title: Teerenpeli Keskuskatu
item.description: Teerenpeli Restaurant is known for its relaxed and cozy atmosphere. The restaurant's own craft beers and ciders are filled with full flavors. Taivaanranta Restaurant is located on the other side of the hallway and it offers heavenly food. Terrace menu can be enjoyed inside or outside. Seats inside 60, terrace 80. Free WiFi.
item.matko:disabled: At street level, disabled toilets.

item.title: Tekniska Halls
item.description: Tekniska Halls is a conference and event location in the sixties' businessmen's style. Several meeting rooms and the conference hall create a great selection of locations for business meetings, lunches and festivities.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: High standard restaurant and alcohol license on location.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Restaurant and foyer
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: Meeting rooms from 10 to 200 persons, biggest hall for 200 guests, max. 500 guests on location.

item.title: Telakka Event Centre
item.description: The Telakka Event Centre is one of the biggest event facilities in Helsinki. It offers unique opportunities for dinners, cocktail parties and special events. The history if the property dates back to 1945 and it has served as a head quarter of a Finnish company as well as a shipbuilding dock.

item.title: Temppeliaukio Church (Rock Church)
item.description: Quarried out of the natural bedrock, Temppeliaukio Church is one of Helsinki's most popular tourist attractions. The interior walls are created naturally by the rock. The church was designed by architects Timo and Tuomo Suomalainen and opened in 1969. Due to its excellent acoustics the church is a popular venue for concerts.
item.matko:open: Opening hours vary weekly, please listen to the bulletin +358 (0)9 2340 5940. Closed during ceremonies.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance from the street. Accessible WC.
item.matko:groups: Guidance free of charge (Finnish, Swedish, English, possibly also other languages). Booking in advance.
item.matko:ingress: Quarried out of the natural bedrock, Temppeliaukio Church is one of Helsinki's most popular tourist attractions.

item.title: TerassiBAR
item.description: TerassiBAR is a popular 24-seat breakfast bar and living room on Porthaninkatu 9's on the second floor. We have wide selection of alcohol drinks, coffees, teas, snacks and free Wi-Fi. Welcome!

item.title: The Aalto House
item.description: Aino and Alvar Aalto's home was completed in Riihitie Road, Munkkiniemi, Helsinki, in autumn 1936. In this as in their other works, the young architects combined modern and traditional thinking. The furniture, designed by the Aaltos, had already won international acclaim in the early 1930s, and the couple furnished their home with their own creations. The cosmopolitan atmosphere of the home is underlined by works of well known artists such as Le Corbusier, Alexander Calder and Poul Henningsen. The Aaltos' home has recently been lovingly restored and is now a home museum open to the public.
item.matko:open: Guided Tours: 1.10.-30.11. and 1.2.-30.4. Tue-Sun at 13, 14 and 15. 1.12.-31.1. Sat at 13, 14 and 15. 1.5.-30.9. Tue-Sun at 13, 14, 15 and 16. In August daily at 13, 14, 15, 16 ja 17.
item.matko:groups: Groups are requested to make a reservation in advance, and their guided tours are arranged outside the regular opening hours.

item.title: The Aalto House and The Aalto Studio
item.description: Aino and Alvar Aalto's home was completed in Riihitie Road, Munkkiniemi, Helsinki, in autumn 1936. In this as in their other works, the young architects combined modern and traditional thinking. The furniture, designed by the Aaltos, had already won international acclaim in the early 1930s, and the couple furnished their home with their own creations. The cosmopolitan atmosphere of the home is underlined by works of well known artists such as Le Corbusier, Alexander Calder and Poul Henningsen. The Aaltos' home has recently been lovingly restored and is now a home museum open to the public. Aalto House (Riihitie 20): Dinners max for 10 persons in the dining room. Service upon agreement. Studio Aalto (Tiilimäki 20): Meetings and private celebrations like weddings and anniversary max for 50 persons. There are two separate spaces for holding meetings: the studio and the dining room Taverna. Renting fees: Aalto House Morning and afternoon events (8-16) €550 / 2 h (+ VAT). Evening events (18-23) €1500 / 3 h (+ VAT). Additional hours >€100 / h (+ VAT). Studio Aalto Morning and afternoon events (8-16) €450 / 2 h (+ VAT) Evening events (18-23) €1100 / 3 h (+ VAT) Additional hours €100 / h (+ VAT).
item.matko:location: Munkkiniemi, city centre 5 km, airport 19 km
item.matko:open: During 1.10.-30.11. and 1.2.-30.4., open Tue-Sun 13-17. Entrance and guided tour on the hour (last one at 16). During 1.5.-30.9., open Tue-Sun 13-18. In August daily at 13 -18. Entrance and guided tour on the hour (last one at 17). In December and January only by appointment. Max 20.pers/guided tour.
item.matko:groups: Groups only by appointment, e-mail:riihitie (at) alvaraalto.fi
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Service upon agreement. Dinners max for 10 persons in the dining room. Private celebrations like weddings and anniversary max for 50 persons.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: There are two separate spaces for holding meetings: the studio and the dining room with room for a maximum of 10 people.
item.matko:services: Museum shop

item.title: The Abattoir
item.description: The Abattoir celebrates food culture in it´s many forms. The area was constructed in 1933 when it housed the City of Helsinki's abattoir. Used for wholesale in the recent years, the historical compound is now being taken over by citizens, phase by phase. The historical spaces are under gradual renovation and preparing for the next chapter. Spontaneous urban culture will be nesting among wholesale bustle for some more years to come.

item.title: The Artotheque
item.description: Art exhibitions

item.title: The auditorium of ETERA Mutual Pension Insurance Company
item.description: The auditorium of Etera Mutual Pension Insurance Company offers a comfortable facility for various occasions. The auditorium´s lobby can be used for serving snacks and beverages and arranging small exhibitions.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km, Pasila railway station 0.5 km.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Fazer Amica Restaurant offers coffee, breakfast, lunch and buffet dinner for 100 persons and terrace for 70 persons.
item.matko:additionalinfo: State-of-the art audiovisual equipment, auditorium technician services and interpreting room are available.

item.title: The Cathedral Crypt
item.description: Venue for events and exhibitions
item.matko:services: Café Krypta open every day during summer, Mon-Sat 11-17, Sun 13-17

item.title: The Circus
item.description: Night club in the city centre with five large bars. The night club also offers karaoke rooms (reservations in advance).

item.title: The Empire Helsinki
item.description: As the flagshipstore of Villawool knitwear co. The Empire offers wide range of hats and beanies to warm your head during your stay in Helsinki (especially in winter, spring, summer and autumn). The shop also carries a selection of international street fashion and original art by visiting artists and a high quality furniture by Tebian.

item.title: The Forest House (Metsätalo)
item.description: Metsätalo (Forest House) was designed by Jussi Paatela and completed in 1939 for Helsinki Universitys Forest research institute. Buildings architectural style is a combination of functionalism and 1920's classism. Forest House is DOCOMOMO-rated as a landmark of Finnish modern architecture.

item.title: the Funkiest
item.description: A record store specialized in hiphop, founded in 1995. Hiphop on CD, vinyl and cassette. A large selection of Finnish hiphop and rap music. Soul, funk & jazz on vinyl only.

item.title: The Helsinki Ice Hall
item.description: The Helsinki Ice Hall is suitable for diverse corporate events.
item.matko:location: City centre 3 km, airport 15 km
item.matko:disabled: Restricted accessibility, high threshold (over 4 cm) along the path, essential access, lift; essential for access, lift doors opens automatically, toilet for wheelchair users, parking for disabled above the ticket office from where also access to INVA-stand, access to lower floor only from outside, training field can be accessed with lift from behind the building, easy access for blind or partially sighted, lighting intensity 50-150 lux
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Main Street, Sport Café, Beer restaurant, Big reds, lounge, Royal Club, Brewster's corner, Corner bar, 14 fast food outlets Restel event restaurants sale service tel. +358 (0)9 733 5456, fax +358 (0)9 733 5435, e-mail: tapahtumaravintolat@restel.fi, www.tapahtumaravintolat.com
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Arena 2000 m2, Foyers 4000 m2, Training Hall 1800 m2
item.matko:additionalinfo: The Helsinki Ice Hall also hires out chairs, stages, floors etc.

item.title: The Holmasto coin shop
item.description: Coins and medals
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 10-17, Sat 10-14 (summer Saturdays shop is closed)

item.title: The House of Municipalities
item.description: Situated in the Helsinki district of Kallio, the House of Municipalities (in Finnish Kuntatalo) is a convenient meeting place with an easy access to and from the city centre. The premises provide an ideal venue for companies, organisations, public administrations and private persons wishing to hold a range of events or celebrations.
item.matko:location: City centre 2,5 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Palmia takes care of the catering on-site.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Two saunas and a swimming pool. These facilities also include a conference room for 40 persons. Cocktail parties and similar events can be arranged in the sauna department.

item.title: The Left Shoe Company
item.description: Personalised shoemaking at its finest. Experience the quality, fit and comfort of a handcrafted custom made shoe, created just for you in 7 weeks.

item.title: The Light House
item.description: The Light House is a multipurpose centre owned by the Finnish Association of the Deaf, Finnish Federation of the Hard of Hearing and Service Foundation for the Deaf. The Light House is situated in Haaga and is easily accessible. The well-equipped auditorium has seats for 175 persons.
item.matko:location: City centre 7 km, airport 10 km
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant (advance bookings only), 130 seats
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: The lobby can be used for exhibitions or presentations connected with the seminars.

item.title: The Macbeth Hall
item.description: The Macbeth Hall´s rock walls, big glass paintings and dozens of candles creates an medieval ambience where customers can forget present-day and enjoy their evening. Grandiose meals and tasty wines with the ambience of the Macbeth Hall gives an remembrance never to be forgotten. The Macbeth Hall is one undivided hall. Height is 4m and customer area 400m2. Capacity during dinner is 150 and 180 cocktail. Estrade (6x5m) and light & audio system for speeches. Technique was hidden in order to preserve medieval atmosphere. Wares and equipments are easy to freight with elevator (3m long, 2000kg) that goes from street level to venue. You can bring your own goods or we can tailor an offer including only the services which you are externalizeing.
item.matko:location: city centre 4 min, airport 20 min
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Venue is well suitable for private events like medieval theme events, show & dinner, b to b events, incentive groups, promos etc. Interior is medieval and castle-like. Capacity during dinner is 150 and 180 during cocktail. You can bring your own beverages but the catering is exclusively of Crepperie.
item.matko:additionalinfo: All services, from catering and evening programme direction to technical applications, are available.

item.title: The National Library of Finland
item.description: Exhibitions in the gallery and the Cupola Hall. The Library's main building is designed by architect C.L. Engel 1836 and was built in 1840-45. The annex is called the Rotunda and was built in 1902-06, architect Gustaf Nyström.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri 9-20, Sat 9-16 (Between 2.6. and 31.8 open Mon-Fri 9-18, Sat 9-16, in July closed on Saturdays).
item.matko:admission: Free admission to exhibitions, lectures and concerts. Further information Inkeri Pitkäranta tel. +358-9-1912 2738, inkeri.pitkaranta@helsinki.fi
item.matko:groups: Guided tours 1 hour/40€; library Esko Rahikainen tel. +358-9-1912 2722, esko.rahikainen@helsinki.fi, gallery exhibitions Sisko Vuorikari tel. +358-9-1912 2671, sisko.vuorikari@helsinki.fi
item.matko:ingress: Exhibitions in the gallery and the Cupola Hall.

item.title: The People's Archives
item.description: The People's Archives maintained by the Social Archives Foundation is the central archives of the Finnish left-wing labour movement and popular organisations. The People's Archives was established in 1945, right after the Second World War to be the central archives of the Communist Party of Finland. The People's Archives collects, preserves, arranges and catalogues archives and other material related to the social and cultural history of the left-wing labour movement, popular organisations and the working class in Finland. There are actual archival material 3006 metres of shelving over more than 9600 record creators.
item.matko:services: Exhibitions

item.title: The Reitz Foundation Museum
item.description: The Lauri and Lasse Reitz Foundation Museum displays the art and antique collection of Lauri Reitz, one of the most renowned master builders of his time. The collector's wife, Maria Reitz, established the foundation in her will. Alongside her husband she wished to honour the memory of her son Lasse, who had died young. The home museum was opened to the public in 1971. It exhibits 19th century Finnish painting as well as handicraft from the 16th to the 19th century including silver and china items, arms and furniture.
item.matko:open: Wednesdays and Sundays 15-17. Closed in July.

item.title: The Tiger
item.description: The renewed dance floor of Tiger is providing the best hit songs and club beats. On Fridays the program is brought to you by the best party promoters Finland has to offer, known from the world famous party island; Amnesia and Space. The other dance floor is offering the best of urban party music from hip-hop classics to the freshest R&B-songs.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: The Tiger is a high class nightclub, which is located at the 5th floor of the shopping center of Kamppi above the rooftops of Helsinki.
item.matko:additionalconferencerooms: The Tiger is also perfect for corporate- and business events. The nightclub can be reserved for private use outside the business hours.

item.title: Theatre Academy
item.description: Theatre Performances

item.title: Theatre Avoimet Ovet
item.matko:location: City centre 1,5 km, airport 18 km

item.title: Theatre Museum
item.description: In the Theatre Museum the exhibitions "Might and magic", "Arkadia theatre" and "The attic of the theatre" offer an excursion into the history of the Finnish theatre, the magic world of drama. Temporary exhibitions on themes and subjects tying in with the permanent displays.
item.matko:location: City centre 3km, airport 21 km. Metro to Ruoholahti, tram 8, buses 65A, 66A, 20, 21V, 15.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue-Sun 11-18, Wed 11-20. Closed in July.
item.matko:disabled: The museum is fully accessible, and there is a ramp leading to the main entrance. If you need any assistance, please contact the museum staff for assistance (tel. +358 (0)207 961 670). Accessible toilets are located in the entrance lobby and on the second floor.
item.matko:groups: Workshops and guided group visits, tel+358 (0)207 961 670. Group visits possible also outside normal opening hours. Languages: Finnish, Swedish, English.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Restaurant services are available in the museum, also outside the opening hours.
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Museum also suitable for private and corporate occasions. All spaces in the Theatre Museum are excellent for very unique banquets and receptions for 20-100 persons. We will plan together your party or event and make them look like you want; good food, theatre, acting, bands, guided tours, as you wish. Enquiries tel. +358 (0)9 6850 9127 or e-mail teatterimuseo@teatterimuseo.fi.
item.matko:services: Coffee automat. Parking close to the Cable Factory. Theatre museum can arrange for e.g. coffee/lunch to be served for groups. Museum also suitable for private and corporate occasions. Enquiries tel. +358 (0)207 961 670 or e-mail teatterimuseo@teatterimuseo.fi.

item.title: Tieteiden talo
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 19 km
item.matko:exhibitioninfo: Näyttelysali 504: pöytävitriinit ja standeja.
item.matko:additionalinfo: Salissa 104 on flyygeli, asiakas maksaa itse virityksen. Lisäksi saatavilla äänentoisto, mikrofonit (myös langattomat) ja kuulosilmukka.

item.title: Tiger of Sweden Consept Store
item.description: A different cut.

item.title: Tila Gallery
item.description: Place for visual happenings.
item.matko:open: Opening hours are changing depending on the exhibition.

item.title: Tivoli & R3D
item.description: Located at Fredrikinkatu in Helsinki, Tivoli is a combination of high quality event venue and a spectacular nightclub. Tivoli is one of the most popular nightclubs in Finland and its special characters are first class lighting system and interior planned to the last detail. On Saturdays, the music is brought to you by the most popular DJ's Finland has to offer, as for example the Heavyweight DJ's. On Fridays Tivoli provides events organized by external event managers. The entry fee costs 8 € on Saturdays, on Fridays the entry fee depends on the event and promoter. Invariably, free entry with the Membercard is not valid on Fridays. R3D is Club specialised for electronic music that operates in same space as Tivoli.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: High quality sound- and lighting systems, 14 screens, 6 plasma screens, 15 video projectors, 200m2 dance floor and performance stage on which events can be projected on screens with cameras.
item.matko:additionalinfo: The sales services of Night People Group are open mon-fri at 020 7759 814, myynti@npg.fi. Tivoli is part of Night People Group.

item.title: tm-gallery
item.description: Focusing on Finnish Contemporary Art, the Finnish Painters' Union's gallery has a versatile profile.

item.title: Tori Quarters
item.description: Visit Tori Quarters in the historical centre of Helsinki to discover the heart of the old town meeting the new buzz of the city. The historical buildings of Tori Quarters, used for administration offices for over 40 years, are now being renovated, opening up new spaces for new businesses and Helsinki-dwellers and travellers alike. In the area you find a growing number of cafés, restaurants, design boutiques, craft shops, creative sector companies and renewed public space.
item.matko:open: The Tori Quarters project also coproduces events, rents out empty spaces to interesting pop ups and events and acts as an enabler for new urban culture. Follow and find us at this interesting phase of development!

item.title: Toscanini
item.description: Toscanini - A taste of Italy on Bulevard! We offer you a modern country style kitchen under the Tuscan lilies. Our menu is based on the most essential elements of Italian kitchen, such as olive oil, herbs, tomatoes and Tuscan cheeses and cold cuts. Welcome for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

item.title: Toyota Climbing Arena
item.description: The biggest wall climbing center in the Nordic countries!

item.title: Traveller's Home
item.description: The Traveller's Home reception is located in the city centre. Traveller's Home offers reasonable priced accommodation in homelike apartments which are located in downtown Helsinki, about 50-1000 m from the reception. The rooms are equipped with TV, microwave oven, water and coffee cooking facilities. Toilet, shower and towels are available.
item.matko:location: City centre 1 km, airport 17 km
item.matko:open: 1.1.-31.12. opening hours 14-18, other times by agreement
item.matko:accomodationinfo: 3 apartments for 1-2 persons, 2 apartments for 2-4 persons

item.title: Tree Top Adventure Huippu
item.description: Adventure at 6 to 18 meters height in a sunny forest. Bridges, ladders, tricky crossings, unforgettable zip wires and a breathtaking scenery. Enjoy 2 hours of outdoor fun with friends and family!

item.title: Tres Bones
item.description: This trendy restaurant/bar/disco is located in the up and coming Punavuori district and offers good food and refreshing drinks. Local lads call it "LesBones".

item.title: Tropicario - The tropical animal house
item.description: Experience the adventure in the world of snakes and lizards. See the worlds most poisonous snakes, look into the eyes of giant multimetre snakes. See the giant monitors basking or water turtles swimming and spiders waiting for next meal. This is the biggest tropical zoo in the Northern countries.
item.matko:location: Metro to S örnäinen, trams 1, 1A, 7A, 7B
item.matko:open: Mon-Sun 10-19; last admissions 45 minutes before closing time.
item.matko:admission: adults 12€, students and pensioners 10€, children (4-14 yrs) 8€.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible with wheelchair
item.matko:groups: Groups (min.15pers.) 10€/pers. Guided tour 50€/1h. Inquiries and bookings tel.+358-(0)9-750 076 or tropicario@tropicario.com
item.matko:ingress: Tropicario is the biggest tropical zoo in the Northern countries.

item.title: Tuuliatuu Second Hand Shop
item.description: Tuuliatuu is a quality second hand shop for ladies and gents and offers timeless fashion with a large selection of unique, affordable clothes, shoes, accessories and bags.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue-Fri 11-18, Sat 11-16, Sun closed.

item.title: Töölö Church
item.description: Töölö church was built in 1930 and it was designed by prof. Hilding Ekelund (1893-1984). The church seats 500 persons.
item.matko:open: The church is closed due to renovation until autum 2015.

item.title: Töölö Sports Hall
item.description: Swimming Hall, sauna, gymnastics, ball games

item.title: Töölö Sports Hall
item.description: Töölö Sports Hall, previously an exhibition hall, was completed in 1935 and served as a venue for concerts, banquets and sporting events. Nowadays the multifunction hall is used for a wide variety of sports training purposes and for competitions in basketball, volleyball, fencing, boxing and gymnastics. The Sports Department also has its offices on the premises.
item.matko:services: Café, meeting facilities and sauna (reservations tel.+358 (0)9 310 87800)

item.title: Töölön pallokenttä
item.description: Töölö Football Park (Bollis) comprises of five sports fields, including one natural grass and four synthetic turf fields. When the park opened in 1915, it was the first proper football field in Finland. Since its opening, Bollis has brought together some of world's most famous football stars, currently active players and amateur sportsmen.

item.title: Töölönlahti Bay
item.description: The park around the Töölö Bay begins in the heart of Helsinki and there's a popular walking path circling the bay. The Winter Garden, boasting hundreds of plants, is located at the north end of the bay. Wooden villas along the shores are a reminder of Helsinki's history. The Töölö Bay is a treasure especially for bird watchers. Finlandia Park is a new oasis for culture and city events that is being developed along the southern shoreline.
item.matko:ingress: The park around the Töölö Bay begins in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: Töölöntori
item.description: During summertime Töölöntori works as a street market with sellers and street cafes.
item.matko:location: Töölöntorinkadun, Sandelsinkadun, Tykistönkadun ja Runeberginkadun rajaama tori Taka-Töölössä.

item.title: UFF
item.description: U-landshjälp från Folk till Folk i Finland rf (UFF) is an independent non-profit non-governmental humanitarian organization founded in 1987. The objective of UFF is to give equal opportunities for all people. The shop on Fredrikinkatu sells mainly clothes and shoes for men and women, textiles for homes and on teh vintage-department clothes from the 70's and 80's for both men and women. Other UFF -stores in centre: Iso Roobertinkatu 4-6, Runeberginkatu 4 C, Hämeentie 4 & Mannerheimintie 104.
item.matko:location: Other UFF -stores in centre: Iso Roobertinkatu 4-6, Runeberginkatu 4 C, Hämeentie 4 & Mannerheimintie 104

item.title: Uggla
item.description: Personal bar & nightclub in cool Punavuori district. Trendiest DJ´s with hottest tunes.

item.title: Unicafe Ylioppilasaukio
item.description: Diner for students. Five different lunch alternatives that change daily. Salad and bread included.
item.matko:location: Ylioppilasaukio -square

item.title: Union Design
item.description: Union Design is a modern atelier workshop, which represents the finest traditions of handicraft culture. It is situated in one of Helsinki's most culturally noteworthy historic complexes - Whale court, in a building designed by Theodor Höijer in 1904. The client's imagination and wishes are, for the goldsmiths, silversmiths and jewellers of Union Design, the most highly valued raw materials. Such resources are the undeniable outset and goal for any crafted piece to succeed.

item.title: Union Five
item.description: Clothing store that specializes in street fashion as well as in skate -and snowboarding apparel and equipments.

item.title: Unique Cottonbags
item.description: Unique and environmentally friendly cotton bags! All bags are designed and printed in Kallio, Helsinki. Series are small and as handprinted each one is Unique.

item.title: University of Helsinki
item.description: The Main Building of the university, designed by Carl Ludvig Engel, was completed in 1832. It is located next to the Senate Square in the heart of Helsinki's neoclassical centre, facing the Cathedral and the Government's Palace. The Fabianinkatu side was completed in 1937, before the war. The architect was J.S Sirén, who also designed Parliament House.
item.matko:ingress: The Main Building of the university.

item.title: Unknown Cargo
item.description: Unknown Cargo is an art gallery of the unknown. The gallery reveals the artists only at the end of each exhibition. Some of the artists are recognized and acclaimed, others are still unknown to the greater public. Unknown Cargo takes contemporary art out of the regular art galleries. It gives the visitor the opportunity to experience art without context or reference, as a pure and raw encounter.

item.title: Urbansauna Pirkkola
item.description: In this stylish rental venue you can celebrate with even 70 guests. In the venue there is a dining space, a bar and other living areas. Urbansauna Pirkkola offers you a sound system, free Wifi and a video projector to use. In a bar there are dining supplies for 70 persons, fridges, an oven, a dishwasher, an electric kettle and a coffeemaker. There is no sauna in this venue. It is possible to hire the venue from 8am to 4pm or from 5pm to 11pm (extra hours from 55 € per hour). Book easily on the website!
item.matko:location: 20 min to the Helsinki city center, to the airport 15 min.

item.title: Uspenski Orthodox Cathedral
item.description: Completed in 1868 in the Katajanokka district of Helsinki, the Uspenski Cathedral is the largest orthodox church in Western Europe. With its golden cupolas and redbrick facade, the church is one of the clearest symbols of the Russian impact on Finnish history.
item.matko:open: Mon closed, Tue-Fri 9.30-16, Sat 10-15, Sun 12-15. Closed during ceremonies.
item.matko:disabled: There are many stairs and inclines in the Cathedral, which is why moving e.g. in a wheelchair is difficult. There is an accessible toilet, but it's not easy to reach. In summer, there is a temporary ramp to the church to make it easier to access.
item.matko:groups: Guide booking in advance, tel.+358-(0)207 220 683, languages: Finnish and English.
item.matko:services: Small souvenirshop.
item.matko:ingress: The Uspenski Cathedral is the largest orthodox church in Western Europe.

item.title: Uunisaari Island
item.description: Uunisaari Island is located close to the city centre, offering a tranquil and relaxing seaside atmosphere. Close to the harbour, the island is a short 3-minute boat ride from the Kaivopuisto Park beach. Winter time there is a bridge. The swimming beach is supervised. The Uunisaari restaurant offers a setting for special occasions, such as corporate events, weddings, celebrations, meetings and conferences. There are also sauna facilities. Terraces and dressing rooms can be found from all of the three saunas. In the winter time there is a hole in the ice where you can swim if you've got the courage! There is also a hot water Jacuzzi outside where you are able to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery of the Helsinki coastline.
item.matko:location: On an island, just off the Kaivopuisto park
item.matko:services: An attractive, fully-licensed restaurant, a café with a sun terrace and four saunas on an island off Kaivopuisto Park. The main building was renovated in 1999 under the supervision of the National Board of Antiquities. Red brick walls creating a warm and festive atmosphere. Open all year round. Ferry from Merisatamantori, 1.5-3 €.

item.title: Uutela Recreational Area
item.description: The park includes pine forest, rocks, bogs, shoreline, stately trees and an old arboretum as well as the "Uutela lagoons". The park was established in 1952 - 1953 and covers 71.5 hectares (total area 105 hectares).
item.matko:location: Eastern Helsinki, Southeast of Vuosaari, about 16 km from the city centre.
item.matko:services: 3 cooking shelters, toilet, well, parking place, hiking trails, nature trail with information boards

item.title: Valkosaari Shipyard
item.description: Genuine island atmosphere in the middle of Helsinki, at the Eteläsatama harbour by the Olympic terminal. Built in 1926 and located on the island Valkosaari, the shipyard is rented for festive occasions for private parties and businesses alike. Continuous, easily modifiable space is available for 100-350 persons. The end of the building opens up to the courtyard, where you can enjoy the view of the Suomenlinna island fortress.
item.matko:location: In the city centre, airport 20 km

item.title: Valtimonteatteri
item.description: Theatre

item.title: Vantaa Art Museum
item.description: Vantaa Art Museum's exhibitions present contemporary art from both Finland and abroad. The focus of the collection lies on national art starting from the 1960s. Supplementary program is available for visitors of all ages.
item.matko:location: M-train to Myyrmäki. The art museum is situated at the Myyrmäki House by the railway station.
item.matko:open: Tue, Wed, Fri 11am-6pm, Thu 1pm-8pm, Sat 10am-4pm, Sun, Mon closed.
item.matko:disabled: Accessible entrance, a toilet and a lift for wheelchair users.

item.title: Vapiano
item.description: Italian fast food restaurant (German concept).
item.matko:location: I the vicinity to the Central Railway Station, in the center.

item.title: Variety Second Hand & Vintage
item.description: Variety Second Hand & Vintage specializes in men's sportswear & workwear by selling brands like Alpha, Carhatt, Champion, Levi's, LL Bean, Patagonia, Pendelton, Polo Sport and Starter.

item.title: Vartiovene 55
item.description: Former warship of the Finnish Navy. Presently under private ownership and operates as a charter ship. Events out on the sea or in harbour. Two large cabins, sauna for 15, jacuzzi on the deck, Weber barbeque. All the audiovisual equipment.
item.matko:location: In the center of Helsinki.

item.title: Verkkokauppa.com
item.description: 28 000 m2 home-electronics store that includes 24 h kiosk, gaming café, restaurants and sightseeing terrace with MiG-21BIS fighter. The sculpture Bad Bad Boy by Tommi Toija is situated outside the electronics store.
item.matko:location: Opposite to Helsinki West Harbour, use address Hietasaarenkuja 7 if you are using a GPS-navigator.
item.matko:disabled: Restrooms and lifts for disabled.
item.matko:services: Free indoor and outdoor parking.

item.title: Vermo Race Track
item.description: trotting races

item.title: Vermon ravirata, Race track & Restaurant Raviini
Vihti Ski Center
item.description: Vihti Ski Center offers slopes for skiers of all levels and age. In particular, the skiing center is focused on children and families with the longest and gentlest children's slopes in the Southern Finland. Vihti Ski Center offers challenges also for more experienced skiers with the Stenmark -slope. The drive from central Helsinki to Vihti takes about 45 minutes.
item.matko:location: Vihti is 45km away from Helsinki via Turku highway.
item.matko:services: Equipment rental, cafè, ski school

item.title: Viikki Church
item.description: The church is located in sustainable Eco-Viikki residental area and represents ecological wooden architecture. The exterior walls are made of split aspen shingles. In the interior, there is a forest of pillars made of glulam cluster columns. The altarpiece, Elämän puu (Tree of life), and the works in the baptism recess and on the foyer wall are mahogany patterned with punched silver. Their motif is the vine parable of Jesus. The church was completed in 2005 by Architects JKMM.
item.matko:open: Visits can be arranged at viikki.piiri@evl.fi.

item.title: Viirus
item.description: teatteri

item.title: Villa Achille
item.description: A seaside log villa with unique atmosphere located only 30 minutes' drive from the centre of Helsinki. Villa Achille's facilities accommodate 30-80 persons depending on the type of occasion. For meetings, theme days and evening gatherings. Villa is directly adjacent to a bathing beach.
item.matko:location: City centre 15 km, airport 20 km

item.title: Villa Andania
item.description: Villa Andania is a beautiful villa situated in Vuosaari Helsinki. Stunning surroundings and marine landscape provide memorable events. Big hall and atmospheric veranda are suitable for 100 guests. There's also different meeting rooms and places for group work in upstairs so Villa Andania is excellent place also for companies and their events.
item.matko:location: Vuosaari, Helsinki. City centre 30 min.
item.matko:accomodationinfo: No accommodation
item.matko:services: Theron Catering provides diverse catering services for all kinds of celebrations and events.

item.title: Villa Angelica
item.description: Villa Angelica, situated close to Seurasaari, invites you to enjoy a cup of coffee and delicious pastries in a romantic villa environment.
item.matko:location: Bus 24

item.title: Villa Gyllenberg
item.description: Villa Gyllenberg houses one of the finest private museums in Finland. Villa Gyllenberg is the former home of the Gyllenberg family. It was built in 1938 and extended in 1955. The art museum is specialised in Finnish art from the period 1700-1970 and in early foreign art.
item.matko:location: Buses 194, 195 from Elielinaukio
item.matko:open: Wed 16-20 and Sun 12-16. Closed from Midsummer until the end of July. Other opening times for groups by arrangement.
item.matko:admission: Adults 10€, children (15-18 years), students and pensioners 8€.
item.matko:disabled: New gallery accessible by wheelchair, but not old part of premises. Inva-WC and lift in the gallery.
item.matko:groups: Guided tours for groups upon request, also outside the openinghours. tel. +359 (0)9 647 390 (Mon-Fri 9-16). It is also possible to arrange a coffee break upon request.
item.matko:services: Café, seating c. 50, open when museum open. Shop, cards and art books. Car park.

item.title: Villa Svalvik
item.description: Romantic and peaceful Villa by the sea. Good connections by car and by boat. Only 20 minutes from central Helsinki. Room for 10-60 persons. Meetings, events, parties.
item.matko:location: Helsinki city centre 20 min.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Free catering

item.title: Villa Vuosanta
item.description: Villa Vuosanta is situated in Vuosaari region in eastern Helsinki in a nature conservation area. The main building was completed in 1900 and it was designed by the famous Finnish architects Eliel Saarinen, Armas Lindgren and Herman Gesellius. The villa has its own sand beach.
item.matko:location: Vuosaari, keskustaan 17 km, lentokentälle 25 km
item.matko:accomodationinfo: Lodging possibilities for approx. 20 persons.
item.matko:restaurantinfo: Catering from Base Catering, 09 - 877 6655, myynti@basecatering.fi
item.matko:additionalinfo: Possibility to bring own beverages (incl. alcohol). Wood-heated sauna by the beach for approx. 30 persons.

item.title: Villi Wäinö
item.description: Finnish beer restaurant with three floors. Finnish live music on weekends in the restaurant on the bottom floor.
item.matko:open: Sun-Thu 14-02, Fri 14-04, Sat 12-04. Age limit on weekends is 20 years.

item.title: Villipuutarha
item.description: The "Wild Garden" is a green oasis amidst the granite features of the Kallio district.
item.matko:location: Kallio district, next to the sports field

item.title: Vin-Vin
item.description: Vin-Vin is a proper winebar in the heart of Helsinki. Our selections consists mainly of organic wines from small producers. Our service is professional and personal: the threshold is low and sprit high. Wine tastes better in good company - Vin-Vin shares its premises with Noir beauty concept.
item.matko:open: Mon-Fri from 16.00 o'clock, Sat from 14.00 o'clock, Sun closed.

item.title: Virgin Oil Co.
item.description: An Italian-American restaurant with a bar and a club with live music mainly on Fridays and Saturdays. The pizzas are made in a wood-heated oven and the wine is straight from the cask. All this on three floors in the heart of Helsinki.

item.title: Virka Gallery
item.description: Virka Info and Gallery are housed at Helsinki City Hall. Virka Gallery arranges exhibitions and concerts. Virka Info provides information on the City of Helsinki and its services.
item.matko:services: WLAN and free access to Internet

item.title: Vuokko Shop
item.description: Vuokko Nurmesniemi is an internationally recognized and awarded designer. She's been designing her own collection since 1964.
